title: Level standards
text: Perfect location in the Tribeca neighborhood, one of the best and liveliest in NY. A stone's throw from the metro station and served by all services. Cleanliness and decorum as per standard. Standard services for the category. For breakfast and dinner I recommend one of the many bars and restaurants within a 100m radius.

title: Perfect hotel to be close to everything in the heart of NYC - Very reasonably priced too
text: I love the location of this hotel.  You can catch any train with just walking a few blocks.  The rooms are reasonably priced, view from the Club room is a 10/10, fabolous food is a blocks walk in every direction.  Great choice for those who love to explore NY.

title: Excellent Property-Recommended
text: Service was outstanding.  Very comfortable bed.  A small room - but normal for NYC standards.  Complimentary water.  No on-site parking, but there is a parking garage right across the street.  Convenient to the Canal Street subway station, which connects to a number of subway lines.  Marriott Bonvoy members get late checkout.  One very minor hiccup - front desk told me about the breakfast hours, without telling me that there was a charge for breakfast.

title: Look at other properties before booking this one
text: Our room was next to the elevator and it was SO LOUD. Make sure you request a room far from the elevator. We had an extended check-out (2pm) but housekeeping woke us at 9am to ask when we were checking out because they needed to clean the room. They were very loud all morning while cleaning the other rooms. Disappointed- this isn’t what I’m used to when it comes to Marriott properties. Will probably steer clear of this property moving forward

title: Sheraton Tribeca - our go to city stay!
text: Arriving at Sheraton Tribeca for our stay makes me happy just thinking about it.  The hustle and bustle of the city, the smiling and welcoming staff, the inviting entrance  - just such a great experience. The location is ideal - walkable to Chinatown, Little Italy.  It is by far our favorite place to stay in the city - and in fact the only place we stay anymore . We visit Sheraton Tribeca at least four to five times per year.  We notice the same staff members there during our stays! They are so kind and friendly - says so much about the hotel.  By the way, great 24-hour market right next store.  Great selections for any meals.  Fresh juices, smoothies.  Thank you so much to the staff.  Every thing you do makes such a difference for all of us that have the benefit of staying in your fine establishment.  So very appreciated!

title: My go-to hotel when I visit NYC
text: For the past couple years, every time I visit NYC, I stay at Sheraton Tribeca. The location can't be beat, with great restaurants and the Hudson Rivers Park close by (perfect for an early morning jog).  The entire staff, from check-in, to lounge, to bar, to housekeeping are all amazing.  One time I had to stay for a longer trip and had packages delivered to me as well! I look forward to returning soon!

title: A great stay with a super team
text:
This hotel is in a great location for me. It is close to the metro and the office. The staff here is wonderful and the GM Mairovi was just lovely sending an email to check in on us. 
This is definitely a hotel that I will be coming back to in the future. 
Thanks for a great stay from a titanium member.

title: A hotel that is trying to make huge profits from customers that leave items at the hotel!
text:
Here's a review for the Sheraton hotel TriBeCa New York:

My recent stay at the Sheraton hotel in TriBeCa, New York left much to be desired. Despite being a Titanium member and arriving early, I was surprised and disappointed to find that I wasn't upgraded, even though the hotel wasn't at full capacity. When I inquired about this discrepancy, the front desk's response was unsatisfactory, citing my early arrival as the reason for not having a room ready, despite my returning later in the day. While I eventually received an upgrade, there was no acknowledgment or apology for the inconvenience of spending two nights in a room with a view of a brick wall.

The lounge experience was underwhelming, with the same breakfast and dinner offerings every day, accompanied by a staff member eagerly soliciting tips despite the self-service setup.

Furthermore, I caution against leaving any items at this hotel. When I returned weeks later to retrieve a forgotten item, the process was frustrating and costly. It took multiple attempts to ascertain what had been left behind, only to be informed that retrieving my suite jacket would require going through a third-party courier service at a steep cost of $220, which exceeded the price of my flight to New York. The lack of flexibility or assistance in resolving this matter left a sour taste in my mouth.

Overall, my experience at the Sheraton TriBeCa New York was subpar, characterized by inadequate customer service and opportunistic pricing for lost items. This experience has certainly diminished my desire to return to this hotel in the future.

title: Elite Level Service
text:
Everything from the time I arrived to the time I left was a first class stay.  
The room was clean and fresh upon my return nightly, with the linens crisp and the pillows fluffed.  Every hotel employee I came across was nice, professional and courteous.

title: Good cost-benefit
text: The best thing about the hotel, without a doubt, is the location. It's on Canal St, which divides Tribeca from Soho. There is a metro station on the corner, as well as hundreds of restaurants, cafes, galleries and shops in the area. Regarding the accommodations, there is no luxury, but it offers what you would expect from a chain hotel (which is always my choice when I don't have references about local options). Very American standard, double beds, carpet and bathtub with curtain. Great value for money for the very expensive hotel industry in NYC.

title: Fabolous!
text: My stay with The Sheraton Tribeca was outstanding!   The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and the hotel is beautiful with the new renovations.  I love the club lounge as it’s a perfect spot to check emails and just relax.  The rooftop terrace is amazing with the breath-taking views of the NYC skyline! I enjoyed my nights watching the sunset over the Manhattan skyscrapers while enjoying a complimentary happy hour featuring wine, beer, antipasti and snacks.  The staff, from the front desk, housekeeping, & the Club Lounge were extremely pleasant and always happy to assist and accommodate.  I was truly impressed! Thank you to you and your team for an awesome week in Manhattan! Keep up the great work, I will be back!

title: Great experience
text: Check-in was smooth, and my room was clean and comfortable.  Hotel is central to area, and also was close and easy access to subway.  Had a late drink at the bar one evening, and service was excellent.  Wi-Fi was solid, which was important for working from the room for a morning.  Overall, an excellent experience.

title: Best value and great stay!
text: This is my second time at Sheraton Tribeca. For the price, this hotel is a no brainer. Super well located, room are spacious enough (especially for NYC), service was great and did not run into any issue. Of course do not expect a 5 stars hotel but I will always come back as it offers the best value for the money, plus points and nights for Bonvoy members!

title: Found a new favorite hotel in Manhattan
text: It was an all-around great experience.  The location is great for touring the city.  The staff was excellent in all facets - front desk, lounge, housekeeping were all friendly and efficient.   It is a great facility with spacious rooms for the city.  I highly recommend it.

title: Great customer service!
text:
Sheraton Tribeca gets a 10/10!
I had a request at check in and the desk agent made the accommodation on the spot. Professional & personable. Greeted us by name each time we passed by!
The room was clean & comfortable, with a stunning view from f the city.
We’re sure to go back!

title: Pleasant, but needs improvement in accessibility and restaurant options
text:
Visiting NYC in midwinter imposes some limitations — when we were there, wind chills got close to 0 at times, so the location advantage of walking distance to Tribeca amenities and restaurants was significantly reduced.  When that happens, you rely on your hotel to step up.  In our case, the hotel restaurant — Henrietta — was a bit of a disappointment, probably because it competes with fuller establishments nearby.  The dinner menu was very limited and the dining area extremely chilly because the lobby’s outside doors fanned cold air across the first floor (the hallways aren’t heated, either).  The food was very good, just didn’t have many options, which might explain why there rarely was more than a small number of diners in it.  

As premium elite members, we had access to the 21st floor club lounge, which was too small to accommodate the larger number of guests for morning breakfasts.  There’s a nice outside terrace connected to the lounge, but the winter keeps guests inside the small lounge. The meals there also did not stand up well to similar amenities we’ve had at other Sheraton properties — powdered eggs, reheated sausage links, wafer thin bacon, etc.  I strongly recommend Tribeca Bagels right next door for great breakfast items.  

I was also surprised that the hotel registration desk was unable to break a $20 bill; I went to the small coffee stand in the lobby for change, but the cashier there provided it from his own pocket, not the register.  

The bellmen were very polite and helpful. 

 Our accessible room had several good accessible features, esp the bath, but the king bed swallowed up all living space — anyone in a wheelchair or with a rollator would be unable to get around it or over to the windows.  The hotel does a poor job of handling the parking issue, a major challenge in Tribeca.  Its website only says “self park” for $55 a day, which means parking at the Wooster parking garage across the street and down the block.  I had hoped that Sheraton would’ve cut some kind of discount deal there, but no luck.

Our stay was pleasant, but Sheraton needs to invest a bit more in this property’s restaurant and club lounge.

title: Great Experience
text: Consistently great service no matter the time of day/night.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  At 1AM the front desk directed me to Tribeca Bagels next door for an outstanding bagel and coffee (open 24 hours!). Clean room, comfortable bed, great price.  See you next trip!

title: Amazing holidays
text: Albergo in posizione strategica. Camere superior molto belle e spaziose con pulizia giornaliera. Utilissimo avere quelle con accesso alla lounge dove la mattina ci sono colazioni gratis buonissime e molto varie (sia dolci che salate). Acqua, bevande calde e fredde a disposizione tutto il giorno e la sera aperitivo dalle 17 alle 19. Inoltre nella lobby ogni giorno offrono merende diverse (cioccolata calda, pop corn etc). Personale gentile e disponibile. Super consigliato

title: Girls trip before the new year
text:
Location was great and affordable. Great for shopping and grabbing food. The team was very attentive

This was a great girls trip in the city during the holidays! The girls and I enjoyed all the available amenities and customer service that was received.

title: Sheraton Tribeca is Great!
text:
Sheraton Tribeca has been our favorite hotel in NYC for over 10 years. We visit NY 3-4 each year for business and pleasure and have found this hotel to offer us everything we need.

The location is great but the Staff is friendly, professional and way beyond what we find in most hotels these days.

title: Wonderful stay in Manhattan at Sheraton Hotel Tribeca.
text: I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca New York Hotel from December 13th to 17th, 2023, and I had a wonderful time. The hotel is located in a trendy area, opposite the fashionable shops of SoHo. The rooms were spacious and spotless, with great décor and crisp bed sheets. Some rooms even had a view of Midtown and the Hudson River. The breakfast buffet was delicious, with a huge variety of options. The staff were attentive and went out of their way to ensure that we were comfortable. Nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is also close to the subway station, which made it easy to get to the center of Manhattan. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting New York. It was beyond my expectations. Thank you, Sheraton Tribeca New York Hotel, for making my trip unforgettable!

title: Great hotel with an optimal location
text: Had a great experience staying at the Sheraton Tribeca! Subway stop close by or walking distance to good restaurants and bars! We were upgraded to a room on the top floor with amazing views of Hudson River. Would stay here again.

title: A really nice hotel with great staff in the middle of Tribeca with easy access to subways
text: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay here! The hotel and room were clean and well kept. I had access to the executive lounge which, compared to many was awesome. It has a beautiful view of the city from the 21st floor, and a great happy hour! The breakfast is also very good in the lounge as well. The staf was very helpful at all times as needed and they have a nice cocktail lounge on the 1st floor. I didn't get to try the restaurant, but if the rest of the place is any example I bet its great as well. We will definitely stay here again when possible.

title: Poor service quality. Stay elsewhere.
text:
Disappointed. Stayed here 6 nights on business. After paying more than $500/night, I was charged for two bottles of water. I did drink one - but had to do so only because they did not replenish the complimentary water. When I complained to the front desk, they made a very huge deal and insisted that they needed to check housekeeping reports before they could credit the water that I did not drink (refused to credit the second). Supposedly, you can ask for more water at the front desk, but they were very clear that it's not something they let the guests know in advance. 
This is not acceptable treatment for any guest (and I even have Bonvoy Gold status). 
The rooms are tiny, but that is not surprising for NYC. The ironing board has seen better days. Housekeeping was spotty (in addition to the issue with water).

title: We Love this comfy hotel!
text: We were very pleased and comfortable in the newly remodeled Sheraton in the Tribeca neighborhood of New York City! The location was perfect for hopping on the subway and quickly arriving at your chosen destination. The bar with complementary bites was a welcome site at the end of a long day. We plan to use this hotel when we are visiting NYC!

title: Wonderful place to stay
text: Very clean and accessible to everything! We were able to walk to the subway easily. We enjoyed coming back and enjoying the wine in the evenings. The view from the patio was incredible for my late husband who had never been to NYC. It was an awesome experience. Staff very friendly.

title: Amazing view and amazing staff
text:
I have been staying at each of the Marriott properties around my work addresses, and found that this one provided me the services I am used to, a quiet place to sleep, and staff that helped me consistently.  

Carlos with the bell team was particularly helpful and the bar staff were very professional.  I will be planning my next work visit for this property.

title: From Lovely to Grubby
text:
We stayed 5 days this time.  The last time a year ago the service was better and the hotel felt less worn.

The good:
The location is very good between Tribeca and SOHO.  Easy subway lines close by too.  Hotel is safe.  Rooms vary in size.  The -15 tier slight larger.  Views good from high floors. No bed bugs.  This is a big deal in NY right now.

The bad:
Breakfast hours are shorter in the club room which is now a free for all.  Way too many people packed in for an ardinary breakfast.  Room is tired, supplies run low, the atmosphere is fairly dumpy now.  Not enough forks, plates…the hot items are mid at best.  

The happy hour is ok, less frantic.

The snacks are reduced from a lively variety last visit to Snyders pretzels and Grandma’s cookies which are cheap and awful.  Not at all a club room that Bonvoy management would be proud of.

The room we got this time was small and grubby.  It really felt dingy and was not delightful but just adequate.

We get to NY a fair bit.  Will shop around for a fresher, newer hotel next time unless this one gets a good scrubbing and a bit of an update.

title: Adequate. Good if the price is right
text: The hotel is adequate. Things are a bit dated. But it was a good value and is essentially located to Soho and multiple subway lines. Front desk, for the most part is lacking any grace. In fact, they were rather abrupt and rude. Rooms are a decent size and higher floor of views are nice. I would not bother with the club lounge unless you are interested in piles of people clamoring over mediocre eggs.

title: More pluses than minuses
text: Overall, good hotel, but there were issues.  The hotel is located in scruffier section of Tribeca.  Hotels north of Canal Street are more appealing.   Room was clean, but not quiet.   Some staff were absolutely first rate.  Front desk staff were outstanding.  The biggest negative was the breakfast.  It was served lukewarm, and service was lax - except for pushing my breakfast plate away mid meal to ask that I sign the bill.

title: Great Staff and Big Rooms for NYC
text: Room was spacious and the staff were incredibly friendly. We were traveling with our tired toddler and Cesar at the front desk could not have been nicer. He saw our daughter was getting a little restless while my husband parked the car and came over with a kids kit and requested housekeeping work on getting our room ready. He was exceptionally kind and hospitable. Housekeeping did not come to clean our room during our stay, but we were only in town for 2 nights, so it was fine. Cesar was certainly the highlight of our stay.

title: Third Stay, Best Yet
text: This was my third stay here and the best of all three. The view of Midtown from the upper floors is phenomenal, but unlike staying in Midtown, it’s slightly quieter to stay here, although the area is well connected to the rest of the city. The staff, especially Wilmer at the front desk (who has checked me in all three times), is friendly. The hotel also gets points for a concierge lounge that’s well-stocked and open on the weekends, which can be rare among Marriott properties and on the weekends. Also, the comfort of and view from the roof deck on the 21st floor on a warm November night stole the show! I’m a fan of this hotel.

title: Good location
text:
Stayed 2 nights for business. Location is great, steps to Soho and Tribeca. 
Rest of the property is very standard, nothing special. Room was on the small side. Had dinner one night at the restaurant downstairs and it wasn't very good.

title: Pessima esperienza
text:
Hotel gestito in modo pessimo da quattro ragazzetti incompetenti . 
Ho lasciato la biancheria da lavare , il giorno del ceck out non era pronta , il personale della receptionist rideva divertito dicendomi che se la volevo me l avrebbero spedita a casa a mie spese . 
Hotel sporco e lasciato andare .

title: Moderate sized room for NY, clean room but potential for improvements
text: This was not a bad experience for a city with high competition between properties. We stayed on the club level and the room was moderately sized, not too small and was clean and comfortable. However, it is due for some modernisation and attention with some dated aspects. The air con was noisy and it was not possible to sleep with it left on. The service from staff could be improved with a more positive, friendly approach. They did not feel welcoming. Whilst I do not review on this amenity as it a benefit of club rooms/status, the rooftop lounge did offer good views of the skyline.

title: Unbelievably bad for the money
text: Not the worst hotel I have ever stayed at, but definitely the worst hotel I have paid $550/night to stay at. I know it's NYC...I lived here for 12 years...I know Canal St is a dump, but these rooms have not been touched in 30 years. It is clean at least. Other than that, what a rip off.

title: Helpful Staff - Mr.Alejandro
text: The hotel was very well-located, decent and clean. We wish to make a special mention of Mr.Alejandro at the front desk who was most helpful. He was always smiling and willing to assist us with anything we needed.

title: Excellent
text: ALEJANDRO Y WESLIN  son personas maravillosas muy serviciales, nos dieron una información correcta de la ciudad y del hotel nos sentimos como en nuestra casa y queremos volver a hospedarnos.  Son dos jóvenes muy amables y cariñosos y muy respetuosos nos sentimos felices

title: A less than exemplary Sheraton
text: Sometimes there is comfort in a nondescript hotel chain property, which can mean a reliable standard of service and upkeep. And sometimes if can mean a property that does not meet the expected standard. Our stay here was the latter, starting with check in. Early checkin was done online through Bonvoy app, which had no effect whatsoever. We were rudely told it never works and that there was no way in hell a 1 pm checkin would ever have been accommodated. Inasmuch as it was 2:50 pm at the time, we were told our room was still not ready and they would not give us another room that was ready because our booking was part of a block of rooms for a wedding no matter what my Binvoy status was. Nor was the room ready at 3 pm. It was closer to 3:30 pm. The room itself—1516–was pretty minuscule for a Sheraton branded property and felt almost like a windowless room as it just had the tiniest of windows ticked into the corner. The toilet seat was not firmly attached to the toilet and the motion sensing bathroom light turns on an incredibly loud fan if one walks even near the bathroom door, so that a trip to the bathroom in the middle of the night cannot be done without waking up one’s partner. Finally, the public men’s room on the second floor was positively revolting, with clogged and overflowing stall toilets in worse shape that the public restroom at Washington Square Park.

title: Love love love!
text: Great customer service, clean facilities, housekeeping was everyday for the three days that we stayed. Bed and pillows were oh so comfy! Location was great, saved a lot coz it was walking distance to everything!

title: NY
text:
Muy bien el servicio de este hotel, fabulosa estadía, todos muy bien entrenados y muy amable y cálido el botones colombiano, Alejandro, de Bogotá, fue un gran anfitrión, nos dio muy buena información sobre la ciudad.
Saludos desde. Cuenca Ecuador!

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text:
Excellent service and facility.
I recommend staying in the Club Level, where you get breakfast and happy hour included.
Front desk staff is great .
Housekeeper was very detailed and personable. Sabrina at the Front Desk makes a difference . Thank you all.

title: Disappointed in neighborhood.
text:
The dog rules appear not to be followed (under 25 lbs and not allowed in eating areas) as another guest had their pit bull in the club lounge. 
Neighborhood is not very family friendly.  

The room was clean and the housekeeping staff was very friendly.

title: Family Vacation
text:
This is one of the few Marriott hotels in the city where one can find a room with a king bed + sofa bed at a reasonable price. 

The location is great.  It is very close to the subway, easy walking distance to Little Italy, Chinatown, SOHO, West Village, with many restaurant options.  However, the immediate area right outside of the hotel is full of street vendors selling knockoff, just be aware of the surrounding.  

The room is not updated, the bathroom is fairly small, but it was a fairly decent size (king bed, sofa bed, dining room table with 4 chairs, additional chair).   As others have said, the hotel is dated and nothing have been updated since the last time we stayed here in 2019.  

The lounge on the 21st floor was open all day, and always stocked with drinks and snack, also served breakfast and evening snack.  The team in the lounge was fabulous, friendly and always made sure the fridges were stocked.  They are so efficient during rush hour, cleaning off tables (both inside and out on the patio).  The patio off the lounge had a great view of midtown.   

Given the option when traveling with kids, I would pick this Marriott property again for the location and lounge access.

title: Não parece um hotel 4 estrelas
text:
Não parece um hotel 4 estrelas Sheraton, parece menos, café da manhã deixa a desejar com poucas opções, front desk despreparado e pouco cordial, o quarto não parece limpo, chuveiro sem potência de água.
A vista para quem fica em quarto alto é boa e a cama bastante confortável mas só isso.

title: Inadequate A/C & poor storage
text:
My husband and I stayed in a king room at the Sheraton Tribeca a few days ago for three nights.  We were “upgraded” to room 2016 on a Club floor, which was a nice perk, but that perk didn’t begin to compensate for the tiny size of the room, the almost total lack of storage, the meager air conditioning, and the motion-activated bathroom light that could not be turned off at night. 
Literally, the only storage consisted of a small shelf below each nightstand, the desktop, and two cubbies for shoes or small items. The bathroom had only two 8” x 2” glass shelves.  The worst feature was the air conditioning.  It could not be set colder than 68 degrees Fahrenheit, which seems to be the way hotels are going these days, but there was a motion/body heat sensor that not only turned the A/C off when we left the room, but even worse, turned it nearly all the way off at night when we went to bed!  The one time I really appreciate A/C is while sleeping, but the room was so warm at night that we could only tolerate a single sheet.
Equally as annoying as the A/C was the motion-activated bathroom light.  When entering the bathroom in the middle of the night, the light went on at full brightness, thus fully awakening both me and my husband, who slept facing the bathroom door.  It always took me one or two hours to go back to sleep.
The Club Room was well maintained and its large terrace very inviting.
Housekeeping did a nice job and only one time was the room not made up until late in the afternoon.

title: Without customer service what is there?
text:
We just arrived, and the hotel and our room is ok. It’s fine for the price point in NYC.
However we called the night before, came in on a red eye and asked for early check in. They were lovely on the phone.
When we arrived, we were told that nothing was available. After an hour, we were told the guests had checked out of our room and it was a priority to get cleaned. So we waited. 
After an hour, with us having to go up to the desk each time-we were told it was not cleaned yet and there was nothing they could do. After an hour, we were told it had been cleaned and needed to get inspected.
At that point I was sitting right in front of them in the hotel lobby. When it was done they appeared annoyed and gave us our key cards-no hotel information. Nothing about happy hour etc. 
I understand checking in early can be hard, but what I do know from running mental health clinics, is the way you talk and treat people matters. 
The gentleman at the front was very nice. The lady was dismissive and obviously not willing to do anymore than she minutely needed to. 
To boot-our window faced a brick wall. 
Unfortunate.

title: A night in Tribeca
text: It was just one night stay but it was pleasant. The hotel is on Canal street but out of Chinatown. Close to NYC subway and close walk to Chinatown. The hotel itself is comfortable, very welcoming staff. Rooms are slightly dated but fine. The club lounge was better than most-nice happy hour with complementary wine/beer/soda and very pleasant breakfast with a outdoor seating terrace. Overall a good experience.

title: Superb
text: My stay was absolutely delightful here at the Sheraton Tribeca for it being my first time accompanying a friend.We enjoyed every moment of it particularly  the great views from the rooftop. Sabrina at the front desk was fantastic with adding to our experience with great late night fun activities to get into. I will definitely book here again in the future.

title: AN UNEXPECTED GEM
text:
When I first arrived at this hotel on bustling Canal Street, I was not impressed That soon changed. I had  a room with a panoramic view of the city and the caring and professional staff, especially Sabrina,  won me by over.

Sabrina was beyond accommodating and compassionate. She did everything to make my stay memorable. Every wish was fulfilled and she checked up to make sure I was having a great stay.

In addition, the Club Lounge feature is an added bonus. You get complimentary breakfast, late afternoon hors-d’œuvres and wine as well as  day  and evening access to lounge on the rooftop with it’s spectacular view of New York City.

If you are looking for a relaxing, well-kept, personal,  accommodating haven in New York City, you must book into The Sheraton TriBeCa.

title: Nice hotel near Chinatown/ Little Italy
text: I selected this location merely based on price and what I thought was its close proximity to the 9/11 Museum. It was still close, but not close enough to walk as I initially thought. The front concierge gentleman named Eka was so very nice and extremely helpful the entire trip. All of the front end employees we encountered were great as well but Eka really went above to make sure we had everything we needed. Another nice feature was the water they had in the lobby everyday that was infused with cucumbers and lemons. Very refreshing to come in to the cool lobby and grab a cold, refreshing water after walking around New York City and being on the subway all day. The only negative caveat I had was our room was pretty small (smaller than a normal double occupancy room), and there did not appear to be a way to change the air conditioning in your room. There was a thermostat but it didn’t seem to do anything and I felt the room was not as cold as a normal hotel room gets but nothing that I was sweaty or uncomfortable - I just like to sleep in a very cold room. All in all, I would stay again if I were looking to stay in this area.

title: Everything you need in a great location
text: Great staff, location, rooftop terrace. The rooms are of course small due to being in NYC but there are comfy beds, large bathrooms, a gym, and a great lobby lounge and terrace with 270 degree views of NYC (W-N-E). Very affordable, considering the market here. A few subway lines converge nearby and it's easy to access from NJ if you drive through the Holland Tunnel. This neighborhood has so many art galleries, boutiques, and restaurants within walking distance. I will try to stay here every time I visit Manhattan.

title: Amazing property with best views and service. 5 nights stay loved every bit
text: Amazing front desk and f and b teams. Service culture across all teams at the property. Rooms with best views and the marriott lounge and service at roof top is the best part of the property.  Just be careful abt the canal Street stretch at night

title: Excellent 2 night stay
text: My wife and I just stayed here for two nights. Some of the negative reviews worried me but everything was great.  Desk staff were very friendly, and check in was a breeze.  The front end staff were also great.  Room was modern, very clean, and a decent size for NY.  Free wifi was extremely fast.  We both were very happy with our stay and the price was great.  Would easily stay here again.

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: We very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel!  Bed was comfortable, room was quiet and the staff was wonderful.  The staff did recognize my loyalty to Marriott which many Marriott properties don't do.  The area does have some street vendors, but it is only a short distance to a subway and we found the location convenient for our trip.  We loved the rooftop lounge.  Watched a beautiful sunset and NYC light up at night.  Excellent stay.

title: This hotel is an embarrassment to the Marriott brand.
text:
This was the worst Marriott stay I ever had, a bait and switch game.
  I should have realized from reviews that the plumbing was iffy, but as a lifetime gold member who has had great stays at Marriott properties I never expected to check into a room where the toilet didn't work...at all.  The front desk staff were slow, so it took another 20 minutes for them to find a room that they assured me had working plumbing.  WIFI didn't work in the room, so back downstairs for help and staff who had no idea about how to connect me to the room's wifi.  I spent another 20 minutes with Karen and a very hostile Ermel, who forbade me to sit down at the front desk even when I told him about my disability.  Finally Sabrina saved the wifi day, but while I waited I realized that the "dining room" the hotel bragged about online was actually closed and there was nothing but a lobby bar with several small tables and a very restricted menu.  When I found the Executive Lounge I had paid extra for it only had the dregs of a bag of chips at happy hour.

title: Met My Needs
text: I had a pleasant stay at this hotel during my overnight business trip. The room was spacious and the hotel's location was convenient, as there were plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. Ika, one of the staff members upfront was especially helpful. However, the hotel could benefit from some modern updates. Nonetheless, it met my needs!

title: Extremly poor  and rude management
text: Do not stay at this hotel. We had multiple reservations and they screw us. We had the Presidental Suite reserved for over 2 months. They called the day before and said there was an incident and the suite could not be rented. Another of our suites was not ready until 5:45PM. There was a guest in the room and they couldn't get them to leave. The girl at the front desk who's name was Bree was the rudest individual I have ever encountered. She was no help and couldn't have been more abrasive. I would never,ever return to this poorly run hotel. Did I mention I have been a Bonvoy member for many years. I'm ready to cut up my card !!!

title: Geniale Lage, mittelmäßiges Hotel
text: Wir reisten vom JFK mit Airtrain und U-Bahn an, dauert etwa 50 Minuten. Die Lage des Hotels (U-Bahnstation Canal Street) ist genial. 3 Subway Stationen direkt vor der Tür, großartige und aufregende Gastronomie und der Mix aus "dirty and chic" fasziniert. Ich bin Hamburger und es erinnert mich sehr an unsere "Schanze". Dieses Sheraton kokettiert mit seiner atemberaubenden Dachterrasse in der Werbung. Hierzu zwei wichtige Informationen: 1. Diese Terrasse ist nur für Bonvoy-Status und Suitengäste zugänglich. 2. Die Dachterrasse wird gerade renoviert und ist geschlossen! Sagt einem nur keiner. Für mich ist das unredlich. Die Zimmer selbst sind sehr klein, haben bessere Tage schon erlebt und die Aircon ist furchtbar. Also laut und zugig, so dass eine Erkältung nicht lange auf sich warten lässt. Die Lounge ist im 21. Obergeschoss sehr schön gelegen, toller Ausblick und sehr nette Crew. Als "Platinum" erhielt ich ein Upgrade mit super Cityblick.

title: Must stay hotel !!
text: Staff was very friendly and loved the attention to detail. Staff gave great options of things to do in the city with small children. The hotel was also very clean. Stayed with my husband and kids, already planing a trip back.

title: Friendly staff, amazing accommodations
text: Amazing experience. Special thanks to Mairovi for such a wonderful stay and accommodation. My experience was very pleasant from the time I checked in until I checked our. I ordered room service and the food came super fast, the person who delivered my food to me was super funny. I highly recommend!

title: Great Empire State View
text: we had a family trip here and everything was really great the staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean. It is NYC so the rooms aren’t the biggest but it was nice to sit on the terrace and enjoy the view. Really loved our stay here and would definitely return. we had a room facing the Empire State with big windows. Couldn’t have asked for better.

title: Relaxing
text: We had a wonderful time during our stay. The staff was attentive to all  our needs. We couldn’t have felt more welcomed and relaxed. What I loved most was the cleanliness of our room. We highly recommend!

title: Amazing stay!
text: Very clean overall; room, lobby, restaurants. Upon arrival, we were immediately greeted with a smile. Staff & service was smooth & efficient. Checkin, anything needed during our stay the staff tried to accommodate us in a timely manner. Even got a free breakfast buffet!!! Will definitely be staying here.

title: Horrible customer service and overcharged
text: Really bad experience. The hotel put a hold on my credit card for incidentals that they have yet to release and every time I call they hang up on me before even saying hello. I would avoid this place unless you want to be overcharged.

title: Very nice stay! Upgrading to club level was a win!!
text:
We almost did not stay here but so glad we did. 👍🏾👍🏾

Friendly staff! 

We upgraded to the club level and it was absolutely worth it and still affordable.

We had a King bed room with sofa and dinette table with chairs. Comfortable bed, and walk in shower! Bed was comfortable. 

Nice happy hour for club level guests in the lounge.  Beer and wine and great appetizers and snacks, were served.  I never cared for Avocado but the avocado dip was delicious.

Nice view of the city from the lounge too. Outdoor patio was closed for repairs. 

Free breakfast was offered as well. Very nice spread. Bacon, sausage, eggs, cereal, fruit, bagels, muffins, fruit, juice, coffee, tea, water etc.  Very nice!  Staff were very friendly and accommodating.

Location was excellent for visiting Times Square. 3 stops on the train and we were there.

Hotel is within walking distance to bustling Chinatown. 

We will definitely stay here again when visiting the city.

title: Top-Notch oasis in gritty Tribeca
text: Stylish 4* modern hotel with friendly staff; lovely stay. But - If you're researching your 1st visit to NYC, I'd recommend Midtown rather than Tribeca/Lower Manhattan (unless you're visiting nearby NYU). This Canal St. neighborhood had very few walkable services or nice/casual spots nearby. Mainly it was teeming with street-entrepreneurs selling knockoff designer wares on the sidewalk, wreathed in the aroma of ganja.  The only place we liked nearby was the Nancy Whisky Bar (an English/Irish NYC dive bar, which we like) around the corner.  But the Sheraton Tribeca does a great job.  Nice staff, super-clean, stylish rooms - just be skeptical about the actual hours of services (which is not uncommon). Lobby lounge claimed dinner til 10pm, but I knew to go down around 9; indeed, friendly bar waiter said kitchen would be closing soon without notice.  But a great place to stay in Tribeca; well done, Sheraton.

title: A quick 3 nights in the Big Apple
text: This hotel is fairly average in terms of overall quality, but boasts larger-than-average rooms for New York City. The noise level on Canal St, where the hotel is located, can be unpleasant, but the trendy neighborhood of Soho is just across the street and a block away. Conveniently, there are three subway stations with access to over six different subway lines, all within a three-minute walk from the hotel. While the hotel itself is not particularly luxurious and is showing its age, the prices are reasonable. The beds were pretty comfortable. but with the large table n the room - there wasn't a lot of space for suitcases. We stayed on the 21st floor, which is the club level. The club-lounge area is nice, although a bit small, and unfortunately, the terrace was closed during our stay due to renovations. However, the happy hour provided by the lounge was excellent, and the breakfast was decent to good (especially when compared to other options in NYC). Club level guests can also enjoy complimentary coffee, tea, sodas, water, and even potato chips and other snacks in the lounge 24 hrs a day.

title: Still a solid pick for a stay near Tribeca
text:
It was several years since our last trip to New York but the Sheraton Tribeca remains a solid pick if you want to stay near Tribeca which we enjoy.  The lobby area can be a little busy depending on your arrival time but the rooms are nice, clean and comfortable.  

The hotel location is nice as you are at the edge of SOHO, Tribeca and Chinatown and it's easy to go by on foot to downtown as well.  Although the area around the hotel on Canal street can look a bit rough, it's largely very safe even at night.

We are already planning to go back this year and most likely will stay at the Sheraton again for the convenience.

title: Pratique mais bruyant !
text:
La literie est très confortable, l'hôtel est propre. 
Le seul bémol est le bruit, Canal Street est vraiment très bruyante (klaxon), l'isolation phonique n'est pas optimale. Prévoyez vous les boules quies ! 
Le personnel est agréable et serviable. 
Plusieurs lignes de métro accessible en très de temps.

title: Good pick on canal
text: I really like the location of this hotel - you can hop to Tribeca, Chinatown, soho, Little Italy on foot quickly. It also has access to numerous subway lines. The room itself was a little tired and there was thudding construction when I stayed in March. Hopefully that’s done because I wouldn’t stay there again with the noise. You would not be able to do a work call through it. I’d go back but confirm the work is over.

title: 値段の割に貧相。
text: バスタブ付きを頼んだのに、シャワーのみの部屋だった。フロントに申し出て換えてもらったが、要求通りにしてほしい。到着して疲れているのに不快な気持ちになる。アメニティは環境配慮なのか、乏しかった。スリッパはフロントに言えば持ってきてくれた。スタバのインスタントコーヒーと紅茶が置いてあったが味は今一つ。朝食のルームサービスはひどかったので、2日目は頼まなかった。2泊3日500ドルの価値は全くない。2度と利用したくない。スタッフは普通の人たち、部屋も普通の清潔さ。500ドルの価値は見出せなかった。

title: Canal street  - rocks and diamonds
text: Ok Hotel - ok location, but overall its tough in hotels at the moment  - and i get it, but this place needs a good deep clean - busy hotel  - but you can feel the team is under pressure...they were all nice but hurried... Canal street is different to the normal tourist areas - a block east & west and its another world

title: Mixed Experience
text: We booked this hotel thinking the area of Tribeca would be nice however we just didn't feel safe. Just outside the hotel there were people selling drugs, and fake bags  the street outside was very dirty, there was no door man to keep entrance free and to help you. At one point we had to walk around a homeless man trying to keep warm in the door way. The music in the bar was obnoxiously load and there was no lobby bathroom, you had to go up two floors and use your key card which we thought was odd if you just visited the hotel for a drink.  Room was very small with just too much furniture which was all very large.    Disappointed that you had to pay for WiFi, on this trip we stayed at a Hilton, Comfort Suites, a Holiday Inn and a 5 star independent none of which charged extra for WiFi.  We were also disappointed that only Club members could use the rooftop bar which was one of the main reasons we booked this hotel, We felt this was not clear on the website and is a bit disingenious. On the plus side the staff were nice,  the linens, bathroom and products were all of a high standard and the bed was very comfortable.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: I am a titanium Marriott rewards member and chose this hotel because they had a club lounge open seven days a week for breakfast and evening apps that included complimentary wines. Of course you must have Marriott rewards status to visit this lounge or book into a club lounge room type. This is a rarity in the United States! The hotel is a hidden gem. The rooms are decent sized for New York. The location is away from tourist central and walk-able to nice restaurants.  The club lounge definitely needs more seating overall - but has nice views and staff does their best to accommodate people. I think the real selling point is the staff. The front desk acknowledged my status, explained the lounge hours, and gave us bonus drink coupons as it was our first trip away from our little one. They were always greeting us as we came in and left. There is a great little deli/grocery next door. Overall, we highly recommend staying here.

title: Consigliato
text:
Stanza ampia e ben illuminata, con posto per due valigie a terra; 
letto comodo ed ampio, soffice;
Bagno e doccia comodi e ampi, abbastanza moderni; phon e prodotti forniti di qualità.
Bel quartiere, silenzioso di notte nonostante si trovi vicino a bar pub e ristoranti; comoda la metro, anche per arrivare direttamente in aeroporto.
Abbiamo scelto la formula “solo pernottamento” perché nel quartiere ci sono un sacco di bei locali per colazione.
Ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo, considerando fosse la settimana di natale.
Unica pecca: Wi-Fi disponibile gratuitamente solo nelle aree comuni, ma noi avevamo l’abbonamento Vodafone per gli USA quindi nn è stato un problema.

title: They don’t care about your rest or experience.
text:
Hotel failed to tell guests there would be “city mandated” construction going on starting at 9am everyday. Manager was rude and unhelpful when approached about the sound waking us up. 
A hotel is for sleeping and relaxing and that is not what we got here. 
The room was also not in very good shape either. Door looked like someone had tried to break in at one time. 
Long story short, not worth it.

title: One Night Stay in a Clean, Central Location
text: No complaints. My husband and I stayed for one night and the hotel was clean, stocked with toiletries, and had a comfortable bed with nice pillows. My only complaint would be the woman at the reception, who was not the friendliest, but besides that, we had a pleasant experience.

title: Barely marginal for one or two nights if Platinum Elite or higher; stay away otherwise
text:
The hotel must have spent their millions of dollars renovation only on the lobby. The rests  of the hotel were pity (or even pathetic). TLDR; you might bare with this hotel if you are staying for one or two nights as a Platinum Elite (or higher) member. But otherwise don't be fooled by the fancy pictures and find somewhere else. 

Bonvoy Platinum Elite (and higher) members are supposed to be offered complimentary room upgrades and also a selection of member perks like extra points or free breakfast at check in. None of these happened in my case. I had to beg for an upgrade to a club room, and the staffs were not aware of the member perks until the check out.

The staff assigned a corner room on 19th floor. At the end of gloomy hallway I was embarrassed to find two other rooms' doors just few tens of inches away from mine, foretelling bunch of noises from ins and outs (which actually happened till 1 am). Entering the room was another panic to only face red-bricked wall of the next building straight through the window (see the attached), and to see way too much tired bathroom and furnitures which definitely don't look worth of the $3M renovation as the hotel advertises. Not enough power outlets next to the bed without a single USB port in year 2023 is another minus.

I could bare with these as I was thankfully staying for just one night anyway. But when I returned to the room after dinner in Soho, the room was full of bad odor like rotten onion even though I didn't unpack my luggage and didn't use the toilet. I couldn't stand anymore so visited the front desk to get a different room. But not a chance; the answer was "just open the window as there's no other room available". I would have believed if the staff at least spent few seconds to type something in their computer, but the staff didn't hesitate to instantly answer that. I get it, you don't prefer changing the room for a one-night guest at 6pm. But you could have made up some fake efforts to look better.

The only reason for my two-star review is the friendly & hard-working staffs at the club lounge. The staffs literally struggled to serve breakfast and beverages (including complementary wines in happy hour, which is quite unusual in NYC) in a tiny lounge less than 1,000 sqft, but it gets easily crowded with 25+ people with not enough tables/chairs. The staff explained that the hotel is aware of this problem and plans to move the club lounge to a bigger hall on a lower floor. Not sure if that would help, as this will lose the panoramic view from the current club lounge on 21st floor.

So I can't recommend this hotel at the end. Fresh lobby with not-so-nice front desk staffs is hiding outdated and not-so-pleasant guest rooms and hallways behind, where the super-busy club lounge is on its steep downhill due to the lack of resource. You can give a shot if you are looking for a short stay in a budget club room in NYC, but otherwise, think it over.

title: Avoid if you can!
text: We had requested early check-in and we understood that it could not be accommodated. But the rooms were suppose to be ready by 3 PM and we were told they would call us but we never received a call. Came back to the hotel at 6 PM but the rooms were still NOT ready and the attitude by the front dest was rude and dismissive. We had already swiped our credit card earlier at 11 AM for the two rooms but had to wait another 45 minutes and the the front desk employees acted as if they were doing us a favor. The rooms were on different floors and most of the time the keys in the elevator didn't work so you would have to come back down in the lobby and try again. The hotel is somewhat clean but dingy. I would avoid this hotel if possible. The only reason I gave it two stars was because the male server in the restaurant at breakfast was great.

title: So Annoyed
text:
It's taking me a while to write this review as I am so annoyed still almost 3 months later. As a Bonvoy Gold member, I booked this hotel at least 6 months in advance, I was flying in from Australia and catching up with a friend flying in from London. On at least 4 occasions before arriving I rang the hotel (mind you all the calls were long distance from Australia) to advise I wanted to pay for the accommodation up front as my friend was arriving a few hours before me and I didn't want them having to worry about any payments, I even completed an authority form and was advised this would be done. BUT, when my friend arrived from London the payment had not been taken from my credit card and they requested my friends card and put the full payment on their's even though she has told them what should have been done, the person would not allow her into the room until full payment was done.When I arrived I was not happy that this had happened and asked for their credit card to be refunded so that I could pay the account, which was always the request from the beginning. So when I paid they only took part payment and continued to processing an amount of my card each couple of days and still taking money even 2 days after checking out, this total around $5,000 when the full amount for a 5 night stay was $2,000.00. I  could go on and on but I think you understand by now that the billing system in this hotel is absolutely disgusting.

The twin room for a New York hotel is quite roomy and found the dining OK for breakfast and staff were friendly but the way the account was handled totally turned me and my friend off this hotel and would not recommend it at all.

title: Good hotel gone downhill
text: Its really sad when a reliable hotel, that I've used for years, goes downhill, but that is what has happened here. The hotel is in serious need of maintenance - lots of little things are breaking. The room clock is broken, the bar plays awful music, the restaurant is dead and gone, t he club sets up food sort of around the right time, the exercise machines are almost all broken. Until they start fixing things I will avoid.

title: Do not stay here
text: When I arrived at the hotel, I went to use the bathroom in my room and it was disgusting, covered in hair and pee. I took a photo and went down to the front desk and asked them to clean it. They said they would right away. 6 hours later when I got back around midnight, the toilet had not been cleaned and looked the exact same. I took another photo and went  down to the front desk to show them and ask for it to be cleaned. I asked to speak with the manager, and the man at the front desk told me he was the acting manager because he was the only one there. He asked someone to clean the room, and the man he asked looked at me and rolled his eyes. I told them I did not feel comfortable staying here with the dirtiness and their attitude, the man at the front desk looked at me and said "You are welcome to check out and go stay somewhere else" at 12:30 at night. I then got on the phone with Marriott customer service, and the front desk man finally became concerned about me. The following morning, the room service delivery man gave me attitude. This has been a horrible experience and I will not be staying at this hotel or a Sheraton again.

title: Amazing front desk service
text: Some of the best service we've ever had from Miracle at the front desk. She made us feel like VIPs - me and my partner were amazed at how great she was. Super refreshing to have such a good experience at a hotel.

title: Excellent choice in the heart of Manhattan
text: For any businessman who will visit New York at any time of the year! Close to Soho with a lot of bars and restaurants. Very convenient place to visit any place in Manhattan in just a few minutes. Very clean rooms 10/10! The only problem is the poor breakfast which is also very expensive!

title: Nice change from Midtown
text:
This is a great hotel in a convenient location. We often stay in midtown Manhattan, but we’re looking for a change and we are happy we picked this area. There are multiple subway lines a block in either direction at Canal Street (A, C, E, N, Q, R, W).  It’s around the corner from Soho, Little Italy, Chinatown and more. There were plenty of places to eat nearby. 

The hotel itself has a clean, modern lobby with a restaurant and bar. The employees greet you every time you walk through, however you do not have to show your room key (you do need it to access your floor by elevator though). We didn’t have any issues at all with long waits for elevators, and from what I remember there are 4. (If anything, we were pleasantly surprised by how fast they were given the number of floors!) The room we stayed in was on the Club Lounge floor. The Club Lounge was convenient for a free breakfast buffet. There was also a nightly happy hour (5:30-7 I think) with snacks, chips/salsa/guacamole, cheese and crackers, deli meat. They served free wine and beer (you have to ask for the beer, it’s in the storage room fridge).  When it’s not breakfast or happy hour, there is basically a cooler with water and sodas available. There are also bags of chips, some fruit and trail mix packets. We could see that the view was beautiful from the lounge’s patio, but in January the lounge was closed for repairs. There’s a gorgeous sunset view over the Hudson, even from inside! 
 
The king room was adequate size, but a little tight if using the desk chair. It had a desk, mini fridge, closet, luggage rack, lounge chair, and safe (no dresser). The night stands had lamps with outlets and USB’s for charging. The bathroom was fine, but the towels are not soft at all. The room is a bit in need of updating, but it was clean and very comfortable. Also, I found it to be quieter than many areas with sirens blaring and traffic honking! 

We would stay here again, especially if the Club Lounge patio was reopened. This was a nice change from our typical NYC stays.

title: Housekeeping-very very excellent
text:
Xiao Ping was very very wonderful she treated me very nice and was very helpful. She even assisted me in making coffee 
I’m so happy to have meet her on my trip first time visiting and I’ll definitely come back again thumps up Xiao Ping

title: Good value, great location
text:
I was there on the 30th. I was in town for a concert nearby. The room was very nice for the price, and was quiet, especially considering the location. 
The staff were courteous and helpful. 
I would definitely stay there again.
Try the Tribeca Bagel Shop next door., the food is awesome! There are lots of restaurants in the neighborhood. It's a $60, 45 minute taxi ride to and from Laguardia.

title: Perfect NYC Location Delivering Good Value
text:
This hotel has become our 'go-to' when visiting NYC.  Great location within walking distance of Little Italy and Chinatown and quick, easy access to multiple subway lines within a 5-minute walk that will take you almost anywhere.  There are also plenty of both quick eats and upscale dining in the neighborhood.  Definitely not touristy.

The property is fine...not exceptional...but offers most of what I would expect from a Sheraton and the rates are comparably much better than if you wanted to stay closer to midtown or Times Square.  The rooftop deck is a great place to have a cocktail or just enjoy the view.

The biggest negative, viewing this as a Marriott Titanium Elite member, is the concierge lounge.  On both visits (November '22 and January '23) the staff at breakfast was disinterested at best and one of them spent a lot of time taking selfies on our most recent visit.  Not a big deal, but why are they even there?  I could overlook this if the food was just slightly improved.  While the continental items are fine, the cold, overcooked, and dry scrambled eggs are just sad.  They have a kitchen...would it be that hard to make this just a bit better than what you find at a Fairfield Inn?

Yes, I know that this is a 1st world problem and I will continue to stay at this property, but it would be nice if management took a look at this to see if some minor improvements can be made.

title: Will stay again.
text: Stayed here for a few days, for a quick getaway from Chicago. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by the friendly and professional front desk staff. ERMEL is great! Checkin was easy and fast. The room was nice, the bed was comfortable. Everyday they gave us bottled water which was awesome!  I already booked another reservation for this summer. Convenient location and right next to the Canal subway station.

title: December 2022 Stay
text: Just returned from two nights in New York at the Sheraton Tribeca. I thought this hotel was excellent. I had a room on the 20th floor and the view of Midtown was wonderful! I enjoyed the club lounge too, it was always well-stocked. The room had all the amenities I needed, and was very clean. The front desk staff was very friendly. I used to stay in Midtown when I visited NYC but I've started staying in other parts of Manhattan recently. I got a good night's sleep compared to some Midtown stays because even though it was a busy area, there wasn't as much commotion from sirens and honking from outside. The hotel is very close to the Canal Street stop, which has 24-hour access to the train. No issues at all on this visit, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

title: Great basic downtown location
text: Great location close to Canal St subway, restaurants and shops. Clean room and nice to have a proper glassed shower. No drawers but staff did bring extra coat hangers and new hair dryer. Furniture too large for the room which was actually not tiny but furniture got in the way. Friendly staff but concierge didn’t know that our lost luggage had arrived and we had to look in storage. Cold showers last two days due to burst pipe. Good small bar and cocktails. It was ok for the price and the location worked for us. Staff always greeted us and did their best.

title: No heat, no hot water
text:
Day 4 of 0 hot water in this hotel.  Its all anyone talks about here.  People are being checked in as if everything is great and then finding out shortly after nothing works and complaining but nothing is being done.  Being told its being worked on but 0 improvement in 4 days.  Forced to take cold showers with no heat in the room in January in New York is torture.  Marriott should be ashamed.

On top of this the tv didnt work on certain channels and the walls are paper thin.  Also lots of rooms surround the elevators and its loud.

The staff seems good and housekeeping is great but there is too much wrong with the building to make it worth staying here.

title: Horrible experience - AC didn’t work and we couldn’t sleep our whole trip.
text: I have never been more disappointed in a stay than I was staying here. We are here for two nights and our AC hasn’t been working.  We haven’t been offered any alternatives other than getting partially reimbursed for sleeping in a room that is 90 degrees.  They told us that the whole hotel is experiencing it yet all the hallways are cool, the lobby is cool, and we haven’t heard any other guests complaining.  Finally today we found one other couple who had a similar issue and they were offered a different room - yet we never were.   I don’t tend to complain easily, but I’m truly, truly disappointed.

title: Derubata
text: Ho cancellato mesi fa la prenotazione gratuitamente ed ora mi hanno Addebitato 180dollari . Ladri . Se non rispondono li denuncio. Mai successa una cosa del genere. Mai . Ho prenotato con Booking per altro che ovviamente durante le feste non rispondono .

title: average hotel, less than expected of a Sheraton
text:
pros - 
very good location
friendly staff
lobby is nice and welcoming

cons -
hotel needs some uplifting
rooms is relatively big but is not well planned so it appears smaller than actually is (e.g the desk is too close to the bed so the luggage cannot be moved to the other side of the room)
sound proof is horrible - could hear anything the went in the adjacent rooms, and every noise in the corridor 
no real black-out option

title: Great hotel. Transactional robotic front desk team
text:
Let’s start with the pros 

1) Good location close to the A line which you can take straight to JFK. Close to other lines where you can go midtown and uptown with ease

2) Quite a big hotel , nice views and have food and coffee to fill you all day even though you are not a club lounge member. If you are you have added benefits.

3) Rooms are quite decent sized for New York and sleep quality and bathrooms are considered good for the hotel

Cons

This hotel is very transactional. Staff are trained to do the bare minimum and when situation arises they won’t be able to assist further.

1) Front desk team led by Kim have to answer both phones and handle guests at the same time. Some times they will hold on the phone and check you in. Things with credit card info or payments are highly secure and should be dealt in a professional non multi tasked manner

2) The Sheraton is an international brand and training should be provided to the staff to handle international clients as well. Tones should be watched. Talking in 3rd person when the guest is in front is very rude. “ e.g I was assisting him but he decided to go to you instead” when I am right in front. 

3) I had a left item and calling the hotel to ask what item I left. The front desk is not prepared for this and I had to be diverted and assisted by 2-3 different agents. It’s like this is a complicated issue let’s get the newest member to handle it. Don’t bother me kinda impression.

Well it seems that the front desk team as the face of the hotel has lots of improvement in customer service. Since these are the only cons.

title: Great staff, awesome stay!
text: It was our second time at the Sheraton Tribeca. We had an awesome time, can’t say enough about the staff. We arrived late and had some family issues to deal with so didn’t pay much attention when we checked in that evening but soon realized that the floor we were on, club level, was a bit too noisy for us. We asked to be moved to another floor that morning and thanks to Kimberly, one of the supervisors we were able to move by 1pm. The room was on the floor below and had an awesome view! Club room was great for breakfast, snacks, and evening wine.  Angie and Carla at the front desk were exceptionally helpful as well. Conveniently located to the subway. Planet fitness is next-door if you want to squeeze in a workout. If you have a membership.  I only mentioned a few names, but every staff member we met was gracious and helpful  There is a section up the street that is a little sketchy because of the street vendors, but, we had no issues and spent a lot of time walking around. Would definitely stay here again, they made our 20th anniversary trip extra special.

title: A Great Place to Stay in NYC
text:
We stayed here during November 2022 for 7 nights  - we arrived in New York early - the hotel was more than happy to look after our bags while we played tourist - NICK was the concierge  - what an asset to the hotel - helpful, friendly and willing to look after your needs.

Our room  1110 included a fridge, large flat screen TV, coffee/tea making facilities, safe, iron, phone, large room and a King sized bed.  The bed was extremely comfortable

Unfortunately, the Sheraton Tribeca did not offer complimentary break fast  - we had a complimentary breakfast on our first day.  However, next door is the Tribeca bagels and next door to that was Cafe Bene (which had a large range of items for breakfast - with a decent coffee - rarity in NYC)

The staff at the Sheraton Tribeca make the hotel great - Miracle, Minty went out of their way to help us - from printing out tickets for events we had booked on line to offering advice and clues about what and where to go in NYC - it is staff like these that make a place 

The Sheraton had regular afternoon wine tasting which we imbibed in -  and as we were staying for an extended period we got to know the staff well

Our room was reasonably quiet - we had a great view of Tribeca - canal St looking up towards the Holland Tunnel

The hotel is close to several subway lines - Line 1, Line ABC, Line 6, Lines J N Q R W - all in easy reach and taking you to all parts of NYC

The area around the hotel at night can be a bit "seedy" but we did not have nay hassles or problems or issues

There are numerous places to eat nearby - from China town (take care - pickpockets), to Little Italy (great pizzas at Maneros Pizza restaurant at 113 Mulberry St - Little Italy - from HUGE to MASSIVE) and Soho 

All in all - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - as I say - it is the staff that make the place

A BIG THANK YOU TO NICK, MINTY AND MIRACLE - thanks for looking after us - we are glad to acknowledge your great customer service!

title: LADRI BUGIARDI
text:
Sono dei ladri e mentono concordo con la precedente recensione, si permettono anche di rispondere il precedente feed che restituiscono i soldi.. FALSI BUGIARDI . I anche a noi hanno trattenuto più di 240 dollari dalla carta senza motivo e ad oggi 12/12 è trascorso un mese , non rispondono a nessuno.. se eravamo ancora a NY vi mandavamo la polizia LADRI
NON PRENOTATE

title: Sheraton Tribeca
text:
My family and I (2 adults/1 teen) stayed 3 nights.   Here's the Good and the Bad:

Good:  
   - Service was fantastic, especially Aminta at the front desk!  Really helped us enjoy our stay!!  Kudos to the lounge staff as well!
   - The Club Lounge was great.  Amazing views of NYC including the Empire State Building.  Great breakfast selections.
   - Location was good.  Tribeca is a pretty good spot.  Walkable to downtown (longish).  Easy access to the Subway (Canal St.).
   - The hotel is beautiful and is kept spotless by the staff.
   - Great value (considering NYC rates).

Bad:
   - The neighborhood is a bit rough.

title: Decent spacious hotel with good view of the skyline of New York
text:
We stayed here for a few nights to visit New York. 

location: very good, close to nearby subway entrance (Canal Street) and also close to Chinatown.

Room: the rooms are spacious and it is worth getting a room with a view over the skyline of New York!

Service: the service was just good, but not the same as some extravagant grande sheratons in other cities (comparing it to Grande Sheraton in Bangkok sorry).

They have vending machines which is actually quite handy in a hotel. I like having this option.

There is an upper floor that is only accesible to club members. 

Overall: a decent good located hotel with very nice views (in rooms facing skyline of New York).

title: SONO DEI LADRI , STATE ALLA LARGA
text:
la recensione ve la fanno agenti di viaggio che girano il mondo , perchè nessun altro deve avere a che fare con questi truffatori .
I signori dell'hotel hanno trattenutto una bella somma dalla nostra carta senza nessun motivo e senza autorizzazione ( non rispondono alle nostre  mail , alle continue mail del fornitore hotel e dell'ente della carta di credito )
VERGOGNATEVI - STATE ALLA LARGA DA QUESTI LADRI

title: Long weekend in Trebec
text: Staff very responsive and plentiful. Restaurant short on full service with limited schedule. Club level nothing special with closed outside overlook in Concierge lounge. Sad to see it under repair. Great view of Mid town skyline.  Overall the location is great but it is musty and tired lobby and elevators. Rooms are good and beds are comfortable. Good showers and clean bath.

title: Excellent location, good hotel (but small double beds)
text:
Stayed here from 23 Nov to 2 Dec with my husband and two teens. Pros : Excellent location with A C and E lines around the corner and also, N R W and 6 lines just 5-10 minutes walk away (exit hotel glass doors and go right). Times Square is less than 15-20 mins subway ride away. Tribeca Bagels is just next door, with an All Day Breakfast place just a few doors away. There’s a dunkin donuts diagonally across the road and a $1.00 per slice pizza place too. Front Desk staff were generally genuine and friendly. Special thank you to Wilmer at the Front Desk for being so genuine, friendly and so patient with us, explaining how to use the Subway and giving such clear directions! Housekeeping services were excellent and they came daily and followed up on requests promptly. They were able to provide us with a microwave in the room during the stay too. Lastly, the free Starbucks coffee in the room and lobby daily! 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼

Cons : The room is tiny. We booked a room with two “big beds” and so were well prepared for this after reading the reviews. We had four big suitcases but repacked while in Orlando, so we needed only to open two suitcases for the 9 nites stay in NYC. The beds are actually super twin beds becos it was a tight squeeze for me and husband as well as for my two kids. The difference in size was apparent becos we stayed in a double (beds) room in Orlando but was so comfortable there. Hope the hotel will be more honest in their publications. 

Having said that, its a lovely hotel and I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a property with good rates and excellent location 👍🏼.

title: アクセスの良さ、コスパに優れたホテル。
text: 今回はSOHOに位置するこのホテルを中心に移動しました。タイムズスクエアのあるミッドタウン、自由の女神ツアーの船着場バッテリーパーク、イントレピッド博物館、ブルックリンを中心に回りました。これらは地下鉄を利用し、近場は自転車、キックボード、をフル活用しました。ホテルスタッフも気さくで感じよく決して新しい建物ではないですが不自由ありません。今回はシティビューの部屋にしたこともあり、毎晩マンハッタンに来ているという気分に浸ることができました。ただ、バスタブはありませんので悪しからず。

title: Big Disappointment
text: I had stayed at this hotel twice before and found it very modest given the price range that they expect guests to pay. Rooms are tight, bathrooms are tighter, and many staff members appear to be unempowered when something goes wrong. Tribeca is not a haven of quality hotels, but our son and his family live here, hence my third time at this hotel. My minimum expectation is for a comfortable bed, electronics that work, support for current traveler tech, and a hot shower. The bed was fine, the TV was good; but I found the number and placement a places to plug in were below standard for a hotel at this level; and hot water was non-existent during my three night stay. The first two nights the shower was barely tepid despite letting water run for several minutes. The last night there was no hot water in the hotel as the boilers must have failed. The resolution at the front desk at checkout was a 50% discount for my last night and an offer of 11,000 Bonvoy points which they failed to deliver. I am a Bonvoy Titanium member and normally  well-received at Marriott-branded properties. This response was much less than expected and hence one of the very few 2-point ratings that I feel they have earned. In the future, I'll stay further from my family and Uber when necessary. But I'm sending the wrong message to return here or recommend this hotel.

title: Amazing Stay - Good Location - Great Staff
text: I loved my stay at the hotel. I had approximately 9 rooms booked for 7 nights and my stay felt like home. There were almost 20+ friends and family who stayed at the hotel for a wedding. Front desk staff and Club Lounge staff were all amazing. All my requests were accommodated and everyone at the hotel was very helpful. Lounge access was one of the best perks. It was open 24/7 and a great spot were everyone could meet and socialize. I would highly recommend this hotel and stay here again.

title: Our “Go To” in the city
text:
We have stayed here a good thirty times at least, it is our Go To for frequent lomg weekends in the city,  this time we had a room with a spectacular view to the north of the ESB and the rest of the city skyline.

Breakfast downstairs is always good and the service is friendly.  Rooms are smallish, and furniture could use some updating, but we will be back again and again as the location is really good, near lots of subway stations and the prices are always reasonable

title: Good Location - Soho and More
text:
First time staying here and would do so again.

Hotel staff are so helpful, really liked that
Club room helpful for breakfast and evening water/soda or a snack
Room was spacious for us but furniture is showing west and tear, everything was cleaned and fine but just banged up and tired.  These rooms are booked but we liked the city view from the top floor and the quiet.  
Location of hotel is great.  Close to everything and plenty of subway to get us places.  Buying fake bags was fun too, all the haggling and silliness of it all.  

People who don’t like this hotel are probably not frequent visitors to NY and can’t imagine how small some rooms are and how awful or dirty they could be.  This hotel is no frills but has all the elements needed to make for a good, comfortable, safe stay.  Would stay here again!

title: Three star hotel with a four star price tag
text: The hotel is well located however, on a busy street so quite noisy.  The rooms are a good size and beds comfortable.  Front desk staff were not super helpful and mostly indifferent.  Elevators super slow.  Overall, just an ok experience.

title: Enjoyed my stay here
text: Nice room, spacious, clean. View on the city was fantastic. Staff is very friendly, location is great close to the subway and easy to get to by car/taxi/uber. Restaurant does a decent menu too. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Double charged on a credit card booking, completely incompetent staff
text: I had a reservation that was booked through a credit card travel portal and fully prepaid. Upon arriving, they issued a new charge for the stay. I talked to the hotel staff 4 times - each time they agreed that it was an issue and they new pending charge would be removed. It was not removed, went through, and now I have to dispute it with my credit card instead because they staff is so incredibly incompetent.

title: Perfect hotel for Tribeca Rooftop event
text: Newly renovated hotel.  Quiet for being in NYC right on Canal Street.  The rooms are on the smaller size but normal for NYC hotel.  Had an event at the Tribeca Rooftop and this hotel was a perfect location to get to the event.  An easy 5-10 minute walk. Easy access to subways also.

title: Enjoyable stay and convenient location
text: We took a "girls trip" to Manhattan to visit family and friends.   We had a suite type room with a sofa, chairs and dining table which worked out well for visiting in the room. We enjoyed the rooftop lounge snack service and breakfast.  The views from the rooftop outdoor space and the room were excellent.   Staff at the hotel were competent, accommodating and pleasant.   The hotel location was convenient to walk to SoHo, Little Italy and the WTC Memorial.   It was also easy to access the subway and obtain taxis.

title: BUON HOTEL
text:
Buon hotel, posizione comoda vicina alla metro, a piedi è possibile raggiungere parecchi punti d'interesse.
Camera spaziosa, letto comodo nonostante il traffico e la confusione di New York le camere sono abbastanza silenziose.
E' possibile fare colazione a pagamento in hotel altrimenti si può uscire dall'hotel e si trovano sia bar che diner.

title: Very solid hotel. Angie was great at check in. We’ll be back! (Don’t let the Canal St address scare you off.)
text:
We’ve stayed there consistently over several years. Solid hotel. Great location. So close to the subway, TriBeCa, and more. 

No doubt we will return again and again. Not fancy. But usually reasonably priced for NYC. Great staff. We’ll be back. 👍

title: A good city sleep factory
text:
Built in 2010 and located in Lower Manhattan, the Sheraton TriBeCa Hotel offers 369 rooms over 22 floors. The hotel is an adequate city sleep factory. Staffs are helpful and friendly.

Our junior suite was adequately decorated and furnished, with a good king-size bed and a thin duvet. The room had a wardrobe with safe & ironing facility, fridge, desk & chair, couch, club-chair & table, dining table with 4 chairs, coffee facility, and a large TV. We had a separate bathroom with washbasin, toilet and shower. Window can be opened in safety mode. All was clean.

The complimentary buffet breakfast in the club lounge at floor 21 is average, with the usual US variety. Soft drinks, apples, crisps, bottled water and tea & coffee are available all day. The lounge has a terrace with a great view of mid-town.

When you fancy a good city hotel, Sheraton TriBeCa is the place for you.

title: Clean Room and Shower
text: We stayed at the hotel from September 21 through 25th 2022 for 5 nights.  The room size for New York was very good and the house keeping staff did a very good job in cleaning the room.  The front desk staff were helpful specially Carla who at our arrival made sure our keycard was functional.  The breakfast was good the issue we had was that tea or coffee was served in a small cup and it will get cold and you had to ask for refill. And When the restaurant was relatively full the breakfast served was also cold.

title: Need to improve the customer experience
text:
My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights 
•	On our the first Night we discovered the bed was broken and we requested the following day to have it fixed twice. This was not done so we requested it again twice the following day before it was actioned. No apology for the inconvenience (but we were given a new alarm clock for some reason?).
