•	On the first day our room was not cleaned, unfortunately housekeeping was misinformed and did not clean our room. 
•	The toiletries in the bathroom was not checked and we had to call and request shower gel twice as the receptionist did not act on the first request. 
•	The trip was a birthday trip and my sister had ordered a surprise for my birthday. The reception signed off on the delivery that was clearly marked with my name and room number. When I did not receive this on my birthday my sister asked if I had received the surprise which I had not. We asked in the reception and the people working at the time said that they had not received anything for me and when they checked they said they could not find anything. We asked again the morning of checking out and also showing the staff the confirmation my sister had received on the delivery but still the team could not find anything. Later the same morning they called our room and said they had found the package (a very large box that I recall having seen in the reception at least the day before).

title: We both really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Tribeca Hotel
text:
I spent an overnight trip with my best friend at the Sheraton Tribeca  and we both really enjoyed ourselves. She is a gold customer and they upgraded us to the Club Floor which was really nice. We got a room on the 22nd floor with an excellent view of Tribeca and the surrounding Canal Street neighborhoods. You could see a lot from our room with the views to the rivers and the roof top gardens.

Our beds were perfect and we both fell asleep when we got there. We both took a rest and then went down to the Happy Hour they had for club members and relaxed out on the Terrace. That also had nice views. It was nice to have a snack as neither of us were very hungry.

We both slept really well as the beds were so nice and firm and I went out like a light at 9:00pm later waking at four and then at six. I had not slept that well in a long time. The rooms were really quiet and we both got a good rest.

The Club Room also had a nice breakfast with scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, pastries and fruits. It was a nice meal and was just enough to start the day. We sat at the counter overlooking the Hudson River and just relaxed while we ate.

We went back to the room and relaxed and watched a movie until it was time to check out. It was a very pleasant morning and we had a nice stay.

The location was also perfect too within walking distance to Little Italy, Chinatown and SoHo and Tribeca restaurants and the subways. Overall it was a wonderful stay.

title: Just OK
text:
Not great, not bad.  

Pros:  Very close to several subway stations and multiple subway lines. Front desk, bartender and baggage room clerk very friendly and helpful. 

Cons:  Room not ready when we arrived after the check in time (although they did give us free drink vouchers while we waited).  No fridge in the room. WiFi at an additional charge.  Lots of street noise in room all night (9th floor).

title: Mal servicio Housekeeping
text:
Reserve de lunes a domingo. Confirme mi llegada por internet y cancelaron mi reservación aunque si me dieron habitación, eso fue bueno ya que llegue el martes por vuelos cancelados. 
Tuve que pedir papel sanitario, Kleenex, jabón para el cuerpo porque no ponían en la habitación, no lavaron el sanitario en toda la semana, solo entraban a hacer las camas, ningún día pusieron las toallas completas de nuevo. La hubicacion es buena pero si te importa la limpieza, tienen muy mal servicio en ese aspecto.

title: Decent hotel in good location (although the immediate surroundings may not be that pretty)
text: This is a decent standard-level Sheraton, nothing fancy and no spectacular views (at least that we could behold from our room overlooking some dingy rooftops). And to our disappointment, there were no nice streets or decent eateries in the immediate vicinity for a quick/good breakfast or late-evening snack. That being said, the Tribeca location is excellent for roaming around the southern part of Manhattan, if you like neighbourhoods like Tribeca itself, Greenwich Village, Soho, Chelsea etc... Manhattan is a "put your walking boots on" kinda place, and you can reach so many places easily from this hotel, so if you get a good deal, you won't go wrong.

title: Great location and good Club Lounge - good stay despite apprehension from other reviews
text:
We were slightly apprehensive in advance of our stay based on some of the reviews we’d read ahead of our trip.

We had booked a club level room so had access to the club lounge.

Rooms were spacious although they were a little tired.   Having stayed at the Moxy East Village before lockdown there’s obvious differences deciding to stay at a more ‘traditional’ hotel like the Sheraton Tribeca but based on the room rate we got and having a slightly different location we felt this was a good move which we were proved correct on.

As I said, the size of the room for NYC was excellent and location wise it was perfect as a base point for visiting the areas of NYC we planned to.   Even for alternative areas - because it was so close to the Subway it allowed us access to all points.
Even for our journey home as we were heading back to JFK at rush hour we were concerned on how much time we’d need - based on a local friends advice we took advantage of hotels location and got subway instead followed by the Airtrain which is something I didn’t think would have been a good idea but this was great due to close proximity to subway and allowed us to fully make the most of our last day.

I do understand the comments from those unhappy with street sellers etc but by same token you turn a different corner out the hotel and you are in the streets with all the high end shops so it really is in an interesting location but one we viewed as a positive.

The club lounge was a highlight of the stay.  It was clearly not the Ritz but having the happy hour with a selection of beers and wines and nibbles each night as well as complimentary breakfast was great.   The fact it had its own rooftop seating area was amazing too and we were gutted weather didn’t allow us to make more use of this although I don’t blame for the weather!! :)

Staff in lounge and reception were helpful and friendly and overall we had a really good stay and were pleased we opted for the Sheraton Tribeca.

title: Compete disappointment
text:
From the moment we approached the counter we realized this is going to be a poor stay. Not only the front desk attendant was unpleasant, not knowledgable and said our breakfast is not included (although we book a package rate with breakfast), the room itself has one of the worst views you can only imagine and on top of that the toilet is dirty (see photos). Very disappointed for this type of service from Sheraton and the for the rate we paid.
Marriott seem to be really going downhill

title: Good location and value for money
text: We are  Elite members of Marriott chain and have stayed in many of their hotels in New York. This was one of  the best, we have stayed here 4 or 5 times in the past 12 months. Mai at check in a warm friendly smile and professional, it was very busy and a few people waiting and she saw me as she was leaving work for the day and stopped and assist and help with the check in, not many would take the time to provide that service. Same for Kevin on the club floor, very polite and helpful. I recommend the Club floor as great value for money with good breakfasts and evening food and drinks. Walking distance to so many great spots

title: Not as advertised
text: We booked the Sheraton Tribeca for the main reason they had rooms with 2 double beds available for the weekend we wanted and many hotels did not in that area. We also liked the idea of having access to a beautiful rooftop bar as shown in the photos. My reservation stated 2 double beds, at check-in we were told we have been 'upgraded to jr suite' and it was much better. The staff told us that the sofa bed was already made and was 'very comfortable and the room was 'much larger. We got to the room to find the bed was folded up with old dusty sheets, the room was small and the bed was not a true king size. We are good friends but did not want to share a bed. Called back downstairs to find out the truth that no double rooms were available. We also found out that the rooftop was only for the executive levels. To try to make us happy they gave us access to the executive lounge and roof. The rooftop had old furniture, dirty, views into their laundry room, and is also a storage for items at one side of the roof. Not as shown in any way. The breakfast in the morning was minimal and they ran out of coffee and black tea. The attendant stayed in a small room and was not in attendance. When we walked into the small room to ask for coffee and tea, we were told they were out of black tea and the coffee would take a while. We ended up going downstairs to the lobby where we found black coffee and black tea. The hotel needs to work on its hospitality and sell what they actually advertise. Trust has been lost and will not be back.

title: My go-to hotel in lower Manhattan!
text: The staff at this hotel especially Mai Garcia the general manager, is so awesome! Responsive & attentive, problem solving people despite frustrating snafoos with the Marriott reservation system. Kudos to them! This hotel is centrally located near Tribeca, Soho and Chinatown. The rooftop deck has an amazing view of the skyline. The only challenge is the slow elevators…

title: Sheraton Tribeca
text: Mian thing this hotel has going for it is the location in heart of Tribeca.   Otherwise rooms are run down.  Front desk staff not helpful. No onsite hotel parking;  have to go across busy new york street to park car (garage is on one way street so have to go two blocks around block to park car) then return to hotel.  No parking discount.  Overall despite location. would not stay here again

title: Good location but rather average
text: So it’s in a great location right by Canal Street subway for easy access uptown and downtown. A short walk from the heart of Soho too. I had an executive room on the 19th floor with a great view looking toward Empire State Building. The top floor executive lounge was a bit disappointing except for the terrace with a fabulous view.

title: Convenient Location and Great Service
text:
We were so glad that we booked the Sheraton Tribeca. Located close to a number of subway lines, it was easy for us to get to and then go out and explore the city using the subway. There are a number of places nearby to grab something to eat, but the neighborhood as a whole has a number of empty stores and boarded up buildings. 

Our room was spacious and clean with a nice large bed, a good size bathroom and walk in shower, and a nice view. Even though we were up on the 17th floor, we could still hear the honks and general noises of the area. 

The front desk was very helpful, storing our luggage, making recommendations, etc.

If you are a tech person, make sure you download their app so you can use your phone as your room key. We did that and it was so helpful! You can also check in online as well, so in reality, you never have to stop at the front desk if you are checked in, your room is ready and you use your phone as your room key!

We really enjoyed our stay and might stay there again if we come back to NYC!

title: Meh stay with convenient location
text: As others noted, the hotel is a bit dated with worn-out furniture in the lobby for the price. The shower started making noises and pipes shook when I turned up the hot water. On the plus side, staff was nice and the location was convenient for subway access and getting around Soho. I liked use of larger dispensers of shampoo, conditioner and soap in the shower instead of those itty bitty plastic bottles.

title: Great location!
text:
I last stayed here in January 2020 before returning in April 2022.  It was nice to see how attentive, friendly and helpful the front desk staff still is.  However there were a few glitches.  As a lifetime Bonvoy Titanium member I was entitled to a room upgrade.  Even though a higher level of room was available to book online not 10 minutes prior to arriving at the hotel, I wasn't offered one.  I can only think this was down to the fact I had gotten a look no further rate. I also checked in online and requested extra towels and hangers as I was travelling with my husband.  Guess what?  There was 1 bath towel, 1 hand towel and 2 washcloths along with empty shampoo, conditioner and body wash bottles and 4 hangers in the closet.  Now they knew there would be 2 people in the room so what was up?  I went downstairs to get what I had requested and they were delivered.  Maybe I can put that mix up down to staffing?  Who knows?  But 1 set of towels and 4 hangers for 2 people is just plain ridiculous!  
Now I also had access to the Executive Lounge.  Imagine my surprise when I entered to see the exact same stained and filthy chairs and the ripped carpet!  This is a lounge for people Platinum and above or paying for an executive level room.  There is absolutely no excuse for this.  Especially as it was already horrible 2 years ago!  I also gave to say the breakfast was disappointing.  The eggs were always overcooked and dry.  3 of 6 days the bacon was cooked so little it looked raw.  The other days the bacon was so overcooked it could have been used a crumbles in a salad.  And don't even get me started on the bread.  It was the weirdest bread I have ever seen!  Uber large, thick, hard crust and untoastable.
Now I have to say the location for my needs is perfect but there definitely needs to be improvement.

title: Amazing Front Desk Service!
text: The hotel communication from the front desk was an unexpected treat.  From the pre stay emails with information about the hotel and room availability through check out I was just so impressed.  I did not expect to be able to use my suite award but happy when it was confirmed.  Unfortunately there was a maintenance issue and it was not available.  The lovely girl at the front desk informed me before the stay, moved me to a very nice room, and awarded me with Marriott points and a very nice bottle of wine.  It was so unexpected.  Thank you Sheraton for empowering your team and fostering a culture of fantastic service!

title: Clean, Convenient, Beautiful View- 100% would stay again
text:
We stayed in the hotel at the end of March. First impressions of the hotel weren't great- outside looked a bit shabby, but this was our first time in New York- and after a few days we realised that a lot of Manhattan looks this way!  We went in through the doors and were met with a lovely, clean hotel. 
The receptionists were very friendly, offered us water, but I don't think there was enough detail in telling us about the hotel. I'm not sure if this was just a Covid thing- to get through as many check ins as quickly as possible, and we did get an email with information but we were literally given our room cards- without being told where the room was, did we need help with bags?, what time breakfast would be, where we'd find the lounge etc. 
Our first room I wasn't happy with. The window was like a postage stamp in the corner of the room. I had specifically requested a city view and expected to have one of the floor to ceiling windows like in the pictures. I went straight to reception and requested a new room. They didn't have any for that night- but promised we could get one the next day. We didn't unpack- which was a slight inconvenience, and we thought that they'd be able to move our cases and bags during the day without us (we left them on the bed ready to move) but were told that we needed to bring them down- and take them back up when we came back that evening. It was a little bit of an inconvenience but the new room made up for it. 
We had the most beautiful view of the empire state building and NYC. The room was spacious, clean and our room servicer 'Ana' always left us nice notes. We found we needed more coffee - a decaf for night- and one for the morning each, requested it on the notepad, and it was there each day for us, along with extra milk and water. The bathroom was immaculate, and the bed was so so so comfy! 

We paid extra for club room access- another real winner. I've used club access and lounges all over the world and you usually fine that its awful wine/ beer. We were impressed by the choice, corona, brooklyn beer- and some other local one- all really nice according to my other half, wine there was 2 reds, 2 whites- one of which was my usual oyster bay- which is usually a more expensive wine and I didn't expect it for free. From 5.30-7.30 you can have beer and wine for free! There's a server who will pour your drinks, I'd have rather had a glass though instead of a plastic cup- but I'm assuming this is another covid-safe thing. 
There was salad, a selection of cheese, cold meats, dips, crackers, crips, and a hot item such as pigs in blanket, or samosa with spinach and ricotta (i think). Either way, it was a nice snack before we headed back out for our evening in the city each night.  Through the day you can have breakfast items in the morning and help yourself to cans of drink (they did have diet options-  it worried me in a previous post they said they had none!), water, coffee throughout the day and night. 
The lounge also gives you access to a rooftop area with the most beautiful view of Manhattan. 

I loved the location. literally a minutes walk from one of the main route sunway station, You could get from your hotel room to times square in about 10 minutes! the trains were so regular we weren't waiting longer than 5 minutes at any point. There was always a presence from staff/ police on the subway and I felt pretty safe at most points. No one likes seeing homeless people/ people on drugs- but we did see a few around Manhattan. Not really any near the hotel though. 

There is a shop next door that sold sandwiches- try their sliced meat sandwich with swiss cheese- game changer! We thought their pizza was great- but if you come out of the hotel- turn left, cross the road.. there's another pizza place there thats even better. 
The lift was fast, wasn't waiting long for it even at busier times. There was 3 available. One day they were servicing the lifts and only had 1 in operation- it was a bit of a nightmare, but they ended up opening a staff lift, and the manager had a table in the foyer at the evening handing out free wine to all guests- which was a nice touch. 

The staff- probably the only let down of the hotel (apart from the view on that first night). The guys on reception were amazing, nothing was ever too much. 

One of the days we ordered breakfast from the room- omelette, it came with the option of bacon or vegan sausage. My partner didn't want it with meat- he wanted some mushrooms. But was told that he needed to pay 2 dollars for it with mushrooms, and we needed to give card payment to cover the additional 2 dollars. I said id pay cash- nope... needed card. I felt uncomfortable doing this. Bacon costs more than mushrooms so we couldn't see the issue with swapping- but they weren't willing to be flexible. 

One evening we used the bar. The barman served us, and another gentleman around 9pm. He then disappeared. We wanted another drink... went to the reception desk but they didn't know where he'd gone either. We (and the other gentleman) ended up going and buying some drinks from the shop next door and going to our own rooms. 

My partner appeared to have issues most mornings at breakfast- he ate his meal with a spoon once because a fork wasn't given and even after requesting one- it never came. 
Milk wasn't offered with tea/coffee- I had to ask for it

But... they were the only issues in our 5 night stay, pretty minor. 

We 100% would opt to stay here again on our next stay. Staying away from time square was a worry for me at first- but the location is amazing, the subway is literally on the doorstep (and for 34 dollars all week a cheap option !) ... and I'd say it has one of the best bedroom views in the city. Why stay within a concrete jungle with noise, chaos and expensive food- when you can stay just outside the madness for a fraction of the price!

title: Clean rooms, but nothing special
text: You can't beat the price. I just needed a place to stay for one night and it fit the bill fine. Rooms are small, but that's typical for NYC and I've definitely stayed in smaller. The lobby is kind of odd - you access the elevators in a very narrow area and it felt cramped. But the room was clean and I slept well. But there was a definite lack of attention to detail. There's a coffee maker with coffee in the room, but only decaf coffee was available. But this is a Sheraton, so I wasn't expecting much else.

title: Very mixed experience
text:
Some things here are great, others are still impacted by Covid.  For example, the restaurant/bar is only open Thursday-Sunday for dinner.

The main problem is the front desk is staffed by a single person all day long.  I was waiting to check luggage and had to wait 15 minutes while a complicated issue was dealt with in front of me.  Why is he left out there alone to deal with everything? There was a line of 6 parties waiting for him. Please hire help.

In general it is still a good place to stay in the area.

title: Decent  choice in that area
text: Room was fine - a little dated, but a decent size, clean, quiet.  There was a small restaurant in the lobby area. Reception people were friendly. Location right on Canal and near multiple subway lines. Walk to Chinatown, little Italy, soho. Tons of food and beverage options everywhere.

title: Don’t stay here
text:
The hotel is located on Canal street which busy but doesn’t look so shady as there is always someone. We saw just one incident but like in minute there were 6 police cars dealing with the situation.
The hotel itself is old with nice view of empire state building of course only if you pay for the city view. We had mold in bathroom, blood on curtains and the worst pillow and duvet cases ever…..
Air conditioning is very noisy and makes air very dry. Also for  two nights we didn’t get proper sleep at all as there was someone partying or fighting next door during entire night…
The worst thing about the stay was that my full Shopping bag went missing probably housekeeper stole it…we reported it on reception they investigated for two days and after that one rude receptionist told us that they don’t know what happened housekeeper didn’t see any bag…obviously but the management decided to give us free night  not even making up for what was in the bag. When was the receptionist informing us about the outcome she didn’t even apologised for the situation or offered anything else except the free night which I would say is the minimum to do for such hotel in situation like this in brand like Sheraton.
Not even saying we expected something for my husband’s birthday as it usual in hotels around the world.
They also took deposit for the room twice and gave us back only one even it is more than 14 days what they have as limit for returning the deposit.
Overall I would not say this is Sheraton 4 star hotel…stay somewhere else

title: New Go To Hotel In NYC
text: Had a great stay. Hotel was well kept and rooms were a good size for in the city. If you get Club level or have status, the lounge was very nice for the view alone (snacks and drinks were a bonus!) Will stay again!

title: Decepcionado , esperaba más por el precio y la cadena del hotel
text:
Hotel ubicado en el Soho muy cerca de China town i little Italy pero en una calle muy ruidosa por el tráfico, bien comunicado por metro, las vistas desde la terraza de la zona club espectaculares pero aquí se acaba el encanto, habitación pequeña con armario más pequeño, todo bastante antiguo y con moqueta, el baño poco iluminado i también pequeño, la calefacción por aire ruidosa y poco funcional el servicio justo. Si contratas habitación club, tienes desayuno todos los días (o casi pues un día nos dejaron sin por problemas internos), por la noche tienen unos kits con embutido bastante malo y a todas horas puedes coger patatas fritas y agua.
Bastante decepcionante para el nombre y precio del hotel.

title: Excellent Lounge, Odd Breakfast Arrangements
text: Stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for one night as a Bonvoy Plat. Was told that the upgraded room (a deluxe/superior) they had assigned me was unavailable at 2.30pm as the guest was checking out at 4pm. Not ideal since I had indicated I would check-in at 3.00pm using mobile check in, but the front desk associate managed to assign me another room with a city view. Rooms are nice. The club lounge is excellent and I used it to take several calls with Asia in the wee hours (i.e. 2am) during my stay. Limited food options, but coffee/tea/soda readily available. I had a very odd experience with breakfast when the server was insistent that the restaurant (a) did not allow guests to charge to the room, and (b) would not honor hotel breakfasts. I was given vouchers for this after clarifying with the front desk but it was a poor experience, plus the food was all served in take out containers, as if it was brought in from an outside diner. Would return should travel bring me to lower Manhattan. Good choice for Plats and above, given lounge access.

title: Great first NYC trip. Average stay at the Sheraton.
text:
Not too much to say about the Sheraton. I arrived at around 12:30PM to check in and the front desk area was nice and very clean. The staff were pleasant and attentive to my questions. I had 5 gift cards to use (totaling $150) but wasnt able to use them due to me checking in via my phone. That was my bad! I was told I could use them at checkout. No problem!

I made it up to my room (1111), which greeted me right off the elevator. Inside was pretty standard amenity-wise, but a bit on the smaller side. Understandable, as space in NYC is a premium. There were only two gripes that I could come up with. The shower space was laughingly small but the extra, smaller shower head made up for it. I'm not a wide guy but if I stood shoulder to shoulder to the wall and curtain (facing the shower head), the curtain would drape over a quarter of my body! The other gripe was the telephone in the room. It was extremely dirty (see picture) and looks like it hadn't been cleaned in a while. Not sure what the policy was on that one. The bed was average, but a bit worn out. I slept like a baby though, part from all of the walking I did that day.

Before I began my journey into the city, a gentleman asked me if I wanted a glass of wine. SURE! I'm not one to turn it down. I finished it quick and was off to the races.

Checkout the next day was pretty uneventful but quick. I handed over my gift cards to the staff member, which she took care of. I was told it was going to take awhile to input the cards but I will get a copy of the bill in my email. No problem, and I was on my way shortly after.

After I got home, I checked my email for the receipt. The total look a bit off but I let it ride for a few days. Maybe I'll get a credit to the card instead? I just checked my credit card statement today and I was charged $215 for the total stay. It should been around $100 after the cards. Not sure what happened. I emailed Marriott support and am waiting to hear back from them. I understand that things happen and I'm pretty sure Marriott will make it right. I'll post a reply once I get the outcome from them.

Overall the stay was average. Not good, not bad, just alright. Would I stay here again? Probably not. In a pinch? Sure, but I'll be looking elsewhere first to rest my head for the night.

title: Avoid - not even good as a ‘base’.
text:
We were really bitterly disappointed with this hotel.

We were on the 15th floor facing the road and the noise was unbearable. We live on a main road in central London. We are used to a busy road but the hotel windows did little to nothing. We barely slept the whole time.

The club is a joke, breakfast was almost acceptable but there was no diet soft drinks or snacks the whole time we were there. I reported to reception twice and was told “we’ll let them know”. The evening appetisers was pre packed meet and cheese. The same every night. 

The website said fully renovated: absolutely not. It is old and tired.

We left early in the end and cut our stay short. We were supposed to be moving to a Sheraton in Orlando but based on this experience we’ve cancelled that too.

title: On y va les yeux fermés
text: Préférer une chambre dans les étages hauts ( j’ai eu au second étage et on ne voit rien) . Belle chambre grande, lit de qualité, salle de bain  sympa. Plusieurs ascenseurs, pas trop d’attente. A priori roof top mais pas accès avec ce prix. Accueil professionnel, bagages  gardés si besoin. Bref je recommande

title: Tried A Bait and Switch at Check-In
text:
Typical Sheraton room and amenities. Pretty small elevators, so very long wait times. The positives are the executive lounge and that it is pet friendly. Also, the room was quiet for NYC (we did not have a view — faced a wall and rooftop). 

BUT….
I’ve never had this happen to me before, but the hotel tried a bait and switch at check-in. 

I had booked a King suite (with a sofa bed for our daughter) at a higher rate than a regular double room. The website said the room included executive lounge access & I called the hotel to confirm this. 

However, at check-in they tried to give me a double room and said off-handedly, “oh we are overbooked and don’t have your room but we still have you in a room with two beds so it’s the same — plus we are giving you lounge access.” Sorry, I’m not stupid. I politely pushed back and then she went in the back room to speak to the manager and “oh look, we found a king suite room for you.” Great. 

Then she said that the room did not actually include lounge access. Fortunately, I remembered the name of the hotel employee who told me on the phone that it did include lounge access. I mentioned his name and “oh yes, it does include lounge access.” 🙄

So, just watch your back at check-in.

title: Not a great stay
text:
Upon arrival, I was greeted at the front desk by an employee who wore no mask for Covid precautions and who proceeded to check me in while talking on the phone.  This was not a good first impression.

I have stayed in many hotels in NYC over the years, but the room at the Sheraton has to be the smallest room I’ve ever stayed in (standard King). The only silver lining to the room size was that I was traveling alone because It would have been challenging to have more than one person in that space.  

The bed was very firm, and although I’m not opposed to a good firm mattress, this was so firm that it was uncomfortable.  I normally sleep very soundly when I travel, but I found myself tossing all night trying to get comfortable.

The location was very good, with the ACE subway station just around the corner, making it super easy to ride the subway to and from JFK, and shopping in Soho was a few short blocks away.

title: Worst experience in my 10 years traveling to new york
text:
1. Horrible customer service and worst front desk
2. All you care is to take money, not give the service
3. On the first night we were put in room 710. It looks into windows, how insensitive! we will be there for 7 days, and you put a lady in a room which looks into windows, where will I change clothes, how will I open windows?
4. I asked for a room change and was told I have to bring my bags down at 12 and wait till room is ready!!! how inconvenient. You want the room free to put in another poor traveler. You dont care about convenience.
5. Even after putting in the sign for "Don't disturb", someone came into my room without knocking. I reported it to the front desk, and no one did anything. All the answers I got was we are investigating. You have cameras, how long does it take to investigate?
6. The cards are supposed to allow us to use gyms and 21st-floor lounges, but cards don't work.
7. The front desk gentleman on Sunday, Oct 31 around 8-9 PM was so rude, didn't share any info on when breakfast is available (to buy), gym, 21st floor etc.
8. who charges for wifi in the 21st century!! even subway has free wifi

title: I Love this property!
text: What more could you want?  Great downtown location, clean rooms, Amazing associates who consistently go out of their way to help guests, always with a smile (behind the mask), for a reasonable (for nyc!) price. As a titanium member. I’ve been to many properties; this is My “go to” nyc hotel!

title: Great view, professional staff, best-in-class hotel experience
text: We had a City View room on the 17th floor and the view from the window was outstanding.  The staff was very professional and well-trained, and offered services before we even asked.  Every request was addressed well and quickly.  The fitness center is open 24/7.  Good food in SoHo, Little Italy and Chinatown nearby. Bed was comfy, rooms quiet. The price was very reasonable for the quality of the hotel.  I would highly recommend this hotel for stays in NYC.

title: Thanks for the wonderful stay!
text: I stayed at the property on the weekend on October 1st. I was greeted nicely at check-in and my room was ready slightly before 3pm.  The lobby, elevator and my room were decorated with a modern look. The bed was comfortable and the environment was exceptionally clean. I needed some extras like blankets and water and all were delivered to my room in record time. When checking out, the front desk staff pleasantly secured my bags, while I went out to take care of some last minute business. Of course,  it’s an amazing location but I can’t say enough about this kind of attentive service the entire staff displayed during my stay. I’m certainly grateful and wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

title: Terrific Spot
text: The hotel was very clean and the staff was excellent. We would stay there again next time we are in NYC. The room was a good size and the noise was minimal. In terms of location, easy access in and out of the city and lots of places are a short walk or bike ride away.

title: Great Staff!
text: Honestly, the best hotel staff ever. They were all so nice and helpful and exactly the kind of people you'd want be there during your stay. We were able to check in early and leave our stuff in our room while we went out during the day. The room was clean and as expected.

title: Lovely stay
text: Very friendly & helpful staff. Large clean rooms, great location.  Grocery next door is super convenient & good food too! Street noise is loud around rush hour. Subway station around the corner.  Overall a great stay….will be back!

title: Nice clean comfortable
text:
If you are used to a European style smaller room hotel you would like this. It’s downtown close to Chinatown little Italy and World Trade……clean rooms nice staff. Great rooftop concierge lounge. 

Next to the “shopping” on canal street but better shopping in Greenwich Village

title: Value for money was not worth it
text: Many things went wrong during my stay - lights weren't working, TV was broken, room service is a weird outsourced service, and on top of all of this the rooftop is only available if you pay an additional charge ($30 per night per person). The whole reason we booked this hotel was because we were under the impression we would be able to use the rooftop. This hotel is not worth the money and I feel extremely misled. Book another hotel if you're between two choices.

title: The staff needs training!
text:
This hotel staff is a mess!!!
We stayed there shortly after a storm hit.  I had used the online chat on their website to request an early check in and was told that they would make a note of it, but couldn’t guarantee (totally understandable).  When we arrived we found out that the computer system had been down for several days, and they couldn’t do early checkins; obviously this had been an ongoing problem, but honesty would have been appreciated.

When we finally checked in we were given a room that someone was already in, which was a bit awkward.  We were given a different room and vouchers for free breakfast which we found out the next day were unusable because the computer system was down.  A couple hours after we checked in, people were given a card key to our room and tried to enter.  It would seem that a simple spreadsheet could be used to keep track of which rooms were occupied.  The staff did not seem at all phased that they were giving people the same rooms and keys to other people’s rooms.

The hotel is in a great location, but the staff is very inexperienced in customer service, and we won’t be back!

title: Back after a long absence
text:
This is our usual place to stay when we visit the City and we have missed it over the past 18 months.  All the old staff seems to be gone, but the new folks tried hard and made it work.   Hotel is having system problems since Ida and some checkin/checkout processes were done on paper, but our room was fine and the lounge had decent b'fast options (no fruit the second day, though) and snacks for "Happy Hour".  And the deck is open again which is the best part of the hotel!

Housekeeping is "limited" on weekends, just empty trash and replace towels, although that didn't happen for us but we asked for fresh towels as we didn't know they were limiting service and had left them on the floor.

No Platinum b'fast offered, but we got points instead

title: Great Hotel! Great Location! Great Staff! Great Stay!
text: What a great stay!  I travel weekly and the most frustrating part of traveling is the poor attitude that I encounter when staying in hotels.  Thankfully that is not the case at the Sheraton Tribeca.  The hotel is obviously facing the same staffing challenges that we see everywhere today (I work in healthcare so I definitely understand), but the attitude of the team off this hotel truly sets them apart from their competition.  Everyone we met greeted us with a smile and a warm “how can I help you”.  Not once did we feel as though we were a burden to the staff.  Unfortunately this just isn’t the same everywhere else.  Our room was spacious for New York and we had an incredible view from the top floor.  There is Starbucks coffee in the room and ice make and drink machine on our floor.  The location of this hotel is PERFECT.  Train is close so you can get anywhere quickly or just venture out the door to find so many great restaurants and shopping close by.  There is a great little store directly next door (Tribeca Bagels) that has great bagels, coffee, smoothies and food.  Really is a GREAT little deli.  So, to wrap up…If you’re heading to the city this is an excellent hotel.  The attitude of the staff is a great reflection on the management team of the hotel. They are clearly doing something right!  WE WILL BE BACK:)

title: Home away from home
text: I thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Sheraton Tribeca, which has a warm, welcoming atmosphere. A special shoutout to Mai Garcia, who took extra steps to address all our needs, including restaurant recommendations and reservations. She served as front desk supervisor, lounge attendant, housekeeping supervisor, concierge and everything else.

title: Overall great hotel, nice staff
text:
Due to some unforeseen flight changes, I arrived well before my check-in time. After an exhausting day of travel, the front desk team found a room for me and let me check-in early. My stress levels dropped immediately. I got to shower and rest ahead of a long day.

The hotel itself is clean, staff friendly, rooms friendly...legit, no complaints here. 
The cleaning staff were friendly and provided anything we needed.

title: Clean, comfortable, great staff and lounge deck
text:
I met up with friends for an extended weekend, and we booked this hotel due to the amazing deal we got. It was also an area of the city where we haven't stayed before.

We all had our own rooms scattered across a few floors, so we used the lounge as a meetup spot. In particular, we took advantage of the great outdoor deck space! There was always room for us and the staff was so nice. We enjoyed the refreshments, though it did seem they went through a lot of bottled water. It would be nice to provide a water bottle refill station for guests like the one in the workout area. 

Our rooms were clean and comfortable (if a bit on the small side, but that's NYC). The hotel is in a great location with easy access to multiple subway lines and everything we wanted to do. I will definitely stay there again!

title: Great hotel !! And so clean!!
text:
Me and my fiancé stayed here for a weekend to get away and site see in the city. The hotel is super clean!!! The staff made us feel so welcomed. We asked the front desk for places to visit and they were super helpful and offered great suggestions. It was a great stay. Suggested this hotel to my friends going next month! 

THANK YOU !

title: Great experience!!!
text: It was a nice experience to stay at this hotel. I’m very happy of my choice. The staffs were friendly and helpful. My room was nice and clean with all the amenities necessary for my stay. I loved it!!

title: Hot Week in NYC with a Sheraton Oasis in the middle of it all
text:
We really picked a hot week to visit New York. But at the end of every busy day it was so amazing to come home to an air-conditioned room full of all the luxuries you need to take the edge off travel. We made many requests of the front staff all of which were handled beautifully. The staff was professional, warm and friendly. 

The room all those small felt luxurious and very cozy. Bathroom was clean and up to date. Shower pressure was strong and just right. The TV allowed us to use YouTube Netflix Amazon and others by signing into our accounts. The beds were easy to sleep in and super cozy. If I ever go back I will definitely use this hotel again.

The photo was taken from our room. Next door was an amazing coffee shop, Cafe Bene, and across the street, Matchful, for you matcha devotees. I also recommend Macau bar/restaurant for drinks and food.

title: Unsurpassed experience!!!!  👏
text: Convenient location with all the amenities.  Beautiful views from the rooftop terrace and our Empire State building room type was incredible.  I actually awoke pre-dawn to take a pic (I am not an early riser at all but, couldn't resist).  Club access was superb.  The room was very clean and included a safe.  From beginning to end, all of the staff at the Sheraton Tribeca were very welcoming (especially Mia! She is such a beautiful person.  She made us feel like family.)  We ate in Little Italy which is walking distance.  Hopped in an Uber for a quick ride to the Ipic theatre in the Fulton Market by the South Street Seaport (you have to go there).  Partied all night on a yacht cruise too.  I am still smiling as I am writing this review.  We had a blast!!  Thank you all!!! We will be back very soon!

title: Sheraton Tribeca  NYC: great hotel and location
text: DO NOT pay Attention to any  negative reviews. This hotel was excellent from day one...Nani and Gary at guest services were so nice and helpful...The room was spacious and clean..I stayed in a king room with a fabulous view of the Empire State building..definitely consider staying at THIS  hotel when staying in Manhattan

title: Wonderful NYC Property
text: Excellent stay at this property. Seamless check in, with the front desk team upgrading our experience when reserved room type not available. We were put on the Club Floor with access to the Club Lounge, and given an extra hour to check out the following day. Two nice (and unexpected) gestures which made our visit even more enjoyable. Lobby, Club Lounge, elevators and room/bathroom were spotless. Room HVAC quiet. Great view to the east. Loved the lounge (and the abundant bottles of water).

title: Nice hotel at a good rate in Manhattan
text: The staff took care of my every need, and accommodated my request for a room change... Although the breakfast staff was limited due to COVID, they were always with a smile and ready to take care of me...thanks...

title: Amazing hotel with great amenities, highly recommended.
text: The check in process was smooth and seamless. The staff was efficient, helpful, and very accommodating. My room was on the 16th floor, it was very clean and cozy with an amazing view of the Empire State Building.  The bed was comfortable and the bedding/pillows were perfect. The television was a little off set from the bed but I didn’t have a problem watching it as there is a comfortable chair directly situated in front of the television. There was plenty of lighting, if needed. The alarm clock has 2 Built in USB ports so we can charge our electronic devices. The bathroom was clean and roomy with good quality towels. Once I was ready to check out, the checkout process was very quick and the staff was just as pleasant checking out. Thank you for the hospitality!!

title: An excellent choice for your SoHo Stay in NYC
text: Great staff, clean hotel and many amenities! The front desk staff was very supportive and kind. The rooms were very clean and well kept, updated. The Concierge Level was outstanding along with the roof terrace. Lounge was stocked 24/7 with coffee and cold beverages along with snacks. The breakfast offering was  excelent!

title: A great 7 nights stay !
text:
This hotel is great in every aspect:
Location: superb right in the Tribeca, walking distance to SOHO, 10 mins walk to Chinatown and Little Italy, 5 mins walk to subway A, C, E where you can go anywhere in the city.
Room: got upgraded to Club Level for my Marriott Elite status. Room is super clean and good size compared to other NYC hotels. Other online negative reviews do not apply to the room I stay.
Great Staff: this is the greatest part of my stay. Gary in front desk and reservation service is very helpful and takes good care of my stay. Javier and Rosalva in restaurant offer great service during the breakfast hours. All other staff I have encountered are very friendly and accommodating.
Overall, I highly recommend this hotel and will come back again.

title: Pleasant Surprise
text: Spent a long weekend there as my daughter was getting married in SoHo...The room and bathroom were spotless, had a great view, and was in a good location...Chinatown and Little Italy were  within walking distance and any other place was easily accessible by Uber or Taxi. Due to all the excitement of the wedding, I had accidentally left a wedding card for my daughter in the room... Of course after years of hearing NYC  stories about crime and corruption, I was sure never to see that card again... but 24 hours later, when I called the hotel... The staff found it still in the room gave it to the front desk... Needless to say I am forever grateful to the kind, courteous staff from the front desk to housekeeping...THANK YOU so so much Sheraton Tribeca... we'll be back and I assure you we'll be staying at the Sheraton Tribeca

title: Great spot for a Tribeca stay
text:
Everything was great during our stay. Everyone was kind and gracious. The 2 folks at breakfast were great. So was the staff we interacted with at the front desk.

We were in town to move our daughter into her new apartment in Tribeca and we would definitely stay with you again when we come up to visit.

title: Great Price and Convenient Location
text:
The hotel is right on canal street and a two minute walk to three different subway lines and a 10 minute walk to Chinatown. The price I had was very reasonable for a weekend trip. I travel alot for work and always pictured Sheraton hotels to be stuffy business hotels and a little dated but this one shattered my expectations as it was well updated and, despite COVID restrictions, received daily room service.

The only hiccup was a small technicality about loyalty benefits that had no impact on the stay and was proactively corrected by the manager without me asking.

title: NYC Visit
text: I  have over 2,000 nights at Marriott. The staff at this hotel was exceptional. They are professional and very friendly. I dealt with Nelson for one situation and he was very professional and wonderful to deal with. My compliments to his supervisor for hiring such an exceptional person to assist the guests. Great location and good prices for NYC.

title: An Amazing Time on Canal Street
text: That was my first time staying in your hotel.  I visit NYC often and I'm glad I stayed with you and your staff.  Every staff person I encountered was pleasant, professional and eager to assist.  My room was clean/sanitized and the cleaning staff actually worried me to clean my room and I didn't need it cleaned the first day.  I appreciate the willingness of their expertise!  I will be back!

title: Great location and service
text: We visited NYC for a friend's bridal shower in SOHO. The hotel is in walking distance to all the great restaurants and shops and the staff were superb. Room was clean and comfortable for the 3 of us which was nice . We highly recommend staying here and we will definitely be back.

title: Bday staycation
text: We turned a 2 night stay into 3 nights :) Clean room, super comfy bed, and excellent city views. Gary from the front desk was our first point of contact and he was wonderful. Overall relaxing stay & helpful staff. Thank you!

title: Friendly Staff
text: Booked for five days. Friendly staff throughout the whole trip. Helpful from the moment of check-in and nice greetings throughout the day. Housekeeping was also nice, cleaned the room very well. Would stay here again.

title: Sheraton tribeca is awesome
text: Sheraton Tribeca is the place for an awesome New York Vacation!! The staff and management are excellent! They go above and beyond to assist their customers. Cleanliness of the room and lobby were top notch!  Shout out to Amanda the supervisor and to the amazing gentleman at the front desk who checked us in june 20 at 3pm. The free breakfast we had as platinum eite members were so delicious and the service was excellent. Location was near subways and Nice walk to World Trade Center. Thank youn Sheraton Tribeca!!!!!

title: Great property and great service
text: Have had two excellent experiences at this hotel.  Staff is very friendly and extremely helpful.  Within walking distance of both Chinatown and Little Italy.   Definitely recommended for a stay in lower Manhattan.

title: Horrible experience
text: We booked a hotel here a month ago and received confirmation a few days before that our reservation was confirmed. When we showed up at the front lobby, we were told that the hotel was closed to the public, nothing else. We went outside, confirmed the address, and then went back in. It was only then that the hotel staff approached us and told us that the hotel had been converted in a Covid-19 treatment facility and that we should have received notification weeks ago that our stay was canceled. WE RECEIVED NO NOTIFICATION! And we unknowingly exposed ourselves to Covid-19. How are there not better protocols to prevent unknowing individuals from entering that facility? And why wouldn't you contact us? Customer Service also did nothing and admitted no fault about their non-existent policies. And we had to rebook a much more expensive room at a different hotel for a much higher price. I will never stay at another Sheraton property because of this.

title: OK hotel; staff not wearing masks properly
text: Most of the staff were wearing masks, but then a couple consistently weren't or weren't doing so over their nose. Not only does this have direct effects, but models the wrong behavior. Encountered people in elevators without masks, not sure if they were guests or visiting the rooftop bar or what.

title: The worse and nasty hotel to stay in NY !!
text: It is incredible how a hotel of Sheraton level can operate in such dirty conditions and without any type of sanitary regulation, even more in times of pandemic.  I am still waiting for the recognition and credit of my stay by Marriott Bomboy of which I am a Gold member.  You just have to see the photos of the sheets and bed covers with fungus to imagine the hygiene and cleanliness conditions with which they maintain the hotel in which I was forced to leave immediately the next day without receiving any type of refund for the night.

title: terrible customer service in addition to incompetency
text: I stayed at this location from Oct 16th to Oct 18th.  I find it totally unprofessional that a hold is still on my credit card and when I call to speak to a manager or someone in accounting, I'm always getting a "they are not in."  This is extremely unprofessional now.  The bill for my stay has been paid.  The $200 was a "deposit" I was told, which I totally understand, but why is it still showing on my credit card and why am I getting the runaround from your organization?

title: Decent place to stay
text: We had a decent stay at this motel. It was located in an easy location to drive to with a parking garage nearby.  We had a room right off the elevator, so we had a lot of late night noise from others.  If our room would have been located away from the elevator, im sure it would have been nice and quiet.  The restaurant was closed at the time we were there, so no breakfast at the motel.

title: Mai is the best!
text: Thank you to Mai at the concierge. I had many special requests and she was more than accommodating. I will be back. I have stayed at multiple hotels during the past year and really appreciate the hospitality offered by Mai. :)

title: Tiny rooms, terrible location next to the Holland Tunnel
text:
It may just be due to the pandemic, but my stay was not good. Perhaps the worst part of the stay was the fact that my room faced Canal St, which leads to the Holland Tunnel. As I was working remotely, I was distracted all day by New Yorkers honking. If you plan on staying in you room between rush hours, do not stay facing the Empire State building.

There were a lot of small things that needed repair. My AC vent tended to rattle. The shower door doesn't close all the way, so my bathroom was always wet. The desk is not flat, which made working on a laptop difficult. The internet got pretty slow at times. Parts of the building would creak when the wind blows. 

Additionally, the room was so tiny I couldn't open my luggage rack. However, my stay was pretty cheap at about $80 per night. You get what you pay for.

title: Letti comodissimi
text:
Un consiglio per tutti quelli che devono ancora prenotare l’albergo, io sono a New York l’anno scorso e ho prenotato l’hotel Sheraton Tribeca. Lo consiglio vivamente per un motivo il letto ha un materasso comodissimo ed è una cosa fondamentale perché camminando tutto il giorno, quando si torna in camera è fondamentale riposare bene e questo è davvero confortevole!!! Meno male!!! È anche curata e pulita al punto giusto, con bottiglie d’acqua complimenary sostituite tutti giorni. ￼
Aggiungo alcune immagini della camera per il resto non posso dare altri giudizi perché ho scelto il trattamento di solo pernottamento aggiungo una cosa che la mia camera è al 16º piano ovviamente resta pochino rumorosa perché si affaccia su una strada abbastanza trafficata però tutta New York￼ è rumorosa...ma il mio termine di paragone è molto relativo perché io abito in una piccola città!

title: Are we sure this place isn’t the La Quinta?
text: If you came to NY for fake bags, this place is for you. Jokes aside, this Sheraton left more than a few things to be desired. We chose this hotel because of the club lounge and rooftop deck we’d have access to as Bonvoy titanium members. When we checked in, we were told the lounge was closed and had been replaced with a pop up bar from 4-11. ANYONE (even those not staying at the hotel) could come to the bar so it was always at capacity. So we were on the club floor because of the status with no perks of being on the club floor. Aside from that debacle, there were lots of other smaller issues. There were no washcloths in our room and we only had two towels. In the photo of the room before booking, an area by the window with a chair was shown; however, our room was tiny and had no chair. The room had very few amenities. There wasn’t even a mini fridge and the coffee pods were too large for the coffee machine. The room features listed a duvet but this consisted of a sheet with a comforter (which was stained) and a sheet on top. The sheets weren’t attached to each other to make a duvet cover so they just fell off. The pillow cases were also too small for the pillows so they just sort of fell off. Additionally, there was a persistent stench of marijuana in the hotel lobby and the hand sanitizer dispensers by the elevators were empty the whole time we stayed. After the first night, we considered calling Marriott corporate to see if we could be accommodated elsewhere but decided not the bother with the hassle. Don’t fall for the good price. This Sheraton isn’t with it!

title: beautiful
text:
ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo
situato in una zona facilmente raggiungibile coi mezzi e anche a piedi
camere confortevoli e pulite
consigliata l'offerta con inclusa happy hour  e colazione sel service
ci ritornerò

title: Don't ever stay in this hotel if you are a titanium member because you are not getting ANY special treatment
text:
Hotel is outdated and dirty. Front desk crew is rude. The room is tiny only good for 1 person. I am a life time Titanium elite but they won't give me a bigger room. I tried to use the upgrade certificates but they don't accept them.
I've stayed in at least a couple of hundreds Marriott before and this is the worst experience I every had.

title: Wonderful stay
text: The hotel was very clean and made me feel comfortable about my stay, especially during COVID times. The price point was ideal and I definitely got my money's worth. The reception staff made check in and check out very smooth, I couldn't have asked for a better process. While the exact street it's on isn't exactly the nicest, there are so many fun things to do in the area just a few blocks in any direction. I'm a NYC local and checked in after a night out just to avoid a commute home. It was well worth it and I would definitely stay again.

title: horrible service & small room
text:
So many great places to stay in the city, this is not one of them. The staffs are mediocre at best. I had to call the front desk to have them clean our room, and they did not give me service when I asked. The room size is small
I Will never come back here again, and would not recommend this hotel to anyone because of the horrible service

title: Great Hotel in Lower Manhattan
text: The room is clean, the staff is friendly and efficient.  The hotel location is very close to many subway stations so it is super convenient to travel all over Manhattan.  Best of all it is close to Little Italy and Chinatown!

title: Quick trip to see family
text: Everything was so nice and clean. Perfect location with everything close by. The deli downstairs was amazing. The staff was very friendly. I would definitely stay here again. Wish the rooftop was open.

title: Great and Comfortable
text:
The room is very clean, and the bed is comfortable. Also, the service is great!
The receptions are very kind. They help us a lot. For example, they offer to heat a food because in the room, there's not a microwave

title: SoHo is a tremendous place to stay.
text: Great place to use as a home base for a New York City SoHo, and surrounding area, visit. Located at the Lincoln Tunnel end of Canal Street, it has everything to offer regarding food/shopping /sightseeing, etc.

title: Party noice all night long
text:
Hotel is very clean, sheets are crispy and super comfortable. They towels are soft. Just make sure they don’t put you next to a room that is there to party, because it goes all night long. Doors slamming as they are the only guests in the hotel. We’ve stayed here for business and never had that problem, but prices are low now because of Covid, and that attracts the wrong crowd to be around. 
People working are friendly and professional. They are the only reason I’m giving 2*

title: ENJOYABLE STAY
text: Our 1 night stay was very pleasant.  The check-in was friendly and quick.  Our room was very clean and enough room for a short stay.  The bathroom was spacious and updated.  Most importantly the bed was very comfortable.   Due to the  covid situation understandably some hotel features were closed, but since the hotel is near many eateries we had no problem.

title: Perfectly clean and comfortable Soho spot
text: Spent 5 days here on business and am returning in October. Felt very safe in this clean hotel that was located within a block of Soho on Canal. Its just a few blocks from chinatown too. Happiness NYC.

title: Service is so unpredictable
text:
Nice property overall with a great central location (in spite of sidewalks taken over by illegal vendors all along Canal Street, a real nuisance).  During these strange times it is hard to give a fair review or know how the hotel would be very different during normal times ... but regardless, for any hotel that is desperate to get more business during tough times, you would think whatever service they can provide (like 10% of normal) would be top notch ... but it is so unpredictable what they will provide as service if at all.  Requests for items to the front desk where never deliver as promised.  Timing for a full housekeeping service after 5 days of just towel and coffee refresh was not honoured.  Request for small repairs in the room were not done.  Also claims by housekeeping to run out of regular coffee or creamers were untrue (just lazy to get more product since it was available when called front desk).

In spite of these service issues, still a nice hotel with good potential when it can return to full operation (restaurant, club lounge, gym, bar, etc.).  In the mean time, the reduced staff need much better training/orientation for customer care.

title: Terrible servive not sure it was clean and sanitary
text:
They do not clean or check your room. If you would like any supplies you need to call down. I asked for a clean towel and some sanitizing wipes... since I needed to do my own clean up. After 4 !!! request I finally got towels, no cleaning wipes.
Nice location. Stayed there many times before and found it to be nice. Apparently they are taking advantage of the situation and not providing service

title: Marriott elite members don't get treated well
text:
I am a lifetime gold and currently hold Ambassador status and booked this hotel because it was close to Chinatown and places I wanted to visit.  They are advertising rates of 90 usd per night which seem liked a great deal based on their reviews. During the check-in process I was expecting either an upgrade or a least a room on the club level or with a city view.  I got nothing and was told they were all sold out.  Later that night when i checked the Marriott app, however, I saw that all those rooms were available.  To make matters worse when i got to my floor there was two huge bags of trash left less than 5 feet away from my door.  I called the front desk and this was taken care of by the time i returned later in the day.  The room was clean and nicely kept. 
I was supposed to stay a second night but canceled my reservation.   Booked another Marriott hotel in the city.  I'd rather pay a little extra and get treated better than save 10 bucks.

title: Back in New York, una conferma!
text: Ho avuto la fortuna negli ultimi anni di essere spesso a New York, e dopo il mio viaggio in coppia del 2017 sono tornato con due amici nel 2019. Scegliendo l'albergo, dopo l'ottima esperienza passata, ho quasi "imposto" di fissare qui. Per me conferma assoluta, soprattutto avendo anche termini di paragoni con altri Hotel. Confermo la posizione eccezionale per visitare la città, centrale e vicina a tutte le linee della metro. Le camere sono ampie, pulite ed i letti comodi (si cammina tanto a NY, non è quindi un dettaglio di poco conto!). Il personale, inutile dirlo, gentile e disponibile come al solito. Ottimo anche il rapporto qualità/prezzo. Tornerò sicuramente. Thank you!

title: unpleasant and rude guest services staff
text:
Honestly, for a 4-star hotel, the service was disappointing to say the least. I was expecting better. During my stay, my room was only 'half-cleaned', sure they took out the garbage but the beds were not made. when has that ever happened in a 4-star hotel? not in any of my experiences before even if I stay just for a day. Room service should be a FULL service. Period.
The brown lady had a reception was not very pleasant to deal with. A lot of blank stares. No hello, no how are you, just attitude when I first approached the staff where as the white couple behind me were immediately greeted with a ' hello! how are you guys doing today! " with a big bright smile. I thought that was super weird and discriminatory.
The most basic training in any hoteling service is to greet your guests when they approach not just respond with a blank stare and a "yes?"
Considering the low number of guests staying at the hotel, the staff should have gone above and beyond to give me a positive experience at the hotel. I also found it odd that they were not in any professional clothing, just casual t-shirt and jeans as if they are chilling in their living lounge.
Anyways, I have given the staff the exact emoticon with the expressions with which they had treated me. Just a plain bitchy resting face as if I had caused them a major inconvenience just for asking a simple question. The tone with which I was spoken to was quite rude as well for no reason.
I also called the guest services for a spoon and I was rudely told to come down to the lobby to get it myself. Like how dare you ask one of our staff members to deliver a spoon to your room, even though they've been hired to serve the guest. Really? For a 4 star hotel with hardly any guests and you can't provide basic decent service to your guests? Unacceptable.
The black guy was super friendly and helpful though.
The location is a little unsafe. A hotspot of druggies right outside the hotel.

title: Wrong minimum age, bad customer service
text: I am 19 years old and trying to spend time with my boyfriend who is also 19, before we booked with we checked Expedia and booking and both of them said the minimum check age was 18, but after we booked it( non-refundable) it said you have to be 21 to check in. I called and tried to cancel, but the person said we had to talk to the website we booked through and that they have so many people waiting on line. They should have made an exception when it was obviously their fault for putting 18 as the minimum age. I had to find another hotel the night before and We’re forced to book a more expensive one for the time being. This hotel was terrible.

title: Wonderful service
text: I had a wonder time I want to specifically want to thank Mia at the front desk. She was wonderful and very helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. I also had a great view of the city it’s great spot to stay at.

title: Great customer service
text: My name is Michael Cox and this was my first time staying at the Sheratons and had the best customer service provided by Teri Singh she was such a big help and had no issues going above and beyond to make our stay more comfortable

title: Worst hotel stay of my life
text:
I had a very disappointing stay and decided to leave in the middle of the night and sleep in the car because the AC was unbearable, it wasn't getting cold at all and it was hard for two people to breathe in that room. Your technician came to fix the AC and failed to fix it. The vending machine was bad and the hotel staff was very unfriendly, I talked to them twice before, where they said nothing about limited service but I got to know after I checked in that Breakfast and Club level services weren't available. There's no point in club level branding if there is literally no amenities for the extra charge.

I hope the management sees my review and do something about it. The view was good though

title: No Breakfast for you
text:
Promised breakfast wasn't provided.  When I posted this on Marriott.com I received an email asking me to contact the hotel.  I did but the person who emailed was no longer employed and whoever answered had zero interest in why I'd called.  

Upon checking my review on Marriott I see that Mia Fowler responded claiming no harm was done because we ate in the lounge.  My review noted this wasn't true, we paid to eat out.  She also  claimed to have put 5,000 points in my Marriott account for our inconvenience but it's coming up on two months and nothing has credited.

Advice to property, when you mess up and email a customer asking them to call in, don't blow them off when they do.  More advice.  When you promised a token amount of points to make up for a larger loss, at least follow through.

Not a bad hotel but sloppy management.

title: A solid value
text:
There is nothing exceptional about the Sheraton. However, given its location (Manhattan) and the fact that I've had my share of stays at incredibly subpar properties in the area, I'd consider the Sheraton to be a decent place to stay, especially when considering the price.

Rooms are spacious enough, breakfast is decent enough, it's reasonably clean (although it could stand to use a refurb in the near future) and has fast WiFi. The right kind of business hotel that does the job and doesn't break the bank.  This is my third stay there, and won't hesitate to return should I have meetings nearby.

title: Renewed rooms and friendlier service
text:
I've stayed at this property several times over the past 10 years and I must say that the service has definitely improved since then.  The rooms are very small and for me at least, good for 1 person to relax in comfortably.  Most of the time I've gotten rooms facing east or south which means very little to any view but recently I (somehow) got a west facing room which faces towards the Hudson River (although you need to have a higher floor to get the true view).  Rooms have been renovated in the last few years with the typical Sheraton standards----clean and comfortable and they usually stock the bathroom with all the amenities you might need.

Staff has also gotten better----in the past they were a bit gruff but now are much friendlier and helpful.  If you want/get Club access, the Club has terrific views including an outdoor terrace (which is open to anyone staying on the Club floor).  The Club is smaller than most and can get very crowded if there are more than 15 people in there.  

The location is central to SoHo and downtown/FiDi (about a 15 minute easy walk).  If coming from JFK, the E train stops right around the block at Canal Street making it easy to get to or depart from.  Lots of terrific bars and restaurants in the immediate area and while there are many pricier ones, do look around on the internet as there are many reasonably priced (and fun) places here too.

title: For NYC, great room
text:
Living in CT and working in NYC I often come in for a weekend or day trip. For being in NYC, this hotel is actually a great deal.

The hotel itself is out of the hustle and bustle of Times Square (where I ended up anyway due to a broadway show). It was an easy subway ride from our hotel to Times Square. If you are traveling by subway keep in mind it’s $2.75 per person per ride. The subway stop is Canal St but it’s a few blocks walk to the hotel. It’s easy to miss it if you aren’t looking for it, look for the large post office on the southeast corner. We got to the hotel around 5PM and during our walk we were harassed by the typical Canal St dealers selling their knock offs. If you aren’t interested, keep your eyes down and keep walking. 

We got a standard room for under $100/night which was an amazing price for NYC. Being Marriott Elite we were hoping for an upgrade but on a Saturday night there were none available. Hoping for the best but preparing for the worst, we made our way up to our room and was pleasantly surprised. Room 1620 was the typical small size but had a gorgeous view of the city. The room could use an upgrade but it met our needs just fine. The room looked right out to the NYC skyline, seeing Hudson Yards, the Empire State Building and everything in between. During the day it was nice but at night you can’t capture how pretty it is. 

The bed was comfortable enough and we both had a decent nights sleep. We got 2 free bottles of water in the room along with a larger bottle for purchase for $4. If you have lounge access, just go and grab a few bottles from there if you need. The only time the room was too small was when my wife was sitting at the desk and I needed to get to the chair on the other side of the room. I couldn’t squeeze through so I had to roll over the bed to get there.

Being elite, we get access to the lounge on the 21st floor. This was also small but nicer than other lounges we’ve been in. They have the same gorgeous views of the sunset but just a bit better because of the additional height. They have a nice happy hour every day from 5-7PM. They offer free wine or beer plus some snacks like cheese, hummus, veggies w/ dip and chips and salsa. We heard there was food there and thought we’d be able to eat dinner there but that wasn’t really the case. There was a good amount of food but I wouldn’t plan a dinner around this. We did enjoy about 7 glasses of wine amongst the 2 of us so I can’t say anything bad about the lounge. 

The noise wasn’t too bad from the outside. Not sure if it was the fact that we were on the 16th floor or that there wasn’t too much car traffic in this area but I didn’t hear anything throughout the night. Overall this was a pleasant stay and hotel and I would stay here again versus being right in the heart of the city.

title: Weird Room Configuration
text:
We stayed here for the NY Times travel show.  For us the hotel was perfectly situated.  We could walk to the World Trade Center sight, thete's a great deli and coffee shop next door.  There are 2 different subway stops, one right around the corner and the other maybe 2 blocks away.  There is also a great little Italian restaurant around the corner recommended to us by the concierge.
The concierge was amazing.  So funny and full of life.  He was like watching a show with everyone.  
The room was nice but it seems the windows aren't double glazed because I have stayed in lots of big cities and this room was by far the noisiest.  You heard every noise outside.  The room itself was large but weirdly configured.  To get into the teeny tiny dark closet you had to move the nightstand to open the door.  I needed my flashlight to see inside.  In order to see the TV from the bed you needed to lay on your left side as it is directly next to the side of the bed.  Our room had a very comfy chair and sofa.  There was also a large kitchen table and 4 chairs...weird.  I think the whole room needs to be redesigned.
The executive lounge was small and very hot with a limited breakfast selection.  Not what is expected in an executive lounge.  However in the warmer months, this lounge also has a huge outdoor area with amazing views.  Again a redesign is needed and a refurb as the furniture is all dirty and stained.  Nice touch in the evening is free unlimited booze.
The staff are all exemplary.  From the minute I arrived everyone was wonderful.  Housekeepers, front desk staff, executive lounge staff and especially the concierge.
As a lifetime Titanium member I have stayed in lots of Marriott properties.  For me it served ir's purpose for a 4 night stay but I don't know that I would want to stay longer.  That being said, I am planning on returning January 2021.

title: Cocktails on the 21st floor
text:
We loved Dion who took care of us for cocktails on the 21st floor lounge. He is very kind, helpful and full of positive energy !
We love him!! This hotel should be thankful to have such a wonderful person working for them .

title: Pleasant Stay
text: We stayed here for 3 nights in November and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  Room was exactly as expected and staff was very helpful.  This is a great location with lots of food choices and a great deli next door.  We would stay here on our next visit.

title: No frills but comfortable
text: One of the Marriott Bonvoy hotels, this is a good, basic place to stay in the Tribeca area. The rooms have no frills but are comfortable. No shower gel but soap and shampoo are provided. Staff very pleasant and helpful. There is a fitness suite. You can borrow an umbrella for a $50 deposit if it’s pouring down. They offer a green deal without housekeeping for 500 points a night.

title: Worst Marriott Property Yet
text: I'm a pretty low maintenance traveler and do not expect perfection, but my recent experience at this property was so bad I feel an obligation to share it in this forum. We stayed for one night this past weekend and had the following issues: 1) 20th Floor room was incredibly noisy from both the street (which is understandable, it's NYC) but also from the elevator, which generated a loud banging noise all night. This hotel is poorly maintained, has thin walls and is long overdue for renovation. Do not stay here if you need to sleep. 2) The Sheraton "Lounge" is a gross exaggeration of what you're getting. The Sunday breakfast ends at 9am, the earliest I've ever seen for a weekend breakfast, and food/beverage options the rest of the day are minimal. Not worth the upgrade. 3) Service at the front desk can best be described as apathetic. There seems to be no incentive or desire to do anything but the bare minimum. With all the great hotels in the area, don't waste time or money at this outdated property.

title: Fantastic location for getting around
text: Stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca first week of February 2020. This is a great hotel. Staff are professional and friendly. We always got a lovely greeting when leaving or entering the hotel. The location is just brilliant. We used the subway for the week and it seemed that every train stopped on Canal Street where the hotel is based. Yes turning right out of the hotel means you do come across some street sellers which may seem intimidating at first but they are not. Once you say no they move onto the next person. Turning left and then left again puts you into a really lovely area with great restaurants and the best pizza slice I have ever had. Room was very clean and much larger than we expected for New York. No real noise issue but then again we were tired from exploring all day. One block up and you are in Soho and would pay much more per night. Easy to walk to One WTC. We will definitely stay here again as it is a real gem in an expensive city.

title: One Day Get Away
text:
Found a great rate on Bonvoy site on Friday and decided to head up from Northern Virginia on Saturday morning.  We usually stay in Mid Town and then fall into the trap of never leaving the Times Square area.  We got outside our comfort zone a bit and hung around Chinatown, Little Italy and the Village.  The hotel is an area that might scare off some people.  It's a little sketchy on the edge of Chinatown, but it's the "charm" I love about the city.
