The hotel itself is great.  Modern with a huge bar area on the first floor.  The young man who checked us in, Sal, was super cool and very professional.  We did not utilize the gym on such a short stay, but did check out the lounge on the 21st floor.  24 hour access to water, pop and snacks is always appreciated.  There is also an outdoor patio up there, which offered a fantastic view of the city to the North.  We stayed in a King on the 11th floor.  Typical small NYC room, but quite cozy.  Good AC, fantastic shower and comfortable bed for all activities!  Clean and modern.  Not much more to ask for.

We also received a nice email from the assistant manager, Mai, when we returned home.  Direct service from the hotel itself will keep us coming back.

title: Это не Шератон
text:
Расположение отеля радует- это Манхеттен, рядом станции основных линий метро. И это, пожалуй, все....
Недостатки:
1. Мы приехали в отель вечером и даже таксист не мог найти гостиницу. Темное здание без каких либо светящихся вывесок или ярко подсвеченного вестибюля. 
2. Мы жили в клубном номере на 19 этаже. Номер небольшой, но очень зашарпанный. Старый ковролин. Кровать большая, удобная. Но подушки просто отвратительные - старые, скомканные! Это недопустимо для отеля, называющего себя Шератон.
3. Завтраки для клубных номеров накрывают на 21 этаже. Маленькое помещение. Мест для всех недостаточно. А сами завтраки ниже всякой критики!!!! Ассортимент состоит из сладких хлопьев 3-х видов, совершенно несьедобного омлета из порошка, пережаренного бекона или отвратных котлеток-блинчиков, очень сладкой овсяной каши, выпечки, которая все время заканчивается, очень ограниченного ассортимента и количества фруктов, хлеба, напитков. Овощей, сыра или колбасы - нет!!!Венцом являлся омерзительный кофе!
Нам с мужем, диабетикам со стажем, было практически нереально выбрать себе еду для завтрака!
4. При заезде берут депозит с кредитной карты в размере 100$.  Я предлагала наличные деньги в качестве депозита, но мне категорически отказали. Хотя в других отелях этой сети (например в Праге) такой проблемы не возникло!
Теперь жду когда вернется депозит и вернется ли!

title: 15 giorni di relax
text:
Hotel in zona molto comoda e servita da diverse metro a pochi metri di distanza.
Colazione abbastanza completa e variegata, con affaccio spettacolare panoramico.
Camera molto spaziosa al 21esimo piano con bagno, tv, armadio, poltrona, phono, ecc.
Personale molto gentile e pulizia adeguata.
Consigli di stare attenti solamente ai prelievi dalle carte per i pagamenti perchè delle volte superano le quantità prestabilite con la prenotazione ma dopo alcuni giorni/settimane dovrebbero regolarizzare tutto.

title: Just ok!
text:
We stayed for 2 weeks at the Sheraton and overall it was value for money in a ok location in NY.

I am extremely picky, so read below if you are too, if not it was a good hotel however I would give another hotel a go next time. 

Here’s why: 
- first major downfall, no contact details for the hotel can be found at all! No email address across, Expedia, trip advisor, Sheraton website, Facebook page. Nothing! No way to confirm your room prior to arriving!!! Something that needs to be addressed! 
-Check in process was ok, nothing special with staff, didn’t really go above and beyond however was quick. Didn’t touch on wifi so we had to check that it was complementary. 
- room wasn’t serviced until really late in the day or early morning so be sure to use your do not disturb sign if you would like to sleep in.  
- Rooms are not quite, noise from hallway and outside sirens/ traffic is normal.  This only bothered us a few nights with loud people in the hallway, however the rest of the time was ok. We were on level 10. 
- Rooms are not smoking however we did smell weed within the hallway etc.
- Towels and linen are clean and crisp. However there is no doona per se it’s sheets on top of the bed. 
- Room is small, hard to have two cases with luggage out. You get that most places in NY so this is average. 
- We requested a fridge on the third night we were here to be told they had none available, after requesting again in person they were able to send one up. Rooms should come accompanied with a fridge, wouldn’t have been a problem if staying one night however for two weeks it was nice to have a cold drink or milk available for a tea or coffee in the morning. If your staying a while I’d request one prior to arriving. 
- Pillows were very flat! It did say on the website they had a pillow menu available however it wasn’t on the in room guide. 

We didn’t eat in the restaurant, only had a drink at the bar. Was good value during happy hour. 

It’s not advertised however Friday and saturdays have free drinks and nibbles for members in the 27th floor lounge. This was a nice touch, along with festive drinks and hot chocolates in the afternoons in the lobby. 

The location is central to those using the subway and if you don’t mind walking to locations like china town, Wall Street, little Italy etc. 99c pizza and delis are a short walk too! 

Overall it was ok. I wouldn’t stay here again however I wasn’t overly impressed nor disappointed.

title: Bad value, disappointing stay and unprofessional staff. DO NOT STAY HERE.
text:
Staff refused to provide service to our room. Had to chase up our dry cleaning, which they then SHOVED into my suitcase when I was not in my room. 
I asked the staff about the issues I had while I was there and all I got was "we'll investigate the issue and get back to you" and zero follow up. 

I emailed the manager to resolve this issues I experienced, but it has now been over a week and they still have not gotten back to me. 

Hotel is not good value for money, and honestly provided the worst service I've ever experienced at a hotel. 

Do yourself a favour and avoid this place.

title: 4 nights in New York for a Family get away
text:
Not sure were to start. The rooms were clean, but there is a lot of road noise. The location is very close to China town and a stones throw from Tribeca. My issues revolve around the hotel using a very dangerous taxi company to take us to JFK. He was extremely dangerous, weaving in and out of traffic on the Freeway and we had at leat 4 near misses. I had to yell at him to stop at least three times. He also had an iPad in the front seat and I do not think it is ieagl to watch programmes on it and still drive, To add insult to injury he over charged us by $13 despite it being an agreed fare with the hotel. 

I emailed Marriott customer services at least 3 times and never had a response. I eventually rang the hotel (at international call rates) and complained to Sal (the hotel manager). He assured me that they would take that particular taxi driver off their books and refund the $13 via the travel agent. My issue is that the hotel should throughly vet the drivers before and not put their guests lives at risk. Ina addition, I have never received my $13 refund, despite t at least 4 emails to BOTH Sal and Mia. I have also rang the hotel and every time I get to reception and ask for Mia and Sal I am always cut off. When everything is ok, the hotel will communicate with you. When they need to learn from experience, they seem to not bother or care about their guests. I have stayed at a number of hotels in Manhattan and I have to say the customer service in relation to this incident has been atrocious. I am sure I will get a stock response, asking me to reach out to the hotel. What is the point when they cut you off the phone or never replay to emails!

title: Brother in law birthday weekend
text:
When we arrived, it was around 9a and our room was not ready so the front desk staff stores our luggage, free of charge and we went out and explored for a while, while we waited for another couple to arrive!!

After exploring and returning around 3p, our room was ready! It was a very comfortable room. One young lady at the front desk, wish I remembered her name, left a nice bottle of wine for us!! Thanks so much sista!!

We would definitely stay here again.

title: Sheraton Tribeca Nueva York
text: Hotel excelente recomendable 100 por ciento, estuve 7 noches alojada alli con familia y amigos. La sorpresa fue que tienen un lounge en el piso 21 que ingresas con la tarjeta de la habitación y esta TODO incluido en la estadia. Fue un gran ahorro de dolares tanto en el desayuno como el lunch que es de 17 a 19 hs. En el desayuno pueden encontrar desde huevo, beagle,croasant,yogur,cereales,jugos,frutas,etc super variado y además tiene una vista increíble en la terraza también. Además podes comprar comida y comer ahi las bebidas libres las 24 hs. Cafe,agua,gaseosas,y en la hora del lunch hay cerveza y vino también. Lo recomiendo totalmente las habitaciones impecables y el baño también.

title: Best Accommodation to Stay in New York
text: I have stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca twice.  Once with our daughter 2012 and once with my husband October 2019.  Our room was small, but we were very happy with the cleanliness of our room.  We had the club room.  Which included appetizers and drinks.  Our guest Service Agent is Deon!  Deon was kind and friendly!  No complaints about Deon.  We also had breakfast buffet in the club room.  Very satisfactory to us.  If we are visiting New York in the future, we will certainly stay at the Sheraton Tribeca!

title: Très bien
text:
Hôtel vraiment bien situé.
Station de métro canal street à 3 minute.
commerces à proximité.
L'hôtel en lui même est très bien, la chambre très bien le seul - salle de bain un peu petite.
Literie de très bonne qualité, je recommande.

title: Excellent Room & World Class Service!  Thank you Sal!
text: I have stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca multiple times and will continue to do so.  Sal at the front desk always greets me by name and welcomes me back.  It's a great feeling when you return to a hotel and receive such amazing customer service.  There is something really special about how the staff works hard to earn your repeat business over and over again.  They treat you well and try to do what they can to give you a warm, friendly environment in which you will look forward to when you return.  Thank you so much Sal and the entire team at the Sheraton Tribeca.  As a Gold Elite member, I can proudly say that the staff at the Sheraton Tribeca is World Class.  You will continue to have me as a very happy repeat customer!

title: Disappointing
text:
The hotel has some positives:
- Central location
- Large, clean bedroom with comfortable beds
- Club Lounge area with nice views and free 'happy hour' drinks

But there were also significant negatives experienced during our stay:
- Outside of the hotel is disappointingly drab and not what I would expect from a Sheraton. Inside is a little better but rather old fashioned.
- Our room looked tired and not well maintained. The phone didn't work, light bulb was hanging from the socket, etc.
- Our window "view" was a brick wall. We asked to change but we were told curtly that this was the only room available... As we had booked 11 months previously, I would have hoped for something better and also a  more helpful response from reception staff.
- Some reception staff (not all) were generally quite rude and unhelpful. For example, I asked about the Club Lounge when we checked in and we were told it was available only for Club members. After a couple nights, I learned from a different staff member that this was untrue and anyone can pay $30 for access.

While the price does help to counterbalance some of the negatives, it wasn't the stay I had hoped for.

title: Buon hotel
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per 10 notti. Personale accogliente e disponibile, stanza ampia con grande parete a vista, letto comodissimo, pulizie giornaliere. Avevamo anche l’accesso al lounge che è stato comodo per avere sempre bibite disponibili a qualsiasi ora, ed anche spuntini tipo biscotti patatine caffè ecc...però la colazione e gli antipasti serali compresi, sono molto deludenti...per il resto ci siamo trovati molto bene!

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: We have been to this hotel several times.  Great location in Tribeca with super easy access to the subway uptown.  We like staying here when visiting our daughter on the lower East.  Weekend rates are great.  When we drive we can find affordable lots and parking meters close by on the weekend.  Staff is very friendly.  The lounge while small  has a great outdoor deck on the 22nd floor with sweeping views.

title: Good location and nice hotel!
text: Good location close to so many fun neighborhoods! We were able to walk to Tribeca, Soho, Greenwich, financial district, west Village, union sq and Washington Sq! The hotel is nice. Rooms are the typical smaller NYC rooms but hotel is in good condition and clean. My only compliant is the pillows were lumpy.

title: Great visit to NYC
text: I travel a lot but I rarely write hotel reviews. Most of my stays are at mid-range uninspiring hotels.  Only when I have a horrible stay that people should be warned about, or when I find a gem of a hotel that deserves extra attention do I spend the time to write something on TripAdvisor.  Sheraton Tribeca was the latter. The staff were very friendly and made us feel extra special for visit to NYC, something that we don't expect at a NYC hotel.  The subway is just around the corner, 2 minutes away (blue line).  We had Club Lounge access where breakfast was served daily.  The lounge was super crowded at 8:30am everyday but the staff worked hard to keep food replenished and tables cleared.  Through the lounge you could access an outdoor terrace with amazing panoramic views of midtown Manhattan.  If the weather is nice, grab a drink during Club Lounge happy hour and sit outside. Room was average size for NYC. Clean and efficient. Elevators get busy during rush hour so expect a bit of a wait, which was to be expected.  To wrap it up, I think the friendly staff here made our stay special and memorable and we'd return just for that reason. Well done!

title: Bel hôtel mais trop de points négatifs
text:
Points positifs
- Emplacement impeccable pour visiter New York, juste à côté de la station Canal St avec accès à de nombreuses lignes de métro
- personnel de la réception et femmes de chambre très sympas
- taille de la chambre très correcte (en King)
- literie très confortable 
Points Négatifs
- en King accès à un Lounge ridicule (allez à l’intercontinental pour voir ce qu’est un lounge)
- le pire petit déjeuner connu à New York et personnel du petit déjeuner vraiment pas sympa (nous avons été au Starbucks)
- pas de pression dans la douche
- les portes claques violemment nuit et jour et le bruit de la fermeture de vos voisins vous réveille 10 fois durant la nuit.
- boissons périmées dans le distributeur de l’étage (2 fois, 2 fois périmées)
Rapport qualité prix non

title: Super Preis-Leistung und zuvorkommendes Personal
text:
Super Preis-Leistung und zuvorkommendes Personal 

735838310 

Wir sind seit dem 21.12. in diesem Hotel und sind sehr zufrieden.
Gebucht hatten wir ein Doppelzimmer mit KingSize-Bed und wurden bei Ankunft auf Club Level upgegraded, Zimmer im 19ten Stock.
Heißt also Frühstück inklusive im 21sten Stock (toller Ausblick von der Dachterasse)
Und zwischen 17 und 19 Uhr werden kleine Snacks und kostenfreie Getränke angeboten (inkl. Bier und Wein).
Das alleine ist schon echt was wert.

Dazu kommt fast jeden Tag nachmittags am Empfang eine kleine Überraschung für die Gäste hinzu: heißer Kakao mit oder ohne Baileys, Schokobrunnen etc.
Keine Ahnung, ob das nur in der Weihnachtszeit so ist, aber wir genießen es.
Das Personal ist echt freundlich und zuvorkommend, z. B. Deon ab 17 Uhr in der Lounge, einfach toll.
Oder Josh morgens beim Frühstück, immer freundlich trotz Hektik.

Das Zimmer ist sauber und für NY-Verhältnisse geräumig. 
Vielleicht etwas in die Jahre gekommen aber dafür mit dem bequemsten und tollsten Bett, welches ich seit Jahren erlebt habe.

Man hat außerdem mit der Canal Street Station echt viele Möglichkeiten, von A nach B zu kommen, alles sehr problemlos.

Wie gesagt, wir sind super zufrieden und würden wiederkommen :)

title: Sensacional
text: O hotel é muito confortável, localização excelente próximo ao metrô e ao Soho. A cama é muito confortável e a equipe é super prestativa. Tem maquina de cafe e cha no quarto, muito bom. Adorei! Super recomendo.

title: Wow we made new friends
text: Ok the 2 people that stand out the most to me ,,and who went above and beyond are Cesar and Josh.. super friendly and bent over backwards to make our trip spectacular..  had a blast.. thank you so much!

title: DO NOT STAY AT THE SHERATON TRIBECA
text:
I've never had a worse hotel experience than when my mum and I stayed here last month. Check-in time was 3pm but we were coming off a cruise so arrived early at 11.30ish. We knew the room wouldn't be ready but wanted to leave our bags to walk round the city so we did this and were told our room would be ready, as expected, at 3pm. We walked miles and ended up getting back, totally exhausted, at 4.30pm. Plenty of time to have a quick nap and get changed in time for our restaurant booking at 6.45pm. But our room wasn't ready. We were told to wait another hour and that we could wait in the club lounge. They made this seem like a special treat even though it was included with our booking anyway. So we waited until 5.30pm and called back down. Still not ready!! They said it would be at least another hour which meant we'd have to go to our restaurant booking as we were, sweaty and under dressed. I also have a slipped disc in my back and it was hurting so much that I really needed to just lie down. We went for the meal and returned for us to finally be allowed in our room at 9.30ish. We collapsed onto our beds and I logged in to the WiFi (included with our room)... or tried to. There was no WiFi signal. I stepped outside the door to the room and tried again and sure enough it worked. Our room was seemingly the only place with no reception! Over the next two days I wasted hours of my holiday on the phone to their tech support who seemed to subscribe to The IT Crowd method of turning everything on and off again, and with the hotel's own engineer, but to no avail. This was massively inconvenient as we needed to make plans and call family members, especially as I had my 30th birthday while we were there. Also, on the last morning we had breakfast in the hotel and one of the waitresses was literally holding her head in her hands when greeting us, clearly suffering from the night before!
Seriously, the price might be tempting but this hotel is not worth it!! Hope this saves someone else from experiencing the same!

title: Business trip to NYC
text: I had a pleasant stay at this hotel. The staff are very courteous and excellent service all the way. Great location to stay and  in close vicinity to Manhattan. The room was a bit small with tiny windows, but that is the normal for NYC hotels, I guess.

title: A Super Stay.
text:
Having stayed here with my mother last month, I just wanted to write and say what a pleasant time we had. 

Staff, from the moment we arrived, were only too happy to help and very friendly. The atmosphere in the lobby was really warm and welcoming. As our room was not ready yet we were given a couple of free drinks to wait with in the bar, which was much appreciated after a long journey from London!

When we got into the room it was lovely. Very clean, and modern - the bathroom was especially nice, as was the up to date TV. 

We only ate here a couple of times, and this was for the breakfast buffet. Very tasty - scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, pancakes, confectionary and so on - nice comprehensive choice that included a coffee. Reasonably priced for where we were too.

Location was really good for going out sight seeing and getting back - some things were easy walking distance, and for what wasn't there was a subway point just along the road a bit which was very hand. Plethora of good eateries in the vicinity too.

Check out was nice and painless, and the staff once again couldn't have been nicer.

title: Club VIP Lounge
text: Al reservar habitacion, eligiendo el acceso al Club VIP Lounge tienes desayuno buffet incluido, merienda incluida y en cualquier momento del dia puedes subir a la terraza y consumir su cafe starbucks, agua y refrescos, patatas, galletas, fruta... junto a las vistas de la ciudad, resulta una combinacion increible que realmente merece la pena pagar

title: Great hotel in a central location
text:
We stayed here for a week and thought it was great. Ample space in our room and bathroom. Clean and excellent service. It is really located in a great spot so lots of walking around and close to the subway too. I'd highly recommend.
We had lounge access which was amazing as the view of the city from the top floor is unbelievable. There's also a nice patio up there with heat lamps.

title: Situation idéale
text:
Nous avons passé une superbe semaine à New York dans cet hôtel idéalement situé dans le quartier TriBeCa avec la station de métro Canal street juste à côté; trés pratique pour se balader partout dans Manhattan, pour aller à Brooklyn et aussi pour rejoindre l'aéroport JFK directement. On est aussi tout prés du sud de Manhattan (1/4 d'heure à pied).
Les chambres sont grandes, trés propres et trés bien insonorisées. L'ensemble du personnel toujous trés sympa, trés souriant et trés "friendly" ce qui est appréciable.
Nous recommandons de prendre le petit déjeuner plutôt au café Bene juste à côté bien meilleur et beaucoup moins cher.
Bref,si on à la chance de pouvoir retourner à NY nous choisirons cet hôtel de nouveau sans hésiter.

title: Weekend in New York
text:
Definitely book this hotel, we had a Queen bed room, spacious enough for 2 people. Bed was very comfortable, two different type pillows to chose from. Fabulous view, looking towards the Empire State Building. Our room was 1018. Friends were in 1120 same view.
The staff at this hotel are outstanding and work as a team. Check in and out was quick and easy. Answered questions from restaurants, what to see and definitely helped with directions. New subway system was great and people are very friendly and help with directions 👍
24hr bagel place next door is the best. If you forgot anything they have it.
Great breakfast sandwiches, smoothies to drinks for the room. Wine store across the street.
Great dive bar around the corner Nancy’s whiskey pub.
I loved this location.
Central Park is a must 🍷

title: Jederzeit wieder! Super Preis-Leistungsverhältnis in idealer Lage
text:
Das Sheraton Tribeca hat sich für unsere 5 Nächte als echter Glücksgriff entpuppt. Super Lage an der Canal Street, 3 unterschiedliche Subway Linien in Fußweite, dazu Chinatown und Little Italy ums Eck, runter zum 9/11 Memorial auch nicht länger als 15 Minuten zu Fuß. Also ideal, um New York City zu erkunden als Tourist. 

Die Lage des Hotels ist nicht im absoluten Tourist-Hotspot wie Times Square,...wobei man die rasch mit der U-Bahn erreicht. Das ist aber auch ein Vorteil, weil man nicht komplett erschlagen wird von Touristen. 

Direkt neben dem Hotel liegt ein Cafe und ein 24-Stunden-Deli, super Frühstück dort. Also in Sachen Kulinarik gibt es dort ums Hotel sowieso alles (Burger,..). 

Das Hotel selbst passt vollends. Unser Zimmer im 4. Stock war voll in Ordnung, nicht megagroß, Bad okay, WLAN gratis und flott. Einfach alles was man für einen Städteurlaub braucht. Angenehme Pflegeprodukte gab's im Bad noch dazu. Besonders angenehm: Ich hab meinen Nachbarn nicht gehört und konnte gut schlafen. Wer NYC kennt, weiß dass das mitunter ganz anders auch sein kann...

Die Lobby im Hotel ist fein, nette Bar dort und einige Sessel zum Verweilen in der Eingangshalle. 3 Lifte stehen zur Verfügung, musste nie lang warten. Sind zwar nicht die neuesten, funktionieren aber bestens. 

Total freundlich waren die Mitarbeiter dort vor Ort. Immer gut aufgelegt, hilfsbereit. Alles perfekt. Hab von dort einen Transfer zum JFK Airport gebucht, zum Fixpreis, gut organisiert, alles top. 

Und nicht zu vergessen. Das Hotel bietet ein tolles Preis-Leistungsverhältnis. Wirklich volle Empfehlung, wir kommen sicher wieder. 

All jene, die hier kritisieren das Hotel bzw. die Zimmer seien nicht mehr super modern, der Lift aus den 90ern,.... Hey, bitte bucht einfach beim nächsten Mal ein Hotel am Times Square, oder auf der 5th Avenue. Kostet aber halt dann auch das Vierfache.

title: NYC Business and Pleasure
text:
Visited NYC again on business and opted to be in Tribecca area - this hotel is near food and shopping areas.

Room smaller than Sheraton in Times Sq.  Limited in house coffee bar and lobby area seemed unnecessarily loud with music - myself and other guests mentioned to staff to reduce radio volume.  

Otherwise - staff was friendly and rooms were clean.

title: Unbelievable
text:
This hotel is the absolute best.

 Location is tops. Rooms are big for NYC. The staff is the so extremely helpful and kind. We have stayed in NY a few times and this was the least expensive hotel we have stayed at as well as our favourite. When we stay in Manhattan this is definitely the only place we will stay from now on. 

Thank you so much to all the staff especially the front desk! Can’t wait to see you all again.

title: Great location
text:
Second time in this hotel in 2019.
Location of the hotel is perfect. View from the lounge and some rooms is awsome.
However, I’ve faced some issues with housekeeping:
- it happened that the room was not cleaned at 5pm ; this is not what you expect after a day at work or visiting the city;
- cleaning could be improved, really...

title: good value if you are just looking for a place to sleep
text: We don’t go to New York to sit at the hotel. Very outdated, but at 200 (all in) per night, we were happy with this hotel. We have no complaints. If there are other hotels for similar prices, would definitely consider those, but since most of the time is out the hotel this one works for us.

title: Blown away by the service!,
text: I spent a few days at the Sheraton Tribeca on business earlier this month.  First, they put me on the club level which provides a breakfast and happy hour, on the 21st floor of the hotel.  The food, service and view were excellent.  But the most amazing aspect of there service was when I left the hotel!  I used their flat rate car service to the airport and left my credit card in the car.  The driver returned it to the hotel and the emailed me immediately.  Finally, and what a crazy story, the car service fat-fingered my fee and instead of $55, my card was charged $550!   The hotel caught this, and arranged a credit, before I even had to ask.  Kudos to Sal and Carlos on staff at the hotel.  I simply can’t get over this kind of service, in this day and age.  I won’t stay in any other hotel in NYC ever, but the Sheraton Tribeca! 😀

title: Stay elsewhere
text:
As a frequent traveler for business, I judge hotels by a few simple criteria: 

Does the Executive Lounge provide a decent breakfast?

Is there a shower in the room vs a bathtub?

With Marriott - Am I recognized as a Titanium Bonvoy member and offered any sort of upgrade?

This hotel fails on all accounts.  

I have had better breakfasts in a bottom level Springhill or Fairfield, and the evening snacks in the lounge are just as bad.  Honestly, don't bother if you must stay here - go outside of the hotel, turn left, and walk 50 feet to get an overpriced but delicious coffee and breakfast from Caffe Bene, or walk the half mile to Bubby's and get some biscuits.

Any hotel these days that still has shower curtains should automatically get three stars at best.  Especially one that doesn't block the water, and the bathroom floor ends up getting soaked.

Staying more than 100 nights in Marriott's each year, I expect to be recognized.  Didn't happen here.  A tiny room with double beds, and terribly slow elevators for more than $600 per night.

Stay elsewhere.

title: Mangelhaftes Hotel in sehr guter Lage
text: Das Ambiente dieses Hotels ist ernüchternd. Das Hotel liegt in keiner schönen Gegend, dafür aber hat es eine sehr zentrale Lage. Der von uns gebuchte Executive-Room war für den Preis viel zu klein und zudem war der Ausblick auf der falschen Seite. Das Frühstück war mangelhaft. Der Service war bemüht, aber genervt. Fazit: Teures Hotel bei wenig Gegenleistung.

title: Street noise
text:
Great location, rooms are clean and functional. Decor could be updated.
Our room was facing Canal Street and street noise was loud.
Lots of fabulous restaurants and cafes within walking distance.
Would stay here again using the ear plugs provided in the room.

title: Great choice for NYC
text:
This was our first stay in NYC, we were originally booked to stay near central park but changed the reservation to here as it only required half the points. This was a good decision as the Sheraton provided everything we needed. The location is near the subway and only a 15 min walk to world trade center so very accessible. The rooms are small but this isn't an issue in NY. 

Our room was a patio room on the second floor at the side of the hotel which was quiet so we slept well.

We had lounge access on the 21st floor which afforded two hours of snacks and alcohol each evening (5-7pm) with amazing views. Breakfast was also available in the lounge and 24hr hot and soft drinks.

We didn't eat in the hotel as there are plenty of quality options locally. 

If you're wanting a room that's away from the craziness of Times Square but accessible then this is a good choice.

title: Optimal für Sightseeingtouren in New York
text:
Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral in Soho/Chinatown. Die Metro in allen Richtungen ist direkt um die Ecke! Man ist schnell in Midtown und Downtown.. 
Abends bieten sich viele Möglichkeiten in Soho ein Bier trinken zu gehen und eine gastronomische Meile ist in ein paar Schritten erreichbar
Das Hotel selbst ist sehr sauber, zwar etwas in die Jahre gekommen, aber grundsolide..
Weil wir nicht wie angefragt einer der oberen Etagen ein Zimmer bekamen, bot uns das Hotel ein kostenloses Frühstück jeden Tag von den 7 Tagen an! Für New York ist das toll und ein guter Service!
Die DachTerrasse bietet einen tollen View aufs Empire State Building!
Uns hat es gefallen! Top

title: A weekend away in the city
text:
This hotel is located on the edge of Tribeca and Chinatown. The property itself is very nice and the lobby is not too big. 

There is a restaurant/bar located directly next to the check in desk. The check in staff was very friendly and explained all the hotel has to offer and where the executive lounge is located and the hours for breakfast and happy hour. 

One great this about this property is that they offer free happy hour in the lounge. That’s very hard to find at a Marriott property in the US. The lounge is small but it has an amazing outdoor patio with great views of midtown. They also have heat lamps for the colder months. Deon who was working in the lounge was great!!! He was a one man show. The lounge gets very crowded and he was there as the bartender, waiter and whatever else you need him to do. He was very quick and efficient and friendly.

The rooms are quiet small, typical of NYC, but who stays in their rooms in NYC. There is lots to do around the around and plenty of bars and restaurants. The subway is a few blocks away as well.

Definitely check this hotel out if you are in town for work or pleasure.

title: Hôtel au cœur de Manhattan
text:
Un hôtel agréable car bien situé et desservi. 
Les plus: la propreté, 
la rapidité du Check in et Check out ( à l’Americaine).
La serviabilité et la compétence du personnel,
La fonctionnalité des chambres : grand lit, salle de bain refaite, 
L’emplacement idéal pour visiter le cœur de New York. 
Un prix raisonnable pour New York
Les moins:
L’aspect défraîchi et les décorations en couleur terne,
La petitesse des chambres,
Le petit déjeuner : buffet au delà du pauvre (moins bien qu’un deux étoiles où nous sommes tombés sur un jour de grève ou de rupture des fournisseurs).

title: Delusione
text:
Quattro notti in questo hotel.
Per quel che costa siamo rimasti molto molto delusi.
Mancava il frigobar in camera, due notti senza lenzuola e soprattutto molta molta polvere... dopo una giornata in giro per la citta torniamo in camera ed in mezzo alla stanza troviamo un mucchio di capelli.
Lo sconsiglio assolutamente

title: Noisy
text: This hotel is located within walking distance to many great areas and close to three subway lines.  The room was small but clean and updated, fine for us. But, the hotel has very thin walls and cheap windows.  We initially had a room on an upper floor that faced Canal. It was very noisy - there are approx 3-4 metal plates on the road (from construction) and you hear the “thump thump” of cars driving over the plates non stop 24/7. We asked for a new room after one hour.  The new room was in a higher floor but was a connecting room. We were told it was one of their quieter rooms and they’ve not had complaints.  But, we heard everything clear as day and had to bang on the neighbours door to quiet them the first night (at 1:30 am).  Next night I sent a chat to the hotel bec noise woke me at 3:30 am - no response till the next morning. I could also hear the other neighbours alarms and people walking in the hallway/slamming doors. Doubtful that I would stay here again.

title: Nelson my welcoming committee
text:
Nelson was a doll.  I arrived early in the morning, Nelson went above and beyond to assist me in securing accomodations and helping out a tired traveler.  He was just extraordinary.  My whole stay was lovely and the hotel staff were very accomodating.
Would definitely stay there and thank you to Nelson...
stacey

title: Great service and really do their best
text:
The front of house team really work hard to make sure you are looked after. I needed a quiet room after a hectic trip to Mexico and they nailed it. 

Thanks guys for a great service and an understanding spirit.

title: Some highs and lows
text:
Stayed in a Club level room for a week working in the city. Had access to the Club lounge which was a nice surprise. Breakfast wasn't huge but higher quality than expected so ate here each morning. Was also nice to come by in the evening and have been. Spectacular views from the terrace. Good location near Soho and Chinatown but  Canal street is pretty rough.

The bar and restaurant were pretty empty the whole time which I think was due to lack of any atmosphere. The gym was decent but small and all the staff were great!

title: Weekend in NY
text: Great property, great location and great service.  The team here is service oriented.  And the concierge lounge is open on weekends, unlike full-service Marriott hotels.  The location is within walking distance of many local restaurants, and far away from the tourist traps of Times Square.

title: Sleeping uptown
text:
Nice hotel. Small rooms but accommodating. Helpful staff and quickly responds to meet needs or special request. 
Decent breakfast although it’s not complimentary. Small gathering place near bar. Elevators are slow. Comfortable bed.

title: Perfect
text: Whether you go on business or vacation this is an excellent hotel to stay in NY City. Very good service, tiny but comfortable rooms. Clean. Reasonable rates. This hotel has a club room located on the 21st. floor. Take your lap top and work from there. The terrace is elegant with great view of the city. Don't miss the happy hour there from 5 to 7.

title: Awesome Stay
text: My wife & I recently stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca.  Wonderful stay.  Sheraton staff were amazing, considerate and very pleasant.   Room was great, clean and spacious.   View was incredible.  Hotel location very close to Chinatown, Little Italy and the subway.  Hotel lobby & lounge was welcoming and very comfortable.  Will definitely stay again.

title: Not the best of Marriott
text:
This hotel is conveniently located for Soho and Chinatown, but the actual location on Canal street is very down market.

The hotel itself is fair but has a number of drawbacks. 

It is located on a very busy intersection and the traffic noise at night was bad. 

In addition, one the of the reasons I choose the hotel is that it had a bar and restaurant. Sadly the restaurant was virtually empty the whole time I was there (except at breakfast). The reason, I suspect, is that it lacks any atmosphere (think funeral parlour) and it is over priced. Similarly, the bar seemed expensive and the wine selection was not great. There is a quick take out option for breakfast but again this is overpriced - I would suggest popping to either of the two Starbucks that are 5 minutes away, or the shops next door.

On a more positive note, the staff were great!

title: Amazing
text: I have a long connection and booked this hotel to wait it out and nelson I believe was his name at the front desk was amazing! He checked me in really fast and helped with my late check out so that I can recharge after my long flight and before my next one! Hotel and rooms are clean, could not ask for more

title: Имя не оправдывает местоположение
text: 24этажа с выходом на край крыши на 23эм.Не большой фитнес на 2ом этаже 24часа.wi fi нормальный.Номер как и Отель скучный,мрачный.в номере шкаф с сейфом ,плазма ,кофе машина ,утюг,кровать с огромным высоким матрасом,душ.Номера маленькие ,тесные .Лобби с баром не уютное и не стильное.Район в 3мин от чайна таун где исходя из названия (китайский квартал:рестораны ,аптеки,спа..все из Китая ).канал стрит страшная улица,обшарпанная !в 10мин пешком памятник 9/11(мемориал),рядом с ним же торговый центр 21.В районе Сохо есть хорошие бары и магазин Эппл .Лучше выбрать отель ближе к центральному парку,здесь только спать хорошо.

title: ALWAYS AMAZING
text: This is my second time staying at the Sheraton Tribeca.  Just like last year it's a pleasure to stay here.  I NEVER had any complaints during my stay.  Our Bell Team Guy Carlos Salazar, was OUTSTANDING.  We remebered him from last year and ironically he remembered us.  Everyday we saw Carlos he made sure that we were ok and that ANYTHING that we needed was taken care of... Carlos came to know us, so there were times it was as if he read our minds and knew ahead of time what we needed and Volia!!! there it was... Thank Carlos.. He is a Keeper... See you next year for My Annual Cousin trip.

title: Top!
text:
Les chambres comme l’accueil sont au top!
Préférez une chambre en hauteur et surtout vue Empire State Building !!!
Quartier super vivant avec Chinatown au bout de canal street.
Deux stations de métro à côté.
Bref, je recommande avec plaisir.

title: Great hotel in good location
text:
Positives:
The 5-7pm small snacks and drinks which was perfect after a long day and a good way to socialise. Also the happy hour from 3-7pm, hotel location (close to a few subway stations) and finally the 21st floor terrace for great midtown views.

Negatives:
The buffet breakfast was frequently under stocked with delays in getting food/drinks replenished - if at all. 
Also overcrowded at times as it's a small space.

Overall:
Great hotel and thoroughly recommend especially if you get a good rate.

title: Hotel can cancel your reservation without warning!
text: I showed up after driving five hours to NYC and arrived just after midnight to check in. Hotel found my reservation—but said they “clear” out reservations after midnight as DNA (Did Not Arrive)—they put someone else into my room and they had no rooms available. Really? No warning! Nothing in confirmation stating they would do this! I demanded a refund and night desk manager refused.  I had no place to stay (and was unable to find another room anywhere).  This hotel is not customer friendly. I called Marriott  (i had booked through their web site—and I have elite status). No help whatsoever. Book here at your own peril if you have travel delays—they will give away your reservation, even if prepaid.

title: Mixed bag
text: Great location for walking to SoHo and Tribeca.  Rooms had some rusty metal in bathroom and could use some refreshing.  Ate at lobby bar one night and service was not great.  Gym had everything you need.  Busy hotel -- not great/not terrible.

title: MUY NORMAL
text:
Esta vez decidimos quedarnos en la zona de Tribeca cerca del Soho, elegimos el Sheraton por una cuestión de precio era apenas ma barato que otros de la zona. ;Me pareció venido a menos, los cuartos no muy limpios, no tiene minibar cosa que me molesto bastante y te cobran el wifi en el cuarto. 
La limpieza no es de las mejores aunque la gente del Front desk es muy agradable...La zona en esa cuadra es bastante fea...Muy cerca hay otros Hoteles mejores que sin duda visitare en mi próxima estadía en NYC.

title: Room for improvement
text: First off it's in a busy area so getting to the front door was tricky. They need to hire more bell/valet help. The young man was pleasant but appeared to be working alone so we took our bags up. Front desk was great, especially Sal. He was able to accomodate my request for a bigger room being a gold member. The club level king rooms are very small. They do have a large window which helps to not feel too claustrophobic. The website boasts a rooftop lounge area for club level guests which is now open to everyone on weekends making it impossible for club level guests to enjoy. They also moved the club happy hour downstairs to the "dining room". Basically a bare room with tables and chairs put in. Definitely not up to Sheraton standards. We did order food 1 day. The Cuban sandwich was very good. The crepes were not crepes. They were pancakes. The breakfast in the club lounge is disappointing. I've had better at a Residence Inn. The bar in the lobby is nice. I was surprised the bartender didn't know how to make an apple martini! She did make a good chocolate coconut one though. All in all it is a clean hotel with nice people. They just need to put in a little effort to decorate the dining room, up the quality of the club breakfast and give the rooftop back to the people paying extra for the perk.

title: Beautiful place to see this city.
text: We walked everywhere...great restaurants, the World Trade Center Memorial, the business meetings we needed to attend. I felt safe and the hotel itself is lovely! The rooms were perfect for resting after the long days we put in as business travelers.

title: TERRIBLE Customer Service response from Hotel Room Supervisor
text:
We booked the Sheraton Tribeca Hotel for 4 nights from the 7th August 2019. Our room rate had no restrictions.This was a return visit as we enjoyed our previous stay. I sent an email to the hotel advising them that we were celebrating a special birthday, unfortunately they did not acknowledge receipt of my email.The ground floor needs upgrading. There is an old coffee bar near the bar that is not longer in use. The staff were using it as a meal room. 
Due to family reasons we had to cancel the last 2 nights of our stay, Friday 9th and Saturday 10th August.
I advised your reception desk in person on Friday 9th August at 930am of the cancellation of my last 2 nights and will check out around 12noon on Friday 9th August.
The gentleman (Raul) who attended to us advised that it will be fine and I will only be charged for the 2 nights.
I checked out at 1130am with Raul and he advised that my account will emailed to me and for 2 nights only. He confirmed the last 4 digits of my credit card.
I left my 2 suitcases with the bellman and returned to collect them at 145pm.
When i received my account account folio the next day i had found that they had charged me for the night of 9th August for Room "RT716", when in actual fact I checked out on Friday 9th August at 1130am from Room 2006. I was actually back home in Australia when I received my account. 
I called the hotel from Australia, Saturday 10th August 707pm (New York time) and spoke to Kimberley and Room Supervisor Star. Star advised she will look into the discrepancy.
I received another email that evening with the same invoice amount.
The following day I received another account folio charging me for a 4 night night stay. 2 nights in room 2006 and 2 nights in room 716. I asked myself, How is this possible ???????
It was so difficult to get an email contact address for the hotel. Very frustrating. I finally managed to get an email address for Room Supervisor Star Mc.....
So I emailed Star again, this time with a copy of my Flight itinerary and boarding pass to prove I had actually left New York on the 9th August. It felt like I had to prove my innocence. Very uncomfortable. Star replied to my email on the 14th August as follows

 "Good Morning ,

Hope that your having a great day . I have spoken with My manager and she approved for me to give you back one night. As far as the other nights being that we were never made aware that you checked out early unfortunately we wouldn't be able to refund you the rest of the nights. I will send you over a folio with the refund amount . Sorry about the inconvenience and if there is anything else that I can help you with please feel free to reply back to this email. "

I thought to myself, I am wasting my time corresponding with hotel over charging me for the 10th August for a room I never stayed in. So they charged me for 3 nights for a 2 night stay. They quite obviously don't believe in customer service or satisfaction. It would be great if I could discuss this discrepancy with the Hotel's General Manager, but unfortunately I am unable to get those contact details.
I have used Sheraton Hotels for over 30 years around the world, this experience has left me extremely disappointed.

title: Tunnel Tower Run
text: Going to NYC for 20 years,loved staying @ Sheraton Tribeca very safe,staff was accommodating,helpful. Happy Hour was the best, Roof Top amazing view, food & drinks FREE!! Stay there you will not regret it.

title: UNKIND
text:
This hotel is unkind and not professional with there customers!!! It is not aceptabel that I was not welcome!!!
I hope that there are follow the consulting hotel projets, so there can help more there customers.

title: If i can give a million stars, i would without hesitation.
text: Great hotel, very clean and quiet. The staff is just amazing, everyone is friendly, smiling, and very helpful with questions and directions. The location is great as well. you can find different types of foods whether you are looking for cheap or expensive, its all there

title: Wonderful Service!
text: I can't express how pleased I am with the quality of service at this hotel.  I was greeted with a smile every time I exited or entered the hotel.  Raul has an amazing energy which make you feel so welcome.  Damon at the bar was so attentive and genuine.  When you are traveling alone, it can be tough sometimes.  But not this time.  I felt so welcome and would definitely return in the future.

title: Hotel assistance
text:
The best thing in the hotel was the Bell Team assistance, provided by Carlos Salazar. Everything that I needed, he was ready to help. Great service!
The hotel is well located. The premises are old but confortable

title: Pleasant Stay
text:
This hotel is along Canal st., a short walk away from Little Italy and Chinatown. 

The hotel is well-maintained with clean rooms and comfortable beds. The elevators were fast. The lobby is comfortable with a restaurant and a bar, but it was very dark with very little natural light penetrating inside, only coming from the main door. I did not see any windows in the lobby. There is a roof top bar at the hotel but we did not get the chance to see it.

No complaints on the service. Breakfast was good, food overall was average. There are a lot of good restaurants within walking distance from the hotel.

I could stay again.

title: Great experience at the Sheraton
text: I was on a girls trip in New York City and I had a great stay at the Sheraton. The customer service was exceptional. Teri helped us when we had problems with our key card. Teri Singh was fantastic with all of our needs.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: Visiting NYC on family vacation and the Sheraton Tribeca was wonderful! Clean room, friendly staff and a spectacular view. Teri Singh was extremely delightful and helped with all of our needs. Definitely will be back!

title: Great Business Hotel And One Incredible, Emotional Night
text: This is probably the hardest review I have ever written.  I had to be in NYC for a quick morning meeting and I like to stay in walking distance to events I am speaking at and the Sheraton Tribeca was the perfect location.  It is a great business hotel, easy in and out, great staff and the manager wrote me a couple of times to make sure everything was the way I wanted it.  Great front desk staff and I had room service twice both times fast and food good.  I flew SFO-EWR because this hotel is literally a couple of blocks from where the Holland Tunnel starts and ends.  The issue, it was 9/11 and while I arrived around 8 PM I had goosebumps the entire time I was a mile or less from Ground Zero and the lights that night were over powering.  I was in SF on 9/11 but the emotions I felt 18 years later being near that hallowed ground were as if it happened all over again, very, very emotional for me and I have to say the hotel staff was prepared and I was not the only person having these feelings.  Very high marks at every level of this hotel on a most emotional night and also thank you to the manager who wrote me to make sure things were OK not many people would do that so again highest marks from me.

title: A localização é excelente e o chefe de recepção, Sal, realmente faz a diferença.
text: O hotel tem uma boa estrutura e uma excelente localização, próximo de tudo o que existe de mais interessante em Nova York, a começar pela região do Soho, repleta de lojas descoladas e bons restaurantes.  O quarto é confortável e tem cafeteira. A limpeza na chegada é boa, mas durante a permanência é regular. O chefe da recepção, chamado Sal, merece nota 10 pelo seu profissionalismo,  atendimento, simpatia,  nível de informação sobre a cidade e solicitude para ajudar. Recomendo o hotel.

title: Great staff and great view of the city
text:
I can’t praise your staff enough for the wonderful weekend and am very pleased once again with every moment of the great hospitality that they have always welcomed me with . From the front desk check in to late night welcomes. Your staff is definitely at the top of their game . 
This was my first booking , but my third visit and each and every time they’ve welcomed me as a friend and not just another guest ❤️
The room had a great view , Damon at the bar was extremely friendly, Sal always has a smile and will take the time to ask how I’ve been , and David is always right there asking me where I’m heading to tonight :-)
My only 1 thing and I wouldn’t say it was big , but my room had no mini fridge . So I wasn’t able to keep my leftovers from all of the amazing restaurants overnight to enjoy the next day . 
Once again ... 
I would stay at no other hotel than your facility when visiting NYC ❤️
Your staff is the best . 
Dan Easter 
Kansas City , Mo 
(Room 2009)

title: From Great to Superb
text: From when we first walked into this hotel, they made their first priority our satisfaction. For one, the hotel is in a great location. We were walking distance to many metros, China Town, Little Italy, and many more. When we were given our room, we realized we would like a better view of the city. We went and requested it, and they upgraded us within seconds. The room was clean, spacious, and of course had a great view of the city. The hotel itself had an amazing rooftop with music and drinks. The all over vibe was amazing. Carlos on the Bell Team was the cherry on top. He directed us to awesome restaurants, nightlife, made sure we had drinks, and many laughs. He was always there as we entered and exited the hotel, making sure there was nothing we were in need of. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who would like to enjoy the city with a peace of mind of their accommadations.

title: Icy Greeting for BonVoy Platinum Member
text: If you're Platinum with BoyVoy, don't expect them to roll out the red carped for you at this place.   When we checked in, I asked about the possibility of an upgrade and was told:  "Here you get a breakfast."    No mention of gift of points or other amenities was offered.   We were given a smallish room looking over a building.   I asked called and asked for a room with a view, and the next day we were changed.   In a nutshell:   Negatives:   No special treatment by staff to BoyVoy Elite members, small rooms, so-so breakfast, expensive for what you get.    Positives:   Location.   Some rooms have great views.   Housekeeping staff were friendly and nice.  Great view from terrace on the near the club.  We will not return to this hotel.

title: Great location
text: This hotel is in a great location if you are going to be exploring lower Manhattan.  We stayed here over the Labor Day weekend and were mostly concerned about the location and were not disappointed.  Canal St. itself is not great and be prepared to be accosted by someone every few steps trying to sell you fake pocket books and watches.  However, it is easy to walk both north and south.  There is a very nice rooftop bar.  The two biggest downsides were that our bathroom was super tiny, even by NYC standards.  Also, the elevators were incredibly slow.  We added 10 minutes to the time we needed to be leaving to account for the length of time we might have to wait.  I would also ask for a high floor since there was some road noise.

title: Very odd ecperoence
text:
Dog barking in room next door until 2am.  When I called about this, they made me move my room and said they couldn’t open the door to check on the dog.

Left items in the first room during the switch that they were unable to recover, including some pretty expensive pants.

Bar was the oddest experience, as though they didn’t want to wait on anyone.  Realized why afterwards; mandatory 18 percent tip on all bills.  Guess they didn’t care to work for more than that.

Think I’ll find a new hotel next time given the price.

title: One of the worst experience
text: While the hotel itself is ok, traffic and the steel plates on Canal street means that I cannot get sleep on any of the five nights I am staying there. The sound of cars driving over these plates are awful and go on the whole night!

title: Not Great Service
text: The rooms were fine and we were comfortable but will not stay here again. Our TV wasn't working properly or connected to the internet. We called and someone came to look at it but couldn't fix it and there was no follow up. The internet is NOT FREE. They advertise complimentary wifi but then we had to pay $10 for 24 hours. Someone came into our room while we were gone and left a cheep $6 bottle of wine. We were concerned as to someone was in our room unannounced. We called and they didn't care or again follow up with as to why there was wine in our room. Just not really friendly or helpful staff. There are plenty more hotels in NY that we will visit next time we are in town.

title: Club Level med takterrass
text:
Hotellet var mycket trevligt, hjälpsam personal. 
Fantastisk utsikt mot Empire State Building från vårt rum. 
Tunnelbanans ena linje runt hörnet, de andra linjerna på Canal Street något kvarter bort. 
Stort rum med alla bekvämligheter, välstädat. Stor dusch. 
Sköna kuddar och frasiga lakan. Sängen i det hårdaste laget. 
Takterrass mot upper Manhattan. 
På club level serverades skinka, ost, nachos med olika röror mm varje em. Där kunde man ta ett glas vin el öl innan middag på stan. 
Många bra restauranger på gångavstånd från hotellet.

title: Downtown Soire
text: Stayed in NYC downtown on Canal St. at the Sheraton Tribeca.  The staff of this hotel were fantastic -- great customer service, friently, & happy to provide assistance.  Great French restaurant around the corner too.  The hotel concierge suite was very good with a wonderful outdoor patio and view.

title: Best 1st Experience Ever
text: When I tell you this hotel went above and beyond to make sure my 1st experience was my best they did above and beyond. Every time we called they came. Warm smiles day and night. We also had the pleasure of meeting Mr. Carlos Salazar amazing amazing trip advisor. He was very open about any and everything we needed to know. Even enlightened us on a cheaper and quicker way back out to the airport. Rooms spacious and we had an amazing view of the skyline. Make this your one stop shop when choosing a hotel.

title: Better than expected!
text: During our business trip to the US, I spent three days at this hotel, with my wife. The hotel is very well organized, maintained and clean. Rooms are nice and very comfortable. The sleep quality is excellent. I’ll be back next November!!

title: una delusione
text:
Secondo noi non è all’altezza del costo e delle quattro stelle.

Le camere non sono molto grandi, l’armadio/guardaroba è piuttosto piccolo e mancano ganci appendiabiti. Il bagno è accettabile.
La moquette viene pulita molto di rado (forse una volta alla settimana?!), ma la cosa più fastidiosa che è che la camera veniva rassettata sempre molto tardi. Più volte abbiamo dovuto sollecitare perché alle 17,30 ancora non avevano fatto le pulizie. 

La posizione è piuttosto comoda per la vicinanza alla fermata della metro e la possibilità di andare  comodamente a piedi a Soho e Greenwich. Ma la strada in cui si trova non è un gran che.
Bella la vista dalla terrazza del 21 piano.

title: Great value, location, and a friendly welcome
text:
We couldn't have picked a better location for our 5 days in New York. We had a warm friendly welcome from the check in staff, who couldn't have been more helpful. 
Our rooms were more impressive than some of the hotel photos show. Our room was spacious, clean, and nicely decorated. The added bonus of the safe being free, as is WIFI, ironing boards & irons as standard, and tea and coffee making in the room along two large double beds made it a really comfortable stay.
We accessed the breakfast from the upstairs breakfast bar. Choice was plentiful and suited most palletes. The bonus was the outside roof terrace that gave spectacular views of Uptown Manhattan. A lovely view at breakfast or of a late night drink.
Any enquiries, at reception, were dealt with immediately and efficiently.
The location of the hotel is great for accessing everything that New York has to offer. The Subway is less than 5 minutes walk and gets you anywhere in the City. 
Surrounding the hotel are a great choice of restaurants too. Anything from the Italians in Little Italy, to the Chinese in Chinatown or the bistros of Greenwich Village. All are within walking distance and offer great choice.
Despite the location, on a busy New York street, the hotel is very quiet and sleep was no problem.

title: Excellent
text:
Of course it is a big chain hotel they would never disappointing you!! :):)  Location is fabulous! right on China town where you can find reasonable and tasty foods included Italian. The room is clean and cozy! Big enough the bathroom is too big enough! Clean!
then it's not far from Soho Tribecca and the monument for the World trade center memorial.. If you were a good walker you would enjoy this area! as you know China town has all kinds of restaurant and stores!

title: Great Value for Manhattan
text: My wife and I spend about a third of the year in hotel rooms for business and pleasure. I have stayed at many hotels in Manhattan and will stay in the Sheraton Tribeca on my future visits to Manhattan. The hotel is in a great location in lower Manhattan. The rooms are sizeable by Manhattan standards and updated with a nice ambiance. The staff is very friendly and accommodating form the front desk to the valet and the housekeeping team. The restaurant is excellent and has a reasonably priced menu. We loved the rooftop lounge on the two weekends we were there. The fitness center is very adequate to get your workout in. TMMMJM

title: Still One of the Best in the Area
text: I've stayed here before, and tried some of the new ones. I like this place. Ciara P was very helpful and professional in setting up my stays. The location of this hotel is excellent. The rooms are very nice and a nice size.

title: Lovely stay!
text:
I had a surprisingly great stay at this hotel.

For Manhattan, my expectations were low. I arrived pretty late via the Subway - around 11-11:30 p.m. I booked last minute and got a great rate.

Check in was quick and efficient.

The hotel lobby was very nice and modern.

My room was surprisingly big for Manhattan! While the room was very slightly dated, I had plenty of space around the bed to move around as well as a decent view of the city. No complaints!

There’s a subway stop around the corner from the hotel - you don’t even need to cross the street! There’s also a pretty good deli next door.

The street the hotel is on isn’t the best, but within a couple blocks, you can reach Soho or several other subway lines.

After check out, I was able to hang out in the lobby for a few hours, enjoy my bagel from the deli next door, and get some work done (utilizing the free WiFi) before catching my train.

I did not have a chance to visit the restaurant or bar.

Overall, I enjoyed my stay and will definitely consider this hotel on my next visit to NYC!

title: Clean Room - Staff is Great - Excellent Location very close to Subway
text:
Stay was good enough for me to take the time to go on Trip Advisor and let others know that this hotel is very clean, staff is great and it has a fantastic location to some great restaurants as well as being a just a couple STEPS from the Subway. 

Concierge Level is fantastic! They have a great Terrace plus the Lounge fr breakfast and happy hour have a great view too!!

title: First time
text:
Sherritan Tribeca
Booked this hotel for its 4 star status, location and club room facility.  You’d miss the entrance if you weren’t looking closely.  Modern built hotel.  Nice foyer.  Staff in reception helpful.  We weren’t pestered by the porter wanting to take our cases, I’m not into the embarrassing them waiting for a tip afterwards thing.  Our check in was 3pm but the room wasn’t ready for over an hour despite the receptionist telling us it would be 10 minutes, after an hour it was another 10 minutes!  However the receptionist was lovely, sincerely apologising & offering us 2 free bar drinks each!  We liked her, she did her job well.
Our room was on the 21st floor and the receptionist assured us we had a good room with good city views.  Well we liked the room & the view was terrific, looking towards the Hudson River.  Minuses of the room include being cramped near the wardrobe, the TV could do to be wall mounted instead of being on top of a wooden plinth on a consul table & the fact we could hear the lift when awake.  We slept well & the lift didn’t waken us!  If things like that disturb you then ask before you book or mention on your booking not to be near the lift.  
Handy for the subway, area felt safe.
Would we go again, probably but so many other hotels to try.

title: Book a Club Room
text: Great location, close to subways and walking distance to restaurants and shops. Comfortable, clean rooms and friendly service. Book a Club level room to enjoy a nice complementary breakfast and sundowners on the rooftop every night. Special mention must be made of fabulous staff member Deon Simpson who runs the sundowner bar ( all by himself) like clockwork!

title: Amazing as always :)
text: This is our fifth time staying here on the club level.  We can not say enough good things about this hotel.  The rooms are amazing and the view is just gorgeous.  We could sit out on the deck all day :) The location is perfect because its so close so shopping and great food... and just a subway ride from Time Square.  We will be back over an over again....

title: Great location and value
text: I was going to stay across the river at a Bonvoy property in Brooklyn, but a local recommended this hotel instead. It was an excellent choice. The Sheraton (Now Bonvoy) Tribeca puts you at the intersection of Soho, Chinatown, Tribeca and Little Italy meaning there's something happening 24/7 and you have your pick of great eateries and nightspots. In addition, the property itself was comfortable, the rooms were well sized by NYC standards and the rooftop lounge gave a fabulous view of the Manhattan skyline. The staff was friendly and helpful. I'd definitely stay here again.

title: nice hotel
text: Centrally located, nice staff, clean rooms.  I was impressed with the quality of the stay.  Nice rooftop bar especially in the summer.  Club access isn't really worth it from what I can see.  Nice downstairs bar area.

title: Nice Hotel in a great location
text:
Nice hotel - the staff here was fantastic. They helped us with everything, including tips on how to get around the city quickly. 
The hotel is in a perfect spot  - close to everything - within walking distance of the World Trade Center and Little Italy. Many restaurants in the area to choose from. Can easily navigate the subway system from here if going further out.  The room has a safe to lock your valuables. Beds were great and room was clean and air conditioned  with a great view of Empire State Building. Enjoyable 3 night stay.

title: Average
text: Average hotel in Tribeca on a very busy street. Pay attention when crossing the street, it was constantly jammed with cars. Walls are thin - we could hear the baby next door crying. Tiny rooms. Open the door and you are practically on the bed. Only one office chair for seating in the room. Breakfast lounge is way too small and cramped, making for an unpleasant morning experience. There is a nice balcony area off the lounge which was nice. Music blasting in the lobby area 24/7 is not necessary.  Would not stay here again.

title: Top hotel
text: Perfect gelegen hotel met goede faciliteiten. Personeel zeer vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Toegang tot het dakterras in het weekend is echt een aanrader, geweldig uitzicht! De wijk Tribeca zit vol met lekkere eet gelegenheden en gezellige barretjes.

title: Great location to base yourself in New York
text:
We stayed for nine nights during early July including the 4th in a Executive Room on the 19th Floor.  Overall the staff were very helpful and always offering a greeting and advice when requested.  The Executive Lounge on 21 was full most mornings and nights due to the holiday period.  Due to special events the evening drinks were served in the lobby restaurant over the holiday weekend.  The lounge staff were always polite and helpful.  Guests sometimes pushed them a bit given the number of people wanting to be served but they did try their best to accommodate all.  When the numbers reduced service was excellent.  Food choices were limited but overall reasonable variety and quality.  Was great to be able to get a water and soda whenever required.

As expected the room was not the largest in the world but good enough for our needs.  Great views of  Empire State Building and Times Square area from room with better view of three sides from the Executive Lounge Balcony. The location was great for local restaurants in Little Italy and Chinatown with a good coffee shop, Italian and Japanese restaurants within a two minute walk of the hotel.  Also great takeaway pizza place for late night snacks within 50 metres. Access to the subway was excellent for visits to Chelsea, uptown and Brooklyn.

title: Quiet stay on a busy street
text:
Spent 2 nights (Fri/Sat) in a King Patio room on the 2nd floor. Normally, I don’t like to stay on lower floors due to the street noise of sirens, honking cars, etc.. But the patio rooms are on the back side of the hotel overlooking a side street, with very little traffic.

The patio rooms are the way to go, if you can get one, there are only 4 of these rooms. While the room was small with little space to move around, the patio was very large with seating for 4. I think the patio was bigger than the room. It was nice to have a private outdoor space just to myself to relax after a day of activities.  Just wish there was a table on the patio. 
 
The room consisted of a standard bathroom with shower, king bed, wardrobe for storage, safe, desk with chair, and TV. The room was a bit dated and could use a refresh, however, the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was adequate with excellent water pressure in the shower. One issue we discovered is that the thermostats are off by about 10 degrees, we set the a/c to 63 get the room cool. I noticed in the concierge lounge the thermostat was set at 60 and the lounge was comfortable.  

The concierge lounge is accessible 24/7 with access to a rooftop patio that faces uptown. In the evening, a bar was setup on the rooftop. In the morning, we had breakfast which consisted of eggs, sausage, potatoes, toast, yogurt and pastries. It was a bit crowed in the morning, with folks waiting for seats. We ate around 8 am. 

The hotel is conveniently located near multiple subway lines. Several restaurants within walking distance. 

The price was very reasonable at $190 a night and no destination fee. I tend be more price conscious in large city given the amount available hotels. I would stay here again, if the price is right.

title: Encantados!!
text: El hotel nos gustó mucho! Excelente trato del personal en recepción. Muy bien la limpieza. Lindas vistas y una terraza con muy lindas vistas a la ciudad. Ubicado a una calle del metro. En el Soho! Volvería a parar en el hotel con gusto!

title: Hotel OK, Location Great, Service disappointing
text: Stayed at the hotel for 6 nights in June.  The room was small (as you'd expect for the location), but clean and properly cleaned everyday.  One bottle of free water only which I find quite stingy in comparison to hotels in Asia/Europe.  The truly disappointing part was during and after checkout.  I was on a business trip hence requiring my invoice for claims.  I agreed for it to be sent via email.  I also confirmed with them upon check out that they had my Marriott Bonvoy membership number - they confirmed this and reassured me points would be credited 1-2 weeks later.  The invoice never arrived, my emails were not answered and so I had to go back after 4 days to follow up on my invoice.  It is three weeks now, I am coming back from various business trips back-to-back, and I haven't received any loyalty points either.  As I did my claims I checked the invoice and it didn't state my membership number leaving me to follow up with Marriott Bonvoy to get them credited.  Again, hotel was fine, location is great, but service was disappointing.

title: Beautiful Views, Great Value, Very Noisy
text: Nice size room, comfie bed, so much street noise even on 11th floor. Gonna try ear plugs tonight. But hey, it’s NYC, right, what can you expect? No blankets or comforter but it’s a heat wave so that might make sense but I like the weight of a blanket. Friendly staff, 24 hour .99 cent pizza on the block and nice bodega too. Great price for clean, comfie room. Nothing unique or special but gets the job done. Valet parking $65-$75 a night which was less than I’ve paid.

title: An average hotel ie part of the Marriott group
text: We just returned from a weekend stay at the hotel. Our first time at this location because we wanted to explore this part of NYC instead. Location is excellent with lots of shopping and restaurants all within walking distance. However the hotel is really average. The King bed was too soft and lack support and the covers literally comprised of 3 sheets. We requested to change our room to 2 Queen beds instead the following day with the hope of a better supporting smaller bed. Also the pillows are totally soft and flat when you lay on them. When I called to request for a harder pillow , I was told their pillows are all the same. So needless to say, we did not sleep well at all for the 2 nights that we spent at the hotel.   I also cannot say the room was very clean as I found 2 long hairs that we stucked on bathroom walls . It was not a pleasing find.

title: skip it
text: Stayed here for world pride. I would NOT recommend this Marriott. The lounge was slammed with not enough people able to work it properly. The gentleman who served the wine/beer was beyond rude and made it seemed like the owned the hotel, he was in charge and he was NOT afraid to let people know. His customer service was disgusting.   The elevators also took a solid 15 minutes sometimes 25 to come to you. The hotel is tired and needs a face-lift.

title: A very disappointing stay
text: As a lifetime Marriott Platinum member, I decided to give this hotel a try as I had stayed in so many other Marriott NYC properties over the years.    The location is great, the hotel and service was a major let down.     We had two significant issues during our four night/five day stay.    The first issue was our room AC did not work.   Our room was a good 10-15 degrees warmer than the hallway.    The first night we were tired from our travels and slept ok.   The second night we both woke up in full sweats as room kept getting warmer,    We visited the front desk the next morning and we were told it would be fixed or we would be moved to another room.   Later that day when we came back to the hotel and it was not fixed.  A new front desk person then told us she had no record of our morning report and that she had no other room for us.   She sent up maintenance and he played with it and then said not to open the curtains the rest of our stay.    We hardly slept the next two nights, we made an effort to not stay in the room at all during the day.   It was miserable,   I made two reports to the front desk and never heard back until I filled out a random survey after the stay and then they said here is 6,000 points for not sleeping.    The second issue was the club lounge.   They could not handle the crowd and made no adjustments,    Two of the four mornings they ran out of hot breakfast an hour before closing.    They were consistently out of bottle water and soft drinks.    The entire experience in this hotel was poor.   With so many Bonvoy options in NYC we recommend you skip this one.

title: Long term stay
text: We had a wonderful room 2020. Amazing view of the Empire State Building and city.  I have to give the staff a heads up. Our room was not ready when we arrived but Sal Angioletti the front office supervisor let me look at some of the rooms that were and as soon as I saw our room I knew we had scored a great room. He took so much time out of his busy day to make me happy and I could see he did that for all the guests he helped - it was wonderful to be made to feel at home in a hotel we were about to spend the next ten days. I cannot say enough about how helpful the staff were (especially Sal) they helped in so many ways and everyone was so pleasant.  My only complaint is that the Buffett in the lounge was pretty limited as was the Buffett in the restaurant however the staff in the lounge worked hard to keep it stocked and keep a busy lounge flowing smoothly.  I have been a Marriott member a long time and most of the lounges supply more options for hor’dourves and breakfast.  The other issue was the fire alarm went off at 9:00 am and there wasn’t an announcement made quickly so people were confused as to what to do and the elevators were shut down (as they should be) but still not working at 11:00 long after it was determined there was no emergency (which was the only time I regretted being on the 20th floor.)  I would say the Buffett is a small issue and it’s not often an alarm goes off so neither would stop me from staying here again!

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
We have just returned from a 14 night stay at the Sheraton TriBeCa. From the moment we checked in it was all positive. My wife had emailed them previously and told them this was in effect our honeymoon combined with our wedding anniversary as we had been unable to take a honeymoon when we got married. We were very kindly upgraded to a higher floor with club access and a fantastic view out over the city to the Empire State Building. How awesome is that for a first visit to New York!

Check in staff were lovely and welcoming and very helpful. Our room was great. Not huge but certainly big enough for our needs and was clean and tidy. Only thing I’d say was missing was a fridge. Especially as the weeks we were there the temperature was between 28 and 34 degrees. But other than that we could not fault the room at all. As part of our upgrade we had breakfast included in the lounge on the 21st floor. What a wee gem this place was. Breakfast was great with a pretty good selection of food and drinks and to top it off a
Rooftop terrace with fantastic views of the city and the Empire State Building. This lounge and terrace also has a happy hour every night between 5 and 7 with drinks and snacks and a bar out of the terrace on a Friday and Saturday night. Nothing nicer than a cold drink sitting out on the rooftop on a nice warm summer night with views of New York City all lit up

The Location Of The Hotel on Canal
street was perfect too. Close to a host of Subway stations for the various lines on the subway made travelling anywhere easy. Also situated just outside Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho making all
Of these places accessible with just a short walk

Evelyn from housekeeping was fantastic. Very friendly and helpful she kept our room spotless and kept us well well supplied with water and the usual toiletries and towels etc. A real credit to the Sheraton

Checkout was easy and again the staff were helpful. We had to check out at 12 but our flight was not until
11 that evening. They stored our luggage for us in a secure room and this was no issue for them. After we went some last minute sightseeing we spent the time in the hotel bar. The doorman arranged a car to collect us from the hotel and took us straight to terminal 4 at JFK airport taking all the stress of getting there with out cases out of our hands

Downsides to the Sheraton? None as far as we were concerned. All positive. We wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again and would highly recommend it

title: Good value for the Money
text:
Near Chinatown and its many restaurants. Close to many subway lines.Club lounge is too small when the hotel is full. It was understaffed over the busy 4th of July weekend. Josh did his best to take care of the breakfast crowd and stayed pleasant, but we would expect better staffing from management
.  It has a small rooftop terrace with a fantastic view of upper Manhattan.

title: Posizione e comfort
text: Situato a Canal Street in lower Manhattan è sicuramente in ottima posizione. Personale accogliente, cortese. Struttura molto pulita e ben disposta. Camere confortevoli, letto ottimo, bagno nella norma. In stile New York le camere non sono ampie; prezzo non dei più economici. Comunque consigliato

title: Awesome hotel
text: Great hotel.  Close to the subway stations. Very friendly staff.  Reception staff greeted us every time we entered or left the hotel.  Rooms are comfortable and well maintained.  I would highly recommend this hotel for your next visit to New York.

title: Amazing experience (Sal, Raul, & Angelique are great!)
