text: Sal, Raul, and Angelique were extremely kind, professional, and helpful! We were treated like gold and it made us feel so welcome. They even offered to hold out bags while we went to the happy hour and brought them up to our room right away. They all deserve a raise and we’ll definitely be back! The rooftop is also gorgeous.

title: Non sembra neanche uno Sheraton...
text: La posizione non sarebbe male (ai margini con SoHo e con la fermata della metropolitana proprio a pochi passi) ma la struttura risulta molto mal gestita e non rende piacevole un soggiorno di diversi giorni. Piccole le camere (706 quella da me occupata) e in due non si sa neanche dove mettere le valigie piene (impossibile svuotarle visto che non ci sono cassetti e l'armadio è minuscolo). Personale alla reception molto ruvido e maleducato. Scandaloso il buffet (?!) della prima colazione dove negli ultimi due giorni (28 e 29 maggio) mancava lo yogurt. Sensazione di poco pulito ovunque. Non mi è mai capitato di soggiornare in uno Sheraton così trascurato, un vero peccato per il nome di questa catena.

title: Fabulous NYC Break
text:
Great location, with easy access to the subway. Lots of great restaurants in walking distance. 
Highly recommend the Club Level rooms. The actual rooms are no different (I don’t think), but the use of the Club Level Lounge for a complimentary breakfast and happy hour each day was excellent.

title: Great!!
text: It was a pleasure to stay at this hotel and we will surely return. It was our anniversary and they not only selected a room with the best views of NYC, they also left us a complimentary bottle of wine in the room. they are details that show that a hotel cares about its customers. we will always have this memory of the marriot club! Thank you!

title: Pluses and minuses
text:
Sheraton SOHO Canal St Seemed like a good price for a small room until we went to dinner at the Roxy around the corner which has fabulous food and atmosphere. There rooms are more reasonable but we didn’t actually see one.
As happens often, pictures don’t show size very well. 
Sheraton SOHO service was excellent as we requested early housekeeping 4 days and it was done, although Sunday Pride parade day it wasn’t. 
The shower and a/c in room 1720 was excellent. One of the few rooms where the A/C was quiet, efficient and didn’t blow directly on you.
No dresser drawers just tiny cubby in narrow upright closet. Difficult to organize your stuff after a couple days.
Comfy non squeak king bed.

title: Great for visiting Soho.
text: Never tried a Sheraton until the Marriott/Starwood merger and wanted a place close to Soho so gave this this property a try.  2pm check SAT check in, our room wasn’t ready so we dropped off bags and went out.  6 pm return 16th floor standard king room with bland lower east side view,  room was small but spotless and toiletries are nice, didn’t get any upgrade but Marriott Platinum gave us lounge access which was a big plus.  Free beer/wine (no chardonnay) and nice substantial breakfast next morning, since guests are able to buy into the lounge expect it to be crowded.  The subway is at back of hotel and Soho is a 5 min walk.  I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend  this hotel to anyone.

title: Decent Room Great View
text:
The room was decent size for the price.  View from the room was great, same from the rooftop bar.  Staff at check in and check out was helpful and nice.  

The floor in the room felt kind of dirty and the comforter was in need of replacement.  Something seemed off about the bed and on the morning we checked out I realized it was the horrible condition of the comforter.  The fluff inside of it was all worn down and almost nonexistent.  I was pretty surprised they would put that on the bed.  Second picture is of the comforter held up to the sunlight, which made my wife and I jump out of the bed.

title: The View
text: Our room with the view to the city was fantastic, the staff is nice, but I have to mention that the margarita pizza is disappointing related with the price/time and room service;  without this I had an incredible experience.

title: Great location! City Views & close to Bond Street + Broadway!
text:
Having status with Marriott there is concierge Lou he access which is for the upstairs rooftop! Beautiful views weather permitting. There is also a cocktail hour in the evening which I believe is for all guests. The concierge lounge can all be accessed for a daily fee (unsure of the amount!) 

There are no microwaves or refrigerators in the rooms. I’m sure they can be requested. The lobby is nice and has a restaurant and bar within it. 

This hotel has a little sandwich and pizza shop next door that also makes excellent fresh pressed juices! MAX Restaurant ( 134 W Broadway) is a short walk and delicious Italian food! 

Lulu lemon and Drakes OVO United States store are located on Bond St. which is within walking distance. 

I’d like to acknowledge Angelique and Star - both ladies work the front desk and were extremely kind and helpful!

title: Would visit again
text: Nice hotel in a very trendy part of the city. We usually stay in Brooklyn or mid town, but tried something different this time. Lots of shopping and great restaurants very close. SoHo has a ton of things to see. Just around the corner from the subway terminal where you can get to uptown or downtown and/or transfer anywhere. Nice bar and restaurant on the property too. Rooms were spacious and quiet for a weekend.  Thumbs up!

title: Turismo
text:
Lo primero a destacar es su pesima ubicacion. Calle oscura, con mal ambiente, alejada de lugares donde salir a comer (al menos en invierno donde cinco cuadras por la noche no son faciles). En si el hotel no es malo, ni bueno. No parece sheraton. Las habitaciones son pequeñas para cuatro y arman la cama doble en el sofa con lo cual la habitacion queda pequeña y desordenada porque el lugar de guardado es minimo. 
La verdad no volveria por la ubicacion espantosa, las habitaciones y la mala relacion precio/ calidad.

title: ATTENTION TO DETAILS -NOT
text: So, we stayed in an upgraded room for more money that was smaller than you can ever imagine.  But, for the money, we had an outdoor patio.  Fast forward to the outdoor patio.  Cigarette butts, trash and dirty floor.  The least they could have done was clean the place up!  Shame on you Sheraton Tribeca.  As a loyal SPG fan, there is no way I would come here again.  Also, if you are over 50 years old, you will be totally invisible here.  Again, shame on you Sheraton Tribeca.

title: Lokasyon çok iyi
text:
Düşündüğüm Sheraton hotel kalitesinden uzak. Lüks beklemeyin.Havlular eski ve yırtıktı.yorgan pis idi.kan lekeleri vardı.
Banyo eski idi.
Consierge katı -rest ile aynı kat-rezervasyonumuz olmasına rağmen farklı kattan oda verildi.
Akşam üstleri Happy hour teras oteldeki en iyi hizmetti.

title: Simple and Clean
text:
I stayed here over Thanksgiving a few years back ad found myself here again for a quick trip for work. The staff is friendly and the location is convenient. Very close to some great Chinese food in Chinatown. 

The Rooms: Rooms are what you expect for a Sheraton. Clean, standard and well kept. They charge more to face the city, otherwise you'll be facing the US Post Office building. 

The Hotel: There's not much too the hotel other than a rooftop bar and a little place for coffee. The lobby is pretty straight forward and doesn't have much for entertainment.

My only concern was my bags were stored in a door near the main entrance. I noticed at one point the door was unattended and luggage was exposed to the street. Kind of felt weird that anyone could walk in off the street and snatch something. Maybe they've fixed this by now? 

Overall I recommend this place if you're just looking to have a nice place to stay and a clean room.

title: Awesome roof top - if you pay!
text:
I would gladly recommend this hotel to all my friends because of the awesome roof top, and the only reason I'm not giving five points is because the rest of the hotel is quite underwhelming. We paid for a club level room which comes with access to the roof top terrace and a free "bar" every afternoon. If you are a club level guest, breakfast is also included. The price was pretty high, but we ate and drank enough for it to even out. The most awesome thing about the roof top wasn't the free drink and snacks, but the amazing view of Manhattan. People pay good money for that kind of view, and there we were, having free drinks and enjoying said view. 
I suspect the club level rooms are bigger than the rooms in the rest of the hotel. This was very nice as it allowed us to spend some time in the room when we needed rest. 
We had a great time at the hotel because we had club level rooms, but the rest of the hotel was unimpressive. The reception lounge was cold and uninviting and there weren't really that many comfortable places to hang out on the first floor. There was a dining room that served breakfast, but I never saw any people in there. It just seems that the hotel focuses mostly on their Club guests. 
At first I thought the location of the hotel was quite far from everything, but the VIEW makes it all worth it. It only takes about 25 minutes to walk to the cooler nearby neighborhoods.

title: Pleasantly surprised.
text: The Sheraton brand is rarely my first choice but this property was great. Fun roof top lounge.  Fantastic location that was in the heart of Tribeca and near soho.  The rooms were small but nice and the staff was great.

title: Great hotel!
text: Sheraton Tribeca is one of my favorite hotels in NYC.  I absolutely love it (especially the roof top club).  The service is always perfect.  The rooms are larger than your typical NYC hotel.  The subway station is just minutes away.

title: Great Location - Outstanding Friendly Staff
text:
This hotel was very clean, well maintained, and conveniently located for walking or the subway.

This staff was very helpful from the moment I walked through the threshold of the hotel until my departure.   I stayed for 4 nights.

The bellmen were helpful in holding my bags while my room was being readied. They also asked me each time I departed if I needed a car or help with transportation. 

The front desk greeted me each time I returned. 

A man cleaning the elevator was friendly and welcoming and insisted on stopping his task until my ride was complete. There was also another man putting down a fresh mat near the elevator prior to the start of a rain storm. He also greeted me and insisted on starting his task after I was on my way, even when I told him I was not in a rush and would wait.  I’m sorry I didn’t get their names. 

The pride of the staff maintaining the hotel was evident, with everything looking fresh each day. 

Bibi left my room spotless each day, leaving  a handwritten note thanking me for staying in your hotel.  I was fortunate to briefly meet her on my last day before checking out and thank her in person. 

The hotel may have a recognized name of a large corporation, and while the name may be important to some, it is the people, not the brand, who make any organization a success. The staff should be cited for their dedication and pride... it was noticed and appreciated. 

I will be returning to this hotel on my next trip to Manhattan.

title: Melhor localização e atendimento.
text: Achamos que ficaríamos muito deslocados do centrão de NY e de muitos dos pontos turísticos, mas no final das contas nós amamos. O hotel fica bem perto de uma das melhores linhas do metro, pois vai de norte a sul da ilha, além de ter conexões de fácil acesso para todos os pontos sem exceção. Além disso, as instalações são ótimas, pegamos um quarto alto, com uma vista espetacular! O atendimento muito bom, todos muito cordiais e prestativos, inclusive com relação às nossas compras pela internet que iam chegando durante a estadia. A única coisa que deixou um pouco a desejar foi o chuveiro. Pouca água e sem muito controle da temperatura. Chamamos o pessoal para "arrumar" 2x enquanto estávamos lá, mas não conseguiram nada de diferente do que já estava funcionando. Ou o banho era muito quente ou morno. Mas a gente se virou bem! Super recomendo (especialmente com a vista maravilhosa que tivemos...)

title: Be sure to upgrade your room
text: This hotel is much better described as "adequate" than "exceptional". It's very clean with friendly staff and in a great location, but nothing really stands out. The standard rooms feel like shoeboxes, so it'll be well worth your while to upgrade if you can. It can get a bit noisy with doors slamming and people talking and clomping through the halls, but the staff are always more than willing to move you to a different room. The food and drinks are all right, but again, nothing to write home about. Great place to stay for business travelers and those who will be on the go and experiencing the city, rather than relaxing in the room and milling about the hotel.

title: Perfect Location. Heart of NYC. Excellent Rooms. Upgrade to Club Lounge!
text: If you are looking for a hotel that has preeminent service, plush beds, and cultivated staff, the Sheraton Tribeca is your best bet in New York City.  The location is perfect for those who want easy access to the Holland Tunnel and located right next to the Canal Street Subway Station.  All of New York is yours within minutes.  Checking in was simple and a breeze.  We opted for a room for a balcony/deck that allowed us to enjoy cocktails and NY pizza purchased from a local restaurant.  If you can, purchases and upgraded room with club level access to enjoy complimentary beer and wine with choice appetizers. The breakfast provided in the lounge was excellent as well.  The lounge attendant was quite knowledgable on local places to eat, drink and attend while visiting the city.  He was very personable.  There is a great fitness facility on the second floor which was cleaned daily.  I noticed it being cleaned the same time both days of my stay.  There were up-to-date cardio machines and weights along with the Sheraton Fitness branded tips.  We ate some light food and drank cocktails at their Antica Ristorante which has an excellent assortment of beers.  The service was fast, efficient and offered delicious foods for anyone.  This is definitely a great hotel in a fantastic location.

title: Great hotel with an excellent location
text: I stayed here over Memorial Weekend and overall had a great stay. The hotel staff was very friendly and provided very good service. The hotel rooms while small, were clean and still very comfortable. The location of the hotel is excellent, right near several subway lines and near plenty of restaurants. The one thing that I did not like was how you can hear everything in the hallway from your hotel room.

title: Excellent Service and Location
text:
I stayed here for my wife's 50th birthday for 3 nights in May 2019. Overall excellent. I was contacted in advance by Andrianis M - one of the reception team. Her service from start to finish exceeded our expectations. The rest of the staff were also excellent. Our room was clean and comfortable with am Amazing view. Credit to the 21st floor team - very efficient and helpful. 
We were recommended this hotel by a friend who has used it many times simply due to service , location and price. The location is great. Situated mid downtown it gives great access to all the stuff you might wish to visit. Canal subway 2 mins walk. Fantastic Italian just next to subway entrance ( bellman's recommendation )  
There is a private bar on the 21st floor with roof terrace where you get comp beer and wine between 5pm and 7pm. You can also have breakfast up there too. Defiantly worth joining. 
all in all - well done and thanks -  Tribeca team

title: LOTS of positives here!
text: I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca in room 2207 from May 9th to May 18th 2019.  I had a very positive experience.  With such a long stay, I sprung for their 'Club Level' package; so my room was on a higher, (actually the highest), floor.  Which was great if you're as sensitive to noise as I am.  (This is NYC people - pack some ear-plugs!  Or download a white-noise app.)  The bathroom had the GREAT addition of a magnification mirror on the side wall.  The toiletries were ample & of decent quality.  The water pressure & temp remained at a consistent level throughout my morning showers.  There was a full-length mirror just outside the bathroom.  In addition to the chair at the work-desk, there was a very comfy lounging chair with ottoman in my room, (such a great touch!).  Every single Sheraton employee who I had dealings with, or even a short encounter with, was terrific.  (This was a bit of a shock to me...)  The Club Level breakfast offerings were ok, (though the scrambled eggs weren't very good, unless I used a lot of ketchup!).  I really liked their addition of sauteed onions along with the sausage.  There were three options of cold cereals and an ample variety of breads, muffins, and pastries, etc..  Also, plenty of coffee, water, juices, and even soda.  For the evening offerings, there were basic noshes - crackers & tortilla chips, one kind of cheese cubes, and then one kind of luncheon-meat (rolled up).  Also a pasta salad.  They served several wines & beers.  (Also, they had a cash-bar in the Club room, if you wanted to have hard liquor as well.)  I'm not much of a drinker; so I mostly just enjoyed the breakfasts and then the viewing deck for the Club Level upgrade.   The Sheraton Tribeca is VERY well situated with short walks between four (4!) subway lines that I used every single day of my stay - such a great location for public transit.  I can think of two areas for improvement - the lighting in the bathroom was on the dim-side.  And, the in-room coffee maker was a bit of a spitter.... After the first cup of coffee, I made sure and kept a washcloth handy to contain the water leaks/spurts.

title: Unpleasant
text:
I booked this hotel because of I spg member & closed to the tour bus location which about 8 blocks from the hotel.
the room is average. the room the gave me with an unplesant view of airconditiong unit.

title: Good stuff!
text: Sheraton Tribeca does it right. They treat Marriott elite members very well, and they have a great location with a great lounge. Not a lot to hate about the Tribeca, rooms are always clean and fresh. Can be pricey, but well worth the price. This is my go to hotel for SoHo/Tribeca areas.

title: Incredibly poor customer service
text: What a terrible experience I had staying at this hotel. When we first checked in the counter staff were disinterested and unhelpful. They were barely responsive to any enquiries we had. Halfway during our stay the hot water went out, which granted, happens in older buildings in winter. However, it took two days to fix and we were never notified if it was fixed. We called repeatedly to tell them that the water was not fixed and we got a curt reply of: "oh you have to run it for awhile" and after informing them that we had done it for a few minutes they said it had not been fixed. This would have been fine if it happened once but we tried several times over the course of two days and each time we mentioned it we were given the exact same reply. On checking out we were told that there were no extra charges to be paid, again in a disinterested and curt manner, but then received a charge the next day on our credit card and trying to find out what the charge was about was like pulling teeth. I will never stay at this hotel again and it is a shame to the sheraton and Marriott brand.

title: Inconvenient and poor service
text: My stay was ok and the hotel is decent, if not a little dated. But, I was astonished that I could not get a cup of coffee before 7am and to make matters worse they ran out of coffee for the in room coffee makers! I was told to “go next door” if I wanted coffee before 7am.

title: Excellent Service
text: The staff here is amazing, second to none. At the front desk, Sal and Felitta are warm and welcoming, taking care of all our needs and very helpful with dinner and events going on in the area. Also in the front desk area, Eddie is extremely helpful helping out with all logistics. In the concierge lounge, Deon carries a great conversation and brings a big smile every day; Steve is also great, greeting visitors with a smile and making us feel welcome; Josh is also excellent, keeping the lounge meticulously clean and is warm and welcoming as well. Overall, this is a 5-star hotel with a great management team (too many to mention) and I look forward to returning whenever I'm in the Big Apple. #greatbrand

title: perfekte Lage
text: Wir hatten ein Zimmer im oberen Stockwerk (gegen Aufpreis), die Aussicht war traumhaft. Das Hotel ist modern, der Service sehr gut. Die Lage ist für Ausflüge uptown und downtown ideal. In der Umgebung gibt es auch zahlreiche Möglichkeiten zum Frühstücken oder zum Abendessen.

title: Lindo hotel en una zona un poco alejada
text: Estuvimos con mi esposa e hijo pequeño, y el hotel resultó muy cómodo, con una excelente cama, limpio y muy buena relación precio-calidad. El personal fue muy amable y no tuvimos problema alguno. La única cosa “negativa” fue la ubicación, ya que se encontraba bastante alejado de todo, y había que recurrir al subte con frecuencia. Pero en general estuvo muy bien

title: Excellence
text: This hotel is an excellent choice for business or pleasure.  The staff is second to none, and make every effort to accommodate any request.  I had several business needs that were handled timely and professionally.  The following specific staff members went out of their way to assist and accommodate: Kayleen Solano, Andrew Nkunku, Mai Garcia, Eddie Espinal.  Thanks to each of you!  This hotel is in an ideal location, is well kept and very clean.

title: Overnight
text: We had a King Room then we were offered a Club Room for just $18.00 with the breakfast and evening drinks and apps. This was an easy upgrade. The room was great no problem.  The only downside with New York is parking. $75.00. If I didn't get a good deal on the room I would have stayed in New Jersey.  Picture is a view from the club room

title: Pas à la hauteur !
text:
Nous y avons séjourné 6 nuits en Décembre 2018,
Hôtel hyper bien situé !
Nous avons été déçu par plusieurs points :
-> La chambre : salle d'eau OK mais sinon hyper petit (nous avions un lit bébé, du coup, on ne pouvait même plus circuler ou même ouvrir la valise !)
-> Acceuil très aléatoire, l'équipe du soir est plutôt sympathique mais celle du matin ... La catastrophe sauf le concierge qui est vraiment adorable et à l'écoute !
-> Le lobby est constament blindé / aucun lieu agréable pour boire un verre ou se poser (ce qui est dommage compte-tenu du fait que notre chambre était toute petite)
-> A 2 reprises nous sommes revenus à l'hôtel à 17h et la chambre n'était toujours pas faite ! 
-> Les distributeur d'eau / boissons dans les couloirs ont été en panne tout le long de notre séjour
-> Beaucoup d'attente pour prendre l'ascenseur car très lent

Au final, on s'attendait à vraiment beaucoup mieux compte-tenu du "standing" donc nous avons été déçu.

title: “Fast Eddie” to the Rescue
text: After the worlds worst travel day, my pregnant wife became extremely ill during the middle of the night. We didn’t have any provisions with us in the room so we called the front desk at 3am and “Fast Eddie” came to our rescue hand-delivering juice and a sleeve of crackers. My wife was so overwhelmed she started crying in thanks. That’s the type of customer service that brings people back.

title: Great location for a NY minute!
text:
This was my first stay at this property.  I was in NYC for 3 days only and needed a mini getaway. I booked the Club Level king room and I definitely do not regret it. 

It is pricier than the regular room. However, it does have it perks. High floor, partial view of the river.  The room was smaller than expected, but we didn't spend much time in there, so it's okay.

one of the perks of Club Level is breakfast + happy hour is included. They have a lounge for Club Levels that can access 24/7 for free water + soda/pop.  When I went to happy hour, they had alcohol, appetizers (not amazing, but still decent) 

I was on the 22nd floor (highest) and it was pretty quiet.  room was clean, bathroom was decent size and clean. It did what it suppose to do. Sleep through the night and enjoy NYC outside. Amazing location , right by ACE Canal station (2 min walk) or NQR Canal Station, about 5-7mins walk . McDonalds close by if you're desperate --Chinatown was around the corner and got a foot massage from all that walking. Took uber once, due to the fact it was late a night.  Every staff I encounter was really great. I am a Marriott Memeber, so free wifi and their app is really great to use -- live chat are available. 

I will definitely visit this property again.

title: Guter Service in guter Lage
text: Direkt an der Canal-Street, drei U-Bahnlinien in direkter Nähe; gutes serviceorientiertes Personal; nicht mehr ganz neu, aber praktische Zimmer; zum Frühstücken in der Umgebung einige Kaffees oder im Club- Level (dort aber nicht so gutes Gebäck); Gesamteindruck ok

title: ZAKELIJK SLAPEN
text: Prima hotel. Goed gelegen met West Village, Chinatown en Little Italy op loopafstand. Compacte kamers en met de clublounge als prima backup voor een snelle snack of softdrink. Het restaurant op de begane grond is misschien want donker en ongezellig, maar de keuken is zeker niet slecht.

title: No tiene la calidad de un 4 estrellas ni de un Sheraton
text:
Habitación pequeña, llena de polvo y con un armario diminuto. Las ventanas estaban llenas de mugre...  Para mi gusto, le falta un mini bar en la habitación. Uno de los días no nos hicieron la habitación y tuvieron más de 13h para hacerla...
Lo único bueno es que la zona es más tranquila que midtown y no te pasas las noche oyendo sirenas

title: Great location and value
text:
My husband and I recently stayed at the Sheraton TriBeCa, which I booked due to good reviews and close proximity to a concert venue for a concert we were seeing (City Winery).  We were quickly greeted by staff ready to valet our car, which we happily did.  It was expensive ($65/night), but it was worth the cost to us.  If you want to pay less you could probably find a cheaper garage closeby.  We were all about the convenience.
The lobby is lovely, and the front desk staff was very friendly.  Our room was on the 4th floor.  It was a very nice room, actually quite spacious by NYC standards.  The bathroom was also nice and spacious.  We were facing the very busy canal street and it was LOUD.  I wonder if a higher floor would result in less noise.  It wasn't that awful, but some might be bothered by it.
The free WiFi was no good.  If you want good WiFi you have to pay.  I just used my data and it was fine.  We weren't in the room that much so it really didn't matter.
There is daily breakfast for a fee which we didn't do.  
The location of this hotel is really great, whether you're spending most of your time downtown, or anywhere in the city.  The subways are everywhere.  That's how we got around when we weren't walking.  The only issue with walking in the area is the multitude of street vendors selling bags.  It's hard to get down the crowded sidewalks, especially as you approach Chinatown.  It's also not the prettiest part of TriBeCa.  It's quite dingy and dirty and loud.  However, walk a few blocks and you'll be in lovely neighborhoods.  Never did I feel unsafe.
We were overall quite pleased with our stay.  It's not luxury but it's a good value and great location, so that's good enough for us.

title: Disappointed “Marriott” experience
text:
I work close to this hotel and thought I would give it a try. I was staying 2 nights mid-week. I am Titanium Elite Lifetime. I requested an upgrade through app and I was told it was processed. 

i thought I could check in at noon as the app had sent me a notification. I was told my room wasn’t ready so I left my bags and went to work. At no point did I feel appreciated or greeted as a lifetime Marriott member, in fact it was the opposite. When I returned, I was given my room, which was on a higher floor (18) but it was not an upgrade. All I got was a shrug. I was not told where the lounge was or even if there was one. When I entered the room, the elevator sound was really loud. I called downstairs to see if I could change rooms. After a sigh and being put on hold, I was told to come downstairs to get another key. Wow, first time in a long time that has happened; normally someone would bring a key and help you move! And they weren’t that busy! And it was around 5 pm so there is no way they didn’t have other rooms available.

So I went downstairs and now the attitude was hostile. I was given an identical  room on the 11th floor with a filthy window - fine, I shut the shade. Point is, I got there at noon and it seems that I got put in a less desirable room , not once but twice.

There were multiple other things. Noisy, people in the hallway at night trying to use their key on my door, terrible food from room service at premium prices, worn out rooms, etc. 

I have detailed all of this and more in an email to the front office manager when they asked for my feedback and have not heard one word. And it has been more than a month.

I won’t be returning. Thank goodness there are other options in NYC.

title: Noisy, Cramped & No Maid’s Service
text: I wouldn’t stay here again. The rooms don’t have any sound proofing—I was woken by slamming doors in the night and morning. The maid’s service only came once in my three day stay despite me scheduling them to come and the room was only a few feet bigger than the king size bed on each side.

title: Good Hotel. Below Average Club Lounge
text: This hotel is clean with an efficient staff, close to the subway and West Broadway.  I really liked the location. You could get to most anywhere in 30 minutes or less using the subway. The front desk, while courteous, were not very welcoming or warm.  Rooms were small but clean and updated.  It will be hard to find a large hotel room in NYC. The club or Memeber lounge was an embarrassment. Seating was institutional, afternoon wines were terrible, and the “appetizers” reminded me a what a bunch of college boys would put out.  Cheese cubes,Ritz Crackers and some vegetables. Breakfast was similar low end with a meat option, which was the worse “sausage” I have found in my travels.  Maybe the club room was at this level because of the many families. The lounge on the main floor was better and if you get the happy hour drinks, reasonably priced.  I’ll be back only if I can get a good rate.

title: Tribeca Mother-Daughter Weekend
text:
My daughter and I stayed recently at the Sheraton Tribeca.  Lovely hotel at a very reasonable price.  The hotel is close Chinatown and Little Italy; it's also very close to Soho.  Perfect location - and super easy to get to Brooklyn, too.

In addition the to location, the rooms are lovely, and perhaps most importantly, the staff are wonderful.  responsive, charming, and helpful.  Will definitely book here again.

title: Great location, very clean room, had what we needed
text: Had a very recent week long stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. Didn't get in until 2 am the first night and no problems with check in despite the very late arrival time. Room had a nice view of the Empire State Bldg. and was relatively quiet (always city noise) and very clean. Our room was great, not very large but its NYC and none of the hotel rooms are large. House keeping was reliable and kept the room very clean. Great location, various subway lines (the A,C,E, and N,R,Q, 2)  within very easy walking distance. Canal Street had always been kind of dicey but never felt unsafe at any time. Restaurants galore within easy walking distance and across Canal Street is SoHo, Little Italy, and Chinatown. There's a little deli right next store to the hotel whose food was really good, bialy's bagels, etc., and a wonderful Italian restaurant named Pepolino's is right around the corner. We must've used the subway to get to and from our hotel 20x...Don't bother with Uber (we did 1x) because the traffic doesn't allow you to move from where the hotel is located in any reasonable amount of time. When we left, the hotel coordinated a ride for us to Newark Airport and that worked seamlessly. We would have no problem staying at this hotel again in the future.

title: Great Experience
text: Having been disappointed at a price increase at my regular NYC hotel, I got an amazing offer at the Sheraton Tribeca for a single night. This great price was complemented with great service and accommodation. Heading straight to the hotel after overnight travel from the UK, intending to drop my luggage and get lunch, I was gladly surprised to be to told I could check in early, albeit a room on a lower floor than requested, which was a brilliant compromise allowing me to wash and rest a little before tending to my business. The room was a great size, especially for hotels in Manhattan and matched by a decent sized bathroom. The room had a coffee machine available as well as good quality toiletries and even included an iron and board, a great addition, despite not using them. Although being on the second floor, the room was rather quiet and little outside noise could be heard. The staff could not have been more accommodating, offering their help and service at every opportunity. A great experience and would gladly stay here again for right price.

title: Good hotel
text:
Despite being on busy Canal St, this hotel was great. Subway 2 minutes away.
My room was big for NY standards. Comfy bed and quiet considering the area. I was on level 18 w a nice view. One porter was extra nice, sorry didn’t get his name.

title: Localização ao sul de Manhattan - Tribeca - SoHo - Chinatown
text:
Ótima opção na região sul de Manhattan. O Hotel fica na região de Tribeca ("Triangle Behind Canal Street"), muito próximo à Chinatown e SoHo. è mutio fácil acessar as demais regiões de Manhattan ou até mesmo o Brooklyn de metro (subway), pois existem estações bem próximas, acessíveis à pé. A região da Canal Street, defronte ao hotel, não é das mais encantadoras, porém rapidamente você consegue se locomover para outros pontos mais atrativos. Andando uma quadra pela Canal , St.você vai perceber que chegou em Chinatown quando começarem a lhe oferecer bolsas (Louis Vuitton, etc.) e relógios falsificados. 
O quarto que me ofereceram era amplo e confortável e com algumas amenidades (café / cafeteira cortesia). O hotel possui uma academia, com água e frutas à disposição de quem quer manter a forma. Os acessos são todos com chaves magnéticas, inclusive nos elevadores (ponto para segurança). Minha diária não incluía café da manhã, portanto não avaliei. Se você, como eu, não estiver disposto a pagar o café no hotel, existem opções próximas no entorno do hotel (starbucks, etc.). Enfim, quando me hospedei achei um bom custo-benefício em relação aos hotéis na região mais turística da Manhattan (Central Park, Times Square, etc.), mais caros e de pior qualidade.

title: Wonderful
text: Superbe hôtel, très bonne localisation non loin des transports, service impeccable, personnel fort sympathique, très bon rapport qualité / prix nous avions bénéficié d’un surclassement avec une vue imprenable sur l’ESTB

title: Compact Room that was Spotless
text: We stayed in a king bed/executive level room. Whisper quiet A/C, comfy bed, excellent water pressure and temp. Room is very compact (but, it IS New York, we expected it). The club floor lounge offered 24/7:  Starbucks coffee, bottled water/soda, a few snacks/granola bars. Breakfast had cereal/bagels/danish/yogurt/eggs; around 5-7, they have beer and wine plus light snacks (cheese/chips/veggies). All staff were very nice. Check in is at 3 AND they do not deviate. The reason for only 4 stars: 1. Window treatment did not offer a set of sheers. You either closed the 'black out' panel or keep the panel open for light (and no privacy). Our room's sheer assembly was broken. 2. Bath sink bowl had a 12" crack in the porcelain.  We would stay here again.

title: Superior service, classic comfort
text: The rooms are compact but very comfortable and squeaky clean, some with great views of the skyline. After staying in a few hotels that try to jazz things up with quirky features, it was nice to be in a traditional, classic hotel that offered the things that matter (excellent shower, well designed room, fast Wifi, great bedding, window that opens a few inches for fresh air). Concierge lounge offers bountiful reception at 5 p.m. seven days a week, with beautiful sunsets. Used both the hotel gym and the separate lobby elevator to Planet Fitness. Both gyms had ample equipment in good condition. Everyone working at the Sheraton Tribeca was a true pro, with tiny special requests met quickly and with a smile. The location is excellent if you plan to use the subways; easy access to the A train for JFK and three blocks from the trains that serve midtown and the upper east side. Lots of good bistros across the street in Soho. Very happy Titanium customer.

title: Good Location, Comfortable old style rooms
text:
We stayed in Sheraton Tribeca on our 4 days trip to New York.  
We arrived around 11 am and the check in time was 3 pm. The hotel staff put our luggage in storage room & we went out to the tourist sites until the room was ready.
The hotel is well located on canal street which is just a few blocks away from the world famous shopping & eating district Soho. Brooklyn bridge is only 10 mins walk from the hotel. 
The subway to uptown is at 2 mins walk from where you can easily take the express train which takes you to Times Square in less than 10 mins. 
There are a lot of train stations nearby so you can easily go to major attractions like staten island ferry for Statue of Liberty, Port authority buss terminal which takes you to Woodbury premium outlet shopping mall ( an hour away from NYC).
We booked at room at 17th floor with twin beds and it was quite spacious. However, there was no minibar in the room. It had an ironing facility & a locker thou. The bathroom size is also ok. The rooms are comfortable but not very modern which does not makes much difference as in a city like New York , you only come to the hotel to sleep at night. 
Overall, it was a good experience , not v noisy like Times Square Sheraton . I would definitely stay here again.

title: Pleasant Stay
text:
Pros
1. Location - I chose this hotel primarily for the location (easy access to Soho, Tribeca, Chinatown). Soho is my favorite neighborhood in New York for the high density of great shopping and food and the easy walkability, and this hotel is in an excellent location for exploring Soho.
2. Comfort - The rooms are comfortable and cozy. Bed was a king size (sometimes New York hotels will default to a queen) and the room was clean. Blanket was a little thin but it was adequate.
3. Good service - Staff was pleasant.

Cons
1. The entrance, lobby, hallway areas aren't the chicest in the four-star range. It's fine, but not great.

Overall an affordable, comfortable stay with a great location!

title: Melhor Ficar em Uptown e pegar Taxi
text:
Escolhi o hotel pela proximidade de downtown para uma reunião.
O local do hotel é muito movimentado e chegar de carro fica ruim.
O hotel é muito antigo, com muitos carpetes, um terror para quem tem alergia.
Os quartos são velhos e muito barulhentos, sem tratamento de som adequado.

Não vale a pena!

title: Decent if price is right
text:
Location isn't fantastic as it's right off Canal Street in Chinatown. Very noisy unless you're on a high floor.

Room was okay in size and comfortable / clean.

No real dining on site, though they have a breakfast buffet in the AM.

Staff was friendly but definitely not close to a full service Sheraton.

title: Enjoyable and Affordable Stay, Great Location
text: This was my first stay at the Sheraton Tribeca and I found it to be a quality experience.  It's well located near main subway lines, walkable to great food options and close to the Holland Tunnel for travel to NJ. The club lounge on the 21st floor had limited but good breakfast items, nice views, and space to work.  The restaurant in the lobby is on the smaller side, but my steak was good and the staff was courteous.

title: Boa localização, boas instalações, mas tivemos problemas
text:
O Hotel é bom, bem localizado, a cama é ótima, mas sentimos falta de um frigobar.
O hotel recebe encomendas, o q é um ponto positivo. 
Mas ficamos mais de 1 dia inteiro sem água quente, no inverno congelante de NYC, o q foi péssimo e causou alguns transtornos. Ligamos p o Serviço e a atendente não pareceu interessada, não ofereceu nada p compensar, apenas disse p aguardarmos 20 min, mas passou uma noite inteira e agora pela manhã a água não está quente o suficiente.

title: Convenient to Subway with a great lounge benefit
text:
I selected this hotel because of the very reasonable price and location to several subway lines.  I arrived several hours before check in and the front desk took care of checking me in (room was not ready though) and storing my luggage (no charge - did tip when I picked them up).  I am a Marriott Bonvoy member do they upgraded my room to include Lounge access (complimentary breakfast, snacks, coffee, waters and soft drinks).  

The room I stayed in on the 15th floor had a decent rooftop view looking east. Decent sized room (for NYC) with a queen bed, desk (with desk chair) and restroom.  Bed was comfortable and you are able to open the window a few inches which is nice.  The heat/air worked great.  I left the fan on high to drown out some of the hallway noise.  I will say that my room was near the bank of elevators so I did hear lots of loud conversations while others waited for access to them. The windows did a good job keeping outside noise out as you could hear a tremendous difference when you opened them.

Lots of shopping in nearby Soho too - just a couple minutes walk away.

Several subway lines were within a block or two that would get you to most places in a short time.  I flew into LGA and it was about 55 minutes from getting in the MTA system.  

The lounge breakfast was simple with eggs, sausage, pastries, breads, yogurts and juices.  It was a great treat if you are trying to save a few dollars on a meal to get your day started.  

Happy Hour - this was a very nice treat that I didn’t expect.  During my stay (Saturday-Tuesday) from 5-7 each evening there was a FREE Happy our in the Club Lounge in the 21st floor.  A few wine options, a few beer options and light snacks.  I had a few beers each night (prior to going out for dinner) and simply tipped the gentleman that served us.  Other places I ate charged $7-$10 for beer so this was a crazy good deal.  It was busy each night with little room to sit.  There is a rooftop area with additional seats and nice views but the temperatures were a bit chilly during my visit to linger outside.

You should consider upgrading to Club access if a free happy hour, free breakfast and drinks excite you.  I think if you have two in your group that could easily add a significant value to the room at the Sheraton Tribeca.

Checkout was noon and the desk was happy to store luggage if you wanted to explore and come back later to retrieve the luggage.

title: Rude staff, dirty cold water in he room
text: Very rude staff, can not handle any problems decently, no empathy at all, when I complained in the morning about a dirt  brown water coming from the sink and shower, front desk said it’s a city pipe issue sorry just wait, no shower, brush teerh with mineral water. Later at night got to hotel, then no hot water, front desk rude again can do nothing just wait, should offer to move us to a hotel with decent water. That means no shower again,  just go some place else to get a hot clean water shower with friendly staff.

title: Unacceptable Marriott establishment
text:
Great location, comfy bed. Unfortunately these are the only positive things I can say about this establishment. Upon checking in, I was not greeted and had to ask to check in. The lady had some serious attitude despite my reservation being incorrect on Sheraton's behalf (I had called to make this reservation). Two rooms were booked when I specifically asked for one room to be booked. This same disturbed lady made it seem like it was my fault for this mistake and said they will have to late cancel this room for a fee, but since I have "status" they waived the fee. No apologies were made. Unacceptable. 

I ordered a bottle of champagne for the room and when it was delivered it was room temperature. I asked the delivery lady if I could have a chilled bottle and she said she would "check". She did end up delivering a chilled bottle, however I had a hard time paying the already included 20% gratuity when there was no attention to detail. 

The morning of checkout I had a knock at the door and it was someone "just checking to see if our room was still occupied" at 10:00 am. Checkout is 12. 

After already being irritated at my stay, I again asked the front desk to check out. The lady just looked at me waiting for me to speak. There was no greeting, she did not acknowledge my request, but just looked at me like I was bothering her. So I just rattled off all of my info because I didn't know what she needed. 

These all might seem like small complaints, however for this Hotel to be considered a Marriott property, is unacceptable. Being a lifetime Gold member I have definitely had enough stays to be able to compare. I choose to stay at Marriott properties because of the great service and overall great experience, but sadly I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NY. With all of the hotels in NYC and competition, a friendly greeting and professionalism at the concierge desk would greatly improve guest's experience.

title: Thank you to Carols (bell)
text:
Carlos did a great job and deserves a 5 for finding a prefect sushi restaurant for dinner.  He spent the time to figure out what I needed for my dinner event and something close enough that I wasn’t traveling for hours.  He also arranged my very early airport ride which is great as Uber is having difficulties finding the hotel.

Why the hotel did not get a 5 is they spent money on a remodel and the tv is still on a twisty desk stand??  It is 2019 they make movable wall mounts and who wants a tv on the side of the bed just saying it takes up desk space and is in a stupid location which is not easily seen from the bed.

title: NYU Visit
text:
The location of this hotel is great for parents visiting for NYU. We stayed on the concierge lounge level which gave us access to breakfast and later in the day, snacks and appetizers. The rooftop patio is fabulous! The views are amazing.
The room was clean but the mattresses are ready for replacement.  We felt safe walking around the area at night due largely in part to the police precinct located steps away. We ended up eating offsite for dinner as the dining room at the hotel was closed when we arrived at 8 PM on Sunday night. 
The hotel did not offer anything unique in the way of customer service or experience. Sadly, I’m not sure that I would stay again.

title: I’ve stayed at better hotels in the city
text: Besides the bartender, Chantelle, this hotel is the least desirable. We requested a king room with a city view and the room was just queen bed with a view of a water tower which was a total disappointment. (I get it, you don’t stay in the city to be in the room, but we had to pay extra for this amenity.) Anyways, the sheets on the mattress was stripping off after the first night. The valet is great, the gentlemen constantly greeting people, great. The lady who checked us in did a great job finding us a horrible room. Not only that, our stay came with breakfast because I booked through my cc, she didn’t even give us details on it. There was not even a menu or room service offered at this hotel... Strange compared to other options in the city. Chantelle, the bartender is the only thing this place has going for them... She was sweet, personable & deserves a promotion. Btw, the street noise was heard all night, even though we were on the 11th floor. I booked this place months in advance via Chase... Come on...

title: Front desk ruined it
text: When I came in to stay with a friend the front desk agent that checked us in was very unprofessional and spoke to us like she was bothered to check us in. I thought her attitude might change through the check in process, no. The night staff, however, were well polished and polite, this was the night of 2/10/19. The housemen that brought up the amenities I requested was very kind. When I checked out I saw the bellman almost karate chop a guest for tapping his shoulder, it was funny but a little exaggerated at the same time. I really loved the bathroom amenities and the bed was comfortable. Work on professionalism for you staff a check-in can either make or break a stay.

title: There are many hotel choices in NYC - pass on the Sheraton Tribeca
text: I booked 2 rooms for 7 days in Feb '19 at the Sheraton Tribeca. From the moment we checked in it was apparent that this SPG hotel was substandard. Adjoining rooms were not available even though I booked these 2 rooms months in advance. Excuses were many and I was never given an option other than we had rooms ‘near’ each other. (I did ask for a suite that could accommodate 4 adults but was told they were all booked) My reservation confirmation clearly said extra towels and feather pillows. When we saw these requests were not provided, we called the front desk only to be told "no you did not request that" even though it is clearly on my reservation! Additional supplies were delivered but short 1 pillow and we were told the extra pillow would be up soon - never saw it in 7 days!! After that day we were never provided extra towels either. The elevator hallway at the lobby level is very dark and has illegal light level. We told the front desk and we were told that this is Marriott standard. It was under 10% and one of my guests is an architect who knows the regs! It was increased for a few days but lowered again later in the week. Elevators require a key to access floors and we noticed that many people had issues with their key cards allowing them floor access – we had the same issue intermittently over the 7 days.  In one room (1907) we had various disappointments - one day no toilet paper another no Kleenex another no bath mat. We had a plastic drinking cup on the floor for 4 days - we left it there to see if the cleaners ever really looked. The hair on the bathroom floor (which was ours due to hair washing and drying) was never swept up. Beds were always poorly made with linens lumpy looking and bed skirts caught up in the sheets. Breakfast in the lobby on Saturday 9 Feb was cold because the Sterno pots were not lit. The waiter ,when told, quickly took off to find a way to light them and came to us to say they must have just gone out. I had already taken a picture and surprise there were no Sterno pots!This is a big health issue - needless to say we ate bread products and stayed away from the "hot" foods. The website says it has airport shuttle - well that is not true however the front desk will call a cab or limo service. I said I could do that myself. Our second room 1906 was extremely small and suffered similar issues. I am an SPG Platinum Premier Elite with Ambassador member. I obviously travel a lot. And have many SPG nights in the cities where their hotels align with my needs. I travel globally. I can say without reservation that this hotel (which is a franchise to Ascott Reit) is very poorly run and the staff under trained. Sheraton and now Marriott are allowing this franchise to diminish their brand. All a hotel can offer, after a bed to sleep in, is SERVICE. Not everything can be perfect all the time however staff can respond to issues in a way that underscores that quality and service are job ONE. This hotel is just OK - nothing special, just an older and dated facility with staff that are not engaged or excited about working there. The club floor food is very poor (try the Hyatt Grand Central for a good Club Level experience) The staff we met over 7 days did not even try to enhance our stay. My Ambassador did try to connect with me by phone 2 times but I choose not to call back because this was a problem too big to be fixed by one call from Corporate. So bottom line is I will not be back to this location and I will return to the Hyatt Grand Central as my NYC hotel. SOHO was great and a nice change from Midtown but like hotel rooms in NYC there are also many cabs in NYC. Next time I will pay for cabs to SOHO and stay in a hotel that will offer superior service to their valued members.

title: Atendimento péssimo e muito barulho nos quaryos
text:
Passaram 2 vezes a tarifa no meu cartão e mais uma no do meu marido! Fui reclamar e mandaram eu esperar o estorno!
O quarto do lado fazia festa de noite! Impossível dormir!
Decepção com um hotel deste nível

title: A great find visiting Soho
text: I was visiting a family member and needed a place to stay. Was very pleasantly surprised by how nice this hotel was - clean and comfortable, very friendly staff and with a nice little gym and a cute bar on the first floor.  The king size bed was clean and comfortable tho the room was on the small side, it was all we needed and just fine with bit of city view. We will return. Great value!

title: Best hotel
text: Came to New York for a friends birthday and it was also mine and my partners first time.  This hotel was so amazing and everyone was so sweet and professional and went out of our way to make sure we were OK if we ever need anything. We will definitely be coming back to New York and will only stay here.

title: Pleasant Stay
text: I appreciated being recognized as a Marriott Platinum Elite at check in.  The desk agent struggled to get me an upgraded room.  My first room was so small, there was barely room to walk around the bed.  After going back down I was offered a handicapped room, which I took.  It was sufficiently larger than the first room.  The bed was very clean and comfortable  I was given breakfast in the restaurant as well as lounge access.  I would recommend the lounge breakfast over the restaurant.  The lounge breakfast was not just a continental breakfast as I was told, but also included hot food.  The restaurant food wasn't great, and the buffet was quite sad looking.  Service was lackluster the two times I was there.  The service at the lounge was much more welcoming than the restaurant.

title: Best service I have ever received!
text: My friends and I were coming to this hotel for our friends birthday. A member of the bell team, Raul came to our room and let us go up to the 21st floor and take pictures with all our friends. Amazing hospitality and would definitely recommend for the future!!!!! BEST TIME EVER

title: Great location, friendly staff
text:
Stayed overnight for 24 hrs just to get away. Was upgraded to an Empire State Building view. You can walk Chinatown and Little Italy from the hotel. 

Value for money: Excellent! I paid $116 all-in. The kind front desk person (Jennifer) was so kind and gave me a drink ticket per my SPG status. 

Cleanliness: Perfect! Housekeeping is really top-notch. 

Other tips: It’s just a few blocks from the Canal street subway stop. There’s an Italian restaurant in the lobby but with so much good food within blocks I did not try it. The toiletries were just ok. Two free bottles of water were in the room.

title: City Trip to NYC
text:
The location of the hotel is perfect - between Soho and Tribeca with all the trendy shops and restaurants in walking distance. The Canal Street subway station is only 100 meters away.
Clean and spacey rooms, friendly staff, free wifi - everything was perfect.

title: Most recent visit Sunday, January 13, 2019
text: On this particular visit I checked in early and was told that my upgrade was not ready by the very welcoming Front Desk Associate Precious.  She told me that I should check in the mid-afternoon to make the switch.  The room I was assigned, 1212, suited my purposes.  So I made no call to the Front Desk.  However one of the other FDA, Carlos, made many calls to my room to let me know that the room was available for the switch.  I was either out of my room or was sleeping very soundly in the very comfortable in Room 1212.  I just wanted to rely how the above two Associates go out of their way to make sure that guests staying at the Sheraton Tribeca New York Hotel get the best service ever.  This is why this remains my hotel of choice when staying in New York City

title: Great location. Great value, given proximity to all that Tribeca and Soho have to offer.
text: Friendly and helpful staff. Good soundproofing, important in NYC. Again, blocks from all that lower Manhattan has to offer - shopping, restaurants. Clean. Have stayed 3 or 4 times and will do so again! The club lounge has great views, hearty breakfast, and nice outdoor patio, though we didn't go outside in January! Probably fantastic in the summer.

title: Deon is so helpful
text: You need to ask for the Club level. It’s so very worth the few extra bucks! Deon is so helpful. I would recommend, the Club level. The front fest is very helpful and attentive! You couldn’t ask for better guest services, from tooth brushes, to blankets. They are on the spot!

title: Great quick stay
text: The lounge was one of the better ones I've ever been to as a SPG Platinum.  It was really really really solid.  The hotel was located in a solid spot, was clean, and exactly what you are looking for in a sheraton! The customer service was really strong despite having a small blip in the radar. I was only here for about 8 hours with a layover from EWR

title: Very cool place.. enjoyed the club lounge especially!
text: We enjoyed this hotel very much! the club lounge is just beautiful. It has a rooftop seating area that has incredible views of the city! We were moving our daughter into her apartment there and this was a great place to hang out for a snack and a glass of wine every day after the heavy lifting! This will be our new go-to place when we visit. Well done!

title: Hotel hospitaleiro
text:
Hotel muito bom. 
Situado num bairro bem legal proximo de grandes lojas. Facil acesso ao metro.
Dormitorios excelentes. Bar/lounge acolhedor. excelente jantar. 
Banheiros muito bons. Faltou cozinha para pequenas refeições.
excelente atendimento de recepcao.

title: Passagem de ano NYC
text:
A limpeza dos quartos deixa a desejar... tal como o tamanho dos mesmos. Tivemos que pedir uma manta extra pelo frio, mesmo com o ar condicionado no máximo... e não estava a nevar...
As pessoas afáveis, restaurante agradável e saboroso mas demora demasiado tempo após o pedido...
Não solicitar o pequeno almoço do hotel. É demasiado caro e ao lado existem 3 lojas que vendem todo o tipo de opção para pequeno almoço muito mais acessível.

title: ESPECTACULAR
text:
Íbamos de viaje de Navidad y nos hicieron un "upgrade" de habitación. La manager de la recepción del hotel me atendió de una manera fabulosa  al igual que el resto de las chic@s , lo cual agradecimos mucho. 
La habitación de la planta 19 disponía de unas vistas increíbles y lo mismo en la zona de desayuno de la planta 21. 
Accesos muy cercanos a 3 lineas principales de metro. 
Sin duda que lo recomiendo y no pensaría 2 veces en volver a alojarme de nuevo.

title: Regular
text: Hotel algo descuidado para ser un 4 de sheraton. Habitaciones pequeñas, con un armario diminuto  y un baño que deja mucho que desear. El servicio joven y agradable. Hoy han olvidado hacer la habitación.  Si la habitación da a la calle de correos es ruidosa.

title: Friendly and fabulous
text:
We are 8 nights into a 12 night stay and I love it here. The staff we have dealt with are great (thanks Sal for your excellent welcome and your continued smile whenever we see you and to Deon in the lounge just fabulous) 
Its comfortable, clean and friendly here, on level 20 so have a great view (I know not everyone will have that - but its worth it). Yes the club lounge can get crowded (I am sure in summer when you can sit in the large outdoor area it is quite different) but we have never not gotten a hot breakfast and plenty of coffee. The amenities are good, we only like house keeping every second day, but have never failed to have a call in the early evening to check if we needed anything. Love the location, easy access to trains, entertaining locals and food everywhere. Some people seem to have either not researched or be expecting 6 star facilities in a 4 star hotel. Get a grip people - the Sheraton Tribeca is fabulous for the price, I am travelling with my partner at the moment but it is somewhere I would happily stay by myself (so I feel safe here) .  The staff wish us a great day when we go out (whilst checking if we need anything) and always have a welcome back when we come in - its so welcoming.
Keep up the great work guys, would come back any time I visit NY xx

title: Hele goede ervaring
text:
5 nachten in dit hotel verbleven.

Kamer: Nette kamer met een comfortabel bed. Kamer is wel wat compact, wat onhandig kan zijn als je veel bagage bij je hebt. Badkamer heeft een fijne inloopdouche. Alles was keurig schoon, schoonmaak kwam dagelijks.

Grote kluis op de kamer aanwezig. We hadden gekozen voor een clubkamer (21e etage) waardoor we toegang hadden tot de lounge. Dagelijks is er een redelijk ontbijt beschikbaar (yoghurt was er helaas alleen de eerste 2 dagen) en gedurende de hele dag is er koffie/thee/frisdrank en snacks (chips/koekjes) beschikbaar. Tijdens het dagelijkse happy hour zijn er uitgebreidere snacks en ook bier en wijn verkrijgbaar. Alles is de lounge is gratis, een fooi wordt echter wel op prijs gesteld bij de happy hour. Vanuit het dakterras bij de lounge ook mooi uitzicht over de stad!

Ligging: Metrostation Lispenard Street ligt letterlijk om de hoek. Ook lopend ben je snel op Broadway of omgeving van WTC. Top!

WiFi: Werkte uitstekend.

Al met al een uitstekend verblijf gehad en zou hier bij een volgende trip naar New York zeker weer willen verblijven.

title: Lovely stay for me and my fur babies!
text:
Clean and comfy rooms with friendly and accommodating staff! Very nice ambiance and one of the nicest hotels that are pet friendly in NYC. It was hard trying to find a nice hotel that was not super strict with their pet policy (most were 1 dog max under 15lbs or cost up to $100 extra a night). They did not give a us a hard time at all and even supplied us with extra blankets.

The hotel is in a great location surrounded by cute restaurants and wine bars. Just a couple minutes from several subway stops as well.

Overall, excellent experience and I’d definitely stay here on my next trip to NYC. Thanks for making me and my fur babies comfortable for the holidays!

title: Exceptional service
text:
I had an amazing stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. Upon arrival, I was immediately greeted by Prescious and Sal. Their warm greetings, stellar customer service, knowledge, and efficiency made my stay exceptional! Because of them, I look forward to staying at the Sheraton Tribeca during my business travel to NYC.

Amazing job Precious & Sal!

title: What a fantastic hotel
text:
So, I’m writing this review as we are actually here at the hotel and I have to say that I didn’t expect much before we arrived however the hotel and staff has been fantastic.

As I’m travelling with my family including children there are some very basic needs that we have and so far nothing has been too difficult to deal with for the staff from helping us ordering food to changing rooms for us to something with a nice view.

5 stars from our family.

Thank you to all staff at Sheraton Tribeca.

title: Only Ok
text:
The location is handy enough with relatively easy access to subway, Short walk to Chinatown and across the road into Soho, but Canal street itself is not amazing, quite a lot of touts and a lot of loiterers along the street, definitely not the best street in New York.  Also not near any of the tourist spots even though not hard to get to them on subway.  Hotel itself is only just ok, beds are good enough, rooms are small servicing is a bit hit and miss with team and coffee and sugar etc not reliably replaced every day.  No fridge in room, although they will bring one of you request.  Lifts get crammed in the morning and trying to use the stairs is a nightmare and I discovered the bottom one of the fire exits is stacked with supplies, a huge hazard if there was a fire.  When I pointed this out to a front desk staff member I was told that I shouldn’t have been down there, when I told her that wasn’t the point and that they should clear it out or get a FDNY Report she sarcastically told me to have a nice day.  NOT ACCEPTABLE at all.

Overall I would suggest there are likely to be better options and I would have expected better from a Sheraton brand, they seem to have slipped a lot.

title: Great Location & Comfortable
text: I was pleasantly surprised at how comfortable this hotel was. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and the rooms were sensibly laid out. I always prefer a glass shower over the shower/tub combo and this hotel had a nice shower. The views from the lounge were amazing. The hotel is in a nice area that has less tourists than many parts of NYC. There were many nice dining options walking distance from the hotel. I would stay here again.

title: It has been a pleasant stay.
text: This hotel is very near the business district and is very easy to get around from. The entire hotel and room was very clean and is what you would expect from a Sheraton brand hotel. You really won't need to get hotel breakfast anymore because you can just walk outside and enjoy famous New York City delights like bagels and pizza and all other really good food.

title: Useful location
text: Average hotel standard expected of a Sheraton brand but disappointed at facilities.Lobby area small and can get congested. Breakfast expensive and limited selection. Bedroom comfortable and staff helpful especially when requested late checkout.

title: Outstanding in every respect
text: We stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca New York four nights in early December 2018. As for the hotels location I can’t imagine being in a better position, 2 MTA subways within a couple of minutes walk which made it so easy to get around and virtually every major attraction was accessible ueasily within a short time. lots of local eateries, 15-20 walk to the World Trade Center and the 911 Memorial. As for the hotel itself it was a pleasure to stay in such a lovely, clean and well presented hotel and the views are great, especially the view from the club room, that is what dreams are made of. I would like to take this opportunity to complement the club room staff in particular Deon in the evening his local knowledge,  caring and friendly disposition, attentive service and good humor made the evenings we spent there an absolute delight. He must surely be one of the hotels greatest attributes. Thanks to all the staff for helping to make our New York visit such a wonderful experience. I couldn’t recommend this hotel more. Best regards Peter D Brisbane Australia.

title: Low Mediocre Hotel
text:
The Pros
-Location convenient for where I needed to be for work 
-Bed was comfortable 

The Cons
-Room service run by a third party. Tried to pre-order breakfast in the morning but the order never came. Called room service to ask the status and the girl who answered had difficulty understanding what I needed. She came up to the room to try to resolve the matter but still did not seem to understand. Was a strange situation. Ultimately, had to cancel breakfast all together. Hotel tried to offer free coffee but was in a rush at that point. 

-Hotel bill charges were very confusing to understand and even after calling did not understand at all what they charged

Will not stay here again. Not worth the nuisances especially for work travel when things must run smoothly

title: Noisy A/C that comes on every 5 minutes, dirty fitted sheet, USD 550 per night
text: Convenient location but several issues: 1. Could not locate my reservation, despite me providing the reservation number and it shows in the app (waited 20 minutes and was late for meeting), 2. A/C comes on (heat) every 4-5 minutes and is deafening, 3. Bed sheet not clean, major stains and 4. $550 per night for all this.... Not my first choice in Manhattan and I would recommend to look for a better rate - I had to book on short notice.

title: Clean and Comfy
text: We stayed here for a few nights in late August 2018 when moving our kid into her NYC dorm. We arrived at 10pm with 2 cars packed to the hilt with her stuff to move into college. The valet parking was awesome, and the hotel employees were fantastic with taking everything out of our back seats and up to our room. (I did not want to leave items in the back seat overnight for fear the car would be broken into in the parking garage.) Again the staff was awesome with helping to bring all that stuff back from our room to the car out front the next day. The hotel was very busy and I could see that many other families were accomplishing the same task with their kid. The room was clean, and the beds were awesome. There is no negative thing I can state about this hotel except that we were unable to get the in-room  mini-fridge I requested in our reservation, to store insulin, but an ice maker was on our floor and we brought a mini cooler- so it turned out okay

title: Do NOT stay here!!!! Scam!!!!
text: I recently had a stay booked and prior to my arrival the day before, I received a text saying my card was authorized for a random amount by the hotel that did not match my reservation confirmation. I did not book an advanced purchase rate so I was puzzled as to why my card had been authorized when I wasn't scheduled to arrive until the next day. I called the hotel and spoke to someone named "Sal" who reported that no matter what rate you book, it is the hotel's policy to authorize 1 night stay prior to arrival. This is mentioned no where on their website nor in my confirmation email. He was very rude and kept repeating that this is their policy when I informed him it was not okay as this was not mentioned to me at all nor on their site / confirnation. I later learned this was a lie. I asked to speak with a manager and he said he was the manger. I also later learned he had lied again. He was not helpful at all and told me to take up my issue with corporate. I called Marriott and the lady said this policy is incorrect and no where did she see this policy nor was it in my conformation. She escalated this to her manager as she wanted an investigation into this "made up" policy and apologized for the unacceptable charge / error. We didn't even know what the total amount unauthorized was for because there is no invoice or confirmation stating the random amount he charged my card. The next day upon check in, my card was charged AGAIN for the 1 night but this time the amount matched what was on my confirmation!!!! I was only paying for 1 night but because my card was charged twice, I spent over 900 for a mediocre hotel room. If my card had not been authorized without my consent the day before, I would not have had double charges on my credit card. They are completely unprofessionally and it's a scam. The quality of the hotel is equivalent to a 2 star hotel , not 4 star and for the headache of scamming your credit card, it's best to stay elsewhere. I will NEVER stay here again and definitely not another Sheraton property ever. Sal doesn't deserve my business and Sheraton TriBeCa is not worth it if this is the low level of professionalism I must deal with before, during, and after vacation. There are better quality hotels with much better customer service around the corner.

title: Bien ubicado
text:
Me parece que le falta algo para poder ser muy bueno en relacion precio y beneficio. 
A veces tardaban mucho en limpiar los cuartos y jamas me respondieron en el room service con lo cual, la noche que llegue exhausta, tuve que salir a comprar algo para comer y me hubiera quedado feliz duchada en el cuarto descansando

title: Hmm welllllll ok
text: So torn on this place.  Area out front is rough & trashy, though inside super elegant and nice.  It’s a bigger hotel for the area though standard rooms are typical NYC & tiny with abt a foot between walls/bed/counter- no drawers.  Staff is super nice.  I had room preferences on my account t and booking request to not be near the elevators that apparently didn’t transfer as when I checked in I was a foot off the elevators.  Went down and asked for that to be fixed and specifically requested “the quietest room you can give me” - - moved away from elevators promptly- yay!  seemed great where they put me but in the morning there was a shrill screeching sound every 45 seconds from abt 5:45 am to 11 am when I left for the day. So maybe water-Pipe related?? Unbelievably loud!  Room cleaning was weird as a cup of water with coffee ground was left out and 1/2 toiletries weren’t refilled. Otherwise bed was comfy... just lots of other stuff off

title: Great location, not the best Sheraton I’ve stayed in’
text:
Check in staff were not as friendly as all the other places we traveled around the U.S. We had to ask all the questions about the Club privileges or about getting a map of the area. We booked a twin room on the club level which comes with privileges (breakfast & happy hour). There were too many people booked in club rooms and the actual refreshment/breakfast room does not cater for the amount of people. We only had breakfast on the first 2 days then couldn’t be bothered waiting for a seat or for the food to be refilled preferring to eat out. If a basic room with no breakfast was available at a cheaper price it would have been more worth it. Happy hour in the afternoon was the biggest disappointment with a couple of bowls of corn chips some dips and carrot sticks. Having these privileges at other hotels I’ve stayed at, this was pretty embarrassing we only attended once.
I would stay in the area again but probably not here.
Room was a little outdated but quite spacious by NY Standards.

The location was great. Close to Soho shopping, Little Italy & Chinatown.
Subway was close, area felt safe. Great rooftop with amazing views.

title: Good location and lounge - staff could use more training.
text: Marriott Platinum Premier.  In NYC for Thanksgiving.  Had booked the rooms because of location was a bit wary due to some of the reviews.  However the rooms were clean and spacious and the lounge was good as well.  The one thing could use improvements is the staff interactions.  I had booked multiple rooms under my mine and others names and called the Marriott reservations number and the actual hotel to make sure that we were good to go but when they arrived earlier than I did they were told they couldn't check in until I arrived - has never been a problem at other Marriott properties.  Finally, when I checked out I was double charged for the rooms during my stay which the GM fixed after I had to follow up with them.  Long story short - you'll be in a good location with clean rooms, but might have to deal with some hurdles due to the staff.

title: Solid, reliable choice
text: If you have business or pleasure in TriBeCa this is a good option. A solid, reliable choice with no frills but one that does the basics well. There is not much at the hotel apart from the room, but the room is done well with a super comfortable bed, big shower and (in my case only maybe) an amazing view of the NYC skyline. The staff were efficient and friendly. Recommended as a no frills solid choice in this area.

title: Muy buen hotel.
text:
El hotel está ubicado en el límite de los barrios Soho y Tribeca. Tiene líneas de metro a una cuadra para ambos lados y la ubicación es buena. La calle en la que está el hotel es bastante fea y más de noche. Nunca tuvimos ningún problema, pero no es la calle más linda de NY. 
El hotel es muy bonito, la habitación espaciosa y la cama muy cómoda. El baño parece estar nuevo.
La habitación tiene caja fuerte pero no tiene frigobar. En cada piso hay una bending machine y una máquina de hielo.
En la recepción fueron siempre muy amables pero solo hablan inglés. 
Tiene un buen servicio de recepción de paquetes si uno desea comprar algo y enviarlo al hotel. 
Este hotel es una buena opción.

title: DISAPPOINTING STAY
text:
My friend and I stayed at Sheraton Tribeca 2nd visit and she is a SPG member. I had better experience on my 1st visit in 2015. Stayed 15 to 17 Nov and again 21-28 Nov. I do not recall small rooms in Sheraton and was surprised how small, dark the room was. There were little bathroom amenities - tiny bottles, tiny soap and plastic disposal plastic cups! Where is the environment friendly, save the earth program under Marriott or Starwood?
If you have plans to store luggage more than 24 hours, be prepared that only Sheraton Tribeca policies - not allowed. Its because of Security reasons but more so because they do not have space to store. Storage of luggage only for early checkin and after you checked out but on a late flight.
Our return on 21 Nov, front desk informed they notice we stay a week and is giving us a larger room! That was nice if only it is true. It was no different from the room we stayed on 15th Nov. There were no bedroom slippers and no luggage stand. We only received it after 3 reminder calls & 3 hours later.
The only reason to return to Sheraton Tribeca due to low rates and location.

ps. This is subjective - we hate the mattress. Too soft caused bodyache & terrible pillows. Regretfully we should have asked for better pillows.

title: Sheraton Tribeca - Great Hotel, Great Location!
text: We stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for the Thanksgiving holiday and it was excellent. The rooms are very spacious for NYC. They were well appointed and very clean.The location is perfect for getting around Soho, Tribeca and the West Village. Lots of delicious restaurants, beautiful parks  and plenty of shops in the area. The staff at the hotel was very helpful and accommodating. We will be back!!

title: Just okay
text: Room size was decent for NYC (still small) but we weren’t crazy for the location. Hotel was clean and staff nice. Not likely a place we’d return though. We ate in the lobby restaurant (dessert) and they staff was attentive.

title: Great Hotel and Great Value
text:
Rooms are clean and bigger than other Manhattan hotels in my past experience.  Staff is friendly and extremely accommodating.  

Good location with decent restaurants within walking distance.  Would stay again

title: Good Area Option
text: Good option if you want a base for shopping in the area.  Rooms are small, excellent executive lounge w/great terrace and open view of Statue of Liberty, good service from front desk personnel... friendly and aim to please.  Lots of top restaurants within a short walk or ride.  They offer some great rates at times that are very tempting.  I'll be back.

title: Very friendly Staff
text:
