Genesis, the lady who welcomed me at the reception on my check-in, has been super sweet, kind and accommodating. I'm really grateful for the positive experience and comfortable stay I had at this hotel. 
The room was spacious, cosy and with a great view.
Thank you!

title: Always welcoming
text:
I mean, we're only halfway across Canal street with our bags and David the doorman meets us in the middle of the street to welcome us back to the hotel!  Amazing how many folks there recognize us based on just 4 or 5 visits/year.

Usually they have a room ready for us when we arrive (we're always quite early, before 11am), but not this time.  Ah well, they stored our bags while we explored the city and we came back to a quiet room with a nice view of the Hudson.

Hotel is very well located for the subway (3 minute walk to the A/C/E) and great walking streets all over TriBeCa and SoHo.

title: A very good value
text: I would very certainly not rate the hotel among the best I have stayed at. The rooms are comfortable but not sensational. The staff on the other hand were very friendly. The front desk, baggage assistance and service at breakfast was exceptional. I wanted to especially recognize Ben who was our waiter on two days. The concierge lounge was subpar. The hotel is far from The theater district but an easy subway ride. The hotel rates on the other hand were only half as much as in the theater district and the hotel sometimes advertises specials even cheaper than that.

title: Lovely stay
text: We stayed here for 3 nights on a trip to New York. This was a trip for my partners 30th birthday. The hotel recognised this and made our trip really special. The location is perfect and away from all the tourist traps but also walking distance to many attractions such as the highline Park, world trade centre and Brooklyn bridge. The rooms are clean and we were lucky to have a breathtaking view of the Empire State Building. The hotel is next to the canal street subway station too. I would recommend this hotel!

title: Nice Hotel
text: I have never been to New York before and I did not pay for this hotel. I cannot write about if this is a good deal or not. I thought the staff was very courteous. They allowed me to check-in early. The beds were comfy but the area is very noisy. Short walk to 9/11 Memorial.

title: Frustrated!
text: We stayed here for 2 nights in Aug 2018. It was one of the worst experiences I had with a hotel. We checked in at 1030 am and stored our luggage. We booked the room in April 2018 and when I checked in they told me they didn’t have the rooms and would upgrade us for free and that our rooms would be ready about 1pm. They weren’t! They then told me by 3pm  We got one room at 5pm and my parents(in their 90’s) still wasn’t ready. They told us they would comp us for dinner that evening in their restaurant and for the first night. They did comp us for dinner but the room still wasn’t ready at 6:15 pm. They didn’t have the room till 7:30 pm. They never refunded our room for that night. I’ve contacted them NUMEROUS times and still nothing from them. I can guarantee I won’t be using a Sheraton again.

title: Great Hotel, Location & Staff
text: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca and found it to be an incredible location, close to all the best shops and restaurants. The staff were incredible prior to my arrival, during my stay, and even while checking out. I had several boxes that had to be shipped home. David & Fery went above and beyond to make sure it happened. Helping me seal them up and they even hand delivered them to FedEx so I knew before I left they were on the way. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC.

title: Treat platinum members well, great service at check-in
text: Great service from all staff the minute you step in the hotel, the staff made you forget that you are in New York City.  Felitta at check-in was very friendly and positive, when I requested for slippers it was delivered to me in ten minutes.  The staff also upgraded me to a top floor with an amazing view due to my status.

title: Visit to NYC
text: Very nice hotel. Long wait for the room to be ready, but front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. Room is clean and nice. Lounge is great, view is fantastic. Very relaxing and staff is friendly.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Great Hotel. I don`t understand any of the negative reviews I have seen.
This is a clean modern hotel and our room was excellent. All the Staff are very friendly and helpful. It is within walking distance of lots of great bars and eating places. There are three subway station nearby so you can get around really easily. 
We had booked a city view room but were given a free upgrade to the club floor with free breakfast ( which was great ), free WIFI  and use of the club lounge with great views over the city from the terrace.
Would definitely stay again.

title: Classy with a view
text: I stayed at the Sheraton tribeca Thursday thru Sunday. My room had an amazing view of the city. My bed and pillows were so comfortable and the black out curtains really helped me ensure quality sleep. Complimentary Starbucks coffee every morning was provided. This hotel was classy and clean and I would recommend staying at this hotel over any other in the tribeca area.

title: AMAZING STAFF
text: Carlos the doorman went Above and beyond for us. We had a flat tire late at night right outside the hotel  and he went out of his way to help us get it fixed and made sure we were okay.  Even though we were not even guests at the hotel that night. So very kind and nice. I definitely recommend this hotel just because of carlos !!! I appreciated his hard work and help.

title: Typisches Hotel in guter Lage
text:
Das Hotel ist in Allem ein typisches New Yorker Hotel. Das bedeutet auch, dasss man in den unteren Etagen eben nur die gegenüber liegende Häuserwand betrachten kann. Es empfiehlt sich, den im Vergleich niedrigen Aufpreis für den Zutritt zur "Club - Lounge" zu zahlen. von der dortigen Dachterrasse hat man einen guten Ausblick Richtung "Empire State". (21. Etage) Dazu kommt die Bewirtung mit Frühstück und diversen Snacks sowie die Getränke alles incl. !!! Wer sich schon mal in New York selbst mit Essen und Getränken versorgen musste, wird dies zu schätzen wissen!!!
Die Lage erlaubt es sich in Manhatten fußläufig so gut wie Alles anzusehen. Auch zur "Brooklin Brigde" sind es gerade mal 20 min. zu Fuß.
Alles in Allem ein empfehlenswertes Hotel.

title: Such a great experience!
text: First time to New York, Nelson probably provided the best experience I could have had. Check in to check out, these guys make you feel platinum no matter what. Doesn't matter when, I'll definitely be back every time I'm in NYC!

title: Great customer service
text: Sheraton Tribeca’s employees go above and beyond to accommodate their guests and make their stay memorable.  Thanks to the entire club level staff, front desk staff and bell staff. Special shout out to Sal (front desk), Nelson (front desk),  Raul (bell man), Steven (club level) and the gentleman who worked club level on October 13 and October 14 evenings.

title: Great location and friendly service
text:
From the moment on check-in I was gteated quite warmly by Kaylene.  Paid for a Club Room which has access to the lounge for drinks and snacks where the staff go out of thwir way to ensure you have everything you need.
Location is my favorite thing.  The area has so much character and brilliant restaurants and among Italian and Chinese districts.  As I like to walk and explore this made trips to Central Park and Times Square a brilliant hike.
Rooms are a bit dated but very clean.  One item to note were the room descriptions on the website showed a room fridge and even a washer and drier which on asking the front desk was dismissed.
Pay for the club room.  The views from the rooftop patio area are amazing.

title: Pleasant hotel, superb location
text: A pleasant hotel with friendly,helpful staff, The room I had was a corner room on the ninth floor and overlooking the street, but there was no traffic or any  other noise. So enjoyed restful sleep in a very comfortable bed. The hotel is also well located, just five minutes walk from the  nearest metro station, so easy to commute all over this great city from here.

title: Great hotel in Downtown of New York city
text: Great hotel for holiday staying! Friendly prices for this place, only weekends are more expensive. Stuff is friendly and helpfully. Very good restaurant and breakfasts. Calm place in center of New York. Real 4 stars place and very good and clean rooms with spaciously bathrooms. When I will come back to this wonderfull city, Sheraton Tribeca will be my choice again.

title: Fantastic Anniversary Stay
text:
Great service started the second I walked through the door. The woman ( I wish I knew her name) at the front desk greet my husband and I warmly and quickly checked us in.  She acknowledged my status with the brand and made sure we had everything we needed for a great stay.  We choose to spend a little extra for the club floor and are very happy we did. The club is small but nice and the deck makes it all worth it. The staff was always friendly and happy hour was well operated with wine and beer options along with a fantastic selection of snacks.  Club access is 24 hours which is convenient for those times you need a late night bag of chips or a bottle of water.   We also tried the bar at the hotel and found the drinks (Tribeca Beauty to be specific) to be outstanding!  
The location of the hotel is away from Midtown, for someone like me who travels to the city several times a year it was nice to not be in the heart of the hustle and bustle but only a 15-minute subway away from midtown.  Tribeca has some great dining options and the vide is a bit more relaxed than what you get if staying near times square.  I will absolutely be considering this hotel for future stays.

title: Convenient Comfort in Lower Manhattan
text: This hotel is conveniently situated one block from the tube station and within easy walking distance of lower Manhattan sites.  It was easy to catch the train from Newark Airport and connect seamlessly by underground.We arrived early and were invited to wait in the members lounge on the 21st Floor where we had complimentary snacks, juice and coffee.  A magnificent terrace provides stunning views of the Hudson River and surrounds.  They also provided a taxi service to the airport which was efficient and on time.  For a luxury hotel the rooms are still quite basic, but comfortable in every respect.  Friendly staff and efficient service made this stay very pleasurable.

title: New York City
text: This was a nice clean hotel. We had a patio room which I would highly recommend. Very spacious patio in the middle of the city which was awesome. Very close to the subway and easy to get around. The staff was very friendly bell staff were awesome. Always ready to assist with your plans. Breakfast was ok but not that great. Paid for breakfast everyday in advance but only ate their once. food next door was way better.

title: Good business hotel
text: Hotel is well located in the upcoming Tribeca Area. Its walking distance from NYU and many high street shops are at walking distance. Once you enter the high street, it feels that you are away from the madness of NY. Hotel is on a very busy street - it takes a good 10 minutes for any Uber to arrive.

title: Great Location!
text: This hotel is right on Canal St and is in the middle btw Soho, Tribeca, and Chinatown...so it’s very convenient to walk around and find everything you need. The room that I stayed was a little bit small. The bed was comfy. Room was clean. Front desk was very attentive! Overall Nice stay!

title: Awesome...as always
text:
Staff is amazing and I’m always happy and well taken care of. Shout out to Nelson, Sal and deon...and everyone else that makes this a great place to stay. 

This is my home away from home. 
You all rock!

title: Great Hotel in a one of the most interesting neighbourhoods and EXCELLENT customer service!
text: If you love staying off the beaten path of Times Square/Tourist Central, this is a great area to stay and a wonderful hotel.  We found the rates very good, rooms very clean.  Great location with a 24hr deli next door, best NY pizza down the street.  So close to shopping in interesting areas and Subway very close.  Staff was EXCEPTIONAL.  Want to specifically thank Nestor (Front Desk).  Our flight was 6hrs late arriving and we were very tired and hungry at 1AM.  He gave us a free buffet breakfast to use during our stay, showed us where we could go for food at 1am and immediately brought a fridge to our room on request.  Couldn't do enough for us.  Equally as friendly was Carlos (Bellman),  We needed a taxi in the evening to go to a show and he walked down the street to the next intersection and stood on the road to flag down a cab for us.  Over and above if you ask me.  Another day he showed us a great shortcut subway trip to Yankee Stadium.  He couldn't do enough for us and had a wonderful sense of humour.  We think this is the best place to stay if you love the flavour of downtown.

title: Really gone downhill
text: I have stayed here many times over the last 5 years and each time it just seems worse. I think I will have to find a new hotel for my next trip.  It's a shame because the location is really great but on this trip - my a/c didn't work (amont other issues). I asked at the front desk at 2 pm for a/c repair and my missing feather pillows. Upon returning to my room at 11pm - nothing had been done. They sent maintenance, who opened the a/c and rattled some things around and said it was fixed.  Of course - it was not and we sweltered all weekend. I then had to call again for my pillow which I finally got at midnight. I am a lifetime platinum and I know good service from SPG - did not get it here. I am in the Sheraton Brooklyn right now and it's a world of difference - every request attended to immediately, everything in my room works, etc.

title: Very Friendly Staff. Good Club Lounge With Complimentary Wine & Beer.
text:
Very Friendly Staff. Good Club Lounge With Complimentary Wine & Beer.

We stay over night at NYC on our way to Israel. We’ve started at Hotel near Time Square many times in the past and decided to try something different.

The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. We were there very early due to our flight and our rooms weren’t ready. We have 3 Rooms Total in our Traveling Group. One Presidential Suite, one Superior Room and one standard room. Due to my Platinum status, the 2 Rooms were upgrades to Club Level Rooms with Club Lounge Access. The Presidential Suite already comes with Lounge Access. The front desk was able to supply us with temporary key access to the Club Lounge to hang out before our rooms are ready.

We have the Presidential Suite which was very basic in furnishings, would not call it Luxurious by any means. The master bed room have the smallest hanging closet in a hotel that I ever been to!

The Club Lounge is located on the 21th floor, it have a open air rooftop balcony area with fabulous view of the NYC skyline.
Happy Hours is 5:30pm - 7:30pm, Complimentary Snacks and Wine & Beer. Complimentary alcoholic beverages is becoming a rarity in the USA Hotel Club Lounges , Most of them will charge for the Alcoholic beverage. Unlike the Club Lounges in Asia will always have Complimentary Alcoholic Beverage and an extensive spread of delicious food.

Overall. The Rooms are just average Sheraton products.
The Staff are very nice, especially the Bellhop staff Jorge- he was extremely friendly , cheerful and helpful.

title: Great hotel for a NYC stay!
text:
The Sheraton Tribeca is greatly located, has an AMAZING rooftop and the staff is the nicest, especially Felitta who was so welcoming, cheerful and helpful!

Would definitely stay there again during a NYC trip!

title: Apathetic front desk, poor communication, no amenities
text: This hotel has paper-thin walls and from my experience attracts loud, trashy people. This was a sad combination for me. I asked the front desk if the couple in the next room was checking out soon because if they were not I really wanted to move since their screaming all night and into the morning (10:30pm until about 4:00am) was pretty horrible. The front desk clerk lied 3 days in a row saying they were checking out. And every night they were still there rattling doors with their shouting. This hotel lacks very basic amenities such as understanding do not disturb signs, having a mail drop, being able to answer any questions about the area (Information about tours of the city?  Their suggestion was to wander around the Port Authority Bus Station.). If you ask for no housekeeping, rest assured they will call you every day anyway and refuse to give you the star points. I cannot believe this is a Starwood property. I made a Trip Advisor account specifically to warn you NOT to stay here.

title: Very good hotel, great location
text:
Very good quality/price ratio for NYC. 
Clean, fast and reliable elevators, good locations, very close to major subway trains.
Had parcel packages delivered to the hotel address with no problem.
Only downside is the room size, expected a larger room, but then again that’s normal for NY.
Would recommend it if asked.

title: Great service
text: The part we enjoyed the most was the super friendly staff! They always went the extra mile to make our stay there an unforgettable one. Having said that, our room at a residual smoke smell in it which means someone before us didn't respect the rules! It happens!

title: Great location and service!
text: Stayed here in August and was pleasantly surprised in how nice the hotel was considering the low price!  Great location, especially if you're wanting to stay in the Village/Soho area or go over to Brooklyn.

title: Great Customer Service
text: Felitta was a phenomenal woman who was SO welcoming! She went out of her way to make us feel appreciated our entire stay. We enjoyed our visit even more because of her wonderful, bubbly personality! Keep up the great work, Felitta!

title: Carlos (Bell)
text: I NEVER do reviews but Carlos deserved to be mentioned. He went above and beyond for me when I was waiting for my car. I travel a lot and hotel service can be horrible at times, for Carlos that was the complete opposite. Someone at a hotel who makes you feel significant, what a breathe of fresh air. Thank you Carlos for professionalism and making me confident in Sheraton!

title: Excellent for location and price/value
text:
This location cannot be beat for walking all over lower Manhattan. It was clean and decent, the beds and pillows were super comfy, and I'm really picky. It's typical NY small, though they do a great job with furniture that has little storage nooks & crannies. 

The staff at front desk was quite helpful. Housekeeping did an OK job with the room, and I did leave a tip. Despite that, the little extra touches, such as realizing you have one tissue left in the box, went unnoticed. The shower was a challenge. Either too hot or too cool, hard to get the flow temp just right. 

I was not thrilled with the club level lounge for breakfast. It was crowded, not always a place to sit immediately, and the staff seemed a little overwhelmed keeping up with demand.  The roof top terrace was super nice, except it was raining the whole time I was there, so didn't get to use it. Perhaps that is why the interior was so crowded. I did not visit the restaurant/bar, as there were so many wonderful options within walking distance. 

I recommend this hotel if you like using SPG family perks and all, and want to stay in this neighborhood.

title: Great staff and hotel!
text: Shout out to Alexa at the front desk who was amazing at check-in. The club lounge is great with an amazing view and the rooms are spacious very clean and very cozy. Great option while in New York, New York!!!!!

title: Great great and Great !
text: 1st time ever in New York and what a great hotel experience we had at Sheraton Tribeca. Upon arrival in very clean tasteful lobby, all staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and accommodating.  I was extremely pleased with room cleanliness, decor and plush white towels.  The room was well organized and equipped with the right stuff. Housekeeping was exceptional.  We spent 3 nights and wished had time to stay longer.  Bell guy “Carlos” was happy to assist and went the extra mile in satisfying requests. Definitely would recommend to friends and eager to return to newyork and stay at the Sheraton Tribeca again.

title: An old favourite
text: So having stayed elsewhere last year I returned - to what is a usual place for me.  The location is great - yes on Canal street which can be tacky - but close the ACE lines and Little Italy & Chinatown .  Beds are really comfortable though rooms a little light on space - but in terms of $ it offers a really good option. Wifi was free as I am a member of the reward points programme- though friendly check in person didn't seem to know I had stayed 5 times before (so an upgrade would have been nice).

title: The first moments made the trip
text:
Upon entering the hotel,  met Felita at the check-in. She was very welcoming and I instantly felt at home and in a positive mood. She made the trip. As an SPG member I had access to the rooftop clup with its wonderful view of the city. The rooms were quiet and comfortable. The location was perfect steps from Chinatown, Little Italy and the train.

With the welcome i received from Felita, the nice rooms, and wonderful team, is it any wonder that we chose to return to the hotel for our visit next week/

title: Great service
text: Carlos Bell was of the utmost help when we ended up with a flat tire in front of the Sheraton. He is very professional, helpful and knowledgeable! Carlos, went above and beyond, providing excellent service.  Thank you, Carlos!

title: Great Soho location
text: Situated on Canal street, it’s an easy place to start exploring Soho.  There’s lots of restaurants and coffee shops nearby.  Hotel offers a nice size lobby compared to New York standards, as well as a nice breakfast area.  Reception is efficient.  Since my international flights had delays, and I arrived late, I was given vouchers for breakfast as a nice gesture. Room compact as many others in New York but efficiently decorated. There is a safe deposit box. Coffee maker, coffee and bottled water provided, but no refrigerator in room. Comfortable beds and crispy clean brand new towels and bedding.

title: Ok but needs work
text:
The hotel is as one would expect for a Sheraton. 
Found hair in bathroom. Room was otherwise fairly clean and spacious for a NYC hotel. Front desk is disorganized and understaffed. 
The porter named David was a breath of fresh air. Enthusiastic fast and helpful. This guy should really be recognized for his great demeanor.

title: Great stay - staff went the extra mile!
text: Really enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. Great sized rooms for NYC, and excellent amenities. The view from the club lounge rooftop is stunning. Special thanks the entertaining and knowledgeable Steven H, who went out of his way to make the stay top notch for everyone on the rooftop!

title: Very nice stay, very nice staff
text: I had a very nice stay here - the staff - especially Sal - were warm and accommodating  - exactly how you’d hope. My room was certainly large enough (although I had one of the larger rooms) and was clean, quiet, and comfortable. I look forward to making this hotel my regular in NYC.

title: Decepcionante, mala relación precio - calidad, no está a la altura de un Sheraton
text:
En general el hotel no cuenta con un estándar correspondiente a 4 estrellas.
El servicio de café era escaso y no reponían los productos que se acababan, así como no había donde sentarse, especialmente el fin de semana donde el lugar donde se sirve el café se ve colapsado. 
La limpieza de la habitación deficiente, varias veces no nos hicieron la habitación (alojamos 8 noches). La habitación no cuenta con mini nevera.
A mi madre quien alojó junto a mi suegra en una habitación doble, una vez estando de vuelta en casa, se dio cuenta que le habían robado un conjunto de lencería y remedios (burdo, algo difícil de comprender). 
Poco personal habla español.

title: Favorite in New York City
text:
Great location, super friendly and helpful staff! (Sal at front desk and Frey at Concierge; the best!)
Rooms have everything you need. The beds are very comfortable, and with a bit of luck, you have a smashing view directly to the Empire State. 
Reception (front desk) and concierge are helpful with every request - from additional bedsheets to a fridge in the room, to storage and transport.
Three subway stations in easy walking distance, and Soho literally just outside the door, makes this the perfect base for a stay in Manhattan.

title: Perfect location, very friendly staff, the perfect hotel in New York!
text: The location in Canal Street is very convenient, with 10 Subway lines nearby. It is close to SoHo, Tribeca, Chinatown and Little Italy. Some of the rooms have access to a lounge with a lovely terrace with Empire State building view. The rooms have air condition and the beds are comfy. The Hotel has a 24 hour fitness centre, this is perfect for Europeans with jet lag. The staff is outstanding. Sal in the reception is the best guy ever, and so is Frey (the concierge).

title: SMALL, SMALL, SMALL!
text:
The room was very small!! We booked a Club Room with King Bed on the Club Floor which they show as being 280 sq. feet. I measured the room at 14'x14' ,not including the bathroom, and the bathroom was not big either. two people cannot move around the room at the same time. I know rooms in NYC are small, but this was ridiculous!
Also, do not pay extra for the Club Level. The food was poor, and you couldn't even get a glass of ice. When I asked for one, I was told to go down the hall to get my own ice, and use a paper coffee cup!!!

title: First time in NY
text: This was my first trip to NY and Sal, Fery and Carlos were amazing!! They were funny, nice and really accommodating. They were super helpful with arranging transportation because I had 5 huge suitcases. I'm staying here whenever I come to NY!

title: Friendly service, nice hotel
text: David at the front door was very helpful to me as I was dealing with luggage for a trade show- really appreciated it!  My room was clean and pretty- and lobby with business center  was great. Thank you!

title: Worst SPG hotel in NYC
text: Sheraton Tribeca costs as much as W New York but with questionable quality. The club lounge had amazing view but was not well maintained. At night times the club lounge was generally trashed by youngsters and when you went there in the morning, the whole room was filled with trashes, pizza boxes, and messy dirty furnitures. The room here was small and platinum members didn’t get any meaningful upgrade. Housekeeping forgot to clean the room despite multiple attempts to ask for one. The only positive side about this hotel was its great location near tribeca restaurants and the friendly front desk. This is probably the worst Sheraton hotel that ever exists among SPG hotels.

title: Service is ABOVE & beyond!
text: We stayed here a full week for business. We weren’t expecting much as we knew we wouldn’t spend much time in the hotel. However, we ended up needed assistance from the bellmen a few times and they were AMAZING. The service we received was exceptional. The concierge was wonderful in giving recommendations and directions. And we couldn’t have made it with out David! He got us rides so quickly, carried our heavy boxes and made sure our packages were safe and in our hands at the time we needed them. David and the other guys made the customer service at this hotel incredible.

title: POOR HOTEL
text:
I stayed in 10th of 4 and 5 stars hotels all over the world , for business and for pleasures and this is one of the poorest and the most disappointing one
We are staying at a club room (highest category) it's very small and crowded (much  much smaller than the size mentioned in Expedia) and poorly equipped..
I'ts noisy and you hear the corridor as if it's inside the room. The free breakfast at the lounge is not some thing to write home about. House keeping always forget something and you have to call them and ask them to bring it and more...
I would expect for more from the Sheraton Brand.
not recommended at all.

title: Good Business Hotel....Great Service!
text: Second time I've stayed at this hotel.  Both times we were exhibiting at a trade show.  We always have so many boxes coming in and at the end of the show going out.  Many of them come up to the room to be reorganized and sent back down again.  The bell staff are unbelievable!  They are so helpful and never seem to get tired of all the heavy lifting and detailed package movement.  Special thanks to Dave and Fery for taking such good care of us during out stay!!

title: Above and beyond!
text:
We stayed at this hotel for the Indie Beauty Expo. The hotel was clean and nice. What was really amazing was the bellman, David. He helped us tape up our boxes from the show and he dropped them off at UPS for us. I could not get over how helpful he was. I would definitely choose to stay here again!

Great location close to shopping in Soho and lots of great restaurants nearby.

title: friendly staff and convenient location
text: Used to live in NYC and have always hated paying for a hotel when I visit. This one is reasonable for the city price-wise and worth paying to have club access/roof access/wifi included. Great views from the rooms on club level and the roof etc. Staff was always super friendly. Breakfast was much more substantial than we expected with eggs and sausage in addition to the usual continental fare. The communal areas of the hotel could have been cleaner, but it was very busy and probably hard to stay on top of at all times. Thin walls so you could hear the 4 am drunk tourists coming in at night, but that's just rude travelers and we were next to the elevator. Would request a room further away next time. Overall great stay. Short block to the E train to the airport for those who don't want to take a cab/car. Canal street will probably always be a meh part of the city, but being directly above tribeca and below soho with every train stop nearby makes this super convenient.

title: Great stay!
text:
We checked in early and were given a room right away along with an upgrade to Club level when I told the young man at the front desk that it was my daughter's birthday.  I am so sorry that I can not remember his name as he could not have been any friendlier.  Our room was a little on the small side but clean and comfortable.  My only negative would be that the walls are a little thin.
The Club Lounge has beautiful views and a nice breakfast.  The location of the hotel itself is ideal!  Right by the Canal Street subway station and a stone's throw from lots of shopping in SoHo.  
Would definitely stay here again!

title: Very comfortable and great location
text:
I was lucky enough to score a nightly rate of $160 for a king bed suite. The room was a great size, I had amazing views. Staff were always friendly and helpful. 

I would however not pay $300 a night for this room (I was travelling alone). But was very impressed with the price considering that I was staying here over July. 

Location wise it’s near two subway stations which gives you the ACE (closest) and JNQR line which takes you uptown or down to financial district in a flash. 

This is my 5th time to New York and I can say it was hands down the best hotel I have stayed at so far (again helped with the price being so low)

title: Disappointed
text: Staying for four nights. Bed comfy and good location. Some excellent nearby bars and restaurants.  Bar service poor, gin and tonic a challenge. Room service poor, no bath towels. Would not stay again. Normally stay in Hilton hotels was expecting something better from the Sheraton, disappointed.

title: Consistently Exceeds My Expectations
text: What can I say ... rooms are perfect for pleasure or business ... views are spectacular. Staff is right on top of their game ... location location location and a club level which can’t be beat for outdoor view ma if Manhattan.  I consistently give the Sheraton Tribeca all stars.

title: Best opportunity in NYC
text:
Go for the Club levels - upper floors
They come with many perks:
Access to the terrace facing uptown (fabulous view on the Empire State Building)
Free wifi - yeah, I know, wifi should be free for any accomodation in any hotel...
Free breakfast - delcious French pastries
Free evening snacks and wine - again with this awesome view from the terrace

And if you’re lucky enough your room too will be with the same views.

title: Good Value For Price
text:
The hotel is modern and clean. Walking distance to most of the sites in lower Manhattan.

The concierge was excellent. He found a cigar bar for me within walking distance of the hotel. On the day I was leaving he flagged down a cab for me in a downpour.

The one negative was the breakfast buffet. It was $20,00 with taxes. While the pancakes and bacon were great, the scrambled eggs were two different colors of yellow. Do yourself a favor and go next door to Tribeca Bagels if breakfast does not come with your room.

title: Great hotel at perfect location!
text:
I really enjoyed my stay at Sheraton Tribeca !

All staff members are very professional and friendly. Check in was smooth and welcoming and I chose to upgrade to a Club room, being able to enjoy the nice city view from the Club terrace. Amazing at sunset !

Rooms are large and they are equipped well with all amenities you expect at a Sheraton. Very comfortable bed and linens!
Very good cleaning and friendly housekeeping staff.

I loved the location with only 10 min walk to SoHo and just 1 min walk to the Subway station taking you to Midtown in approx 20 min. 

I can recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure travels to NYC.

title: Simply amazing!
text: My wife and I stayed the weekend at Sheraton Tribeca and we had an absolute phenomenal time. The staff was extremely pleasant which made the weekend just more enjoyable. The terrace was very calm and relaxing with an amazing view of the city. The manager, Mairovi went above and beyond to make our stay as perfect as possible.

title: Great value, nice room, good service.
text:
We really enjoyed our two week stay here. The front staff were friendly and accomodating to our requests. We stayed on the 19th floor Club Room with a great view facing west, overlooking Canal Street and Tribeca. Our King room was very spacious, well appointed and had excellent WiFi. 
The Club Lounge is very good, providing a light breakfast, evening snacks and drinks. It has stunning views of the Empire State Building from the terrace and is accessible
to members 24/7.
Excellent location - well served by a number of different subway lines, and is an easy walk to pretty much everywhere below 14th Street.
Overall: great value hotel with nice rooms, great club lounge facilities and very friendly staff. We'll be back.

title: Gutes Hotel
text:
Da die Airline unsere Koffer irgendwo liegen lassen hatte, waren wir 3 Tage ohne unsere Kleider und unsere Sachen unterwegs. Das Hotelpersonal war super nett und hat uns geholfen die Airline zu kontaktieren und hat uns auch immer wieder kleine "Geschenke"  gemacht damit unser Aufenthalt doch noch schön wird.
Das Hotel ist super gelegen und wir konnten zu Fuss überall hin (wir sind sportlich). Absolut zu empfehlen!

title: Wonderful NYC Stay!
text: My daughter and I have visited NYC for the past three years for her birthday. This year, we chose to stay in the Tribeca area to be within walking distance to many different attractions. This location is WONDERFUL! There are so many great places to eat within walking distance and so many things to do close by. The hotel is clean, the staff are super friendly, and just in the perfect location. The rooms were nice size for a NYC hotel and the bathrooms were great. I highly recommend staying at the Sheraton and will be booking this same hotel when we return next year!

title: Excelente localização no Soho
text: Para quem quer ficar na região de Soho (bem perto de Chinatown),é uma ótima opção . Fica bem próximo do metro que passam muitas linhas .Quarto amplo ,bom banheiro ,garrafa de agua gratuita .Tem muitas opções de restaurantes por perto

title: Sheraton may just have saved my marriage lol 😉
text:
Hubby and I arrived in NYC to celebrate our anniversary. The trip may have been a disaster but Sal and his team totally gave us a most enjoyable experience and took all the stress off.
Our initial flight was delayed by storms so we arrived at the Sheraton a day late and somewhat grumpy. Upon checking in we found a most unfortunate situation in our room. Upon bringing this up at the from desk  Sal was more than understanding and did everything to make it right, although he had no available rooms to move us to he did have one free for a few hours which he graciously allowed us to get cleaned up in , even though it meant more housekeeping for his facility,  the next day he made sure to promptly move us , even offering to help move the bags. He left a personal message before leaving his shift to ensure we were happy and looked after. The cheerfully faces and genuine warm welcomes from all members of the staff as we came and went throughout the weekend made us completely forget our bungled journey from in getting there. We were even given complimentary drinks for our anniversary. The hotel has fantastic location, great rooftop patio but it's the staff that will bring us back!!!

title: The best kept secret in Tribeca
text: This is my fifth stay at the Sheraton in Tribeca - the first part of this particular trip I first stayed at the Mondrian Park Ave and decided mid-way through that I needed to go back to our faithful favorite in Tribeca. One large tip: ALWAYS spend the extra money to stay on the business floor. Why? Because you get access to the rooftop that not only has incredible panoramic views of NYC but also offers a quiet respite after a long day. There are unlimited snacks, water, coffees, teas and sodas available to you there throughout the day and night - and a breakfast spread in the morning. This is also with NO additional cost. The best part though is the rooftop happy hour that offers wine, beer and cheese for several hours as the sun sets. After spending $20 for a drink most places - especially in Tribeca or the neighboring Soho - you will be delighted to enjoy a few beverages with this particular view for “free” ... and nice wines at that. Deon - who has been there for nine years - is phenomenal during the Happy Hour. The rooms are pleasant but pretty standard. The staff is very kind and quite attentive in my experience. I have thoroughly enjoyed that I have always been given the same room each time I’ve stayed - I’m not sure if that’s coincidental but it feels very comfortable every time I arrive. Finally I highly recommend 5 Boroughs pizza across the street if you are looking for a cheap but delicious snack. This neighborhood offers endless possibilities. Enjoy!

title: Very disappointing
text:
I had 3 different stays within a short amount of time planned at this Sheraton, including one I had booked for my parents. Overall, I found it ok but below what I expect from a SPG/Marriott hotel at that price point, and apart from the lounge access I didn’t feel like my platinum status was recognized. The service was a sloppy, and employees were doing the bare minimum while making you feel like they were doing you a huge favor when they were just doing their job. For instance in 2 of the 3 checkin occurrences, there was no shower gel in the room when we entered the room. I also asked for them to bring and prepare the bedding on the couch for the one night that I had planned to sleep in my parents’ room, but I had to ask 3 different times for them to only bring the bedding to the room and not even prepare the bed. There were a couple more instances where service was lacking but let’s move on to other annoyances: elevators take forever in that hotel (it can take more than 5 minutes to get to the lobby or the lounge), and it just feels a bit old in general. The rooms are small but that’s ok, I’ve never had a huge room in a New York hotel. The breakfast is also disappointing, very few options and the ingredients don’t seem to be of the highest quality. 
On a more positive side, the location is very convenient to visit the city, and right by a metro station. The happy hour from 5:30 to 7:30 for platinum members is nice and the terrace is great when the weather is good enough.

title: Very Nice room, sketchy neighborhood
text:
We stayed at the Maxwell the first part of our trip, which is located uptown. For the second part we stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca. Nelson & Luis are indeed a great asset to this hotel, They were beyond helpful and wonderful! The room was clean, king size bed and great view of the Empire State Building from our room. They have the green program which we participate in. 
The hotel and room where wonderful, its the area getting to and from the hotel that is questionable, especially at night.
Lots of homeless people and drunk/drugged persons along the sidewalk coming up to and when leaving the hotel. Made us uneasy several times. 
The location is a 8 or so minute walk into Soho, which is great for the shopping and the restaurants. I personally prefer staying uptown and using the subway to get to Soho for the days I want to visit there, but I doubt I would stay in this hotel again. Personally just preferred the Uptown hotels area for staying at.

title: Small rooms , bellow average service
text:
Stayed there for 4 nights booked two rooms for my self and kids  , as a SPG gold member they checked me into the smallest two rooms in the hotel 

It was my worst experience dealing with a hotel manger  , requested a pay upgrade for rooms that were available online for purchase yet Front desk manger KK declined every request she was very rude and non understandable , very rigid when it comes to dealing with guest , she will definitely benefit from customer service course that may improve her communication skills , on the other hand all other front desk staff were great 

Breakfast ends at 11 am , I was present at 10:45am they claimed that the chief left and this will not be able to provide breakfast

title: 1st. Visit to New York from Melbourne Australia
text:
Room was good, Nelson and Luis the overnight front desk staff, were amazing, they went out of their way to be very helpful to very tired traveller.  They made us feel very happy that we chose the Sheraton TriBeCa.  Will recommend this Hotel to others, because of their friendly, helpful manner. 
Keith and Sandra 507

title: Great location and super nice staff
text: Nelson & Luis were awesome!  The hotel was beautiful and I’m a great spot.  The morning buffet was not impressive but if included is an easy choice.  Close to shopping and trendy areas. Near to subway too.

title: Comfortable, clean room, welcoming service
text: We booked this hotel to get together with old college friends. it has an excellent location in TriBeCa with a lot of nearby restaurants and bars. Service was extremely pleasant and helpful, breakfast was very good, and the room was very comfortable. It was overall a very good experience, I am a little baffled by a few negative reviews I saw before I stayed there

title: Muy bien ubicado, buena relación precio/calidad
text: Estuvimos alojados con mi esposa y mi hijo de 7 años en julio de 2018. Linda habitación, aunque un tanto pequeña para 3 huéspedes (casi sin lugar para las maletas). El Hotel está a pasos del que para mi gusto es el barrio más lindo de NYC: el Soho. Eso sí, está ubicado sobre una avenida bastante fea como lo es Canal St. El Hotel tiene varias líneas de metro a pocas cuadras, la zona hiper comercial de la Av Broadway, y a sólo unas pocas estaciones de metro de Chelsea, loa Village, y Brooklyn, por ejemplo. El trato del personal es frío y distante. Y no encontramos empleados que hablen español. El wifi es gratuito, y el desayuno se puede contratar con costo extra (muy elevado).

title: Carlos is the man
text:
Carlos in the baggage area as well as Nora at the bar were absolutely accommodating and super helpful! Carlos helped us arrange a ride, made great recommendations on places nearby for dinner. 

The hotel has been great so far.

title: Not recommended
text: As soon I walked onto my floor there was multiple people sitting on the floors on the hallway on their laptops and talking to each other is if it were college dorms. Not sure what that was about. I asked to change my room because of the noise... still waiting... 30 mins into my stay I get a knock on my door to get a shade put into my room. Front desk did NOT notify me of this. They left my room because they did not have the part to install it. 10 mins after that (WHILE IN THE RESTROOM) they just walk back into my room WITHOUT KNOCKING and I come out to 3 of their contracted workers in my room. Not even hotel staff. Room was clean, bed was comfortable. Only reason they get 1 star.

title: posizione ottima
text:
Ci ho soggiornato qualche mese fa, la posizione è eccellente. camera confortevole pulita e bagno pratico. la colazione internazione rispecchiava i canoni di categoria. E' comodissimo per girare la città perchè c'è la fermata della metro vicina. 
Personale competente e professionale

title: SOHO.little ITALY.にいくなら
text:
部屋には歯ブラシ、スリッパは無し。
フロントは極めて感じの悪い応対。
クラブラウンジは21階でスタッフはいない。テラスはいい感じです。SPG  PL

title: Great stay, convenient location!
text:
We had a great stay at this hotel. Its centrally located, 5-10 min walk to the subway, within walking distance to the shopping district in Soho (lower manhattan), restaurants in Little Italy and China Town. When we arrived in New York there was a heat wave and the hotel had an amazing aircondition which we appreciated. Our room was big and spacious for tow people with big suitcases and lots of shopping bags. The room, linen and bathroom was clean.
The hotel has a roof top bar which had happy hour (free drinks & snacks) between 5 & 7pm, fabulous bonus.
The WiFi works everywhere in the hotel.
We loved the hotel gym, which we used. Its not big, it has a few equipment and gets busy if you dont go early in the morning.
The hotel offered cold breakfast (muffins, croissants, cereals & yoghurt) at the rooftop restaurant. We preferred a warm breakfast (eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit etc) which they serve at the restaurant downstairs. They served the same type of eggs (scrambled) everyday. We also had complimentary water in our rooms everyday.
I would stay here again!

title: Idéalement situé
text:
Hôtel de qualité, propreté et confort au RDV.
Sa situation est idéale entre Soho, Litlle Italy et Chinatown, lignes de métro vraiment à proximité qui desservent tout New York.
Salle de Fitness plutôt bien équipée - réceptionnistes très professionnels.
Bémol, le petit-déjeuner (cher), manque de choix pour son prix, de ravitaillement et de présentation, de plus, le personnel s'en occupant n'est pas très conciliant.
Conseil : lors de la réservation, demandez une chambre avec vue vers l'Empire State Building.

title: EXEMPLARY SERVICE!!!
text: We had such an amazing time with Felitta!! She is so professional and welcoming! She made our time here truly pleasant! Thanks Felitta, can’t wait for you to move up in the ranks! Youre awesome!!! The hotel room was so clean and the staff was very accommodating.

title: mediocre accommodations but great location!
text:
The hotel is tired and needs an overall refresh. As an SPG well traveled Platinum member, I was not given an upgrade and made due with a connecting room (could hear tv in the adjoining room) on a high SPG preferred floor. The bed (photos attached) was lumpy with deep indents (photos attached) but the room was clean. No refrigerators in the room (disappointing) and the bathroom is well worn but clean and functional. 
The most attractive aspect of this hotel is its location. When you walk out the front doors - to the left is Tribeca, to the right is Chinatown and Soho is in front of you. 
And the rooftop club lounge - there is a fantastic outdoor space attached but the lounge itself (food/decor) is mediocre and small. They do have sodas, water, coffee available and a ho-hum breakfast. I suggest getting food and a bottle of wine and eating on the outdoor rooftop. 
I would stay here again purely for the location and relatively decent price for a Manhattan hotel.

title: Muy bueno
text: Muy bueno la habitación de primera, contaba con servicio gratuito de ferri y muchas comodidades para los turistas, la atención buena y esta en una zona accesible al centro de la ciudad, también cuenta con servicio de taxis pero es muy elevado

title: Great stay
text: Alexis from the front desk was exceptional. Alexis was very professional, she handled me with care, attentive to my needs and went above and beyond to make my stay more comfortable. I appreciate Alexis.

title: Gran lugar
text: De todos los hoteles SPG de bajo costo que he visitado en Nueva York, éste me ha parecido el mejor. Los cuartos son pequeños pero agradables. El salón VIP es muy bueno y tiene una vista muy bonita a la ciudad. El único problema que tuvimos es que en el corredor había todo el tiempo una máquina prendida que hacía mucho ruido (parecía estar ahí para controlar la humedad).

title: Excellent choice if you find the right deal
text:
The Sheraton Tribeca has it all if you are able to find a price that pleases you for the Club levels.
Location: perfect to visit NYC.
Half way between UpTown and Wall St. With a subway station right around the corner.
The area surrounding the hotel is very quiet, no noise at night which is very unique.

The Club:
Free breakfast, free snacks in the evening, with wine. And free Wifi - ok, I agree with you that Wifi should be free in any and all hotels...
The view from the terrasse of the Club: imagine an unobstructed view on the Empire State building

The team:
Everyone was so nice with us. Ok, the bartender was not a very smiling lady but she was the exception.

title: Generally a good hotel
text:
I have stayed here several times for work. I usually don't have any problems. At one point, they were updating their key card system and struggled to get me the right kind of card for my floor, but we got it worked out.

The elevators are not the fastest. From the lobby there usually isn't a long wait, but from your floor you may need to buffer in some time.

Service in the restaurant is fine, the food is pricey but tastes good.

The location on Canal St is convenient, but I don't love having to walk down Canal to get anywhere so I cross over into SoHo as quickly as possible. During my last visit, there was something going on at the radio studio next door and people were lined up for a few hours waiting for a glimpse of some celebrity. I was several floors up, but the noise was still considerable. 

The room is small but comfortable, toiletries are nice, and the spaces are all clean. If you can get it for a good price, it is a good hotel.

title: Location, location, location
text:
We visit New York a few times a year and the Sheraton Tribeca has become our New York address.  Immediately across Canal from the entrance is SoHo and immediately to the rear is Tribeca.  Two of our favorite neighborhoods. Within 2 blocks is access to every major subway line with Greenwich Village and the Theater District just short rides away.   

Over the last decade or so, we’ve stayed around Manhattan, but no hotel has been able to compete with this location.  Theater is the primary reason we visit, but we HATE Time Square and adjacent (convention) hotels are way too busy.  Within blocks is world-class shopping and less touristy restaurants.  Green Village and Washington Square Park are an easy walk up West Broadway which is right outside the front doors.  

This hotel is a great value with room prices that are very competitive for NYC.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating including housekeeping which left us notes every day.  This is not a convention hotel.  The rooms are typical NYC rooms, which is to say smallish, but very clean and adequate.  There is no concierge but the desk staff work hard to meet that role.  On our recent visit, my husband was celebrating his birthday.  He loves chocolate cake so I contacted the hotel in hopes of securing a small chocolate cake.  They could not accommodate this request but they sent someone to a nearby bakery for a large slice of chocolate cake (at no cost to us) that was waiting for us in the room with a very nice note.  

Get out of Time Square and enjoy NYC as the people who live here enjoy it.  Spend a day walking around SoHo and Tribeca and you will never stay in Time Square again.

title: Clean, modern hotel in a great location
text: Stayed here for a week in August of 17.  Rooms were clean and spacious.  Modern and comfortable.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  There's a bar downstairs where you can kick back.  The location is perfect.  Canal street station is nearby, some great pubs in the area (Nancy Whisky Bar is awesome) and you can grab a tasty bite at one of the restaurants around.  Perfect stay.

title: Sheraton Tribeca New York
text: This hotel in an excellent location, near Canal st metro, so you can easily move around the city by metro . The bed was comfortable bur room very small, free Wi-Fi and printing service. Not very friendly staff, problems with deposit.

title: Great Hotel, great location.
text:
The Sheraton at Tribeca, is your best option if you want to be near to most all important attractions in NYC. Little Italy and Chinatown are within walking distance, there is a metro station around the corner. Parking is just across the street.

The rooms themselves are very comfortable, not spacious, but confortable, they have a gym, and breakfast is great, scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage, bacon, pancakes. Their service is top notch, I was upgraded to the lounge area, and was given a bottle of wine, upon checking, big shout out to Nelson, the attendant on duty. I will definitely stay here again, highly recommended.

title: Perfectly placed in Tribeca
text: The location of this hotel is fantastic! Its easy to get anywhere including China Town, Little Italy, SoHo, the Village, etc...The rooms are a bit small, but well appointed and comfy. The club lounge offers a nice breakfast and a pretty ok happy hour. The best thing though about the lounge is the outdoor patio and view. There was only one negative we had about this hotel and that was the noise level. At night we could hear cars on the street, and people if they were shouting. Despite that though, we would stay here again.

title: Schöne Zimmer, aber ...
text:
4 Sterne, aber kein Kühlschrank im Zimmer? Getränkeautomat auf der Etage kaputt? Zimmerservice vergisst mal den Kaffee aufzufüllen, mal das Toilettenpapier, mal die Handtücher, und die Laken waren auch nachdem ich gebeten hatte, sie zu wechseln, nicht sauber! 
Die Lage ist etwas zweifelhaft, denn die Canal-Street in Tribeca ist nicht gerade eine angesagte Gegend (aber U-Bahn-Anbindungen gut und um die Ecke in der West Broadway tut sich eine andere, bessere Welt auf).

title: Awesome!!!!!
text:
This place was unreal. Very welcoming enjoyed every minute. The rooftop view was incredible.
The staff were great especially Raul. But so we're the staff at the front desk.
Highly recommended. Location was ideal. Pricey but what would you expect from New York

title: Run down hotel with average service with some elevators not operating
text:
I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. 1 of the 3 elevators was not working so the wait times were quite long for elevators.Even though I was given a room facing backside of the hotel it was quite noisy. There were some fans outside that were generating a lot of noise. There is no body wash/bath gel in the bathrooms. The only have solid soap which I did not like. 

The hotel was not very well maintained and quite run down. I would probably not stay at this hotel again as there are other much better hotels at the same price point.

title: Sheraton Tribeca – an excellent choice!
text:
The hotel has a good location and a relaxed, easy-going atmosphere. Our room was on Club floor with access to the Club Lounge. The Lounge is a good place to grab breakfast or pop in during the afternoon happy hour for a snack and glass of wine. 

The fitness room is very nice too. I can warmly recommend the Club rooms on 20th & 21st floors; I’m already looking forward to my next visit.

Don’t forget to tip the Club Lounge “bartender” to keep your wine glasses full! ;)

title: Absolument parfait
text: Quel plaisr de séjourner ici ! Un accueil sympathique par une jeune femme balinaise. Pour notre séjour de 7 nuits elle nous propose de nous upgrader dès le lendemain de notre arrivée si nous le souhaitions, afin de bénéficier d’une meilleure vue. De plus elle nous offre un ticket pour bénéficier de deux boissons au choix au bar .Deal accepté, notre 1 ère nuit a donc lieu au 22 ème étage , au dessus du club Lounge qui se situe au 21 ème. Avec la formule exécutive, nous bénéficions d’un accès à la terrasse, aux boissons gratuites ( eau, café, sodas) à toute heure . Le matin le petit déjeuner est également compris dans le tarif,( excellent d’ailleurs = café,thé chocolat, viennoiseries, pâtisserie,pains, bagels,beurre, confiture, fruits, yaourts, céréales, OMELETTE, SAUCISSE,jus d’orange.) bref, vraiment complet pour démarrer la journée. De plus en début de soirée, petits encas disponibles( fromages, legumes crus, jambon blanc ...) avec verre de vin offert. Chambre bien isolée au niveau sonore, lit confortable,produits d’accueil agréables. Le lendemain changement de chambre avec une vue sur l’empire State building du 20 ème etage. Le service d’etage Est également parfait, je demande des paires de chaussons a l’accueil, et 3 minutes plus tard, on me les apporte. Bref, que du bonheur. Il me reste 5 nuits à faire et je sais que tout va bien se passer. Le quartier n’est loin de rien et on peut se déplacer aisément à pied, en bus où bien encore avec le métro qui est juste à côté de l’hôtel. Je recommande vivement cet hôtel.

title: Probably one of the Best Deals in the City
text:
We booked an Executive Club room for a really reasonable price and it's worth every penny of it.
First of all, when we arrived for a one week stay, the young lady attending checkin, told us that the room we were attributed was with very limited view. So she offered us to transfer the following day to a much better one.
We are now in room 2020 and WOW! 
We have an unobstructed view to all of uppertown, including the Empire State.
And tonight, 4th of July oblige, we will watch the fireworks from our king bed.
Now, about the Executive Club.
It includes a free breakfast with excellent French pastry and the usual sausages and omelette. Coffee is Starbucks and orange juice in real fresh, not from concentrated.
Plus, all day long you may access the Club for coffee or fresh drinks.
Plus, plus, in the evening you have a free buffet with a selection fo wines.

And the view!
The terrace is just above our room, with the same awesome view.
Where else to have your breakfast looking at  the Empire State building?

The room is very comfortable, large enough AND QUIET, which, in NYC, is a luxury.

Bottom line: for the price deal we had we are totally enthusiastics about what we got.

title: Excellent stay!
text: Stayed at this hotel with a friend for pride weekend, we both really enjoyed our stay. Great drinks at the bar and a wonderful happy hour in the lounge. Room service was great, and the manager and staff were were very kind. After checking out I realized I left one of my AirPods in the hotel room, and they promptly located it and assured me they could mail it back to me states away, excellent customer service! I will definitely be staying here again!

title: Terrible Customer Service
text: We were in New York for a wedding. About an hour before we were supposed to leave, I realized the room was missing a hair dryer. On its website, the hotel states that the rooms come with a hair dryer. Called the front desk multiple times. Each time they said the hair dryer was on the way, but it never arrived. So I was forced to attend the wedding with wet hair. Will never stay at a Sheraton again.

title: This hotel needs a top to bottom overhaul.  Many better options exist at this price point.
text:
I stayed here last week while I was in town for the AIA conference.  Last week was a high occupancy week in NYC between this and Pride events.  My travel plans came together at the last minute, and I missed out on advanced booking discounts.  This hotel was one of the few that had rooms in my date range under 400.00 a night. In a panic, I booked and was eligible for the AAA discount, so my room was 312.00 before taxes, discounted from 380.00.  

Checkin was a disaster.  The CSR, let's call her "Twinkle" with the platinum wig,  seemed angry from the start and rushed through my checkin.  When I asked to verify the rate and the perks offered by the AAA booking that I made over the phone a couple days before, she rudely retorted that no such deal was in the system, and that my room was 379.00 before taxes, and there was no city view, no access to the lounge level with breakfast and cocktails.  I showed her my confirmed reservation email, and she said there was absolutely nothing she could do, and that was just how it was going to be.  I then asked for her manager, and she angrily stormed off and found her supervisor who took over the checkin process.  Well Twinkle kept interjecting while the supervisor attempted to locate the reservation that showed my deal.  I eventually complained about her attitude to her supervisor.  Neither seemed pleased that I went there.  Well  miraculously, a room with the specifications promised to me appeared on the system...but I was made to feel this was a grand favor being granted to me, and something was mumbled about a failure of their system to have synced with the central reservation system, or some such excuse.

This hotel is old and dated, but the room was immaculately clean.  The breakfast and cocktail hour buffet in the 21st floor lounge was excellent, and redeemed my stay.  I had dinner in the lobby restaurant the first night as it was very late.  Terribly overpriced for a micro slice of frozen salmon with veggies.  I paid 70.00 for that meal and one glass of red wine.  Cafeteria quality for fine dining prices.

I cut my four night stay in half, and moved to another hotel (Dream/ Chelsea/ See my review) which was incomparable at a rate of 389.00.  

Do not be fooled by the proximity of this hotel to SoHo.  Crossing Canal street from SoHo to this hotel take you into another world...one of whinos, and the stench of weed, urine and garbage combined.  You will not feel safe walking here at night.

title: Basic stay for business
text:
The Sheraton is a difficult brand to understand as it could represent a super luxurious hotel/resort, or a basic, small, simple, old minimalistic hotel. This is the case of the Sheraton Tribeca at Canal St. it’s small and simple and very basic. 
However, they have a great view up on the 21st floor lounge which serves 24 hour Coffee and Soft Drinks. 
I was recognized as an SPG Platinum member and was upgraded to a bigger room so, I’m giving it an extra star for that. 
Anyways, don’t expect too much and you’ll have a fine stay here. 
Rooms are clean and bed is comfy.

title: Amazing club lounge. Thank you Deon.
text: We stayed over the weekend and had a great stay. Front desk was friendly and extremely helpful. Our room was a typical Sheraton room. A little small but that’s expected in NYC. The club lounge is amazing!  Love the huge roof top deck. Deon was great!  Such a hard worker and so friendly. He runs around non stop!  I’m lifetime platinum with Starwood and I’ve been to lots of club lounges and this one is definitely one of the best!  The hotel is in a great location too. We’ll definitely be back!

title: Thank you again Deon from the club Lounge for the AAA service
text:
I stayed in room 302 in your presidential suite.   My stay was from June 22- 25.  

I have been staying at the Sheraton for 15 years with a combined 536 nights.  I had the pleasure of meeting the most curteous, inviting, charming host by the name of DEON from the club lounge on the 21st floor. 

I rarely find myself writing reviews. When one receives such superior service as I did I feel it’s only fair for all of New York and the world for that matter know about this hidden gem. Located on the rooftop with a panoramic view of Manhattan you can be sure to be in aw.   

Meeting Deon and having the luxury of being a guest in his club floor was my best club level floor experience yet!  

I must have been to over 50 different club lounges in my years and this one has exceeded my expectations.  Bravo to Management for recognizing value in such a wonderful man like Deon.   After all my years of travel to New York I have finally found my home when I’m here and it’s definitely thanks to the hospitality I received by this gentlemen.   

Thank you again and we can’t wait to see you again.  

JR

title: Good downtown location
text: Enjoyed our 3 nights at the Sheraton TriBeCa. Well located in SoHo within short walks of great stores, Little Italy, Chinatown, other good restaurants.  Very friendly and helpful staff in all positions. Room was spotless, not appearing worn at all for the obvious busy-ness of this hotel, NYC small in room size. Very comfortable bed. Room rate not outrageous. Had to stay in for dinner one night due to heavy rain, and ate in lobby restaurant. Was expensive, but very good.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Super gelegen in Chinatown, tolle Bar und freundliches Personal
text:
Das Hotel liegt in der Canal Street, unweit vom Zentrum China Towns mit zahllosen Restaurants. Dennoch ist es weit genug entfernt, um etwas dem nächtlichen Trubel in China Town zu entgehen. Fußläufig ist auch der Broadway zu erreichen, ganz am südlichen Ende, den man zu Fuß bis ins Zentrum von Manhatten entlanglaufen kann. 

Das Hotel selbst hat mich mit einem für New York großen Zimmer überrascht. Die Ausstattung ist gehobener Standard, kein Luxus. Teilweise etwas in die Jahre gekommen, daher der eine Stern Abzug. Aber bitte nicht falsch verstehen, die Ausstattung ist absolut in Ordnung und für New York weit über dem Standard. 
Positiv ist mir die Bar aufgefallen, die gut besucht ist und gute Drinks anbietet. Dort kommt man mit anderen Reisenden ins Gespräch, was mir als in dem Fall Alleinreisender geholfen hat. 

Insgesamt ein sehr zu empfehlendes Hotel für einen Städtetrip.

title: Return visit on Friday, June 22nd for three (3) nights
text: As I have mentioned before this is my FAVORITE hotel on. My stays in the New York City area.  This is based 100% on the very efficient and professional staff emoyed at this hotel.  Upon check-in I have the pleasure of being greeted with warm welcome by Front Desk Associate Nelson who has already has my room assignment  and access key ready.  Bellman Lewis has the newspapers ready for me and offers me help with my luggage.  The all of the staff in the Club Lounge & Terrace make me feel right at home on every sine stay at this premise.  It is always a joy to be welcomed by PM Associate Deon always with a smile and a very, very sincere and warm greeting.  All of the staff that works in the Antica Ristorante, where I usually have my morning breakfast always welcome me with a gracious and welcoming '"Good morning Mr. McKaney".  I have been there in some very busy mornings and they handle the breakfast rush like a well-oiled machine!  I am always amazed at how easy they make the customer service end of the business run so smoothly every single morning.  These are some of the many reasons why I will continue returning to this hotel on ALL of my New York City stays.  I hope that the Marriott organization is aware of how lucky they should be that they have acquired this very professional venue with the complete professional staff that it encompasses.  Keep up the great work Sheraton Tribeca New York Hotel!

title: Pleasantly surprised!
text:
I was pleasantly surprised by my recent stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. 

From the moment we arrived until we left, staff was extremely helpful. We arrived and had about twenty minutes to check in, get to our room, change, and leave for our anniversary dinner. The front desk staff could tell we were in a rush and got us checked in and on our way in record time all while being courteous and friendly. It was incredibly hot for our weekend stay and every time we came back to the hotel, the front desk had water bottles available for us. When we checked out, we asked for a cab to Newark Airport and they got us a private car in less than 5 minutes for a flat rate fee. It may have been a bit more expensive than a cab, but the driver got us to the airport in a half hour during rush hour.

We booked a Superior King room and were put in a room right next to the elevator. I was concerned about noise but we only heard other guests one morning and it was after 8am. The Superior room was spacious with a comfortable seating area and room to move around, which is hard to find in Manhattan. The rate was below other hotels in the area that would have offered a room half the size.

Location was great - easy to get to JFK and EWR, as well as being walking distance to the Village, Soho, Tribeca, and Little Italy. There is a subway stop around the corner, too, which made it easy to get to Williamsburg and Midtown.

It's not as stylish as other hotels in Soho might have been, but between service, location, and price, this was an all around great stay.

title: FAN FREAKIN TABULOUS!
text:
Its been a while since it was the staff that MADE the stay.   From Everyone at Reception to Dion, who takes care of the Club Floor Lounge.  If you stay here, get to the CLUB FLOOR and go visit Dion!

  Reception staff.. Sal, Precious,[yes that is her name], and Fritta,,,FANTASTIC. Smiles, friendly, GENUINE and I was on site in April and when I got home I made my next reservation at this same property.  It was so fab I almost forgot about the bartender who really needs to do a little less texting and look up more often  :-)
I completely suggest this property to anyone!

One thing, note to the F & B Department>  If you are going to charge that much for the breakfast buffet, you better amp it up, or drop the price.  DEFINITELY not worth it.
Someone seriously needs to re-evaluate this.

title: Brilliant Allrounder
text: Fabulous 3 day stopover. Location could not have been better. Clean and on trend. Staff could not have been friendlier and polite. Ticketed all the boxes. Will make it my mission to recommend this hotel to everyone I know!

title: Never again
text:
This was the last time at Sheraton TriBeCa. As a SPG member. I paid for staying  at club floor (loyalty program). This includes access to continental breakfast buffet. But most of the mornings we meet an empty table. One morning the complaint was meet with a voucher for breakfast in the restaurant. 
But the other mornings nothing was done. 
In the reception we was promised a discount on our prepaid room. But nothing happened.  

In the afternoon a snack would be served in the club floor lounge. The waiter was very nice but the snack were poor quality carrots out of a plastic bag, cheese (I don’t eat cheese) nachos out of an other bag. Before there was served small warm snack and everything was mush more delicious.

The general standard has fallen over the years. This you se in the furniture, at the floor, the bed and the towels has seen better days.

You might  think that the SPG loyalty made difference but no.

Sorry to say never again!!!

title: Great hotel
text: We stayed in a room with 2 beds and there 3 adults. The room was big enough as lets be honest you don't spend a lot of time in there but to sleep. It had a desk and great view of the city and the bathroom had a shower bath. The bed was comfy with lots of pillows and I could hardly hear a thing from the outside world which is rare in NYC. It was big enough for what we needed which was a room to sleep in and it still fit in 3 very large suitcases. There are also bathroom facilities for guests to use on level 2 which came in handy. All the staff were very friendly greeting us every morning we left and every evening when we came back. The free wifi was great.We had the breakfast on the 22nd floor which is like a continental. Some croissants, muffins juices coffees etc. Better than most hotels however there was nothing gluten free for me so I couldn't eat there. The hotel is right near the subway and there are a few little cafes close by, in fact one right next door which we used often. It was a great base for us for NYC. I would definitely stay here again the next time I visit NYC.

title: Rooftop Happy Hour
text: Loved the Sheraton Tribeca.  Stayed there for 4 nights with my family (husband and teenage son). We found the location to be very convenient for shopping, dinning, night-clubbing and sightseeing. Short walk to subway.  We will stay here on our next NYC trip.  The best thing about our stay here was the Happy Hour in the rooftop club.  Drinks al fresco with a 180 degree-view. Make sure to say 'hello' to Deon for us, our fantastic host.  He took care of us as if we were royalty. Excellent service.

title: Roof top terrace is peaceful, Nice views!
text: Enjoyed the roof top terrace!  It’s peaceful and not very crowded when I’ve been there.  There are great views and it’s in a great, central location.  One of my favorite NYC hotels in Tribeca with a nice standard room for NY and affordable rates.

title: Muy buena ubicación
text:
El hotel tiene una excelente ubicación en la zona de soho, cerca de los negocios de Broadway ave y restaurantes de little.
Lo único negativo es que las habitaciones no son muy espaciosas y el desayuno del último piso tiene pocas cosas.

title: Great Bday Weekend - Thanks Fellita
text: Upon entering the hotel I was greeted at the front desk by Felitta.  Not only did she make the check in a great experience, but she continued with her exemplary service throughout our stay.  I hope that this hotel recognizes that they truly have an amazing employee in her.  Thank-you so much for making our stay for my bday that much more enjoyable Fellita.  We hope to see you next time!

title: Très bon hôtel ,  situé
text:
Hôtel super et bien situé. Employés accueillants et serviables. Chambre très propres et modernes. Valet parking au besoin. 
Je recommande cet hôtel lors d'un séjour à New York en famille, entre amis ou en couple.

title: 10 days @ Sheraton Tribeca
text:
Great location. Many subway options near by to go both uptown & downtown in Manhattan. Walking distance to Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy, even the World Trade Ctr area. Not the most beautiful street tho. But I guess it’s part of the NYC charm

Room is very standard. Absolutely nothing special about the room. TIP: Ask for a room @ high floor with bigger window facing north, you’ll be able to see Empire State Building.

 Lounge is substandard. Breakfast & evening reception offering NEVER change! Basically just coffee, bagel, pastry in the AM & chips, dips, few selection of wines for the PM.
View from lounge is beautiful. Worth going there just for the view.

Lobby is small & elevators are on the slow side.
Cleanliness can also be improved.

Concierge staff ( who also are bellmen, doormen ) are super nice. By my second day, they all recognized me by name. Front desk staff are all just average, none of them went extra length to male my stay great.

Other than the barely there lounge, basically no more benefit or being SPG Platinum member.

title: Will definitely return
text: Have given this review 5 stars as I simply could not fault the hotel. From check in to check out every member of staff we encountered was friendly. The reception, lifts, bedroom was exceptionally clean too. Room was a good size, worked perfectly well for myself and my husband. Perfect base for 'Downtown' - Chinatown, Little Italy, Soho, Tribeca etc. All within walking distance. Already looking to rebook for Christmastime.

title: Great staff
text: My daughter and I had a great stay here. We chose it for the location, but the staff was wonderful. They were very responsive and helpful.  Felita was the best!  She cared very much about making sure we had a great stay.  Her customer service is superior!  Sal was also a stand out.  Thanks so much!

title: O aconchego do Soho longe da barulheira do centro!
text: Fomos em muitas amigas e para nós alguns fatores foram determinantes pra escolha do hotel - localizacao (otima, perto de tudo e de duas estacoes de metro), cafe da manha (nada de mais, mas pra nós super satisfatorio com bagel, geleia, dois sucos, cereais e cafe e croassaint) e um excelente happy hour diario no roof top das 17h as 19h. Show! Quartos amplos, limpos, bom chuveiro, ficamos em QUATRO em cada quarto e achamos mto bom. Agua da pia super gelada mto bom pra pele! Adoramos!

title: Stay Here Every Week!
text: I stay here every week and love it. Great staff, awesome 21st floor roof deck view from the concierge lounge, great gym. Shout out to my man Deon in the lounge, that guy is the best. He knows all the regulars and really makes it feel like home.

title: My home away from home!
text: I cannot say enough about the staff at this hotel. I travel 90% of the time and this is my favorite place to stay. The staff is absolutely amazing.... and a shout out to Nelson, Sal and Lena! This is the only hotel that I stay at for both business and pleasure!

title: Great location, clean room, nice staff
text: We stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for a long weekend.  It worked out well for heading up to Broadway for shows, whether by subway or by taxi, and for wandering around Tribeca and Soho.    The front desk staff were very nice. The room is not too small and it was very clean. However,  I recommend asking for a room away from the elevators, because there is definitely a lot of noise when people come in late and/or are waiting for the elevators to arrive.  And wait they will, these elevators are very very slow.  The neighborhood is ok, with a short walk to the trendy shops and cafes of Tribeca and Soho.  However, you will be constantly accosted by people trying to sell you fake purses and watches along Canal Street. Overall, I recommend the hotel if you can get a decent rate.

title: NYc
text:
Es un hotel más para 3 estrellas. Mínimos servicios, toallas viejas, habitaciones antiguas. No vale la pena pagar tanto.
Además el barrio es muy ruidoso, y las ventanas  no son anti ruido, además de faltarles cortinas y entra claridad

title: Good place ti stay when in NYC
text: My experience of staying here was good. I reached the hotel way before my check in time. The reception staff was courteous and offered me a free drink coupon and followed by an early check in there after.
