The hotel is located in the heart of NYC with prime sites like 5th, Times square, Trinity church just a walk away. Room windows can slide open if you need to smoke. The rooms are fully equipped with amenities and also have complimentary Starbucks coffee which was such a life saver. There's also a grocery store where you can buy really cheap dinner and it's open 24*7

title: good stay in New York city
text:
My wife and I were in New York city for a few days and we opted to stay at the Sheraton Tribeca as we wanted to be close to Soho and we generally like the area.  

Our first impression coming into the hotel was not so good as it was quite chaotic coming in and the lobby area looked old and worn out.  The lady at checkin was also particularly unfriendly.  We probably ended up on someone having a bad day as all our other interaction with staff were good...  

Once we got to our room everything was fine.  It was small by all standards but this is New York so it was ultimately fine as a base to explore the city.

I probably will return when i'm back to New York city.

title: Nice enough stay but be sure to check your credit card bill!
text: My stay was perfectly fine, but afterwards I noticed an extra $75 charge on my credit card. I called the hotel and they told me it was for overnight parking. Only problem, I did not have a car. Several times I called the hotel and they told me they would issue a refund and neither time actually did. I've been trying for a week now and am still working getting the $75 back. So beware.

title: Second Visit within 3 weeks - Awful experience this time
text: I stayed here 3 weeks ago....had a wonderful time and came back this past weekend with my daughter....worst experience ever...the hotel was sold out and was given a corner room that was so small...compared to the room I had 3 weeks ago on the 19th Floor with beautiful view...This was not the room I paid for and the lady at the front desk advised sorry thats all she had....so disappointed....will not stay here anymore.

title: prima hotel met goede uitvalsbasis
text: Prima hotel in een hele leuke wijk. Verschillende metrolijnen zijn op zeer korte loopafstand. Vooral in de weekenden erg gezellig en druk  in de buurt. Mooie winkels in de buurt en bijna alle highlights zijn in een kwartier te bereiken met de metro. Kamer is niet heel groot en weinig kastruimte. Sommige personeelsleden zijn erg aardig maar het merendeel vrij ongeïnteresseerd, Schoonmaak is niet consequent qua aanvullen toiletpapier en handdoeken etc. Bij toegang executive lounge hele dag gratis fris, water, koffie en thee! ontbijt is niet uitgebreid maar prima om mee te starten. Ik zou de volgende keer weer in dit hotel gaan.

title: Just a hotel to stay. Nothing to WOW you
text: Staying at this hotel at our first day arrival in NYC. Dropped out of the shuttle from JFK, and walk into the reception. Stefanie the front desk was trying to help by saying the room should be ready by an hour past mid-day  of our reservation was done at Executive King Room at 21st fl. The same level as the executive lounge. In fact we have to wait until the room ready almost by 14.00. An hour from the agreed time at the firsti time we met the front desk. Room has quite good size compare to many other in europe, it has amenities we need and the access to large window facing to the manhattan down town. The area are safe to walk, even at midnight. There are a bagel 24 hours next door serves salads, bread, and some chips with affordable price and good size of food. The breakfast at the hotel can be done at 21st floor and enjoying NYC scenery from the downtown. It serves bagels, croissant, chocolate croissant, apple, coffee, juice, water etc. Very standard minimal for breakfast. But do not expect a warm protein being served here. Compare to other Sheraton hotel in Asia, Sheraton Tribeca are a way behind in variety of menu in breakfast. Hospitility wise just enough and efficient, like other New Yorkers. Nothing to complaint, but the one that stunning are the bell boy Fery; American Chinese who always look after and attentive to any guest at the Hotel. This is much appreciated. He asked wheather we need to storage our luggage, or looking for a taxi. he even call for the taxi from the street for us. Amazing attentiveness and create happy experience after in a "four star" hotel experience.

title: Good base to visit attractions
text:
Me and my wife stayed here for 6 nights, MTS Metro station just around the corner to get to downtown etc,
We booked a club room on 20th floor but could still hear traffic and sirens,
We had access to the club lounge or as I would call it a cafe had all the usual tea coffee bagels cheese and biscuits,
And Wine only yes wine only ???? which was a stark contrast to other Sheraton club rooms we have booked where in the lounges we had access to hot food and beers wines spirits etc,
I spoke to a member of staff and they informed me that they did serve a variety of drinks and hot food until 2 years ago which stopped because the restaurant and bar on the ground floor was loosing customers because they were eating in the club lounge and these are not even owned by the hotel ? So people who are paying extra for club access are getting short changed because of this,

Apart from this the staff were all pleasant and hotel was clean, but We would probably not visit again because of the disappointment of the facilities that accompany the cost of the club rooms.

title: The highlight of my trip was touring Soho and Chinatown! Oh and the FOOD!
text: The staff was incredible! Kudos to the HR team for hiring the vibrant and energetic staff at the lobby. I would like to acknowledge Carlos, Felita and Precious for being welcoming and helpful and incredibly kind. I had only to ask and my requests were met with prompt and satisfactory answers. They operated as a seamless team and provided an excellent guest experience. The entire team from the front of the house to the housekeeping staff was wonderful. I will definitely recommend the Sheraton Tribeca to my friends and co-workers. The rooms are very comfortable and perfect for a mini stay-cation. The staff elevated a great business trip to an awesome and unforgettable experience. Thank you, thank you, thank you! I hope to see y'all again!

title: Great as always
text:
Stayed here to attend a wedding in Brooklyn. As always this hotel was perfect... short cab to Brooklyn and near many great lounges and spots to eat. 

No complaints... plus for NYC the rooms aren’t tiny. (Not huge either but functional) 

A solid choice...

title: One nigh in NYC
text: Although we only spent 1 night at the Sheraton Tribeca, the service of the staff as well as the hotel room was great! The room was spacious enough for two and had a stunning view of the city! The bedding was fresh and the king size bed was super comfortable! The location of the hotel was good too - found it very easy to get around. Amazing experience and definitely gets a thumbs up from me!

title: Amazing place
text: Amazing staff. The hotel staff are very nice. And the restaurant staff are great :) You can’t go wrong. If the greats agree. Sting and Shaggy enjoying Antica Ristorante at the Sheraton Tribeca New York New York. Enjoy your time at the hotel.

title: Usual Sheraton
text:
Spent one night here in order to be close to meetings early next AM for business.  Property is located in Tribeca and very close to the Holland Tunnel.  Short 5 mins walk from the NYC Subway Lines A C or E.  Exactly what you expect for a Sheraton.  Guess that is good since you know what to expect and who likes surprises when traveling?  But corporate feel and lacking some pizzazz,  Price was exactly what you expect in a city in NYC.  

Great Belgium waffle place next door!  Check it out!

Hotel is great for business if you can expense the room rate but if I were to visit for pleasure, I doubt I would stay here even with SPG points.  Lots more options even within the SPG family with some character in the city,

title: Deon - Club Lounge Manager
text: My husband and I were delighted to meet Deon, the Club Lounge Manager during our stay last November.  While the actual lounge was closed for renovations, the temporary location was wonderful due mostly to Deon.  His kind, gentle, warm and friendly demeanor made our lounge visits some of the most enjoyable we have ever had as Platinum members.  Kudos to the Sheraton Tribeca for having such a wonderful and valuable employee!  Can't wait to go back!  Diane and Blake

title: Already reflect the negative experience, you said you will reply but eventually I have no follow up received
text:
Frankly speaking, the facilities of the hotel are okay. Check in staff and bell man are nice. However, when it comes to the room assignment and members recognition, its a disaster. After checking in, I found the key card holder was for Gold member, so I wondered if there was any misunderstanding as I should be a platinum and should be entitled for an upgrade to best available room (I know, subject to availability). Hence I verified with Front Office. The lady who assisted me was just arrogant and unhelpful. She didnt even ask my surname and just said: There is no upgrade available. For me, its totally fine. However her attitude was so unwelcoming. She added: there is no membership on profile in 1 second. Oh come on, there were 2 registered guests! Obviously she just checked the profile of the one who was not a member. So I stated my surname and asked her to check again, she finally confirmed that I am a platinum. This is really awful. At night, I found my room is very noisy due to the mechanical sound of the lift nearby. I should have quiet room preference on file! I called to guest service and the lady just: There is not any other room available tonight within 1 second. The lady must be very familiar with their room situation. Alright, but, how come I can still find different room type available to reserve in official website? So now I am typing this review in the noisy sleepless room.

This is all already addressed to the hotel and i am glad there is a front desk supervisor return email to say they would like to follow up. However, it is disappointing that i still not receive any reply from them. It has already been three weeks. How awful the service it is here!

title: Once again, this hotel was comfortable and accommodating!
text: I have now stayed at this hotel many times (5+) and always choose to come back for my regular business trips to NYC. The rooms are on the small size (but good for central NY) however the beds are the most comfortable I can find anywhere. I recommend taking access to the lounge as this provides a good quick breakfast and happy hour drinks in the evening. Deon who works there in the evenings is always smiling and super efficient. The hotel is well situated and the valet staff are always very helpful. I'm always happy here!!!

title: Great location
text:
Sheraton at Canal Street have a great location.
Amazing to explore dowtown, tribeca, soho, little italy and nolita.
The staf are professional and have great tips for lunch and dinner.
Confortable and new hotel!

title: Lindo hotel y Excelente ubicacion
text:
Muy buen hotel, muy bien ubicado en Tribeca, a pasos del SoHo, Chinatown, financial district, Greenwich Village, etc.
Tenes varias lineas de subte que te conectan con toda Manhattan y Brooklyn.
La habitación era perfecta, amplia, limpia. La atención era normal, cordial. No es el típico Sheraton de 5 Estrellas y lujoso pero es perfecto para tu estadía de vacaciones o negocios

title: Nice Location spacious rooms
text: We stayed here while we were in NYC with my wife. Location I'd great. Check-in was very easy. Room was very comfortable. WiFi connection was easy and good. Very good cleaning. Comfy bed. We paid for our breakfast in the morning but the breakfast quality was poor. For the money that they charge it definetly does not worth it. Parking place was really expensive. Check-out was problematic because of inexperienced staff. Overall I recommend this hotel for the room quality and location.

title: Perfect Location  for a sisters weekend in  Soho
text: This trip was a sisters weekend and we splurged and stayed in a suite with concierge access. Our suite was wonderful. Very clean and modern. And almost all of the staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. The only place that the staff was cold, not so much rude was the concierge lounge. I would say, hello or good morning with no response. But, the outstanding staff of everyone else in the hotel more than made up for it. I love this hotel and  plan on going back in October.

title: Pleasure
text: Service was wonderful. Room was comfortable and staff was accommodating. Location is extremely convenient to Holland Tunnel. Right off the Canal Street exit. Would definitely stay in this hotel again.

title: Beautiful Hotel with Great Views
text: I love this hotel.  The staff is super nice, the rooms are very roomy and comfortable and the price is reasonable. I would recommend this place for anyone visiting from out of town or just want to spend a fun night in the city.

title: Nice hotel
text: Clean and very nice hotel. The walls are a little thin. I can hear the people next door talking as if they are in my room BUT the rooms are really nice. This hotel is right next to Little Italy and Chinatown. Great location!

title: Terrible service
text: Our family of 5 is currently at the hotel in 2 adjoined rooms.  Rooms are very tight yet fine.   Each room has a small wardrobe with 8 hangers. No other spaces for clothes.  I have called the front desk 3 times asking for additional hangers for our 4 day stay.  Finally, on the 4th attempt, I was told that I asked for too many hangers and there weren't enough to go around.

title: Mediocre, functional hotel
text: The location of this hotel is great, the subway is right outside and you can get to anywhere in New York reasonably quickly. Unfortunately, when we came only one elevator was working and it was very crowded inside. The food was terrible and the breakfast looked stale. The rooms are quite small so we booked two interconnecting rooms which worked well. Don’t have high expectations for the gym either, it’s very small and not useful. However, the rooms were great and the beds were comfy. If you traveling alone and don’t mind not having luxury, you should stay here. If not, this hotel is not for you.

title: Nice place to stay
text: The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The room was a bit small, but clean and comfortable.  The only issue during our visit was that not all the elevators were working and there was usually a wait/line.  The location is near a few different subway lines.

title: Soulless, small rooms
text:
I knew that as a Sheraton it wouldn’t offer a boutique look, atmosphere or service but it was still a surprise at how lacking it was.

The very small rooms don’t contain a fridge (which for someone requiring medication to be refrigerated is an issue). I never thought to ask as it would’ve unheard of in Australia and Asia for a hotel not to have a small fridge.

The club floor was crowded and often needed cleaning as they were understaffed. Breakfast was pastries and sweet cereals and the afternoon array was dip from plastic bags and orange cheese - nothing that looked like wholesome food prepared on premise. They did serve wine which I understand is unusual.

A couple of blocks away from the trendier area.

title: Good location...
text:
Rooms are too small, and breakfast is not that good... Don't make reservation with breakfast included, it will be a waist of money...
Although the beds are of a good size, the rooms are really small, the bath rooms are old...

title: Great hotel overall, but LOSE THE BAR STAFF!!!
text:
Staying in this hotel for 3 nights went really well. Since it was my birthday we received a really nice and warm welcome from Nelson (thanks for the drinks vouchers!!). 
The room was amazing and the view most definitely! The mini bar however was empty, but free water and coffee were just fine. I really have to point out that the bed was like HEAVEN!!! We got in early all nights of our stay just because of the quality of our bed... We also had entrance to the club lounge, which was fine. I do wonder if all the guests there were allowed to make use of the lounge (annoying drunk young-adults from a few floors down also had access, though I was told only guests from the 21st floor should have access...)
The Front Office team have been super helpful all the time!! Special thanks to Felitta Hakim for working with such passion!!! Just talking to her could brighten up your entire day!! 

But... There is one thing I feel strongly disappointed about... I have never seen such negative and unwilling staff working in the hotel bar... Ordering a drink was answered by a sigh and eye roll, and we actually rather went having drinks somewhere else or take our drinks up to the room than staying there. I was told these employees are outsourced, but remember; they are also the business cards of the company!!! So PLEASE replace them by more kind and hospitable people like the guy from the Balkan (I can't remember his name well). He was the best of them all!

title: Still good but...
text:
I have stayed here more than a few times over the last few years. The location is great.  The people are great from the front desk, housekeeping, and the employees in the club lounge. Not excluding anyone else, but since I've been here a week I've noticed how hard Deon has been working during happy hour in the club lounge. He always had a positive attitude and sometimes the room was overflowing with guests. He was always moving either cleaning, serving or preparing. 

My only concern is that since I've been coming here a few years, I have noticed the quality in some areas decreasing. Specifically, the food available in the club lounge. Breakfast used to include eggs, bacon, etc. but now it is strictly stale pastries and fresh coffee not even available at 7 when they open. In the evening they used to serve beer. Now it is just wine. I was given a coupon to try the breakfast buffet. They also open at 7. I was there at 7:15 one morning and the eggs were already extremely dry and sausages burnt.  I'm hoping this isn't an example of Marriott's influence in buying Starwood. 

Again, overall a good experience but you may want to make food choices elsewhere.

title: Great location and value
text: Have stayed here before because of the location and the value. Now worth even more as they have renovated rooms. Great location for Soho, Greenwich, Tribeca, and the World Trade Center area - walked to all. Front desk and concierge were very friendly and helpful.

title: Great location
text: Stayed for a week at this excellent located hotel.Upgrade to executive room which really was a good idea.Executive lounge well run by Deon,wine and nibbles really went down well.Roberta our maid was lovely and did an excellent job.Only down side of hotel is the bar downstairs.Hard to get a drink service is not good and very drafty.

title: Great Location, mixed service.
text:
We stayed for almost one week.  Our experience was as follows;

- The location is great!  If you look at the Manhattan map, it's between the financial district and Greenwich.  Easy walk to the train/subway stations.  Short walk in one direction to China Town or the other direction to Soho where many lovely shops and restaurants are.  We explored around Soho some nights and found some great restaurants and also walked down to China Town one night. 

- During our stay, we experienced a mix of services from the staff.  I like to give a shout out to FERY WONG who works in the concierge section.  Fery's sunny and happy demeanor is contagious and he was always ready to help.  When I had an issue with a package, he went out of his way to help me and made sure the package was redirected promptly.  His warm greetings always brought a smile to our face.  

MIA at the front desk, she was always very friendly and efficient.  

The staff worked in the lounge area on 21st floor was also excellent (pity I didn't remember their names). 

Our disappointing experience was with Alexis.  As we had two separate reservations we had to switch rooms one day.  Before we went out for the day I went to check the approximate time frame we could switch the rooms.  Alexis was unfriendly and her attitude was best described as testy.  In the end what she said didn't matter but how she said it tainted the whole experience.    

- The hotel amenities are average.  The breakfast options in the lounge is very limited.

title: Not great for breastfeeding mom
text: The location is good but at this point I may have to move hotels. I am travelling for work and WEEKS ago when I made the reservation I requested a fridge to store my breastmilk that I pump. 10 days before the trip I called and made sure they have noted thay I need a fridge for my breastmilk and I was told it should be no problem. Today I get to the hotel and upon checking I verify if I have a fridge in my room. I am told that they don't have one because they are all given out but should have one by the afternoon. Fine I try to stuff my milk as much as I can in the ice hockey that can only hold one 16 oz water bottle (not fully covered) and wait till the night. At 8 pm I call and ask about the fridge and am told they don't have one and may or may not have one tomorrow. I asked to at least get a bigger ice bucket and was told I can only have the one in my room. So now my hard pumped milk is slowly spoiling as it doesnt fit in the tiny bucket any more. Will have to go out and buy a cooler so it doesnt all go to waste. For a 4 star hotel this is pathetic.

title: Great Hotel
text: This hotel is in a great location because of its proximity to Canal Street Subway station. The staff is excellent, especially Star at the front desk. She is always friendly and helpful. Deon, in the concierge lounge is superb! He really takes care of his people.

title: Muy bueno y buen precio
text: Me pareció que tiene una buena relación calidad-precio. La ubicación es buena si tienes reuniones o cosas que hacer en downtown y también tienes soho cerca para ir a comer. Si eliges pisos altos, las vistas de las habitaciones son buenas!

title: Welcoming Concierge Lounge
text: We opted for a room that gave us access to the Concierge Lounge on the 21st floor.  It was an excellent decision. We began and ended each day with a stop in the lounge, either for coffee, a snack, or a glass of wine during happy hour.  Deon, was one of the staff members who went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed.  His customer service was exceptional. He was genuinely warm and welcoming and kept the space clean, even during periods of heavy traffic flow, like happy hour.  The staff here has overall been great.

title: Best location
text: So much to love about this hotel--the location, the patio on the 21st floor, the views, the friendly staff. If they could figure out how to get the wifi to work in the rooms and step up the food at the breakfast in the Club Lounge, this place would be a 5 star in my books. But good enough that I'll be back!

title: Nice hotel and excellent Lounge
text: We loved this hotel. The hotel is close to many tourist sights such as China town, Little Italy and 9-11 memorial. We were offered a free upgrade including breakfast. Good beds and excellent Lounge thanks to Deon (picture). Ask for Sheraton Preferred at the desk.

title: Nice weekend visit!
text: I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for a weekend family visit. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable.  The staff was very help and nice. The doormen were especially kind and welcoming. I would stay there again.

title: Great Location but Average Stay
text:
Although I am not a fan of the immediate surrounding area around the hotel, it does enjoy a great location for both leisure and business travelers alike. 

If you are traveling for leisure this property is excellent for walking through Soho. It sits on Canal st. but almost corner W. Broadway and walk down and you immediately find 6th Ave. A huge plus is having a Subway stop behind the property towards Broadway Ave with access to Blue and Orange lines.

If you are a Business traveller you can easily walk to many Tribeca area office towers and also have access to Subway.

However, I did not like the property itself. Yes, its a small hotel but it felt dated and dark...almost dungeony...and although I like dark lit spaces, if its the intention of the design...don’t think its what they were going for...

As for the room, our room was facing an adjacent building that seemed to be under remodeling. Having a view to the wall of another building is quite normal in NY...but if the room is also dark and small it just adds to the feeling....of feeling cramped.

The front desk staff were very good, very attentive. So that is a big plus.

In sum, very good location, however there are other options nearby, as the property itself is a bit disappointing.

title: Great hotel, location and price
text:
I went up for the weekend to visit family that lived a block away, wow what a great location. There was everything you could want with in a few blocks.

The room was ready early at about 1 right when we got back from Katz’s deli (always my first stop in the city)

The room was fine, a nice soft bed  and pillows the manager gave us breakfast coupons since this place only really has one type of room and couldn’t get an upgrade. It’s a nice hotel in a good location for a very low price for the city. It’s not the Ritz yet nor was I expecting it either.

I will defiantly stay here again

title: Family stay for week Feb 2018
text: Stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca with my wife and children (aged 12 and 9) between 20th and 28th February, 2018.  It's fair to say the service was excellent from our late night arrival (very prompt and friendly check in) through to our departure.  I travel a lot with business and this is one of the most friendly environments I have experienced.  As pointed out by other reviews the hotel is a little tired in areas but is exceptionally clean with reasonably sized rooms for NYC.  We stayed on the club level (room 2213) with great views from our room and the lounge/roof terrace on level 21.  I can not recall meeting any member of staff who did not make the effort to speak to us and this includes maintenance, cleaners, reception and bar staff.  The lounge service was excellent and with continental breakfast and evening nibbles including wine, it seriously saved us a lot.  We were initially reticent about using the metro but it worked well with access to most lines within circa 150 metres of the hotel entrance.  We could be at Times Square in 15 minutes, Central Park in 20 minutes and it was nice to break away from busy mid town to Tribeca/Soho area at the end of the day.  I would definitely recommend......!

title: Upgrading my review because of the service
text:
I first reviewed this property shortly after it opened five years ago, and after multiple recent great experiences, I've decided to upgrade my review from 4 to 5 stars. 

The main reason for this is the service. I've found their team to be more than just service with a smile (which is obviously a great thing). On my last trip, I encountered one minor issue that's not even worth mentioning, and Mia quickly and wisely resolved it, overdelivering in the process. 

I'll look forward to staying with you again!

title: Comfortable room, great location
text:
With three tube stations just round the corner, the access to all sights is so easy. The room was comfortable and the staff very attending. However, the windows need to be updated. Staying on the 8th floor, it was impossible to have quiet. The street noise was unbearable at times. Especially during rush hours, early in the morning and around 5-8 in the evening. 
Overall, it was a good stay.

title: Pessimo
text: Hotel fatiscente, sporco, vecchio brutto. Guardi il sito è sembra di livello invece è una bufala. Colazione carissima e pessima praticamente all’ingresso dell’albergo. Camere minuscole non potevo aprire la valigia. Completamente da ristrutturare. Unica nota positiva la posizione attaccato a Soho

title: Excellent location and panaromic view but food in the club lounge was very poor
text: Next to the metro station Canal Street, so has very convenient access to JFK airport by taking A line. Upgraded to a room in the highest floor with stunning view. Club Lounge and outdoor terrace has a very good view of New York skyline. Happy hour and breakfast in the club lounge did not have any hot food items, very limited and poor. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

title: You’ll love it if you enjoy other guests entertaining your room
text:
We made a quick one-night trip into NYC. I previously lived in NYC for a decade, so I know the city and it’s hotels very well. 

We checked in and were given the keys to a room on the top (22nd) floor. We went upstairs, opened the door to “our” room...and saw it filled with another guest’s belongings. Never in my 35 years of traveling have I ever been given the key to someone else’s room. We were lucky we didn’t walk in on someone naked or get attacked for “invading” a room. 

Totally inexcusable breach of security. How can Sheraton not have a system for preventing this? 

We went downstairs to tell the front-desk clerk. She seemed not to believe us, and had no idea what to do. She quickly ran into the back office. She came out and asked us to repeat the story. She disappeared into the back office again. A different clerk came out. She checked the computer and had no explanation as to how this happened. We told her how upset we were. She apologized and said all she do was give us another room and 5,000 Starwood points.

We went up to our new room and worried the whole time that some stranger would be given a key to our room. 

Also, this hotel’s club was tiny, hot and crowded. Not worth the extra money. It might be nice in warm weather when the outdoor terrace is usable. But in winter, the club is worse than the bowels of Penn Station.

title: Godt centralt hotel
text: Meget fin og central beliggenhed på Manhattan på grænsen mellem Tribeca, China Town og Little Italy. Godt hotel til prisen. Fin morgenmadsrestaurant med tagterrasse på 21. Etage som også fungere som lounge med fri drinks og snacks fra 17 til 21

title: Wonderful Experience - Couldn't Be Happier
text: A little late to the review however as it was such a fantastic experience- better late than never! My artist and I had such a wonderful stay at the Sheraton Tribecca. The location was great and made getting around NYC easy. The facilities were all fantastic and we loved our room view. There are perhaps a couple of things that could be improved however the hospitality and energy of the staff is what would make us come back. Big shout out to the amazing - Raul, Sal + Alexis and everyone else who were so helpful and really made us feel welcome.

title: Great Hotel Centrally Located
text: Clean rooms. Pleasant staff. Quiet rooms. Convenient access to the subway and good neighborhoods. This is not the trendiest hotel and the rooms are somewhat dated, but they are clean and spacious (relatively for NYC).

title: Excelente localização e quarto espaçoso
text:
Este hotel tem uma ótima localização, ao lado de duas estações de metrô, próximo a restaurantes, bares e lojas do SoHo.
Quarto super espaçoso (raridade em NYC), cama super confortável e enorme, ótimo banheiro e amenidades.
Funcionários muito prestativos ( colocaram um berço para a minha filha dormir), simpáticos e atenciosos. 
WiFi com ótimo sinal dentro do quarto.
Nosso quarto era bem silencioso e com uma linda vista para o SoHo.

title: Comfortable and clean!
text: First time staying here and the cab ride commute to Javits was super quick! I have never had this comfortable of a bed anywhere in NYC so I’m very happy with the comfort, water pressure of the shower and cleanliness. Will def be back!!!

title: Excellent Hotel - We will stay there again
text:
This Hotel is very nice.  It has a good restaurant.  Ask about the Roof Top Terrace and Club Level Access.  The views are fabulous.  They Have a happy hour in the evening.   Don't forget to leave a tip.   Good Snacks.  

The rooms are modern - European Style and size.    There is good access to the Subway system.  Nice area with lots of things to do including restaurants.

title: Perfect Hotel
text:
Stayed here on a Saturday night for a fun night out in the city.  Great location.  Check-in was effortless, quick and pleasant.  Every employee we came in contact with at this property had a great attitude and seemed genuinely happy to be working at the hotel.  
We traveled with another couple and we both had rooms on the 7th floor next door to each other.  We both payed the same price but their room was a bit larger than ours.  Our room was small but extremely clean and very quiet. There was a coffee pot, iron and safe in the room.  Not one complaint about this place.  The elevators were always available and the bar had a great atmosphere and it was the perfect spot to start the evening.  We were each given a complimentary drink coupon at check-in which was a really nice touch.  We didn't eat at the restaurants but they looked pretty good.  The area was bustling and it was a 10 minute walk to our nightlife scene on McDougal Street.
Great stay and we would definitely return if we were in the area again.

title: Very nice hotel in downtown NYC
text:
We were very happy with this hotel stay. It's off-season (January) and the price was great! The location is right on Canal St on the west side, near the Holland Tunnel so there is a lot of traffic and outside noise. The interior is clean, comfortable, and bigger than a lot of other comparable downtown hotels. Close to subways, restaurants, shopping, and other points of interest.

I thought they had an on-site garage but I was told to pull up outside for the valet. However, the cars were stacked 3 deep and double parked into the middle and right driving lanes so it was impossible to pull over! I circled the block a few times, then gave up and found a nearby garage. 

The woman (Alexis) at the front desk was super nice. She had great positive energy, gave us two comped drinks, and a buffet ticket for breakfast. We had a room on the 10th floor with a view north, of midtown and the Empire State Building. Lovely! We requested a room away from the elevators and they were able to accommodate us. 

The room was a good size for a downtown NYC hotel room! We even had a chair to relax, a desk area, and an armoire. The bathroom was nice as well, with a shower, no tub. Be aware that you are staying on Canal St, and you can hear traffic/honking/sirens/people all night. But it's not a big deal if you travel with ear plugs/white noise apps.

It looks like there is access to a Planet Fitness next door as well! Sadly, I did not have time to go, but it is available. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Great view, good location.
text:
Sheraton Tribeca es un muy buen 4 estrellas, con bastantes puntos a favor cómo para ser una excelente alternativa a la hora de quedarte en NYC:

1.- El precio: es un hotel de buena calidad para lo barato que es, siempre considerando que estás en Manhattan, donde todo es más costoso que el resto de NY, desde ese margen, es un hotel económico.
2.- La ubicación: cuando te hospedas en un hotel donde puedes llegar caminando a varios puntos de interés turístico en una ciudad, con una estación de metro en la esquina (canal street) que a su vez te comunica a todas partes, rodeado de restaurantes de distintos tipos, tiendas de ropa, souvenirs y convenient store, puedes decir sin lugar a dudas que está muy bien ubicado, cómo es el caso de Sheraton Tribeca.
3.- La vista desde la habitación: amazing! 
4.- Staff: El personal del hotel fue cordial, educado y servicial, resolvieron con celeridad nuestras dudas e inconvenientes (ninguno con el hotel), excelente experiencia con ellos, incluso fueron simpáticos.
Luego de destacar lo mejor del lugar, detallaré lo que "cumple", sin ser extraordinario:
1.- El desayuno: Está incluido en el precio de la habitación, lo que sin duda ya es bueno, no es muy variado, pero tiene todo lo que podrías necesitar para partir bien el día, fruta, yogur, jugos naturales, café, leche, y por supuesto los infaltables wafles, (los amo!).
2.- La habitación: Es de tamaño pequeño, pero bien distribuida, cuenta con un escritorio, frigobar, y amenidades cómo agua, y café starbucks, el baño es viejo pero limpio, pequeño pero suficiente, cómo siempre he dicho, si estás en NYC, seguro en la habitación no quieres estar, cuenta con wifi pagado por día.
Punto aparte es la vista de la misma, lo mejor, mirando el Empire State, fue encantado.
El punto malo, no cuenta con estacionamiento, lo que puede complicar un poco las cosas si llegas en auto y necesitas bajar las maletas.
En resumen un buen hotel, 100% recomendado, en general de tamaño acotado lo que según el gusto puede ser incluso algo bueno, cuando vuelva a NY seguro vuelvo a este hotel.

title: Nice Rooms and Central Location
text:
Location is central as one can easily walk to the Canal street Metro station and connect to the world.
Rooms are bit dated but bathrooms were quite well done We were given a room on the 3rd floor which though at times noisy was quite spacious.
Staff was extremely polite and helpful.
Airport access- try to schedule your departure to the JFK early to avoid evening traffic congestion.

title: Great hotel and staff
text: This hotel is highly convenient for my needs, and the staff is abundantly helpful. The in-house exercise facility is a nice addition. The beds are comfortable, the bathrooms are roomy, and the rooms have a desk for those late-night workers.There are several meal options within walking distance.

title: Location Location Location
text: Super location for shopping, Soho is walking distance. We to visit friends in the West Village, great view of the Freedom tower ( may want to request a room on the scenic side of the hotel). Room was very nice, nothing over the top but had everything we needed. We stayed on the club level and LOVED the view and gorgeous outside patio. The club level breakfast was fantastic with cereals, juices and coffee, pastries - super convenient and clean. The evening happy hour and snacks were also great. I can't wait to go back in the Summer and sit outside with my wine and enjoy the beautiful skyline. Top notch service all the way around from the front desk, room service and the front restaurant and bar areas. I definitely recommend this hotel if you want to be in the Canal Street/Soho/West Village area.

title: Great experience, Good location
text: The hotel is in a favorable location in New York. You can reach the subway easily and can get to Uptown easily. The view from the balcony is absolutely stunning, and sitting there to eat your breakfast or to enjoy an evening wine is amazing. In the mornings you can eat breakfast up in the balcony area, however I think you have to book that option additionally. I'm not sure about that.

title: Weekend stay
text: It appears to be a nice hotel, but I didn't take advantage of all it's amenities. I received excellent service from the staff. The king sized room was cozy, but definitely doable for 2 people, and everything was clean. The pillows weren't that great for sleep (could only have been my room), and I had a poor view, but I was on the 4th floor facing a building so that was understandable. I live in NYC, so the area wasn't difficult to get around; close to public transportation and walkable to everything. Overall, I'd stay again.

title: Muy buena experiencia
text:
Well first at all I would like to thanks to the hotel for one of the greatest experience that I ever had in a hotel.

We have been there for 11 days so before the trip I texted the hotel asking for things to make my stay awesome. And they did it!! Just once I got there when I saw the room I was so happy!! It was so beautiful with the perfect views and the perfect floor!! They team from the front desk were so nice and the team from the Club Lounge were so friendly until the last moment. 

Next time I go back to New York I will stay with them 100% for sure!! I am really excited to go back there. 

Once again thank you so much for everything!!

SEE YOU NEXT TIME

title: Superdeal
text: At first it looks a bit "oh no!" since Canal street after all isn't the most charming street in New York, BUT This first impression is put to sleep as soon as you enter the Hotel. All internal service is warm and precise. Did not try the breakfast, but if you do, I'm sure its ok, just be aware that the hood has some brilliant offers within some minutes by foot. The location and the easy accessable public transport system and walking distance to "it all" (sounds weird, but actually true...), makes This Hotel a Great choice! And Talking about sleeping; their beds Are top quality, the rooms Are spacious, its clean... love it!

title: Pleasant triple visits at Sheraton Tribeca
text: I stayed at Sheraton Tribeca three times in January 2018. Each time I visited the king sized rooms were mostly clean, except for one of the rooms that had several coffee stains on the mattress. I have attached photos so hotel management can see them. You need to treat the stain or get a new mattress. The hotel workers were courteous, laidback, and polite. I never met a rude or grouchy employee. The club lounge service was wonderful as well. The engineers were great too. Keep up the good work Sheraton Tribeca. I will visit again and recommend your hotel to others!

title: Nova York sob novo ângula
text: Hotel da rede Sheraton localizado próximo a Wall Street e também do Soho. A avenida do hotel é muito movimentada, pois dá acesso a um dos túneis que vão para New Jersey. Portanto as vezes chegar de taxi até o hotel é difícil. Os apartamentos de frente são um pouco barulhentos. De resto o hotel apresenta acomodações típicas da cadeia Sheraton. O staff do hotel é atencioso. Há bons restaurantes nas imediações do hotel e também uma estação de metrô bem próxima.

title: Mostly good
text: Only bad part of our 5-night stay here in October:  it is not the best part of Canal Street.  BUT a very friendly and helpful staff makes up for the location.  It is very handy to several subway lines, and just north of Canal there are kinds of great shops and restaurants.  Rooms were clean.  We had a quiet room.

title: Excellent Guest Service
text:
I have been staying at the hotel for a week now, and I have been blown away by the front desk team and their connection to the guests. I had a miscommunication with when I was supposed to check out and the front desk supervisor Sal handled it with such grace and made my stay very special.

The hotel is in an incredible area, I could walk to Soho, around Tribeca and the Village from the hotel. It is a vibrant area and easy to access from Newark airport.

The rooms are no frills, but very clean and comfortable. 

I would recommend staying at this hotel to anyone coming to visit New York, especially for the staff and location.

title: What has happened to this hotel?
text: I’m a 10+ year SPG member who has stayed here 4 times, but this will be my last.  I booked 3 months ahead, but they did not advise that the rooftop or SPG floors would be closed.  We complained about a very loud party happening at 11 pm on the floor above, nothing was done.  We had asked at booking for a quiet room on a high floor, but we were put beside the icemaker and elevator on a low floor and told there was nothing they could do as I had prepaid.   The king room itself has no dresser or room for clothes besides 2 tiny shelves, and living out of suitcases on a chair for 5 nights is unacceptable.  Time for a new hotel chain, and time to dump SPG.

title: Great staff!
text: The hotel is very clean and convenient.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  Mia, the Front Office Manager, was extremely helpful at time of our arrival to ensure we were pleased and satisfied (as Platinum members).  Dion from the Club Lounge is to be commended for his excellent attention to customer satisfaction!

title: Posizione comoda e camere confortevoli
text: L'hotel è situato in una comoda posizione nella zona di Tribeca a pochi passi dalla fermata della metropolitana Canal Street e alle linee A, C, E. E' tuttavia possibile passegguare a piedi nelle zone limitrofe come Little Italy, China Town, Greenwich e in generale nella Lower Manhattan. La struttura esternamente non è curata, ma all'interno le camere sono confortevoli e dispongono del necessario. La nostra esperienza è stata positiva, la prima camera assegnataci era accanto all'ascensore rumoroso ma, segnalato il problema, la camera ci è statasostituita il giorno seguente. Il personale è gentile e disponibile. E' sicuramente una struttura che conisgliamo per chi intende visitare New York.

title: Great location and value
text: While not the poshest of hotels, the Sheraton is clean, well-managed, and a great location - close to downtown, midtown, soho, west side, tribeca without all the hassle.  Sal is awesome...make sure you meet him!  Rooms tend to be much larger than average...

title: Excellent Choice
text: I stay here for business. It is clean, updated and convenient. The staff is always courteous especially Sal, who works nights. If you want a room with less traffic noise, ask for one on the Chinatown side but event if you get one on Canal, it is not that bad relative to typical NYC hotel rooms. The restaurant, while limited in size and somewhat out in the open, has decent food too.

title: Gutes Hotel in super Lage von New York
text: Wir haben auf Empfehlung unserer  Reiseberaterin von e- hoi Reisen dieses Hotel gebucht. Zwar schon in die Jahre gekommenes Stadthotel, aber trotzdem super. Man spürte noch den Flair der Vergangenheit. Personal überaus freundlich und zuvor kommend. Zimmer war dem Preis angemessen.  Frühstück wurde als Frühstücksbuffet angeboten. Das Beste ist jedoch, dass man vom Hotel  alles fusslaufig erreichen kann. Uns hat's sehr gut gefallen.

title: Wonderful
text: My sister and I spent a night at this hotel with our daughters during the Christmas holidays .  The hotel is beautiful and has a rooftop view that is amazing ! Also, the staff was wonderful , especially Starr, she went above and beyond to make our stay amazing!

title: Another great stay!
text:
This is the second time my partner and I have stayed at this hotel!
It’s super convenient to the subway and getting into Soho, Tribeca or West Village - even easy to walk down to the Financial District!
Easy easy location, safe and in walking distance to anywhere you want to explore. 
The club room is worth paying for just so you have access to level 21 club lounge! The afternoon vinos and canapés are well worth it. 
The view is amazing too - this is our first time here in winter but in summer - the rooftop is great to sit out on and enjoy your wines. 
The rooms are getting a little outdated but you are truly only here to sleep.
It’s clean, comfortable and a good size for an NY room. 
Love our stay here and would recommend to all

title: Small clean but cold
text:
The room is clean. Better place for a short business trip.
One thing was very upsetting. We stayed on Dec 25th. The room 515 was freezing. By freezing I mean my daughter had to cover herself with a wool coat on top of the blanket. My wife and I had to wear couple of layers of clothes to feel more comfortable in a cold room.

title: Latest visit to my "favorite NYC hotel"
text: As I said in the heading, the Sheraton Tribeca New York Hotel is my "favorite NYC hotel" when I am staying in Manhattan.  This rating is based on 95% of the Associates that are based at this particular location.  The pleasure begins upon my check-in with Front Desk Associate Nelson.  Always pleasant and extremely welcoming upon my arrival.  He makes every effort to take care of my requests if it is at possible.  If not, he takes my cellphone number to call me when my room is ready.  As I have access to the Club Lounge & Terrace at this venue, I must direct my praise to the PM Associate Deon.  Again, he always has a very pleasant attitude and everytime I am staying at this location I get a very warm welcome.  He makes my feel right at home.  I have found out that the Antica Ristorante is not a part of the hotel per se.  I would just like to say that again, every one of the staff in the moring for breakfast treat me like a king.  Again, always a warm welcome.  The staff always take care of any special requests that I may have and the overall service is superb.  On my next stay and review that will follow; I will make a better effort to include all of the names of everyone that treats me so well.  As I said, there is not one Associate that does not go out of his or her way to make my stays a total pleasure.

title: Awesome view from the 21st floor terrace
text: Comfortable bed, nice linens, hot shower, club level, complimentary breakfast and cocktails, pretty much all we could ask for for only one night. On top of that, very friendly staff. Easy spot to grab a cab on Canal and convenient to several neighborhoods.

title: Another great stay
text:
This was at least our 15th stay at the Sheraton TriBeCa.  We arrived early for our weekend reservation and they were unable to give us a room.  Usually they have one put aside for us, but we were prepared to explore the city anyway, so off we went.

Returned around 11PM and they gave us a slightly larger room than normal (normal rooms here are TINY), with extra room to spread out and lounge access.  The lounge food at night and in the morning are not what they once were, but it's nice to have the option, and the open air roof deck is always a treat.

title: Gutes Hotel in zentraler Lage
text:
Das Hotel liegt an der Canal Street in Tribeca, d.h. "zwischen" Downtown und Midtown. An der Canal Street fahren 3 verschiedene Subway Lines, man erreicht alle wichtigen Sehenswürdigkeiten komfortabel.
Wir wurden in ein Club Level Zimmer upgegraded. Das Zimmer war im 21. Stock mit tollem Blick aufs Empire State.
Wenn man Club Level Zugang hat, bekommt man morgens ein kleines Frühstück (Kaffee, Saft, Croissants, Muffins), abends Wein und Häppchen und ganztägig Softdrinks.

title: Prima hotel
text:
Uitstekend hotel met prima prijs/kwaliteit verhouding via booking.com
Vraag hoge etage met uitzicht over de stad Empire State building in de verte.Vlak bij the Village en Chinatown. Veel Subway lijnen vlakbij.Vriendelijk personeel.Tribeca Bagels. ( 24 uur per dag geopend!)voor ontbijt naast hotel.Gewone kamers 23 m2.
.

title: Soggiorno Indimenticabile
text: Grazie ad una ottima offerta ho prenotato l’hotel per due settimane prima del natale. Situato in una posizione strategica potrete spostarvi in qualsiasi direzione tra subway e a piedi. L’eleganza, la pulizia e la cortesia di questo Hotel mi ha fatto ricredere su tante esperienze fatte in altre strutture dello stesso livello(stelle). Consiglio assolutamente questa struttura per qualsiasi tipo di esigenza.

title: Small but beds comfortable and staff awesome
text: The room was small but there were 3 of us.  The beds were comfortable which is what is most important to us.  The staff were very helpful and awesome.  Rooms were clean.  The only thing was the stopper in tub did not work but they were willing to send a repairman or change rooms so not really a problem.  Would stay here again.

title: Breakfast not included
text: In all honesty the hotel is perfect! But I’m so annoyed today as I’ve paid for breakfast and for two days they have been fine but today they have tried telling me I hadn’t paid for it in my package when I have paperwork stating it from booking.com!! The funny thing is that there’s an advert on trip adviser from booking.com for this hotel saying breakfast included hahaha. They put me on the phone to booking.com but to be honest I’m unsure it was actually them. I just had some American women refusing to talk to me about the situation!! If this is the case I won’t stop at management!! All in all the situation had been handled poorly and as it’s only buffet style breakfast they should just offer it me anyway. This is my first review I’ve ever done I’m that annoyed !! Room 1808 if you’d like to rectify the situation before I leave on Xmas day I’m more than happy for that to happen and I will remove my review. Failing that once I have confirmation of breakfast a bill will be sent for $22 per person per day for the breakfast I haven’t received

title: My home away from home
text:
I have been coming to this hotel for a year, now. I truly appreciate the professionalism of the staff. In the club lounge, Jason, Steven, and Deon take excellent care of me on every visit. (Three in the past 12months). Dionne is a welcomed addition to the club lounge service staff.  
Raúl the bellman takes care of my luggage as if it were his own! I can't forget to mention some welcomed additions to the front desk. May in management is always smiling! Colin takes care to thank guests by name! (I LOVE THAT!) Sal and Alexis make sure your every concern is addressed.
Last but not least, Roberta in housekeeping made certain that my stay was comfortable.
With new faces since my last visit, I was slightly apprehensive. This staff has gone above and beyond! I am wowed and excited to return. Great job Sheraton!

title: Great stay — perfect location — top notch staff!
text:
I stayed here for business. As an SPG member, I booked on points. I then called the hotel & received excellent service from TRINA. On arrival, everything met my expectations. DEON & STEPHEN are great Club Lounge hosts.  COLIN, STAR, SAL and others at the Front Desk and Door were pleasant & offered assistance as needed. 

Hotel is located right near subways. Easy to get to Times Square / Broadway. Top restaurants just blocks from the hotel.  

Upgrade to the Club Lounge. Lots of amenities — continental breakfast, beverages, snacks throughout the day & nightly wine & hors d’oeuvres from 5:30 - 7:30. Fantastic views of NYC from the Lounge & Patio. 

Already booked a return trip to arrive on Christmas Day!

title: Lovely Room in a great spot in Manhattan!
text:
The Sheraton Tribeca was the perfect place to stay in Manhattan! More perfect than I could have planned.

The staff were fantastic! We flew into NYC on a red eye flight from Las Vegas with our 23 month old son. We were all exhausted and really wanting to get into our room, despite knowing that we weren’t due to check in. The lady at the front desk was lovely, she said that housekeeping had just got in but was organizing our room to be cleaned first so we could get into with our little one and get some rest & freshened up. It was a lovely gesture and made for the perfect start to our stay.

Housekeeping were great in promptly bring us a crib and an extra pillow for our son. The hotel had everything you needed! It was close to walking distance to SOHO and Little Italy. It was quite central in my opinion to get around Manhattan. The hotel staff were brilliant and more than helpful with holding baggage and even organized a car to take us to New Jersey when checking out and going to pick up our rental car! 

Thank you to the whole team for a lovely stay! Looking forward to staying again in future!

title: Ottima vista, ma situato in zona poco frequentata
text:
L’hotel è situato tra Tribeca e Soho e ad un paio di km a ovest da china town e little Italy.
Abbiamo scelto una camera con vista panoramica e non ce ne siamo pentiti (18 piano)
La struttura è a due passi dalla metro blu linea ACE e a circa 400 metri dalla linea gialla, ma la sera la zona è un po’ desolata e poco servita. 
Le stanze sono abbastanza pulite con cambio di biancheria (asciugamani) ogni due giorni.
Personale abbastanza gentile. 
Per quanto si paga, si trovano hotel di pari livello in zona più centrale (midtown).
Buon viaggio a tutti.

title: Terrible maintenance, needs improvement
text:
I hardly ever write reviews, but I felt like our stay at the Sheraton Tribeca so  unpleasant I had to address it. I booked this hotel at a premium price thinking I would get at least a decent experience. Our heater in our room was broken when we got in, it’s the peak season of winter. Our room keys suddenly did not work, which was annoying since we had to go back down after just receiving them. One of the nights, we had to wait 15mins for an elevator because Two out of the three elevators were not working. The bed we slept on was slumped to the point we could feel the springs against our backs when laying down. We requested a new bed, but they required us to move at the moment (We had dinner reservations) or else they could sell that other room. We ended up being late to our dinner reservation and had to wait even longer, throwing off our plans.
 
On the positive side, the place is clean(expected), the front door gentleman’s were very nice/accommodating and location is nice. I’ve stayed in many Sheraton hotels, but this one just did not meet the standard of a Sheraton hotel. It’s all the little things that were annoying that could’ve been solved with simple maintenance.

title: Fine hotel, poor service
text:
My travel companions selected this hotel for its location and SPG affiliation.  Rightly so, the location is good.  Close to three different Metro lines with walk-able entertainment while being outside of the insanity of midtown.  Unfortunately, this is a substandard Sheraton.

Check in was completed by a very friendly agent (the only good service I had).  However, my SPG status was not recognized nor was I offered an upgrade (the hotel was not full). The rooms are standard NYC rooms, small but comfortable.  The hotel is clean as would be expected at a Sheraton.  Before heading out for then evening, we wanted to enjoy some cocktails at the hotel bar.  Enjoyment was not possible.  The bartender was rude, barely seemed to care we were there and seemed annoyed every time we ordered a drink.  The tab was extremely expensive ($25 for a double vodka and soda), which I can understand due the location, but I would expect the service to match price. 

The next morning comes around and I was woken by slamming doors and chatter, which went  on for hours.  Again, as expected in NYC, noise does occur; this was excessive.  It turns out the problem is twofold, 1. My neighbors were coming and going all morning, and 2. The room attendant staff is loud and my room was positioned next to service elevator and entrance.

While cleaning rooms, the attendants come in and out of a room, allowing the door to slam each time and not propping the door open.  I called down to the front desk requesting to move.  The agent on the line was rude, did not apologize, offered no compassion or compensation, telling me I was already on the quiet side of the hotel.  When I requested to move anyways, the agent sounded exasperated and put me hold.  I was given a new room, however I would have to go to the front desk to get the keys.  

My new room was similar to the previous, as expected, except it includes old towels with holes and frays.  Also unfortunate was that the noise and slamming doors of the room attendants was not better. Overall, the hotel is fine.  But the service, lack of attention to detail and treatment of customers is borderline terrible.  I get the impression that management does not care or is not present.

About the reviewer:
36 year old single male, well-travelled American.  Marriott Reward Platinum, SPG Platinum and lifetime Gold, American Airlines Executive Platinum.  Frequent user of the Marriott Rewards Visa Signature and American Express Platinum cards.

title: Great location
text:
I stayed here for a night and the room was very comfortable. Staff at check-in were awesome and I had used the SPG app for mobile check-in so was able to pick up my key and head to my room within a few minutes.
Very close to Canal Street station so easy to get around, very quiet in the room.

title: Club Level!
text:
The view is great on the Club Level deck!  

Great staff!  Deon is a particularly excellent and fun in the Club Lounge!  

My wife and I also appreciated the location in that there is easy access to great places & transportation.

title: Great service and very friendly, but rooms are not anything special.
text: Thank you, Sal & Nelson for the warm welcome after arriving late last night. Extremely friendly and was very professional but more importantly personable. Thank you for the making my experience so welcoming!

title: Deon Club Level
text: Great staff. Deon who served at the club level went beyond others. He was very friendly and made sure everyone there was satisfied. The young lady who served at the dining area was very helpful and did what she could to keep us satisfied.

title: Excelente ubicación. No es un Sheraton 5 estrellas. Personal que deja mucho que desear
text:
Lo mejor de este hotel: la ubicación. En el límite entre TriBeCa y SoHo, con Chinatown a 1 cuadra, se puede ir caminando a muchas de las atracciones de la ciudad, como Ground Zero, Oculus, Battery Park, Washington Square y todo el bajo Manhattan. 

Es importante saber que no es un hotel de 5 estrellas, como la mayoría de los Sheraton. Es un 4 estrellas con limitaciones: habitaciones pequeñas sin frigobar, desayuno no incluído (U$S 55 extra por día !!).
La cama es muy cómoda, hay una cafetera con café de Starbucks para prepararse en la habitación y todos los días te dejan una botellita de agua mineral. 

Otro punto a destacar: el personal deja mucho que desear. Muy amables, siempre hay uno diciendo "Hi!" cada vez que pasás por el lobby, pero no les pidas que resuelvan problemas o cuestiones prácticas. En nuestro caso, la cafetera de la habitación perdía agua y hubo que llamar 3 veces y esperar cerca de 1 hora para que alguien venga a cambiarla. Un día volvimos a la tarde y no habían hecho la habitación: llamadas reiteradas, promesas de que venían enseguida pero no aparecía nadie, tuvimos que bajar hasta la recepción y pedir con cierta vehemencia para que surtiera efecto el pedido.

title: Great staff, ok room, horribly overpriced, ridiculous that you have to pay extra for Wifi
text: Staff great, room ok, clean and fine. But, come on. Paying $10 for 24hrs wifi? Idiots! Why not charge for water and electricity as well? About time you realise it's 2017 and not 1977. Last time I'll stay with you until you get your act together. Luddites!

title: Weekend In NYC
text: Great location friendly and helpful front desk. We were on the 3rd floor facing Canal Street - there was a lot of road noise (horns and car alarms) all night. But overall a good place to stay.  Breakfast was quite reasonable for the area.

title: Posizione impagabile
text: Abbiamo approfittato di una buona promozione per soggiornare a New York una settimana, sinceramente la soddisfazione è andata oltre le aspettative. Posizione fantastica per poter visitare la grande città, camere nella norma ma un panorama dal terrazzo della louge al 21 °piano da togliere il fiato.

title: Un séjour agréable.
text: Hôtel idéalement situé. Proche de Little Italy et Chinatown donc des restaurants. Métro accessible à 1 min à pied de l'hôtel et desservant facilement et rapidement Brooklyn et Times square. Personnel très accueillant et surclassement lorsque nous avons annoncé que nous étions en lune de miel. Chambre très spacieuse donc. Petit déjeuner correct mais peu varié, malgré la terrasse et la belle vue pour y prendre le petit déjeuner.

title: Great service a feature
text: We don’t have the highest expectation of personal service in a busy New York hotel. But somehow the Sheraton Tribeca is an exception to the rule. Starting with manager at reception Sal and his  wonderful offsider Janilsa we’ve really received excellent service here. Our room while not big is not too small and we’ve fitted in all our bags full of our recent shopping. The walk-in shower we requested was waiting for us. Wonderful. There is a coffee maker in the room. We requested a kettle for tea and it was delivered within 5 minutes.  And not by someone holding their hand out for a tip. If this is the part of town you want then it’s great value and highly recommended

title: Reasonable priced good standard hotel
text:
Recently had a thanksgiving break at the Sheraton Tribeca.  The rooms were of good standard comfy beds and quiet,  no street noise could be heard,  we didn’t have the best view that’s in all the images of the hotel that comes with the $30 price for access to a club room it was a picture I wanted and not the food or drink on offer we found out on asking where the balcony access was the only downside that wasn’t really clear that the lounge access and balcony access are one of the same.

So I saved my $30 and used the money to go up to the top of the rockerfeller centre instead.

Overall a good experience for the price paid and staying out of the madness of midtown this time in NYC made me love the city and this new location a little bit more

title: Quiet, clean and on Canal St
text:
My wife and I decided on a quick trip to NYC but wanted to try to score as much as possible on points.  We had some SPG points saved and the only or one of the few properties we could apply our points was the Sheraton Tribeca.  

We went for this since we had been to NYC numerous times but never experienced this area -- so for us, it was a cool first.  Some cool shopping spots are about 10-15 min away on foot and other places we wanted to see like the Brooklyn Bridge were about 20 minutes. 

The property was decent -- quiet, clean and not overwhelming.  Staff was attentive, friendly, courteous and knowledgeable about the area.  A few spots nearby to get food, beverages, quick meals, etc... Fitness space was small (3 treadmills which were full) but pretty standard for a property of this size.

Elevators were a bit slow and not every staircase allowed you to exit on the first floor so it took a few minutes regardless.  

Overall, a nice stay in an area we never experienced so it was much appreciated.  Not the most aesthetically pleasing property but perfect for this quiet (and cheap) getaway we were looking for.

title: We Enjoyed the Sheraton Tribeca
text:
My family and I stayed in a Club Double Room for three nights and we had a great visit overall.  I would describe the Sheraton Tribeca as a mid-range hotel, with average-size rooms and amenities.  It is perfect if you are looking for an economical place to stay, that is modern, clean, and has friendly staff.

Check-in:  At the front desk Kaylene (I'm pretty sure that was her name!) greeted us and helped us get checked-in.  Although we were early, and our room wasn't ready yet, Kaylene made sure we had access to the Club Lounge so that we could go ahead and have breakfast.  Fantastic!  We checked our bags with the bellman, ate, and went out for several hours to explore the neighborhood.  We returned later to pick up our luggage and headed up to our room on the 19th floor with a fantastic view.  

Club Lounge:  On our first night we also made it back in time for the nightly Hors d'ouevres in the club lounge.  Now, I realize that Hors d'oeuvres is a fancy french word, but you shouldn't really expect fancy, French (or otherwise fancy) food; again, this is a mid-range, economical hotel.  What you will find are a good selection of cheeses, crackers, chips, dips, fruit and, most importantly, wine!  Perfect for us, and we actually had "dinner" at the club lounge several evenings during our stay.  And I want to add that Deon, who staffs the club lounge in the evening, provided excellent service.  He's very friendly and helpful, and can get you what you need if something isn't available that should be.

The lounge space is actually very small, and does get crowded.  But it is attached to a fantastic rooftop area that is pretty cool to visit (weather permitting). The lounge is open 24/7, and always has water, pop, and milk stocked.  Snacks may or may not be available depending on what time of day it is.

Room:  Our room seemed normal-sized to me.  We had a decent view (not sure which direction) and the beds were comfortable and clean.  We did discover two issues with the room once we were a few days into our stay.  First, the tub drain was very slow, which meant that water backed up during a shower.  It got to the point that we would turn it off to let the water drain out before continuing with our shower.  Second, the dehumidifier fan in the bathroom was not working.  So the room often ended up being super-humid and hot after several people showered.  And the shower curtain was not completely drying and had a smell to it as a result.  We had to keep the air conditioning blowing to solve the problem.  So, you might want to check your shower/bathroom fan before settling in.  We'd been there for a few days already so we just tried to make it work.

Neighborhood.  It's Tribeca folks.  Not Times Square.  Not Central Park West.  Not kiddieland.  If you need something to do the best tip is to research the neighborhood before you go and plan out your activities accordingly.  To me, it really wasn't a "walk outside your hotel and find all these amazing things to do" kind of area.  And if you end up walking the few blocks down the street towards Chinatown, yes, you will absolutely run into some sketchy characters (and maybe get a contact high).  But, that could happen anywhere in NYC, or probably your 'hood too.  If you're into artsy stuff, there's lots of independent artist spaces, pop-up shops, boutique clothing/furniture spaces a few blocks over.  If you want to do serious shopping, there's a great mall at One World Trade Center that is partly underground and partly above ground where the designer stores are located.  There are two playgrounds that are fairly close but we only had time to visit the one at Pier 21.  My kids had a great time there and even jumped into a pick-up basketball game.  There were sit-down restaurants but we didn't go to any.  We did visit the Black Burger (a tiny burger joint), which was just aiight, and Billy's Bakery for some cupcakes and brownies, which were good.

Staff:  I've already mentioned Kaylene and Deon.  There were a few bellmen and another front desk person who were great as well.  Was everyone perfect?  No.  Was the cleaning lady a little cranky?  Yes.  But I cut her some slack because I had to bother her for like 17,000 towels after one of my kids got sick and I understand that she probably wasn't expecting to use all the towels on her cart in my one room.  :) Overall, people were friendly and happy to help us get the things we needed.

Whew!  In sum, have realistic expectations for the price you're paying and the neighborhood you're staying in, and you will enjoy this hotel.  I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

title: Bellman Carlos when above and beyond
text:
I travel about 60 nights a year.  I've never had a Bellman this helpful.  I admitted to him I was to timid to jump out and grab a cab on the NY streets - people kept stealing them from me.  Carlos walked 1/2 a block and got in the middle of the street for quit some time trying to snag one for me.  I really appreciated that.  Who knows how long I would have been at that corner!

Overall hotel is good.  Was on top floor and elevators were very slow.  The blinds did a good job cutting out the light, but didn't shut completely so it was hard to sleep with the shard of light hitting the bed.   Clean, spacious rooms for NYC.  Exec lounge is nice with a beautiful view, but the breakfast was pretty sad.

title: Vista impagabile
text: Ho trascorso dieci piacevolissimi giorni in questa struttura. Ho però scelto stanza con vista panoramica su Manhattan con letto king. Stanza spaziosa, letto comodissimo e vista davvero mozzafiato. Posizione ottima a pochi passi dalla metro, silenzioso di notte (a differenza delle strutture più centrali). Wi-Fi gratuito nella hall con 4 computer a disposizione dei clienti gratuitamente.

title: Great location and great staff
text: The location is great to walk around to get a quick bites and a couple of minutes walk to catch a subway.  The room is fine and a bit small but understandable. It is in New York! The staff there are very friendly.  Deon was awesome.  We will stay here again.

title: Perfect for a business trip
text:
I️ stayed here for 2 nights on business. As a gold spg member I️ was given club access. 

Check in was easy. My room was fine - clean , good WiFi, quiet for nyc. Gym was adequate although I️ suggest running along the water I️ f you can. 

Location is great for tourists too. 

Checkout was easy. We toook hotel car instead of cab to lga. Much cleaner and nicer.

title: Great Property and Location
text:
U would probably walk by the property at first glance.  Very comfortable; excellent staff! Sal and Mai were awesome.  Christie and May, bellman David real nice. 

The Sheraton Club Host Deon is a true host! Will refer my friends and business associates to the Hotel. Thank You!

title: New York City Shopping at SoHo
text: My family and I love this hotel. What a Gem for New York. I can’t say enough about the staff. They were top notch and above everyone else in the area. We checked in at around three in the afternoon and was greeted by a polite young man. Sorry I forgot his name. When we got to our room, it was definitely a wow factor. The view that we had was so spectacular that my two kids were all smiles. Never mind the wife. She was just taking it all in and loving every minute of it. We were on the 22nd floor at The Presidential Suite so we got to use The Club Lounge on the 21st floor. The drinks and snack in the club lounge was decent. The free appetizers at night was a nice touch. Now to the area that we were in. It was the best hotel for what we needed to do. SHOPPING!!!!! SoHo is just around the corner from this beautiful hotel. So my new word that my two boys taught me is HypeBeast. What is it you might ask? Well it means whatever kids or pop culture wears for there style. You follow suit to what there wearing too. So there are plenty of stores around there for that type of clothing. But it comes with the price tag. $$$$$$$$$$$$$ the stores that are around there is BBC, Palace, Stadium Goods, Off White, Nike Lab, Supreme and KITH. And we went to all of them and spent a lot of $$$$$$$$$$ doing so! We will be back to this hotel in the early future. Thanks for a very memorable time in New York!!!!! P.S. I wish I remember the other guys name that upgraded us to The Presidential Suite. Thanks My Man!

title: Good - but not great. Don't bother with club level
text:
We stayed here for a few days while my daughter was attending a dance intensive. Our experience with New York is really limited so I had no idea about the area. The hotel is super close to the trains - maybe 2 blocks - so that was super convenient. We didn't realize under a day or two in that if we walked in the other direction, we would be in a much nicer neighborhood - live and learn.

I will say that we upgraded to the club level and that was a tremendous waste of money. We went up for appetizers every night and there was basically just crumbs. Same with breakfast - a could of sad bagels and bruised fruit.  They didn't even have waters laying out for us to take - we had to ask for them and then they were the tiny, child sized bottled water. It certainly was the most poorly stocked club level I've ever stayed on.

The room was nice sized and the bed was super comfy. I would absolutely stay here again, I would just save my $$ and skip the club level.

title: Convenient location, great club lounge!
text: We stayed 3 nights here in November 2017 during the NY Marathon. This hotel is convenient to all the major attractions, as well as near to numerous subway lines. Please note that at the time we stayed here there were quite a few people selling knock-off handbags and watches along Canal Street near the hotel. This was quite unnerving at first, but all you have to say is I'm not interested and keep on walking, and they stop heckling you. We stayed on the club level and had access to the club lounge which offered sodas, snacks, coffee and tea 24 hours a day. From 7 am until 10 am they offered continental breakfast, and from 5:30 pm until 7:30 pm they offered hors d'oeuvres and wine, all of which were very tasty! While talking to the gentleman setting out the hors d'oeuvres, he offered us a complimentary pass to enjoy the breakfast buffet the next morning in the lobby, such an awesome gesture from a dedicated employee!😊 And finally the view from the club lounge and rooftop deck are AMAZING! We would definitely stay here again!

title: Good location, excellent service
text: We went driving from Miami and it was a great experience to rest comfortable in this hotel. We had a lot of options of restaurants to dine nearby as well as a great shopping area with exclusive brands. Walking to the world trade center or Brooklyn bridge is easy. At night the best is to walk to the village were all the jazz clubs are located. The staff is very nice and helpful to provide directions, ideas and were to find things around. They were really super friendly making us feel at home and enjoying every moment we spend there.

title: Doesn't do service to the Sheraton Brand Name
text:
We stayed in the hotel for 15 days in August 2017.
Positives:
1. Location: Pretty much in the middle of all action in New York; very close to Holland Tunnel, and walking distance from many of the tourist spots of the city.
2. Staff attitude: Friendly, unobtrusive and prompt attendance to requests
3. City view: Excellent view of the city from the rooms on the upper floors.
4. If one just wants to stretch one's legs a bit and don't care much about other comforts, this is a decent place to go to.
Needs improvement:
1. Rooms and decor: Badly need facelift.  
2. Maintenance: Purely business-like and no effort to give a thought to what could be done to make the stay a bit more pleasant.  Least impressive.  In the 15 days that we stayed, not once were the bed linen changed.  No attempt to study our habits/likes/dislikes and structure the service accordingly.
3. Breakfast: A rip-off.  Package said breakfast is included.  What we found was a lounge-based cold breakfast offer, just packaged cereals, croissants and coffee vending machines.  Even fruits were missing.  There was no kitchen so you won't get cooked food.
4. Price: The hotel is definitely cheaper compared to the other hotels in the vicinity, but only after staying there did we realize why.  Having said that, the price definitely wasn't worth the experience we had.  We shouldn't have gone by the brand name of Sheraton.  The hotel certainly didn't live up to it.

title: Location is good.  Very expensive for what it is
text:
The hotel in general is quite old.  The rooms are dated.  The bed was comfortable.  I believed that we had B&B but no-one could confirm to me if breakfast was included in my deal, in the end I gave up as the breakfast looked a bit rubbish and went to some of the excellent restaurants locally (Bubby's and Antique Garage get a plus from me).  My girlfriend was sick one day and I got charged $45 for a bowl of rice and a ginger drink.
Location is pretty good with nice cafe's.

title: tolle Lage im Süden Manhattans
