text: Wir waren nun schon häufiger in diesem Hotel. Einer der großen Vorteile ist die Lage an der Canal Street und somit fußläufig an 5 der Metro-Linien (rot/blau/gelb/grün/braun). Mit der blauen Linie (unmittelbar am Hotel) kann man sehr bequem zum Flughafen JFK fahren. Fußläufig kann man in der Gegend auch sehr viele Ziele erkunden, z.B. Ground Zero samt One World Observatory und Soho. Das Hotel ist leider etwas in die Jahre gekommen, daher nur 4 Sterne. Die Zimmer sind für New Yorker Verhältnisse durchschnittlich groß. Der Service an der Rezeption und beim Concierge ist immer sehr nett und freundlich! Wir kommen wieder!

title: The most reasonably priced hotel in the Tribeca area, but don't expect miracles.
text: Have stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca on 2 occasions within the last 5 months.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The rooms are quite small and, as with many NY hotels, the lighting leaves much to be desired.  The location would be my main reason to stay there again.  During my most recent stay, the air conditioning failed on the 3rd floor.  By 3AM, my room was very warm and humid making a good night's sleep impossible.  My prior stay was much more comfortable.  Overall, the hotel itself is nothing special, but the staff was engaging and helpful.

title: Thank you Sal!
text:
A very enjoyable 8 night business trip at the sheraton tribeca with special thanks to Sal who was very friendly, attentive and took care of our every need.
The hotel clean, comfortable and is located in a convenient area with four subway stations nearby and 5 mins walk to the trendy areas of soho, little Italy, Chinatown and close to ground zero / world trade center.
Looking forward to my next stay!

title: Great Staff
text: I chose the hotel based on price, location and my membership in SPG. It's not that fancy from the outside but I was greeted by the bellman who could not possibly have been more helpful. The airline had torn a wheel off my suitcase and I needed a new one: boom. He gave me directions and also suggestions for clothes, that I desperately needed to buy. I got a room upgrade and it was a nice size and quiet. Every employee I encountered was outstanding. The black mark was the restaurant. I'd also factored in the Italian restaurant when choosing the hotel, and the menu that I'd looked at on-line.  It looked fantastic. But when I got my chicken dish, it was inedible. All I could think was Podiatrist Convention rubber chicken. It had some yellowish sauce on it and the asparagus was chopped into little pieces so it looked like it was covered in pickles. I will most definitely stay here again and I will most definitely avoid the restaurant.

title: A pleasant stay in an excellent location
text:
The location if very good, on Canal St. across the street from SOHO, and at walking distance to Greenwich Village, Little Italy and China town.
Confortable rooms. The place has a Sturbacks in the lobby and place for breakfast and dinner close by at Tribeca.

title: Club lounge / Steven
text: Just to note that Steven Hemlall and all the lounge staff do a great job in extremely cramped quarters. It's not easy to keep restocking and refilling while a dozen hungry people mill around you and he did so with efficiency and good humor.

title: Excelente opción
text:
Primero voy a destacar la gran atención de sus empleados. Amables, simpáticos y atentos a todas nuestras necesidades con una respuesta inmediata. Tanto Corey que tomó nuestra reserva, como Deion del Club Lounge fueron sobresalientes!
El hotel está cerca de todo, al lado del metro y rodeado de los barrios más lindos de Manhattan para ir caminando. Muy limpio y con habitaciones amplias, un privilegio estando en NY. Recomiendo sumar el pase al Club Lounge donde ofrecen snaks las 24 hs. y vino durante la tarde/noche.

title: Não há como não gostar!
text:
Excelente não significa perfeito. Aqui é algo muito pessoal de minha estadia. 
Funcionários prestativos.
With free
Optei pelo Clubleval: Inclui buffet pequeno almoço, bebidas no período da tarde (o que faz a diferença em NY), com pratos quentes, etc. 
Quarto confortável.
localização muito boa, com uma estação de metro bem ao pé.
Vários cafés e lojas bem próximos.

title: Parents Day @ NYU
text:
This hotel was a value for the rate charged, considering it is in the Tribeca neighborhood. I must admit, usually every other place we go, hotel rooms are a bit larger. This hotel was very convenient and was within walking distance to most of the venues we had to go to,

The staff was very attentive and Sal, who checked us in was very personable and always had a hello and a wave during our 4 night stay,  We had an issue with our first room, and it was changed the next day with no fuss or bother

title: Club Lounge / Deon
text:
I have been going for years, and their lounge was one of the attractions.  In the evening, a great terrace with Hot food and complementary alcohol (Wine & Beer).  First they killed the hot food and replaced it with processed gmo infused cold cuts (yes, in NYC!).  Now they killed the beer....only wine.

The ONLY thing that makes the lounge worthwhile now is that they have kept Deon as the guardian of the lounge.  He is the hotel's true ambassador.  Hope the management is taking care of him.....he goes the extra mileS!!!

title: Localização
text: Muito boa localização, perto de estações de metrô e muito perto de diversos pontos turísticos. O quarto que ficamos no oitavo andar é razoável, sem frigobar. Ficamos 7 dias, foi ok. O atendimento é excelente e ainda ganhamos dois dias de café da manhã. Foi legal chegar cansado depois de andar o dia inteiro e poder tomar uma cerveja no bar do hotel que sempre estava bem movimentado.

title: Nice location, great staff and comfortable
text:
This was our first time to NYC and wanted to see all the great history and landmarks. We chose the Sheraton based on location, price and reviews. 

The hotel is easy to get to from Newark using either uber or the subway system. We took uber from airport and regretted it...Traffic is horrible and the drivers are scary. The subway and train was easy on the way back to Newark and took about 35min. There are 2 subway entrances on the back side of the hotel. It was nice so you don't have to wheel luggage to far.

We walked to Chinatown, Little Italy and the 911 memorial. We took the subway up to central park and times square bc it would have been to far of a walk both ways.

Hotel staff is amazing! Super helpful with directions etc. The 21st floor is a great view and the breakfast and coffee in am was nice. There are several coffee/bfast places within a block of hotel as well.

We had a king bed on 10th floor and was happy. The room was a nice size and super clean. Bed was comfortable and the noise was tolerable at night. Mostly the honking and traffic was during day which didn't matter to us. There is a bar/restaurant in the lobby. The food was amazing and the tap beers were cold!

title: WOW Service and Location
text: After reading reviews of this location prior to our arrival I was not disappointed.  Every positive review previously written was right on point.  The staff provided excellent service the bed was comfortable and location was perfect. This is definitely out of the hustle and bustle of Manhattan yet the Subway is easily accessible and a quick ride to Time Square or the water front.  We were checked in by Janilse who was professional and knowledgeable.  The front desk staff for the duration of our stay were friendly and ready to assist.  We did not introduce ourselves to each one personally but that didn't matter since it felt like weve known them forever.  In the evening Sal always had a pleasant smile and answered any questions and assisted with any room concerns or food options.  This hotel is conveniently located in the Tribeca area and our room was well appointed (BEST BED EVER the Sheraton bed was AMAZING) and faced Canal street. I highly recommend upgrading to the Club Lounge where you have beautiful views, sunrises and sunsets and another FANTASTIC STAFF member of the Sheraton DEON performed his duties exceptionally.  In the evening he serves delicious snacks and various wines plus sodas and water.  The Club Lounge also serves a continental breakfast and is available 24 hours a day with snacks, sodas water fruit etc. and did I mention the VIEW ...Fabulous!  We head out on October 23rd for a cruise and Carlos our bellman helped us to arrange transportation to Bayonne NJ. (This was a welcome service since 5 years ago we left our hotel via taxi to Bayonne and the taxi driver got lost. Big Bucks for that trip.) We chose this location since its close to the Holland Tunnel and it is closer to Bayonne.  If you want a great room and exceptional service book the Sheraton Tribeca.

title: Clean and comfortable- friendly staff
text:
We’ll stay here again. Every person we interacted with was helpful and friendly. They accommodated our early arrival and held our bags after we checked out. 
The room was clean and updated. Very comfortable bed and space for NYC.

title: Normal hotel
text:
It is a normal hotel, the reception is cool and the rooms are old, the positive point is that is close to little Italy and China town if you are aiming for Chinese food,massage or do you nails.
There are better boutique hotels at the same area.

title: decent location in a busy city
text: This was my first time staying at the Sheraton Tribeca -it was in a good location for restaurants and out of the main hustle and bustle of Manhattan.   The room was on the small size but very comfortable overall.   Staff was very helpful

title: Good location nice hotel
text: One nighter - nice room although pretty tight !  But that's manhattan. Nice amenities and locations great for subways and getting anywhere in lower NYC. Couple small things.  NO Water cooler in gym. That's a must and a no brainer.  Shower head was pathetic...  all else good

title: Helt greit
text: Rommet var helt greit. En del støv. Vegg til vegg teppe. Tett sluk i dusjen og noe støy fra trafikk. God service. 10$ for wifi pr døgn. 30$ for frokost og tilgang til utsiktspunkt. Nær Canal St Subway st.

title: A wonderful experience
text: We, 2 adults + a teenage daughter, stayed at Sheraton Tribeca from 2 - 9 October 2017 and it was just perfect. We had the wildest room with a fantastic skyline view and the room was very clean. We had our breakfast on the top roof every morning and also had snacks and wine every afternoon. We also want to thank you, Deon, for your pleasant and kind welcome every morning when we came to have our breakfast or snack in the afternoon. We think Sheraton Tribeca is the perfect location for a visit in New York and everything worked perfectly.

title: Excellent Hotel with added perks
text: I choose this hotel primarily for price which included the concierge lounge that has a spectacular skyline view on the 21st floor and 24 hr access. The rooms were a good size for New York City. We stayed in a king room. It was clean and there was a walk in shower. The lounge has complimentary breakfast in the morning with bagels, pastries, hot oatmeal, juice, coffee, tea. They also have evening appetizers and complimentary wine, plus you can access it 24 hrs if you need a drink, or snack. We did not have to buy bottled water or snacks our entire stay. They are always open. They also have a microwave you can  use to warm up your leftovers. I know it may cost a little more but I believe you are actually saving more $ with the food. And the sky view was amazing in the morning and night. Everyone was very professional and friendly.  The location is perfect to walk to Chinatown, Little Italy, Tribeca and Soho. A few blocks you are in chinatown. Across the street you are in Soho. There are so many places to eat, around the area. On the weekend, there is an outdoor food market just west of the hotel. I would stay there again.

title: Old fashioned hotel
text:
Nice neighborhood but the hotel needs an update. Small room, very nice matrass but again, the room really needs an update. We slept on the 11th floor but even there we could hear the traffic, very bad isolated. Room wasn't cleaned very well but when I mentioned it , we got a free breakfast. So...nice staff.
We chose this hotel because of the rooftop terrace but  we never had red that you'll have to pay an extra $ 30/ day/person for the use of it and...it even has no bar! So we did not see it once...
We think it was too expensive for what we got!

title: Columbus day
text:
Struttura scadente e male organizzata . All’arrivo hanno cercato di darci una tariffa diversa senza colazione e Wi-Fi rispetto alla prenotazione salvo poi arrendersi all’evidenza della stampa.
Letto senza lenzuola e colazione monotematica americana .
Da evitare .

title: Large room. A little beat up.
text: Not a bad stay. Comfortable beds. Larger room than other places I've stayed nearby. But furniture is showing wear. And lobby vibe is more like an office-park hotel in the midwest than a Manhattan hotel. Perfectly fine stay, just not my hotel of choice in that neighborhood.

title: Happy memories.
text: Great location, good panorama from city view rooms, roof terrace worth the extra if you're having a lazy day. Very comfy bed and nice shower. Best thing is it's just round the corner from New Yorks best dive bar , Nancy Whiskey Pub.

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
Hands down my favorite hotel!   Having stayed over 90 nights there this year, I return for the comfortable beds and friendly staff.  

From the moment you step out the cab, Dave, Ferry, or Carlos greet you with a smile. Colin, Mia, Sal, Megan, and the rest of the front desk staff check you in like family.  Dione up stairs in the club lounge takes pride in ensuring your comfort and satisfaction.  Plus you can't beat the view from the rooftop deck. 

This is my "go to" hotel in New York City.  I recommend that my family and friends stay there. Close to shopping and great restaurants. Around the corner from the subway. It's convenient and comfortable.

title: Beware you have to pay to get onto the rooftop
text:
Despite what other reviewers say, I absolutely loved the bed. It was so comfortable and soft. The room was a good size. My room was close to the lift, which made a really loud screeching noise on my floor. When I asked to be moved, I was moved to a room further away the next morning. 
There are a lot of hotel option is New York, but for me what made this one stand out  was the rooftop. In pictures this rooftop looked bigger than the other hotels with rooftops.
When I went to reception asking how I get in, they advised I had to pay a $30 USD entry fee, which is what it costs to get into the top of the rock at the Rockefeller centre. I was extremely disappointed by this, because have I had know I wouldn't have booked this hotel.
The bagel place next door is amazing, and was my breakfast go to each morning.

title: Great location, even better service
text:
My fiancee and I come to NY about once a year and have stayed at numerous hotels, airbnbs, etc. Lately we've been staying at SPG hotels more due to our status, but this is the first time we've stayed at Sheraton Tribeca. The start, the location is great. As long as you know how to navigate your way on foot or on subway, you are easily connected to the rest of the city. Getting around by car is tough with the all day traffic. 

The room was small, but it was well maintained and comfortable. The real highlight of our stay was the service. The night manager, Nelson, really went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of and had everything we needed. Service was quick and accommodating. I didn't have any interactions with the day managers, but my fiancee mentioned that Sal was also extremely helpful and polite. 

We didn't really take advantage of the rest of the amenities, bar, or restaurant in the hotel since we were out and about for the most part, but coming back to attentive and helpful service is always a great feeling.

title: Great place to stay
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights in August and another 4 nights at the beginning of September and were very satisfied with our choice.

I had read negative comments about reception staff however, I couldn't fault them.  At all times the staff were friendly and helpful especially Meghan.  We asked for cars to be arranged twice for a transfer to the airport and both times there were absolutely no problems.

The rooms are a reasonable size for New York and the Hotel is located near three different Subway lines.

We stayed in a Club room and it was great to have access to the Club on the 21st floor with the outdoor area and the beautiful view towards uptown.

The complimentary breakfast and then drinks in the afternoon were great.  These are included when you book a Club room.

We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again when we next visit New York.

title: A Night in New York
text:
We stayed at The Sheraton Tribeca Hotel in Canal Street. Super hotel and we had a good view of the night life from our hotel room. However the view from the roof the following morning, with a cup of coffee was exceptional.
Good room and helpful friendly staff.

title: Excelente ubicación para conocer NYC
text: Súper ubicación para llegar de manera rápida y económica por el subway (Canal St) a todos los museos y lugares de interés; entre SOHO y Tribeca, a pasos de China Town y Little Italy y a un par de estaciones del distrito financiero. Habitación con espacio aproximado de 2.5m x 5m. Sin el bullicio de Midtown Manhattan. Muy buena calidad de descanso en las habitaciones y relación vs lo que se paga. Su personal de atención a clientes es muy amable y con muy buena actitud de servicio. No dudaría en volver ahí o recomendar :)

title: Hard to get to - traffic so bad cabs won't drive by. Average amenities.
text:
Meeting planner picked the hotel for a business meeting. Terrible traffic to get there.
Rooms typical, nothing special or memorable.

Leaving was a nightmare - no cabs would drive by because the gridlock was so terrible Had to walk 3 blocks to get one that would stop.

title: No VFM
text:
I paid 370$ per night for a very small single room (comparing to cheaper single rooms in other hotels in New York.
The hotel is located in Canal street which is a very dirty street. 
The only  advantage is that it is close to SOHO and to Greenwich.
The bath is poor.
I will not book again at this hotel.

title: Muy Bueno
text:
Hotel: Excecelnte Estado. Recepcionistas: No tiene de habla Española. Extraño en una Enpresa Multinacional y con un Alto Turismo Latino. 

Habitación: Excelente servicio de artículos de Baño/ Excelente dimensiones / vista a la calle / tiene cafetera / NO tiene heladera / excelente wi fi/ tiene hielo en el pasillo.

Zona: Excelente. Tribeca / Chinatown / SoHo.

title: Great location.
text: We spent three nights here prior to leaving on a cruise.  We upgraded to a club level room on the 18th floor, which had a nice view of mid-town and the Empire State Building.  Our room was quite small--really more suitable for a single person than a couple--but it helped to have the access to the club lounge on the 21st floor, which was quite comfortable and had a spacious deck.  We enjoyed the continental breakfast each morning (good fresh bagels and pastries; would have been nice to have some fruit each morning), and the happy hour offerings were generous enough that we made it our dinner each night.  The attendants in the lounge (and I'm sorry I didn't get their names, because they were perfectly lovely) were attentive and friendly, as were the front desk staff members--especially Janilsa, who was always there and always helpful.  Nice fitness center (if a bit on the smallish side), which would be improved with the addition of some real yoga mats, and the replacement of the existing foam exercise mats, which have seen better days.  The location is great--lots of good restaurants in the area, and an easy walk to the tourist sights to the south, plus a subway station just a couple of blocks away.  Our room was quiet, and the bed was very comfortable, but I miss having a dresser so I can unpack.

title: Wouldn't book again
text:
Upon entering the room, it smelled of stale air and was very muggy almost like the smell of a pool house. The bathroom was relatively clean but not as clean as you'd like from a hotel. My sheets also had a stain on them. 

The most frustrating part was probably how thin the walls are. I could hear everything from my neighbors to the outside noise. They also only offer free wifi to members which I thought was a little weird. I'd only book this if you're looking for a hotel on the budget and they're offering a good price.

title: Paper thin walls
text: Booked a club level room on a Sunday night. I had to come in for an early morning business meeting that Monday. I cannot believe how loud it was overnight. I woke up many times to the sounds of my neighbors voices, and especially their doors opening and closing. Even though it's a decent location I will try to not stay here again. My online booking reservation called this a 'recently renovated' room. This was not the case either.

title: Location really meets the needs of everybody.
text:
Trafic to reach the place is awful , recommended traveling after 7pm or in the early morning.
The place don't look wonderfully but the whole place is a mess. 
Personal fine , easy and quick.
Room not so clean as you suppose should be in a sheraton at tribeca.
Insulation from noise acceptable. 
The internal restaurant is a pleasant surprise in the american standard since they are able to produce a real italian cooking (that said by an italian).
Location is remarkable because the position it will be useful to reach easily manhattan or the museum area , no to speak of the theatre one.

title: One night trip. Friendly and good location
text: 2 club level rooms for 1 night stay. Very friendly/easy check in.  Bell hops VERY helpful in suggesting close by restaurants and went out of their way to hail cabs for us (I was traveling with 2 elderly folks!).  Rooms comfortable and clean.  Visited club room for a quick snack and grab some rooftop photos...nice selection of softdrinks, wines and munchies.  Deon was working his tail off and was very accommodating! Beds weren't the most comfy, but for the 6 or so hours we needed them, they were fine.  Also great location!

title: Bien
text: El hotel está bien ubicado, cerca de estaciones de metro, en zona comercial, cerca de Lugares para comer. El desayuno es más o menos, y las habitaciones son cómodas. A mi gusto está bien, un poco costoso para lo que es, pero así en NY.

title: Friendly and good location
text: This hotel is very close to the Canal Street subway, and a good base. It's about a 15-20 minute walk to the World Trade Centre and Irish Hunger Memorial. I didn't have many interactions with the staff but they were very helpful whenever I did.

title: just an ok hotel
text:
location is not bad, there are restaurants and bars walking distance
there's a nice outdoors bar which is in the lobby & outside of the hotel  
rooms are very small 
the room next door was very noise and we heard every single bit of it

title: One night trip for a concert
text: This is the second time staying here. Love it! Friendly staff. Close to everything. Roof top lounge for Club Suite is super nice! Planet Fitness next door. The BEST 24 hour bagel store also next door!

title: Comfortable and convenient if you get it at the right price!
text: Managed to picK this little beauty up for 1/2 price on a booking site, $242@day AUD, great for NYCand location. Quiet,Quality accomodation ( extremely comfy beds) and right next to sub line A C E. Cute bars and restaurants all around and short walk to Greenwich V. Lovely helpful staff which Sheraton is known for, big thumbs up

title: Must stay here!!!!
text: Took my daughter and her best friend to NYC for labour day weekend as a Graduation gift and stayed here.  This hotel experience was one of the best I've ever had.  The location was beyond perfect, felt safe, subway station around the corner, shopping on Canal street, Soho seconds away and a short ride to get uptown!  The staff was friendly and helpful!  If any of you have the opportunity to meet Sal, call yourselves very lucky.  He not only helped us find free parking a block away but he gave us excellent advice on where to go and how to get there. A huge thank you to Sal and the team at the consierge/luggage desk!!  You guys were the best and we will most definatly be back!!!

title: Great Service!
text:
Deon in Club lounge is the best!
Corey - MGMT & front desk also welcoming & accommodating!
I stay here for work & pleasure - location is convenient to Tribeca/Soho & all subways. Deck on 21st floor - incredible views & Deon runs the lounge perfectly.

title: Great Place to Stay
text:
I stayed in a double room for 4 nights here and really liked it. The room was small, but still enough space for two people and our luggage. The bed was amazing, really comfortable, one of the best beds I have ever stayed in! The bathroom was nice and very clean. The shower was also very good.

The location is great, only a 2 min walk from the closest subway stop and about a 5 min walk from other subway stops on different lines. There are loads of good places to eat and drink within walking distance.

Would highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for somewhere to stay in NYC!

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text:
This was my 7th trip to Sheraton TriBeCa, and it is always a fabulous experience. This is due in large part to the friendly, courteous staff who truly appear to love serving their guests. They are not just friendly, but they get to know you. When you repeat visit you are greeted with a knowing, recognizing smile from every employee and are greeted by name (even hugs) from those you really have the most contact with. And I really mean this about every employee. 

The hotel is also in a great area of the city. Easy walk or train to the downtown area, NYU campus, Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho. The hotel is also located at a major subway stop for most trains.

My daughter attends NYU, and we will be booking the Sheraton TriBeCa for every visit the next few years!

title: Cercanía Múltiples puntos Turísticos y Comodidad [Next to Everything and Confortability]
text:
As far as I am concerned, my experience was really good with de amenities and the service. The place was really clean and the Lounge was a good option when you arrived really tired.
Deon [at the Lounge in the 21th floor] was really helpful and nice, as everyday in the afternoon he makes as feel really welcome in a very confortable environment.

We will come again!

title: ottima soluzione
text:
vicinissimo alle tante fermate della metro di Canal Str. Si trova proprio all'angolo fra Canal e W Broadway e dunque in ottima posizione. Nonostante Canal str non sia ben frequentata di sera, si è a pochi metri dagli ottimi locali (bar, cibo, musica live) di tribeca o sono.
C'è un terrazzo al quale gli ospiti accedono, possono bere gratis 
soft drink e sgranocchiare qlcs (all'happy hour anche bere vino) e vedere midtown che si illumina.

title: Used to be good, then Marriott happened
text: The breakfast in their club lounge used to be a hot breakfast, eggs, potatoes, etc...now it's a continental breakfast. The type of breakfast that even the cheapest of hotel chains offers all of their guests is what they now offer their preferred guests in the club lounge. This sort of level of reduction in services being offered to their preferred guests seems to be happening everywhere. Thanks Marriott.

title: Buena ubicacion
text:
Muy buena ubicación, cerca de la parada Canal st.
Habitación limpia y espaciosa. Cama increiblemente cómoda. 

Buen servicio, muy atentos y amables en la recepción.
Servicio de guardamaletas gratuito.

Pero me parece un poco caro y más si no incluye desayuno.

title: Whaouuu le rooftop !
text: Hotel situé dans canal street a quelques pas d une bouche de métro. Ce que j apprécie au delà de la propreté et de l amabilité du personnel (surtout Sal à la réception) c est l accès au club lounge et sa terrasse. Si vous devez prendre une chambre préférer la chambre club. Le rooftop/terrasse au 21eme vous offre un panorama splendide - à ne pas manquer !

title: Di Sheraton ha solo il nome!!! Da evitare!!!!
text: Arrivati all'albergo abbiamo fatto il check in con discreta facilità, naturalmente nessuno che parlasse italiano ma questo non si puó pretendere negli states...non c'era nessuno a portarci le valigie in camera poco male .... ma almeno per la mancia qualcuno potevano metterlo. La stanza con vista laterale orribile e terribilmente piccola, i due letti alla francese la occupavano quasi completamente, l'armadio con un anta rotta e largo circa 1 metro non conteneva praticamente che la metà dei nostri vestiti, lo sciacquone del bagno funzionante solo per la metà del getto, per farsi la doccia c'era una vasca con tendina di plastica stile anni 70....il tanto decantato in altre recensioni distributore di bibite costantemente vuoto ( in tutti i piani) per i dieci giorni di permanenza ... la reception è la cosa che più ci ha meravigliato si entrava e si usciva senza nessuno che ci salutasse o che si accertasse chi fossimo... un vero porto di mare...le uniche attenzioni ci venivano riservate con la richiesta se ci occorreva un taxi ... possiamo tutti immaginare il perchè!!! Check out alle 12, lasciamo le valigie in custodia indicando che le avremmo ritirate alle 15.00 arriviamo alle 14.40 ed un solerte ed arrogante addetto dell'albergo ci sbatte praticamente le nostre valigie in faccia mentre eravamo seduti ad un tavolino della hall!!! Lasciamo questo posto sicuramente senza rimpianti.... abbiamo visto di meglio molto meglio!!!

title: In-Room Climate Control Shouldn't Be This Hard to Get Right!
text:
I was eagerly anticipating this trip to NYC since my husband was taking me to see a Broadway show for my 40th birthday. We picked the Sheraton Tribeca due to its close proximity to the Holland Tunnel so we wouldn't have to spend eons of time sitting in traffic on our way out of the City. If you want quick access to NJ, easy access to the Subway, and a clean and basic place to stay, then this hotel will be enough for you. If you expect more, then keep reading!

We requested an early (12:00 pm) check-in. We arrived at the hotel at 1:30 and our room wasn't ready. We'd been upgraded because we were celebrating my birthday. Therefore, we decided to wait the hour for the room. We returned 90 mins. later to find out our room still wasn't ready. I was unhappy since we had to get ready for dinner and the show. Therefore, the front desk manager scrambled and found us another room. When we got upstairs to room 1809, we discovered it was directly across from the elevator (which is counter to what my SPG profile says) and it was hot and stuffy in the room. We called guest services who advised us to turn down the temperature and place the unit on auto fan. We did this, but it was still warm when we left 30 minutes later.

We arrived back at he hotel around 11:15 pm to discover our room was still hot and stuffy. We requested a room change. We were given room 1706, which was also warm, and significantly smaller than our previous room. However, by 11:30 pm, we just wanted to go to bed. By the time I turned in after midnight, the room had cooled a bit, but the air was blowing directly on my neck in the bed. I was bone tired so I sucked it up, pulled the covers up to my chin, and went to bed. Unfortunately, my neck was still when I woke up thanks to the Ir blowing on me.

Our stay wasn't great. In fact, I won't stay at this property again due to the two room issues we had.

title: Buono
text:
Buona posizione e prezzi accettabili, soprattutto se si prenota on line con diverse offerte. 
L'hotel è molto grande e forse impersonale ma è comodo e il personale è cortese. 
Noi siamo stati al 18esimo piano in una camera con una vista pazzesca. Allego foto. 
Chiedetelo quando prenotate orche alcune camere affacciano direttamente su un muro di cinta orribile.

title: Great location!
text:
Great location, nice staff!  Near major transportation hubs.  Soho and Tribeca are fabulous neighborhoods with shopping and dining galore. 
Rooms are decent size not big by any standards but above average for New York.

Enjoyed my stay!

title: Deon on the Club Floor is the greatest!
text: We stay at the Sheraton Tribeca everytime we are in NYC. Fabulous location, rooms and amenities. The Club room offer a fantastic view from their roof top deck. Sunsets are incredible with Empire State building in the background. Deon makes happy hour truly happy. He is so helpful and professional. Makes all feel welcome.

title: A éviter a tout prix!!!!
text: Hotel excentre, pas digne du tout de la chaine "sheraton" ( et ce pour en avoir fait un gd nombre), les chambres sont veilles et a peine propres, le linge de lit froisse a croire qu'ils n'ont pas été changes depuis les précédents occupants. C'est sans compter sur la négligence du personnel ( la femme de ménage a laisse 3 heures durant en pleine journée ap son passage ds notre chambre , la chambre ouverte. Nous étions a l'étage du loundge ( étage le plus fréquenté de l'hôtel ) résultat une belle frayeur en rentrant en fin de journée de notre visite!!! Nous avons signalé cet incident a la direction a part a peine des excuses on nous a propose de nous up grader lors d'une prochaine visite de quoi vraiment être refroidis de cette expérience malheureuse!!!!!!  Bien évidemment il est hors de question d'y remettre un jour les pieds. Quand au personnel , l'amabilité ne fait pas partie  de leur point fort si il y en a un. Si vous souhaiter passer un bon séjour a new york, un conseil oublier cette adresse cauchemardesque.

title: Location, location, location
text: This is a small, boutique style version of a Sheraton Hotel in lower Manhattan.  As a Sheraton, there was nothing super special with regard to amenities.   This location is well maintained, but is definitely worn down a bit in the rooms and in the gym.  Could use a renovation.  Also since it's NYC, you should expect small (rooms are tight and the gym is minimal)   The check-in and front desk staff were terrific.  The best part is the location.  Just off of West Broadway, you can walk to great restaurants and shops.  It's close to everything in Soho and Wall Street and just a few easy blocks form two different Subway lines.

title: Excelent place to stay
text: Came in with doubts got out with convictions: Hotel is clean, located strategically close to SOHO/Tribeca. Staff is awesome Nelson is amazing warm hearted and welcoming. My place for the next visit. The only thing missing...a pool.

title: We always enjoy our stay
text:
We have been coming to the NY Gift show for years and used to stay in Times Square at the Westin.  Several years ago we switched to the Sheraton Tribeca as Times Square is not very nice anymore since (the area) and we found the Westin to not be a great value. Since then, we have stayed here every time we come to NYC.  
The rooms are small, but clean and the staff are always helpful and generally pleasant. 
We LOVE the rooftop happy hour and so glad that Dion (Deon?) the Jamaican man is still there. He is always so friendly and really runs it very well, keeping all the food fresh and well stocked and the areas are always cleaned and tables cleaned. I was in the restaurant biz for many years so really appreciate the attention to detail.  
The only thing we miss is the buffet breakfast in the rooftop lounge.  
See you all next time!

title: Ottima posizione, ottima qualità prezzo
text: Ho soggiornato insieme alla mia compagna per 6 notti in questo hotel. La prima cosa da sottolineare è l'assoluta comodità della posizione. L'hotel si trova infatti in un punto centrale di Canal Street, strada lungo la quale sono situate fermate praticamente di tutte le linee della metro (blu e rossa a ridosso, gialla, verde e marrone pochissimo più distanti), e comunque in un punto da cui risulta piuttosto comodo raggiungere a piedi numerosi luoghi d'interesse. Anche fosse solo per questo, mi sentirei già di consigliare questo albergo. Inoltre siamo stati accolti e salutati dai ragazzi del desk con il massimo della gentilezza. Camere ampie e pulite, letto a mio parere molto comodo, particolare non di poco conto visti i km percorsi a piedi ogni giorno! Essendo questo il mio terzo viaggio a NY, ho trovato in questo posto per il momento il miglior rapporto qualità-posizione-prezzo. Wi fi gratuito in tutta la struttura. Per la mia prossima visita tornerei qui senza alcuna ombra di dubbio! Thank you!

title: Loved the Area!
text:
The Sheraton Tribeca was clean, quiet, and comfortable, with helpful staff. The TriBeCa location was excellent (right by the Canal St subway station - served by the A/C/E trains; 10 minute walk to SoHo, Chinatown, Little Italy). There was no free wi-fi in rooms, but good wifi in the lobby. Computers were also available. No refrigerator in rooms. We stayed in early July, and the price was excellent.  Extra special thank you to housekeeping, who did an outstanding job.
Great value in Tribeca.

title: Great stay.
text: Stayed last night for our anniversary. Check in was smooth, room was very comfortable and clean. Great location...a few minutes walk to water and great restaurants. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. I will stay here again in the future.

title: Good Location But Weird Experience
text:
I've stayed at this hotel several times because it is near a location I frequently visit for work meetings. While it is conveniently located if you want to be in lower Manhattan, particularly Soho and Tribeca, the experience is unbalanced. The rooms are very nice - NY-small, but nice. 

Checking in has been annoying several times - especially after 8 pm. There typically is only one person on and there is inevitably some issue with the person ahead of me, so it has not been fast or smooth. I've called for a Wake Up Call and had the phone ring for an extended period of time without being answered.

The restaurant is old-school Italian at night, with nice food on the high-priced side. The breakfast buffet is uninspired and not worth the price. Both the Starbucks and restaurant don't open until 7 - which I find late for a business hotel.

This time the bar was hilarious - absentee bar tender and no other bar staff for most of the time. But when she did show up at random occasions, the service was fast and pleasant.

The elevators are slow - my colleagues have had to resort to walking down at busy morning times to avoid missing a meeting.

I feel like I'm in an altered reality when i stay in this hotel.

title: Un servizio molto al di sotto dello standard SPG
text:
L'hotel si trova in una posizione strategica in un quartiere pieno di ristoranti e locali per la sera, nonché in mezzo tra lower manatthan e times square (entrambe raggiungibili a piedi).
Purtroppo il livello di servizio non è quello a cui SPG ha abituato i suoi clienti. Il personale alla reception è molto scortese, maleducato e sbrigativo, e totalmente indisponibile a fornire un qualsiasi aiuto.
La camera in cui abbiamo soggiornato, molto piccola, era posizionata al quinto piano e rumorosissima (sembrava di dormire in strada a causa del rumore del traffico). Al momento del check in le coperte del letto erano macchiate.

title: Reasonable price- Not my favorite hotel
text:
We stayed 4 night this past weekend for a family event.
Pro’s:
The room rate was very reasonable for NYC and the location is good. We booked direct and utilized their online price matching program. 
We enjoyed the club lounge each morning for breakfast and enjoyed happy hour in the afternoon. We loved the outdoor seating area and great views.
Our bed was relatively comfortable and we loved the view of the empire state building from room 2018.
Our request for a mini fridge was granted and the maintenance department was quick to deliver.
We loved the convenience of Tribeca Bagel located next door.

Con’s:
It took over an hour for our luggage to be brought up to our room. I called down a second time to inquire and the bellman was in our room in less than 5 minutes. Perhaps an oversight.
The cleaning service was hit or miss. Some days we had a very clean room, other days we did not.
The customer service staff throughout the hotel was also hit or miss. Some were great, others were less than average. 
The coffee maker in the room made only single serving cups. Coffee is key to survival for most. A one cup maker was frustrating.
The club lounge could use an additional toaster and better-tasting coffee. The coffee tasted old and burnt.

title: Top
text:
On ne comprend pas les précédents commentaires ... autant vous prévenir tout de suite, nous avions pris la formule "club Level". C'était le top : chambre grande et Clean avec une superbe vue, terrasse donnant sur l'empire state building et sur l'Hudson et service snack disponible 24/24 ! Avec plein de boissons + le petit déjeuner gratuit (salade de fruits frais entre autres), 10 thés différents ... le soir entre 5h30 et 8h30, happy hour avec vin blanc ou rouge, fromage, viande de dinde, tortillas, guamalone ... le petit plus de notre séjour après une journée de marche dans les pattes qui nous a permis également d'économiser un repas ! Bref, le top. 
Quant au personnel ... nous avons vu plusieurs commentaires médisants mais pour nous, tout sest très bien passé ! 
Mention spéciale pour Deon qui se bouge chaque soir pour que tous les Happy hours soient au top ! Merci à lui et sa gentillesse.
De plus, salle de sport, grande salle de bain, bar aux cocktails sympas... jusqu'à la Reception d'une extrême gentillesse nous reconnaissant tous les jours et nous souhaitant une bonne journée.
Je rajoute bien entendu la localisation au top : entre Tribeca et Soho le tout à 900 m de lHudson ... station de métro à 3 minutes. 
Vous pouvez y aller les yeux fermés. Dans le cadre de la formule Club Level. Pourquoi ? : la partie snack disponible bien entendu mais également pour l étage des chambres compris entre le 19 et 22 eme donc à l'abris du bruit de la rue et de sa circulation très très chargée ...
Allez, pour trouver un reproche : les cartes des chambres qui se démagnétisent trop facilement... voilà, cest tout. 
Donc, nous nous inquiétons des précédentes notes mais pour le rapport qualité prix, nous en sommes vraiment ravis. Bon séjour aux prochains et passez leur le bonjour de notre part !
Ps : c'était notre 5eme fois à New York après avoir essayé le New Yorker, le Yotel ou encore les locations type Airbnb
Cordialement

title: It was my birthday (48)
text: Very nice people at the bar, nice hotel convenient  walking to all great NY places, However we were put in a tight corner room w/ the neighbor that had a infant (why) when we were a marrurd couple that had NO children are pets with them!?no refrigarator or microwave find that very surprising for such a well known hotel

title: Sheraton Tribeca NY Hotel
text: Sheraton Tribeca is a reasonably priced hotel with very good amenities and service. They do not charge a resort fee unlike many other Manhattan hotels. What sets them apart is the location. IF you are traveling via subway for your vacation AND wish to stay close to Chinatown and downtown Manhattan, this hotel is 2-10 min walking distance to 5 subway station lines (red, blue, yellow, green, brown) and you are minutes from Chinatown any time of the day/night for food!

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: I recently stayed at this hotel back in July and Sal was so good to me. I called the hotel in advance because I had so many questions, and he answered every single question and he was so patient with me. When I arrived at the hotel his hospitality was AMAZING !! He made sure I had everything I requested and he even recommended things for me !! Super friendly!! If you are staying at this hotel I recommend you ask for Sal! I enjoyed my stay but he made it even better! THANK YOU SAL! I will definitely be staying here again .

title: Buon hotel, ottima posizione
text:
Abbiamo utilizzato questo hotel come base per la visita di 5 giorni a New York.
Camere ampie e pulite. Vista dalla finestra non molto bella ma utilizzandolo come punto di appoggio non ha influito molto.
Comodo per la vicinanza alla metro blu e rossa di Canal Street.

title: Great location, a lot of street noise
text:
Well located for the sights of lower Manhattan. Many different subway lines within a very short walking distance.

Staff were friendly and helpful.

Canal Street is extremely busy at all times of day or night, expect a lot of street noise.

There was an issue with our booking where for one of the five nights (which was booked later) the credit card was declined. The hotel honoured our booking but downgraded us from the room type originally booked charging the same amount as for the higher room.

title: Habitacion mejorable
text: Bien comunicado pasan todas las líneas de metro al lado del hotel y estas a tres o cuatro paradas de casi todo, tienen servicio de coche que te lleva al aeropuerto y es mas grande y comodo que los taxis. La pega que no puedes subir a la planta de la azotea a tomar algo  si no perteneces al club y también el escaso mobiliario de la habitación, el personal atento

title: Surprisingly pleased with room and service.
text: As lifelong New Yorkers, we are pretty tough with high expectations. We recently rented a block of rooms here for a big family wedding. Starting with Bash who greeted us and watched our car and May who checked us in, the service was friendly, warm and professional. Rooms are not big or luxurious, but they are clean and comfortable. We slept well. The views from the upper floors and the "Club" lounge on 21 are worth the price alone.

title: Very good location and reasonably priced
text: We booked this hotel for its location and its very reasonable pricing and we were not disapointed. We had a good view over Chinatown from the 16th floor. The room was clean and the bathroom was well appointed. The staff were pleasant and helpful. We spent £475 (inc. tax) for a family of four for two nights, which for NYC is remarkable.

title: Zentrales Stadthotel
text: Die Lage des Hotels ist sehr gut! Die Aussstattung der Zimmer sehr alt und abgewohnt. Hier hat man beim Namen Sheraton eine andere Vorstellung. Uns wurde jedoch gesagt, dies ist üblich in NY. Das Zimmer war groß, das Bad war sehr schön. Sauberkeit war ok. Das Bett war sehr bequem, wobei man nach einer Tagestour in NY bestimmt überall tief schläft :-) Die Club-Zimmer sind bestimmt etwas schöner. Ich würde dieses Hotel wieder besuchen, da die Lage wirklich super war. Der Preis war sehr hoch. Die U-Bahn war sehr gut zu erreichen.

title: Ubicación excelente
text:
Viajamos en julio, hotel situado entre Soho, China Town y little Italy. El metro está a dos pasos (canal street). Habitación doble y cuarto de baño normales.Buena atención y servicio correcto . Desayunos no incluidos como en casi todos los
hoteles.Reserva con antelación y precio muy asequible.

title: Хороший отель!
text:
Этот отель мы выбрали по двум причинам:
1) хорошая сеть 
2) расположение.
Про сеть говорить не буду, дело вкуса, нам нравится.
Расположение в "Мидл тауне" дает возможность пешком дойти как до Даунтауна с Уолл Стрит, Мемориалом 9/11 и др., так и до Аптауна, Тайм Сквер, Централ Парк и т.д.

Отель оплатили через букинг, сразу со всеми налогами. При заезде удержали депозит в размере $150, который в итоге ушел на 2 завтрака и стирку вещей.
Выбрали номер с видом на город. Чуть дороже, но он того стоит! Окно во всю стену с видом на небоскребы Аптауна, включая Эмпайр.
Завтрак в отеле можно взять один раз, потом надоест. В городе полно прекрасных заведений, где можно вкусно и недорого позавтракать.
Номера как на фото, тут ничего нового не скажу. Минус в том, что не было шампуня, геля, ватных палочек и пр.
Утюг с доской есть в номере. 

Менеджеры на ресепшн приветливые и готовы во всем помочь.

title: Excellent service and great location
text: Every person we encountered was very friendly and helpful.  The location is great for shopping in Soho, eating in Tribeca and walking to the 9/11 memorial or Chinatown.  The rooms were spacious and clean.  This will be our go-to hotel when visiting the City.

title: Exceptional service
text:
My wife and went to NYC for an extended visit to see our son.  The staff was outstanding particularly Deon in the Sheraton Lounge. He was attentive, professional while juggling multiple customers at the same time.
megan(sp) was extremely pleasant and helpful during both our check-in and check-out  and made us feel at home. Lena at the bar was also great . We did have one problem with the a/c in the room but the gentlemen(did not get his name) was through and fixed thre problem and offered to come back later that day if we had any more issues.

title: Staple stay in NYC
text: This is my go to hotel in NYC. The location is perfect, easy Canal street walk to Soho shopping, FiDi for work. NO TOURISTS, thank goodness. But above all, terrific staff. I have never seen such hospitable front desk staff, and everyone from housekeeping to bell boys are the friendliest. They recognize everyone by first name. It truly makes it worth coming back to every single time. Dion in the club lounge is also the best server who delightfully chills with conversation while providing wine and snacks during the hotel happy hour (which in itself makes the trip worth a stay). Always a pro!

title: Inspect the sheets...ours had hair and stain.
text:
We booked from Friday 04/28/2017 to Sunday 04/30/2017. We arrived around 10:30pm to 11:00 pm.

We were tired from driving for over three hours to get there. Our plan was to crab a quick bit, go to bed and have an early start the next day. 

I have a habit of checking the sheets before I jump in.  I found hair and stain on the sheet (see pictures). This is suppose to be clean sheets. Look at how crinkled they were. Looks like someone rolled in it for at least a few days. 

It was disgusting!!!! They didn't even try to hide it. It was just there... very obvious. 

Personally, I think there should be a law against hotels renting out dirty rooms !!!  Someone needs to pay. Right now there is no recourse. 

We paid for the club floor (higher floor), the manager said he would move us to the second floor without refunding the difference. 

At this point, we did not feel comfortable anymore. What if they move us to another dirty room? 

We decided to book a different hotel - we ended up at NoMo SoHo. It was more expensive but more out scene and a much better location. 

We were refunded but what we went through was a major inconvenience especially for that time of night. 

This hotel needs to overhaul their housekeeping team. People need to be fired on the spot for pulling a stunt like this. 

I feel they are giving the guests a big middle finger. 

BTW... The phone was dusty too.  

As for my fellow travelers, be vigilant!!! Staying at a $700 a night hotel/resort...check the sheets, unless you don't care. 

Unfortunately, I've been disappointed more times than not.

title: Great location and friendly staff!
text: Had a great week at this hotel; rooms were clean and the staff, especially Sal at reception, were super friendly and helpful. The location is great for the subway and for strolling through soho and lower manhattan! Canal st is a really busy street but you couldn't hear the traffic noise from inside. Booked through booking.com and had free wifi in the rooms which was ideal. Only downside was our room didn't have a fridge which would have been nice however there was an ice machine and also a deli right next door to buy drinks etc! Overall I'd recommend this hotel as the perfect base for exploring New York!

title: Weekend
text:
We stayed here for one night and best thing is the great location. In only few minutes you are in Soho with many stores and cafes. The rooms are newly refurnished but very small. The towels need to be renewed, many were torn. 
The breakfast buffet was a big disappointment and not worth the money.

title: Our second time at this lovely hotel
text: If you are looking for a fancy and luxury hotel you can stop reading now. But if you want to stay in a nice hotel, with helpful staff and a cosy roof top lounge and you do love Soho and Tribeca, this is the perfect place to stay. Make sure you book the Club rooms, then you have a simple breakfast included and afternoon drinks and snacks for free. It was very nice after a day in New York, coming back to the hotel, visit the roof top lounge, sipping a glas of wine together with cheese, nachos, guacomole etc. All served by Duane, who was very nice and serviceminded.

title: Ok hotel stay
text: The first day found one bathroom towel frayed for 8-9 inches and a good sized. Hole in it. During our 3 nite stay we never obtained a bar of soap for shower, ran out of Kleenex, and although the burnt out shower light bulb was replaced they obviously did not try it after replacing as that too did not work. I had to place a towel on the ironing board as it's cover was stained and dirty. Those things aside, the rest of the room, tho small, was fine. The hotel itself centrally located, and employees nice.

title: Fantastic Hotel with nice staff
text:
Check In
We opted to spend a week in this hotel for a special occasion. I found the hotel was clean and tidy on entry. Jamie on check in was the first person to greet us and she was really lovely and had us smiling even though we where tired from our travels. She managed to check us in really quickly without any problems. I spoke with Sal a little after check in regarding a delivery I was expecting and he did a great job helping me with that and the subsequent follow up that was required, after the delivery firm made an error. It would have been nice if that had made it to the room however it was all a little thrown out by the delivery error. 

The Room
The room was a good size for NYC and the view was amazing from the room. The only issue was the toilet flush tended to be a little intermittent, and on a few occasions I had to fix this myself, I'm sure had I raised the issue it would have been sorted. However for me it's quicker to get stuck in and sort it out. Victor was looking after our room each day and he did a great Job I can't thank him enough. He always took the time to say hi to us and crack a joke as we passed him, a really nice guy and he was always working really hard whenever we saw him. 

Club Lounge
The club lounge was tired and didn't have a toilet on the same floor we found this a little odd. You had to go back to your room if you needed the loo. The outside club veranda had the best views you could want in NYC easily on a par with the Empire state and Rocker fella, however it was in need of a tidy up and a few $ spending on it as it was tired and dated, I expected more from a big NYC hotel in this area. The evening snacks where very basic. Little things like bringing cushions in when it looked like rain was going to come down, background music and modern lighting would have been good. Possibly a wind-out canopy and power wash the floor. All small relatively low cost things that really would make a difference.The club staff did a great job at breakfast and of an evening. Deon and Alexia (I think her name was) really went out their way to keep the lounge tidy and well stocked in the evening even when really busy. Both really lovely people and put a lot of effort in to checking in with us to make sure we had everything and give us advice on the city. On a few occasions people seemed to be using the club lounge to hold personal gatherings for friends or associates that where not staying in the hotel, that was a bit off putting as we paid for that privilege, and the bar should have been used for that type of gathering especially when busy.   

Location
Overall a great hotel and location sitting on the edge of China town and Little Italy. This offers fantastic transport links and access to subway lines within a block or two. E line subway takes you uptown to time square within 15 mins and down town to the trade centre within a few stops. Loads of places to eat and drink around the hotel all within a walking distance. We stayed just off Time Square last time and would never do it again after staying in the Sheraton Tribeca 100% better quality and the staff actually acted like they care. 

Recommendation
Try dining, we stopped in one evening and decided to eat down stairs. The restaurant was quiet and the service was really good from both the guys. The food was spot on, the rib eye steak was cooked to perfection and even me being a fussy eater enjoyed it. It was quite big as well. The Lamb dish was also very good. And the cost was the same as local bars only issue the meals could have come with a few more sides. 100% recommended.

Bad Points
The lack of beer in the bar on arrival. We got told a few different things and only two beers ended up on draught by the end of our week. The club lounge had no beer at all after our fifth day of being told no beer we got given a few beer vouchers. This meant going down to the bar and carrying the beer back up to the 21st floor. I was really disappointed with this and the solution provided by the hotel on the whole. Although the staff did their very best it was just not acceptable for a full week, I ended up drinking wine however it was not that nice. I'm sure management must have been aware of the issue and see no reason a few crates could not have picked up from the store. This was the most disappointing thing for me during our stay.

title: Lovely hotel with poor breakfast experience
text: Great hotel with roof top lounge and views.Breakfast was a joke as the staff never put anything out unless you asked for it. I had to ask most of my 7 mornings there could I have cereal and the staff would go into store and hand you out one. They seemed to do this to all people wanting breakfast .I was miffed as to why they just didn't put the cereals they had out .I also had to asked for boiling water every morning too to make my tea as water in the flask which said hot water was only ever like warm.I noticed the staff were too busy texting in their mobile phones to replenish the breakfast items as they ran out.Even getting a plate was difficult as they put out about 3 at a time. Also breakfast was suppose to be at 7am but never ever anything ready at that time and my family wanted to eat early to get out early as a lot to get in on the holiday . Also there were 4 of us in room but towels were always lacking. Left 2 hand towels for 4 people and got face cloths one day but were never replaced again once used .I never saw a cleaner once and also wasn't left toilet roll so had to ask for that . Every thing just seemed to have no regular routine to it . If these things were all addressed it would be a good hotel as in great convenient location for tubes one minute walk away.

title: Good hotel
text: This hotel is located in a great place. Ideal for China Town, Little Italy and the subway. The staff are friendly, especially Colin, Sal and Mia. The club room gives great views. Try to get rooms.. 19 and.. 20 on the upper floors.

title: Excelente opción
text:
Muy buen hotel , a pasos del soho, las habitaciones soy muy amplias , cosa que en ny es muy difícil de conseguir , muy recomendable !
Muchos hoteles que conozco en ny son de habitaciones chicas ,
La gente que trabaja en el sheratron muy bien predispuesta

title: Fantastic rooftop view
text:
I visited during my normal work week in NYC. This is my new favorite hotel, for one reason: the rooftop bar (accessible through the lounge) which has views on three sides.

Rooms were OK as well, and there's a decent bar and restaurant downstairs. Walking distance from the metro, 2 or 3 blocks away.

title: «Sheraton Tribeca New York Hotel - самое большое разочарование в Нью-Йорке»
text:
В отеле есть залог $100, берут только с кредитки, в описании отеля на Booking.com этой информации нет. 
Номер был на 4 этаже с окном в колодец, поэтому в комнате всегда было темно. Заявленного холодильника в номере не было. В номере отеля 4 звезды не было геля для душа, на двух человек могли положить один кусок мыла, 1 флакон шампуня и кондиционера. В номере убирали крайне плохо, ковролин в пятнах, без тапок ходить неприятно, раковина и пол в ванной комнате не могу сказать, что чистые. Всегда забывали пополнить запас кофе, чая и сливок. 
Апогеем стало то, что в  день отъезда я сдала свой чемодан в камеру хранения отеля, а когда через 2 часа его забрала, то обнаружила, что чемодан порван. Я сразу обратилась на ресепшен, но мне стали доказывать, что дыра на чемодане была прежде, что не соответствует правде. Сотрудники вели себя крайнее равнодушно, отказались объяснить мне, как это могло произойти и тем более решить вопрос, и как-то компенсировать мои убытки. Не рекомендую.
Из хорошего. Большая  комната с большой кроватью и удобными матрасом и подушками и это все.

title: Als zentraler Standort in Manhattan geeignet
text: Das Hotel hat eine zentrale Lage. Ist gut an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr angebunden. Es war sauber und hat seinen Zweck erfüllt. Wir haben auf das Frühstück verzichtet, da es unmittelbar neben an mehrere preiswerte und gute Möglichkeiten gab zu frühstücken.

title: Great location and great customer service
text: When I first checked in, I was welcomed by a nice lady named Lama who was so nice and helpful. My room wasn't ready but she made sure to contact me as soon as one became available. She allowed me to go up to the club lounge and enjoy the spectacular view from the top floor! Great service and nice rooms with plenty of room considering it is NYC!

title: Great place to stay in NYC!
text: This hotel is centrally located, close to Soho, Chinatown, and Little Italy.  The rooms are small, but updated and clean - the beds are extremely comfortable.  Be sure to upgrade to the Club Lounge - definitely worth it!  "Neon" Deon is the best host at the Club Lounge!  We've stayed her two years in a row now and will be back.  The view from the Club Lounge patio cannot be beat!

title: Great value location in New York
text: It is very clean functional hotel with all you need for a stay in lower Manhattan. All the staff are extremely helpful and make a difference. Mia Fowler at the front desk checked us in and remembered us as we came and in and out. I needed a boarding pass and although she was about to go home she immediately went back to her desk and printed it out for me. This hotel has all the basics you need with great staff at a competitive price in NY

title: great for budget
text: clean, even though canal street is not the nicest place, it is a block away from tribeca and a block away from the train. The rooftop from the executive lounge has an amazing view. Hotel staff is accommodating and helpful.

title: Dårlig service
text: Hotel bestilt med morgenmad, dvs. Morgenmad er bagles og smør, rengøringsniveau er mangelfuld, var der 10 dage og hver dag måtte vi bede om håndklæder eller sæbe eller toiletpapir, der blev ikke gjort rent i brusekabinen og støvsugeren var åbentbart i stykker, tit var der mangel på kaffe og smør ved morgenmaden, når vi påtalte disse Ting blev der gjort nar af os, og vi fik nedladende svar, det eneste der opvejer til 2 stjerner er eftermiddags hygge i club lounge , med snaks og dejlig vin, men der var slet ikke plads til alle på club level.

title: DEAN @ Sheraton Club Lounge is AMAZING -- 21rst Floor
text: I generally don't enjoy small NYC hotel rooms and crowded lobbies but the staff at the Sheraton Tribeca make it a joy to stay at this property.  The view from the Sheraton Club is amazing at all hours of the day or night. DEON MANS THE LOUNGE IN THE PM and makes it so that you have an amazing experience by having fresh clean food out from 5pm to past 8:30pm every night.  He is attentive and makes sure the lounge is always maintained clean and welcoming.  He is an amazing person and I honestly only stay at this property because he works there and makes me look forward to NYC with his attentiveness, attention to detail and customer service skills.  He should be providing training on how to manage a club lounge across the SPG brands.  He is an example to be followed.

title: Deon  has  the best club launch in all of the spgs hotels. he make sure you have a great day.
text: Deon is a gifted person that the Lord has put him on the  right place. He made sure you are  well taking care off. he will go an extra mile to assure the  costumers are given the service they expected.Deon is a pleasure to meet he made you feel as if you knew him for ever. We need more Deons on this hotels.

title: Convenient Stay in Manhattan
text: Just around the corner from the E train, we were impressed with the great customer service throughout our stay. Our 17th floor room was quiet and roomy for Manhattan. The gym was stocked with water bottles and headphones and had a nice variety of equipment. We loved the view from the executive lounge on the 21st floor. Breakfast there was ok, but just a continental setup. The evening snacks were nicer with fruit salad and vegetables along with other snacks and beverages. The walk to Chinatown and Little Italy is quick and easy.

title: Mediocre stay in a well known brand
text:
Centrall located 
So for the point of getting around and food stores, pretty good 
Rooms are very mediocre, not to any of the other Sheratons I have stayed in
Small rooms with very limited towels and bathroom accessories 
No fridge or in room minibar 
Minimal tea and coffee making arrangements 
So from a access point of view a good hotel but was quite mediocre in other aspects. Was expecting more from a Sheraton perspective

title: Hilton Garden Inn was a better choice
text: This was a perfectly nice hotel with a starbucks in the lobby and a nice co-working space however the room was much too small - i had to get rid of the desk chair to walk between the desk and the bed, rendering the desk unusable - and there was no convenience-type store in the lobby, which most hotels have, to pickup simple things like a bottle of water. The location is good in terms of access to coffee shops & subway stations but beware the tunnel traffic which comes to a standstill in front of the hotel every afternoon, making commuting difficult. The hotel provides a hotel shuttle which is REALLY reasonable.

title: Come for the location don't count on the room service
text:
Great location in lower manhattan. Good shopping in Soho. Nice restaurants. A walk to Brooklyn bridge.  Over the course of 5 days the maids only got to our room twice.  

The maids seemed to try to come at 5:00 the other days and of course we just get back.  Strange to clean rooms at 5? 

Oh and don't eat at the hotel restaurant. $25USD for shrimp cocktail (3 prawns). Crazy expensive and not great. 

No pool either.  But AC and a view is not bad either. Oh and CafÈ Bene next door is fantastic for a quick bite.  Or if you have time. Eat the waffles with banana and caramel and bacon!

title: Outstanding Customer Service
text: Lammah was extremely helpful. This was our first time staying here and she made us feel welcomed. She's amazing! Place is great too!!!! Great location! Spacious rooms too. Im ready to experience this city!

title: Great location needs better maangement
text: Since I am a platinum member of SPG I thought I couldn't go wrong staying at this Sheraton in Tribeca. The location is next to a subway station so it would be easy to get around the city and the price was under $200. What could go wrong? Well for one thing we had to ask for towels every single day of our stay and when we did get them (sometimes after multiple calls) they showed up thread bare and all ragged! The other thing that was weird is that the Club Lounge had an odd character manning the lounge each evening. He would tape signs all over the lounge saying on he could pour drinks! It just made the experience feel very low end so I would not recommend this place unless you can put up with having to make a lot of calls for basic things.

title: Very happy about our 4 nights
text: We spent 4 nights during 4th of July week-end. CI was quick and all personnel at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Good bed - nice towels - shower worked perfectly. Room was cleaned in the morning so my husband could take a nap in the afternoon ... we would definitely go back ! Good price too !

title: Mediocre
text:
Overall the hotel was ok, not bad given the price, but you expect more of a Sheraton
The location is great, easy to get around by nearby subway or simply walking
As always in America, the staff were friendly
The interior and rooms are in need of updating

title: No towels/ room service
text: We are currently staying at this hotel on a 4 night vacation from Canada. I would never give a hotel a bad review but what hotel runs out of towels? When we checked in on June 30th the room had no towels. Called guest services and they brought two up to the room. The next day we spent the whole day out and returned at 6pm to find that our room still hadn't been cleaned. Called guest services and they said that they didn't know why it was missed. We left the room and came back an hour later to see that the room was cleaned but we had no towels. Called guest services again and they said that they would send some up. After two hours no towels. Went down to the front desk and they said that the hotel had no towels because they weren't delivered. They told us they would send some up as soon as they arrived. It's now 1am and still no towels! We now have had to have two showers and dry ourselves with facecloths. Hopefully by morning there will be towels. This is not what I expected when paying this much for a room in a brand name hotel. Was expecting a lot more for my first trip to New York. Other than that the front desk staff are very friendly and the room is nice. The rooftop patio is great!

title: Brand Loyalty Doesn't Count Like It Use To
text:
Recently had a 4 night stay in the Sheraton TriBeCa. Have a SPG preferred level. Checked into the hotel Monday early evening after an all day travel from Florida. One representative at the front desk, 7 people inline. 
15 minutes later it was my turn. Asked for a quiet room  on an upper floor was greeted with sorry, we had a lot of late checkouts. It was 6:45 pm. 
The guests before me were placed on the 14th  and 12th floors respectively.  I was told they had a room on the 6th floor or I could wait an hour. Had an early call and was dead tired. Took the room I could check into then. 
To my disappointment it was above street construction next to the elevator! There was one bar of soap and a single bath towel.
The soap and the towel situation was reminded at my request by housekeeping the next day. 
My company is located in TriBeCa, an easy walk, and I thought I would follow the Sheraton brand., which is why I booked there.
With so many choices in the area I would offer, the hotel is a disappointment and not worth the loyalty points.

title: Hotel was fine but noise to holland tunnel is out of control
text: The hotel experience was good. Bathroom was big and clean. Club lounge was less than I expected. No hot options were available. I know the hotel can't control this but cars were honking almost nonstop for an hour. Crazy traffic going into the holland tunnel.

title: Katastrophe
text:
4* - Hotel? Unfreundliches Personal, lausiges Zimmer, Badezimmer eine Zumutung! Nie wieder dieses Hotel und dann noch Fr. 290.00 pro Nacht bezahlt! Belastung der Kreditkarte schon beim buchen - zusätzlich, ohne Hinweis, 468.00 $ Sicherstellung!!
Bar modern, aber kalt eingerichtet - keine Barbesucher am Abend.

title: Great location
text: Located on Canal Street, right next to the ACE and the 123 subway lines, this location is perfect to move around the city quickly. The bed was very comfortable! The decoration of the room was very traditionnal, with a lot of brown and beige tones. I was also given a room for handicaped people (accessible room), so the bathroom was not convenient at all. Everything was very low, included the shower head. They also charge $10/day for wifi access, which I feel is ridiculous in 2017. Finally, even if I was staying for 3 nights, the cleaning lady didn't clean the room on one of the day. She also knocked on the door at 9am and wake me up on the day of my departure to see if I was still there. That was very irritating since I was still sleeping and didn't have to leave before noon.

title: Top notch service - Comfy room - Relaxing
text: I am not one to leave to many reviews, however one of the hotel staff members at the club level patio was amazing and I had to give him proper recognition for his enthusiasm, kindness, and dedication to his guests. Deon made sure everyone that walked in was treated like gold. He worked his butt off with 20+ people on the roof top keeping the place spotless and making sure everyone was comfortable. His service plus the amazing views made this stay truly a pleasure.  This is going to be our go to NYC weekend home for all of our future trips and definitely going to chose more Sheraton properties in the future. I'm sure there are fancier places, but I couldn't be happier with the value, staff, customer service, and quality of rooms Sheraton has put together with this location.  The only, and not critical thing I would have loved to have was a small fridge in the room, but not a deal breaker. Good job Sheraton TriBeCa!

title: Perfect location, geat service!
text: I was in town for my son's high school graduation, and the hotel provided the perfect location. We were able to attend the celebration, which was within walking distance. The hotel rooms are a bit outdated, but the staff's attention to their guests makes up for it. They were very gracious at the reception desk, and the afternoon bartender was very knowledgeable. Our housekeeper was great, and the bellman, Carlos, was helpful with directions on were to eat. It was a lovely experience.

title: Average experience
text:
I'm SPG gold and it got me zero benefit. 

Also, has it gone downhill since my last stay? I think so. 

No robes? 2 towels. 1 water. Mold (!) on both walls and in shower in the bathroom! Noisy guests. Tiny bath. No view. Warned by staff at check in about the state of the club room - with a bit of doom in her voice :/

Comfy bed and smack in the middle of Soho and TriBeCa but most likely we won't return.

title: Tout est vieux, tout est payant, tout est bruyant
text: Jai réservé cet hôtel sur une application qui ventait les commodités de l'hôtel, son rooftop avec superbe vue sur Manhattan par exemple. Hors, l'accès à une petite terrasse coûte 30$ !!! Le WiFi est également facturé 9$. En 2017 et pour un hôtel de "ce standing" c'est une honte ! La chambre est vieille, mal isolée, au 3è étage, le bruit de la rue est omniprésent. Canal Street et ses embouteillages sont directement sous l'oreiller. Quel "bonheur" ! Je ne poserai plus jamais un pied dans cet établissement d'une autre époque

title: 8 dias em Tribeca
text: Fiquei no 8º andar, num quarto espaçoso, silencioso, com cafeteira, frigobar, cofre, cama e chuveiro ótimos, estações do metro bem perto, itens essenciais para mim. O hotel está localizado numa rua muito movimentada e feia, no entanto, é só atravessar a rua em frente ao hotel e chegamos no SOHO, e é também pertíssimo de Little Italy e  Nolita, lugares que eu adoro. Além disso, do outro lado do hotel, seguindo a Broadway, estamos no Tribeca e pode-se ir a pé à ponte do Brooklyn, além das muitas atrações de downtown. Há vários restaurantes e cafés por perto, além de um mercadinho Garage Gourmet perto. O check in foi um pouco demorado, o quarto só ficou pronto às 16:00 horas. Usei o restaurante por uma vez e o atendimento foi ótimo, além disso, a comida estava deliciosa. Para mim, o hotel atendeu muito bem minhas expectativas em NY. Com certeza vou voltar e ficar neste hotel.

title: Fabulous staff!
text: Recently came to the city for a mix of business and pleasure. After a grueling taxi ride from JFK, the staff at this hotel welcomed my partner and I with warmth and promptness. Lammah was particularly helpful, as she prioritized our early check-in, and letting us take in the sights of the city from the Club Lounge. The rest of the staff was courteous, attentive, and extremely helpful. The room was spacious enough, and housekeeping kept the room spotless. The views alone are enough for me to keep coming back, however it was the staff that caused me to take the time to write this review.

title: Amazing view, clean rooms, and...INCREDIBLE STAFF!
text:
As someone who previously called NY home, I expected an amazing trip back but wasn't nearly prepared for the hotel to be one of the highlights! Not only was the view amazing (18th floor! and the sky lounge are the perfect view of the city from SoHo) but the staff was incredible! If you're fortunate enough to run into her, Lammah is absolutely the best! She checked us in, we were a few hours early and she even offered to let us run up to the lounge, get settled, and called us when our room was ready (which she arranged for almost 2 hours earlier than standard check in!). 

So thank you Lammah and the rest of the hotel team. You made my trip "home" after almost a decade one I wont forget!

title: Small room but the bed more than made up for it!
text: Location was good, room small and hotel fairly no frills but worth the stay for the bed alone. I have NEVER stayed in such a comfortable bed, literally like sleeping on a cloud and just what you need after pounding the streets of NYC! Bathroom was very small too with a 3/4 bath and strange fold in type doors. Great view of the city though with floor to ceiling windows. Would I stay there again? Yes, for the bed and location.

title: Good Hotel, Great Staff - NO PARKING!!
text:
Spent 4 days in NYC (Jun16-19) and booked this hotel through Hotwire... we were initially put on the 2nd floor...arrived late at night and was surprised to find no parking at the hotel even for our motorcycles (no car parking either)...we were directed to a parking lot across the street and they wanted US$50 a night for each bike...managed to find free street parking behind the hotel (as it was the weekend). The safe in our room was not working and the next day the manager and staff were extremely helpful in not letting this ruin our stay. The hotel held our stuff for the day while we went out and were checked into a different room when we got back...I must also mention the lobby staff and bartender in the lobby bar are extremely helpful
PROS: great staff, convenient location, good rooms
CONS: NO PARKING (if you have your own vehicle)

title: Great rate, great room
text: Lammah was very pleasant and helpful. Great location, great rate for last minute reservation. Close to he subway and very convenient to all the places we wanted to go. Great restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Friendly for myself and my teenage son. Safe and clean.

title: Hotel de negócios
text:
Fico neste hotel todos os anos, há pelo menos 5 anos. Quando comecei a frequentar o hotel era bem novinho e me parecia mais bem cuidado. Com o tempo passando tenho a impressão que houve uma queda na qualidade do serviço.
