Fico sempre no Club Floor, que tem uma sala com café da manhã, sofás e televisão, com área aberta com uma vista linda da cidade. Este ano percebi nitidamente uma queda no café da manhã. Menos variedade, sem frutas e com serviço bem fraco. 
Os quartos são pequenos mas limpos e a cama é muito confortável. Mesmo sendo na Canal St, uma rua de muito movimento a vedação do som é boa.

title: Ok hotel
text: Surprised this is a 4 star hotel. Very very small room (but maybe that is typical for NYC?). It was for the end of our honeymoon so think we were looking for somewhere a bit more special.  Housekeeping only restocked one towel (?) probably wouldn't stay here again but good location!

title: Torn between 3 and 4 stars
text: Sister and I stayed for 3 nights this past weekend. Sal at the front was great. Helpful, welcoming and nice. Once upstairs everything was great. Decent room. Upon deciding to make coffee that afternoon, we noticed there was only one coffee pod which only makes one serving, and there were two of us.... in a Finn with double beds.... We had to call and request extra supplies.  In the morning, we had to call for more supplies since we'd used it the day before. No problem there.  Headed out before housekeeping came. They should've restocked coffee supplies then. Following morning, same issue. Enough coffee but one creamer. One stirrer. One cup. I mean, coffee is essential and is the standard thing hotels provide. Needless to say, we called for coffee about 5 times during our stay.  We also never got bottled water in our room till the last night. Aside from that, the top lock latch thing on the door actually broke off the door! With little force.  It gave to the actual thing it's supposed to prevent.  They came and fixed it.  I the tried to gently force my way into it while locked and it almost broke again.  Talk about safe. The most annoying thing was the constant need to call downstairs for coffee. It shouldn't have happened.  Especially since we were in the SPG floor. I don't think we'll stay here again.

title: Mrs karen nassof
text: This hotel has been wonderful. Hotel is well located. But most importantly the staff has been incredible. Very helpful and very accommodating. A shout out to Deon in the concierge lounge and Sal at the front desk who have both been kind and helpful and generous. Highly recommend this hotel

title: Når man får mere end man regnede med.
text: Sheraton Tribeca ligger godt med Soho som nabo og service er i top. Vi boede med adgang til Club Lounge med morgenmad og Happy Hour samt med en fabelagtige tageterrasse med vidunderlig udsigt. Her fik vi en helt særlig oplevelse idet hotellet har ansat en tjener der er ud over det sædvanlige. Deon er en stjerne på sit arbejde, hvor han spreder humør og hjertelighed. Dette var med til at gøre et almindeligt godt kvalitetshotel til en helt usædvanlig oplevelse, hvor vi fik meget mere med hjem end vi regnede med. Ros til et hotel der tør sætte nye standarder for at forkæle sine gæster.

title: Rodent Feces Found in Bathroom
text:
I’m a frequent business traveler and I can with certainty say that I have never been treated so badly by hotel staff as I was treated at the Sheraton Tribeca (370 Canal St, New York, NY 10013). 

After a long travel and work day, I checked in at the Sheraton Tribeca around 6pm. I arrived in my room and was immediately taken back by the smell which was equivalent to my high school locker room after football practice on a hot summer day. 

I proceeded to put my stuff down and lay down on the bed where I got a quick 5-minute nap as sirens woke me up. As I turned over and pulled some of the sheets off I noticed a women’s hair pin in the bed and immediately threw it on the ground. As I was up at this point and disgusted by the conditions I proceeded to use the bathroom where I immediately noticed that the shower was dirty and there were rodent feces all around baseboards (picture attached). 

As I really had enough and didn’t feel comfortable in the room I called the front desk and had the following interaction with Christina: 

Q: Hi I’ve noticed that my room is not clean and I’m wondering if you could move me to a different room?
A: We are all booked tonight. You can wait until tomorrow and then we can transfer you. 
Q: No that is ok. Would it be possible to have housekeeping come up and clean up some of these problem areas? 
A: No housekeeping has left for the day. You can wait until tomorrow to have it cleaned up. 
Q: I feel extremely uncomfortable in this room, could you please transfer me to another SPG hotel?
A: No, we don’t transfer people. 
Q: I’m sorry, are you sure that you cannot transfer me to another hotel? I don’t feel comfortable and I’m not much to work with here. 
A: You can go ahead and book your own hotel if you do not want to stay here. We do not transfer people. 

At this point, I was in complete disbelief at the lack of customer service skills displayed by management and staff at the Sheraton Tribeca. I proceeded to call SPG Corporate where after explaining my situation they offered hotels with astronomically high prices even for New York City. SPG Corporate offered little choice and I had to stay in a hotel that was not in my desired area. As a frequent business traveler, I was flabbergasted by the deplorable customer service and lack of standard cleanliness at the Sheraton Tribeca. You could not pay me enough to return to this hotel.

title: Férias
text:
Hotel bem localizado (divisa Soho/TriBeCa), servido de metrô nas proximidades, quarto de bom tamanho e confortável, porém não dispõe de frigobar. Dispõe de tábua de passar roupas, ferro a vapor e secador de cabelos. 
O grande problema é o péssimo isolamento acústico dos apartamentos, o que faz com que qualquer movimentação do lado externo seja especialmente percebida dentro do quarto. Ficamos no 2º andar, onde também e localizada a academia, máquina de gelo e de refrigerantes, sala de eventos e reuniões, e entrada de funcionários, portanto o barulho era frequente e independente do horário. Portas muito barulhentas. 
Possui um Starbucks no térreo, menor, mas que supre minimamente.
Restaurante com preços acima da média e atendimento cortes.

title: Only cereals and oatmeal at breakfast
text:
Stayed 1 night on Memorial day at Club room. Hotel is nice and silent. 
Evening food at lounge was good with different types of wines and beers. But, the breakfast at the lounge has only cereals and oatmeal! THAT'S IT. it's true. 
The staff said that eggs, yogurts, sausages, cheese, apples, bananas, etc have finished YESTERDAYS. Oh, my god...

title: Buono
text: Buona posizione tra china town e little italy, buon rapporto qualitá prezzo. Pulito. Personale gentile. Accesso palestra gratuito per i clienti. Non abbiamo usufruito della colazione. L hotel è a disposizione per effettuare il transfer decente da e per aeroporto jfk a prezzo del taxi

title: Things seemed to have improved here, much better stay
text:
After 2 mediocre stays here, I decided to give them 1 last and final chance. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean, the service really good, maybe a change in management or a shake up at least. 
The welcome was warm and the spg recognition good. No mix up with bookings this time and offered the room I actually booked. 
Concierge really helpful with booking airport transportation. 
Room service tasty and delivered hot. 
Nice to see some positive changes at this hotel.

title: Adequate for sleeping
text: Stayed here for one night and was a bit underwhelmed. For the price I would have expected a bit more. Did not seem to be up to Sheraton standards. Room was quite worn out and no view which was disappointing. Satisfactory hotel for sleeping (comfortable bed), but not much of an experience in NYC.

title: Nada especial
text:
Me alojé en este hotel en mi último viaje a nyc. Si bien está bien ubicado , está sobre una calle con mucho tráfico por lo cual si usas uber terminas en un embotellamiento diario. 
El hotel es viejo. No tiene frigobar, para ir a la terraza solo tienes que haber pagado el desayuno. El servicio es bueno. Viaje con un bebe y me facilitaron microondas y hervidor y también refrigerador. Pero por el precio hay mil hoteles mejores en ny. No lo recomiendo

title: Qualité très moyenne - Très belle vue du roof top
text:
Accueil catastrophique par les deux hôtesses non professionnelles.
Cela donne une mauvaise impression au départ qui est confirmé par l'état des chambres, vétustes et sombres.Prendre une chambre club minimum.

title: Really Helpful
text:
I was a bit lost and I spoke with the bell guy by the name of Carlos which he helped me out tremendously. He went as far as printing out directions to make sure I was fine and even gave me a water bottle!

Great service!

title: Pratico
text: Service de Transfer oportuno, check-up in e check out pratico e rápido . Só a localização é que deixa um pouco a desejar. Serviço simpático e disponível . A assistência IT não deu provas de grande competência

title: Customer service
text:
Stay at the hotel in May 2017.

Excellent customer service.
I would like especially to mention Lama from reception -
 very  helpful and friendly.

Good rooms, good location good breakfast .

Very good value for money.

title: Amazing Customer Service!
text: I stayed here with my family to attend NYU's graduation. When we first checked in, we ran into a problem with our reservation. It had been booked incorrectly. However, we were helped by Lammah. She was extremely helpful and friendly and made us feel right at home. She fixed our reservation very quickly, and helped us rearrange our booking. We told her that grandparents were coming as well, and she arranged our rooms to make sure the grandparents would be on the same floor as us! The rooms had a beautiful view, and were extremeley comfortable. Lammah made our stay even better by accommadating our every need and making sure that we felt at home. I definitely recommend staying here because the staff is excellent and the rooms are amazing.

title: Excellent customer service
text: My husband (fiance at the time) and I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca in March 2016. We were in the City for the night so that we could go to the menu tasting for our wedding. The tasting was in Soho, and so we found the Sheraton Tribeca on a hotel search website because it was close to where we were going and a very good price for a Friday evening in NYC. Our stay Friday night was very nice. Our room was small (as all NYC hotel rooms tend to be), but the bed was super comfy and the bathroom was a decent size. We checked our bags at the front desk Saturday morning and set off to run errands/explore the city. We decided on a whim to stay Saturday night, as well, but didn't have a reservation. The manager at the Sheraton Tribeca was able to match a special price that they were running on a discount website, which we were super appreciative of! The front desk agent upgraded us to the club level because she knew we were celebrating our engagement/wedding planning. This is when we fell in love with the hotel. The roof top patio on the club level is incredible. My husband and I love looking out at the tall buildings of New York, and this patio allowed us to do just that. We were completely taken care of throughout our entire stay, and we look forward to staying at the Sheraton Tribeca again!

title: Bra standardhotell med sköna sängar och bra läge
text:
Hotellet känns som ett typiskt "scandic-hotell/konferens-hotell". Dvs rätt stort, många och ocharmiga rum, men samtidigt komfortabla och bekväma. Hotellet ligger på en väldigt trafikerad gata, men samtidigt väldigt centralt och perfekt läge för en semester på manhattan.

Tips är att boka ett premium/business-rum (kommer inte ihåg vad deras benämning var). De kostade bara lite extra, och du får tillgång till roof-top terassen, rum högt upp i huset samt frukost och eftermiddags-snack & drinkar varje dag.

title: Zum Vergessen
text:
Altes Jugendherbergsniveau, schmuddelig, teilweise total unfreundliches Personal.
Wer zum erstenmal in NY ist, der sieht das sicher anders, läuft sowieso nur rum. Aber wenn man schon öfters da war, nicht mehr.  Ist allerdings auch eine Frage des Preises.

title: Not good value
text:
Stayed this week for a couple of nights on a work trip and was fairly disappointed with the hotel. For $350 a night I expect more, even in NY which I know is expensive. Everything felt old and tired and it felt like the place just wasn't trying.

Location for my needs worked which is what saves this from being a 2* review.

Bathroom products felt cheap.  

Wifi was free and worked well.

I will try very hard not to go back.

title: Very basic and torn sheets
text: I flew in late from SFO to EWR and needed a hotel to sleep for a couple hours ahead of a meeting in TriBeCa. The positive was that when I arrived post 1am they were expecting me. The negatives included that the room key machine was not working so they could not issue me a room key (someone opened my room with a master key, but I couldn't leave and return to my room with help), the room was very basic and worn, and my bed sheets had a big rip in it. For $400 plus a night I would call this a bad deal.

title: Four Points?
text: What is the difference between a Sheraton Hotel and a Four Points by Sheraton hotel? The Sheraton Tribeca comes nowhere near matching the standard Sheraton Hotel. You enter and a tiny desk on the right is the check-in. There is no lobby as such as the main room is internet, bar, and restaurant. We were assigned a  tiny room in the back of the Fifth Floor despite being Starwood Preferred Guests. The theater ticket I had sent to the hotel was supposed to be waiting for me, but they claimed they didn't get it. They did, it was just locked in an office somewhere. Thankfully it wasn't for the same night. We were able in 6 days to once eat at the restaurant. Even though it was relatively empty, there was never anyone there to seat us. The vending machine on our floor was running loudly all week, but all items were sold out and never restocked. The room keys kept losing their charge and we would have to return to the desk to get them fired up again. But, we did adjust. The bed was comfortable, the water hot. The room was surprisingly quiet. One of the front managers remembered my name and was helpful and friendly.

title: Date Night In NYC.
text:
My wife and I decided to use some SPG points and stay in lower Manhattan, an area we do not usually go.  We arrived at the hotel Saturday afternoon and even though they were at full capacity we were greeted warmly and our room was ready.  

When we got to the room there was a small stain on the bed sheet and the staff came right up and changed all the bedding.  

The hotel is walking distance to many restaurants and sites, which is what we wanted to do.   My wife and I really had a great time.   The hotel is fairly new and all the staff were friendly and accommodating.   

We stay at many SPG properties and this was a good one.

title: Excellent value in Tribeca
text: Getting a good hotel in Tribeca is a must if you want to enjoy walking around and the Sheraton's location is near-perfect. Its right next to the Canal Street Metro station, and close to the heart of Tribeca. The room was excellent (the upgrade helped!) and the service was great. Tribeca tends to get really busy on weekends and the hotel was no different!! It was very busy but the staff managed it well. Sleep quality is ranked average due to the usual NYC background noise of sirens, cars etc., cant escape that!!

title: Bien situé
text:
Très bon emplacement idéalement situé.  le restaurant dans le hall est plutôt cher mais bon
Pas testé le petit-dej. Chambre propre mais avec un mobilier qui commence à dater mais draps propres Chambre donnant sur rue .

title: This is a 2 star hotel max.....good location
text:
Hotel lost one or two starts long time ago.....very expensive for the quality of the rooms, worst breakfast buffet on my life...and I travel extensively all over the world

Please avoid low level rooms facing Canal street....I had to change my room extremely noisy

title: Buchung wurde ohne Rückmeldung storniert
text:
Alleine aus diesem Grund gibt es nur zwei Sterne. Ich stehe mit meiner Tochter um 23 Uhr zum Check-in vor der Tür und angeblich konnte meine Kreditkarte nicht belastet werden, obwohl schon Tage vorher belastet wurde!
Lobby ist nett, Frühstück eine absolute Frechheit. Die Lage ist sehr gut und die Zimmer haben 2-3 Sterne Niveau!

title: Atrocious Front Desk Staff
text: I actually had a front desk girl call me at 10 PM on our last night, when my daughter was asleep asking me for my credit card. I booked with Expedia thru a split reservation so she said I needed to swipe my CC again for incidentals. Unacceptable to call our room phone at 10 PM when we were sleeping. I am honestly disturbed by this persons lack of common sense and judgement. Will NEVER stay here again.

title: Be prepared!
text: Although this hotel is a great option for business folks who work around Varick (me), I highly recommend you to pause. The rooms have a well-used feel to them and that's understandable due to the Canal street location. So you get what you pay for which in my case was very limited in-room food options and poor front desk service. I wanted a suggestion for sushi and no one could provide. I walked outside, turned a corner and found one. Literally less than a block away. I suppose no one needs to rely on live employees anymore but it is delightful when someone surprises me! Starwood please take a closer look at this property.

title: Sheraton Tribeca New York
text: Vi bodde 4 jenter på ett rom og delte 2 doble senger. Litt små rom for 4 personer men går greit. Husk å be om to sett dyner om dere ikke vil dele en dobbeltdyne. Vi fikk ikke alltid korrekt antall håndklær, men de var kjappe opp med det når vi ringte. Vil nok gi hotellet 3+ som en mer korrekt standard. Ligger rett på Canal Street, og har gode kommunikasjoner med subway. Kort gangavstand til bl.a. Little Italy, Chinatown, Soho & Greenwich Village. Hyggelig havnepromenade som kan gås helt ned til Battery Park/Ground Zero.

title: Unimpressed
text: Being a platinum member with Marriott, I was eager to stay SPG after the merge and this was my first stay.  I travel for work and am in a hotel 4-5 days/week. What a disappointment!  The rooms are outdated, customer service was horrible, the front desk staff was not pleasant, and when I asked for a room with a great view I was assured this was a room with a fantastic view--it was underwhelming to say the least. I called down and switched to a different room on the same floor and it was even worse. All the staff had to say was I'm sorry but we don't have any rooms available with a great view right now, but instead wasted my time and having me switch rooms. The only good thing about this hotel is its location. Needless to say, I will not be back to this property!

title: Never again
text:
Rooms are with out fridge no slippers and no bath robe. Very very dirty room The flooring is stinky and needs a change my pillow inserts were yellow also the duvet insert this was the worse experience ever . I felt like the guys in the next room are sitting on my chair and those who are walking outside my room's door are walking next to the bed...I stayed in different hotels here in new York and it was a better experience..
I got some delivery from Amazon which apparently was misplaced by the people who work here (probably given to someone else) and i spent 4 hours waiting for them to bring to my room as i need to pack and check out tomorrow     The service desk did not call back and when i called for the 3rd time she said they are looking for it when it was 11:00 pm already!!

title: Always happy here!
text: This is now my third stay at this hotel and I continue to be impressed with the staff, rooms and service. The club lounge is good and well stocked for food and drinks whilst the staff member working there is so friendly and accommodating.

title: Convenience and comfort
text: I booked this hotel rather last minute after finding a good price on the hoteltonight app.  We were driving in and this was extremely convenient from the Holland Tunnel, minimizing the amount of NYC traffic and gridlock I had to deal with and valet parking was available.  I found each and every hotel staffer to be very friendly and courteous, the hotel was clean and our room was quiet (no view, but who cares?) with an exceptionally comfy bed.  Yes, the immediate area isn't great, but I was with my 18-year old daughter and never felt unsafe.  You are walking distance from some great areas.  I plan to stay here again if possible as my daughter will be attending NYU in the Fall.

title: i thought its a one star hotel
text: Receptionist who check us in provide us the worse service a 4 star hotel can offer. We arrived there April 5 and stayed for 6 nights we stayed in 619 and our parents in 606. I did not even hear her greet us atleast good afternoon :-(. She just simply say checking in ask the name and the credit card and thats it. My husband is still putting his credit card back to his wallet she is already calling the other guest. Even the other guest itself know that he needs to give space to the poor guy arranging his things in the counter. No luggage assistance. Horrible...staying there is not comfortable at all. I ask for hot water for my babys milk no one can bring it up when i went down the staffs were just talking to each other. Incase i will come back to new york never again in this hotel.If i choose a one star hotel atleast i know what i should expect not a 4star but make you feel you are in in 1 star. the room has poor noise resistance. Housekeeping did not clean our room anyway by 7pm she knocked if we need to clean our room. Im sorry but horrible horrible experience. one tip if you are travelling with baby who needs crib if you have a sidings cover please bring because they have a steel kind of crib.

title: Good Price, Ok room, Horrible Starbucks, Bad area of town
text:
Rooms at this hotel are wuite reasonably priced. Mine was $179. The room itself was quite ok. Nothing fancy, but quite ok.

The server at the Starbucks could be the worst I have experienced at any of their locations world-wide. He simply should not be working in the service industry.

I booked this hotel to be near Soho, and it is (about 6 blocks away). But as you exit the hotel and turn right, the first 2 blocks are not a pretty site. In fact, I would not want to walk the, late at night. Even during the day you simply feel the guys hanging around the cheap fake watch and souvenir shops don't have your health and safety in their minds.

Other aspects of service were ok in the hotel.

I took a flat rate $60 to JFK airport. The cars are aged, and the driver texted many times during the trip. UberX was $65, and I would do that next time.

title: Not worth staying
text:
Good location even if rooms can be quite noisy with all the traffic on Canal Street. Friendly service, yet not very switched on: room is made up quite late and often there's no change of towels until you request it.
Rooms are not very big, but furniture is bulky and doesn't leave much space in a room which is already rather small.
Surely the hotel is in desperate need of some kind of renovation.
Price quality ratio is not really good as you can find much better places within the same area for a similar price.

title: Very disappointed, below par for 4 star
text:
I was travelling with my young son who had just turned 12 so had booked a twin bedded room through a very reputable travel agent 6 months previously for a 6 day stay in New York so I was pretty furious that when we checked in at around 5pm we were told that there was no twin room available to us as ours had 'flooded' but they could offer us adjoining rooms instead, and that we would get a twin room the next day. If my son was an older teen this might have been a reasonable option but in a strange city on one of New York's busiest and most chaotic streets, he did not feel happy about sleeping alone. Consequently we had to have those heavy adjoining fire doors constantly propped open by a chair and we never felt properly relaxed and of course we couldn't unpack.  

These rooms were not great, being right outside the lift. The next day we did some early sightseeing so that we could come back in the early afternoon to claim our new room. However, when we came back we were told that we were welcome to keep the extra room at no extra charge as there would not be a twin room available that day either. I really couldn't believe their casual attitude about all of this and how they didn't seem to appreciate how inconvenienced we felt about it. 

At my insistence I got complimentary access to their 'club' area which was a lounge on the top floor which was a very pleasant and stylish lounge with a 24/7 supply of drinks and snacks and spectacular views of New York from the terrace. However, only the next day did I finally get a twin room and what a sorry sight it was. It actually had a badly cracked basin in the bathroom, and when leaning over the sink to brush my teeth I had a close-up view of just how filthy the overflow hole was. One of the towels also had black staining on it - like mascara although it had been laundered so it really should have been de-commissioned. The desk chair had a revolting stain on it - nothing that upholstery cleaner wouldn't shift - but it just seemed typical of the lack of care or attention to detail. The beds were very comfortable so no complaints there. However, I was surprised and disappointed in a four star hotel that there was not even a little fridge anywhere to keep our drinks and fresh milk. There would have been space for this if a couple of shelves were taken out of their poor quality and unattractive brown furniture. 

So I wouldn't recommend this place - the staff did not treat us well and there are better hotels out there for the price.

title: Very average hotel on awful Canal Street in Tribeca
text: I booked this hotel as I knew that Tribeca is a cool area--but I did not realise that Canal Street is probably the worst street in all of Manhattan! There is constant traffic as it leads to the Holland Tunnel and it does not feel safe at all, with lots of illegal vendors, homeless people and other very dodgy looking people lurking around. Now, the hotel itself--if the staff hadn't been very nice and the beds hadn't been very comfortable, I would have given it only 1 star! The rooms are very small and very cheaply appointed--for example, the headboard I think was supposed to look like leather but it was a very bad fake and was plastic as was the wall paper. The bathrooms are also too small with no space to put your toiletries. The closet was tiny and looked like the closets they have in a college dorm! One more thing--we usually had to wait at least 5 minutes for the lift as there were 3 lifts but 1 was out of order, which apparently is the case all the time. The lift then kept stopping at lots of floors since so many other people had been waiting. Overall, very disappointing!! I would not recommend this hotel.

title: It's all about location
text:
We visited New York on a cold April 2017 with my wife, my one year old daughter and my parents.
We decided to stay on Sheraton Tribeca for the convenient location and for the reputed name of the hotel. Sadly only the first part was successful.
Probably we are spoiled by the Dubai standard in the hotel but Tribeca doesn't have the level of a 4 stars.
First of all the receptionist was much more interested in my credit card than in making me feel welcome. Then nobody has accompanied us to our rooms even if we were with an infant and a old couple.
We asked a water boiler to prepare food for our daughter but they answered that we can call and request for the warm water to the room service: we called 6 am and they answer that the service start 7 am :-/
On the 2nd  day no room cleaning were performed even if we remove the DND sign.

The room are not as small as I was expecting: with the crib there are enough space to move around. The beds are comfortable while the furniture looks a bit tired. 
Little noisy the room facing Canal Street on lower level (6).

title: Great staff.
text: Good experience at this hotel!  Staff were great!  Rooms were a good size for New York.  Close to subway.  You can walk to wall st area.  Only negative is that canal st is very busy and it was extremely hard to get a cab.

title: okey, but dont expect Sheraton standards.
text:
Good location, friendly staff and fair price (relativly to NYC general prices). Maybe I would consider to stay here next time im in NYC.

But dont expect any of the normal Sheraton standards. The rooms feel old, with furniture falling apart, dust everywhere, torn towlels and mold in the shower. I asked the reception twice (both second and third day) to get someone to remove the mold, but none of the mold were removed (the second time I could see the roomkeeper had cleaned the shower but still mold). I was not offered a new mold-free room.

Dont waste your money on the breakfast. The breakfast is small and expensive. They do have scrambled eggs (though rubbery) and awesome bacon, and great waffle-machine, but if you want a bagel for breakfast (or something healthy) they are dry (didn't feel fresh, though they probably were) and sweet and with nothing but peanutbutter, jam and philadelphia (cream cheese) to put on it (no cheese, ham, salami etc.).. This could of course be a normal US/NYC breakfast, but as a European I would recomend you go out of the hotel for breakfast where you can find something more healthy.

To conclude: okey hotel, perhaps I'll stay here again, but if you ever stayed at a Sheraton hotel before - don't expect the same experience. Personally I think it is a bit strange Sheraton accepts its name on this hotel.

title: great
text:
wonderfull  experience  great staff food service  upon arrival  very swift check inn suite was very large  with a very big king bed that was fresh  room service 2nd too none 
will be back very soon  love this place

title: All good
text:
Nice room with double king size beds, good and clean service, the room was not too much noising considering the traffic of NYC.
The personnel at the counter was ok, even when we had some problems with the credit card. Really nice hotel, the location is super! suggested!!!

title: OK -
text: Nice hotel. Got a good deal and was upgraded to Club 21 upon arrival. Club 21 is acces to 21th floors lounge with breakfast and free snack and beverage in the afternoon. A good deal. Nice and central location.

title: One of the low performing Sheraton I stayed
text: As a platinum member, no upgrade to even the club floor and no local amenity or water in the room.  Check in person was not that interested to help.  To make it worst she gave me the wrong room number.  Safe not working and bathroom amenities not better than Holiday Inn.  My advise for Gold and Platinum member, move on to a Marriott by transferring your points. I stayed at better Marriott in Manhattan.  What a disappointment.

title: Business visit
text: Hotel was nice and cozy fantastic hotel at town. Nice view from room. staff at guest counter are not frankly and helpful. No parking front of hotel. When we get out from the car. Trouble to pick our language. no one assist there guest. Need to improve we pay very high.

title: Good location, good service
text: The hotel is near key shopping sites, near 24 hour open Duane Reade's.  Hotel staff is friendly. UPS is close by.  The hotel had one issue: they lost the packages from Amazon.  I had to resend them and suffered a bad headache as a result.  Concierge could be more careful

title: Wonderful Property Close to Canal Close to Food, The Subway And VIEWS!!!!!
text:
Time to Write my Review on The Sheraton Tribeca New York!
There is so much to say about this property! From the moment you walk in the door the bellmen are right there for you, in any of our past stays have we ever had to wait, they are on it. I really wish that I could remember their names but I am much better with faces then name tags! They all have made a definite impression on us though! 

Will the Front Desk Manager is a wonderful asset to not only this hotel but to the Sheraton Corporation! 

The Conceiarge Level is wonderful! They really put out a nice spread for appetites of all kinds. 

The view from the top patio is phenomenal! We look foreword to spending much time up there this summer with our family!! 

The rooms are nice! You can never go wrong with a think Sheraton bed. The rooms are nicely updated and have many extra touches to make use of all of the space in a New York size room :) Which exist at any hotel you go to in any big city! 

What I feel is an added bonus is that there is a fine dining restaurant located inside the hotel. There is also a wonderful deli (24 hour) located right next door. There is a Pizza Parlor on the corner about a half a block away. 

At this property you are walking distance to the underground subway, Canal St & Little Italy. 

You really can’t go wrong with this property. I hope that you felt my review to be helpful to you. 

We really look foreword to coming back in the very near future!

title: Is an ok hotel
text:
The reception is nice and gorgeous but the rooms are old, I expected newer rooms but unfortunately didn't happen , I use to stay at another 2 hotels 2 blocks away and the experience I have to say is better because the rooms are newer.
I don't recommend because for the same amount of money you can find better places 2 blocks away.

title: Sans plus ...
text: Très bon emplacement mais pour un 4 étoiles je m'attendais à mieux.... Pas testé le petit-dej et personnel pas très sympathique. Chambre propre mais draps étonnamment froissé à l'arrivée... Chambre donnant sur rue très bruyante aussi bien le jour que la nuit.

title: Ideal business and leisure central hotel
text:
This hotel is centrally located for all attractions, good local restaurants, bars and in a neighbourhood that is safe and away from the hustle of midtown. Stayed in NYC numerous times and in my view  this area of SOHO, Tribeca, West Village is by far the most pleasant for visitors who are staying a few days. 
The hotel is clean, professionally run and friendly from the moment you arrive until the time you depart. It is certainly a hotel you are pleased you chose - specific mention to Sai and his bellboy colleague who provided an exceptional level of profesisonal service and a smile at all times of the day.
The room is not spacious but where is in NY. It is modern, clean and has a superb shower (and hairdryer according to my wife!). Only minor issue was the limited storage space. 
When I return to NY for business or leisure, this is the venue I will opt for without hesitation.

title: Superb service, excellent location, and more...
text:
This was my first SPG stay since the Marriott merger and I already feel less loyal to the Marriott family. My Platinum status gave me more benefits at this hotel. The hotel was also very thoughtful about which type of room I might prefer. The Club Lounge was small but it has a fabulous and spacious patio on the 21st floor.

My room was large (uncommon in NYC) and I used the fitness center every morning. I am in NYC frequently for work and had been trending on staying in a different hotel each time. After this stay it is highly likely that I will try to book here for all future stays in NYC because I had a very special room that I will not divulge here since there aren't many of them. I also could have walked to/from all of my meetings in Lower Manhattan had it not been raining.

The hotel is super close to the 1, A, C, E, and the 6 subway lines all along Canal so it is very easy to transfer underground from Penn Station. The location also is easy to get to via the Brooklyn or Manhattan Bridges if coming into LGA or JFK airports via Queens/Brooklyn.

I spend on average half of every year in hotels for work and I very highly recommend this hotel. Sal - you rock, Man!

title: Already booked 8 nights in August to show my wife the fantastic hospitality at Sheraton Tribeca
text:
After hearing me share so many stories of the excellent customer service at Sheraton TriBeCa my wife is so looking forward to visiting in August 
Location will be perfect for our leisure visit with so many shops and restaurants close by and such easy access to downtown

title: Good location
text: Hotel is big and busy. Good location to the shops and restaurants. Rooms are big and clean. Bathroom shower is a bit date. The shower pressure is very low so took ages to wash my hair. Overall the room is specious and clean. Hotel is very busy and staff are helpful and friendly. Would stay again as I know what to expect. Breakfast is better at cafes near the hotel.

title: Bad choice
text:
Not a 4 star hotel... 
We ask simple things, but they didnt care about it. The hotel and the room is noise.
Nem segítőkész a személyzet, fejetlenség van. A közvetlen környék lehangoló, hangos. Egy masik, szecessziós szálloda helyett választottuk ezt, nagy hiba volt.

title: Great option in Tribeca
text:
Located on Canal St, just a short walk to the hip areas of SoHo/Tribeca. Not a great street and I wouldn't walk around late at night as it's a bit shabby but with access to the subway and close to all the sights of downtown you couldn't fault it as a comfortable base for a sightseeing visit to New York. 
The bed was super comfortable!! The views from my room were wow, the bathroom was very clean. 
I didn't eat in the hotel or use the gym but staff were very helpful. 
They have an airport taxi service too and I had a really professional driver called Juan who was very interesting company and a very safe driver. 
Overall, good value for money and I liked being close to the shops and restaurants of SoHo & Tribeca and on a few really good subway lines. Wish they could improve Canal St though!! Highly recommended overall.

title: Comfort and convenience
text:
I've stayed at this hotel many times and is typically my first choice (if the price is below my work allowance.) My office is just a couple of blocks north of the hotel so the location is perfect for me. It's also just a few minutes from the Canal stations for the blue, yellow, and green lines. 

The rooms are pretty standard for NYC - nothing to write home about but certainly comfortable enough for a week long stay. The staff are friendly and remember you throughout your trip. I am a Starwood member so I usually opt for the high floors on the club levels. This is great as it includes afternoon happy hour in the clubroom as well as free breakfasts. The bfasts are above average for hotels in my opinion - just enough to get you through to lunch. 

The only downside of this hotel is its right on Canal St so definitely opt for a room facing away from canal. You won't get the nice Empire State Building view, but at least you won't be hearing nonstop honking when there's traffic.

title: Goede prijs-kwaliteit verhouding
text: Prima uitvalsbasis. Vele metrolijnen in de buurt dus je kunt je makkelijk verplaatsen. Als je graag wat wandelt kun je naar de Brooklyn Bridge lopen en het WTC. Canal Street is een drukke straat. Soms staat het om 2 uur in de nacht nog vast. Wij hadden op onze hotelkamer geen last van de toeterende auto's/vrachtwagens. Ook zitten er leuke wijkjes op loopafstand en winkelen doe je erg goed op West Broadway. Supertent om te ontbijten is Tribeca's kitchen.

title: Would have been an excellent stay but
text:
Check-in was smooth and quick and our room was spacious and clean. It was all great until we tried to place an order for room service breakfast the next morning. We followed the directions on the card that was given to us and hung it on our door for them to take. We requested a delivery between 10:15-10:30am. Woke up the next morning and no breakfast. Checked the door and the card was taken, so they must have received the order. We called to inquire about what happened and to cancel the breakfast since we had made plans that we needed to get to. Spoke to a gentleman who said he would get back to me about what happened and we never heard back from him. So that was very disappointing. 

While we were getting ready to leave for the day, housekeeping came by our room. We simply told them we were leaving shortly and to come back in a half hour and they said no problem. On our way out, we even spoke with the front desk and told them housekeeping stopped by and we want to be sure our room gets cleaned and she said she would notify them now. So, we came back well after five hours to our room not cleaned. We went down to the front desk and the man told us they were "backed up and he'll check on it for us" he also thought we had our DND sign on the door, but we never used it. Nothing ever happened, there was no follow through, so we gave up and had to request a whole set of things for the room (towels, soaps, shampoo, toilet paper, coffee, etc) and the woman rushed me off the phone so quickly and forgot half of the items we requested. 

Everything about this trip and hotel would have been wonderful had those few things not happened. It's frustrating to spend all of this money and simple things like getting your room cleaned doesn't get done or your breakfast order just mysteriously disappears.

title: Very nice hotel
text: This is a great hotel. The staff is nice and attentive. The rooms are very comfortable. The rooms are nicely sized. The location is excellent. I strongly recommend this hotel. The Club on the 21st floor is well-staffed. The views are excellent.

title: Simple, pero excelente ... con una atención de lujo..
text: Este hotel, puede que no sea elegante, y que no esté ubicado en una calle muy bonita, sin embargo esta ubicado estrategicamente entre SOHO, China Town y Manhattan, las habitaciones no son muy grandes, el baño muy cómodo, sin tina, solo ducha, pero la atención del servicio de mucamas, extremadamente amables, los recepcionistas, siempre con la sonrisa perfecta, preocupados de todo, ofreciendo ayuda sin pedirla, lo amé, en especial a un Bell Boy, que me impresiono lo amable, felicitaciones a TODOS los de este hotel

title: Friendly Staff, Great Location
text: We were very pleased with our stay at the Sheraton Tribeca.  The entire staff - front desk, housekeeping, concierge, and especially Tonya in the bar - were all so helpful and friendly.   We were there during a "state of emergency" storm which shut down a good portion of the city - the staff made the hotel feel like home.  Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  The location is a fantastic base for exploring SoHo & Tribeca, and with the subway around the corner, it is easy to get to other parts of the city.  We would definitely stay here on our next visit.

title: Excellent Location - Small rooms
text: This hotel is in a great location - easy to get to the subway - easy to walk to Canal street shops.  The rooms aren't huge but they are ok sized for NYC. The hotel is pretty clean and the beds were comfortable.

title: Hotels itself is not impressive but Great staff & Service compensate for that.
text:
Sheraton Tribeca New York Hotel and I got off to a rocky start without recognition of SPG status on check-in, and a slight attitude at the front office SPG desk, but this was more than well compensated for over the next two days by a lady whom I suppose was the front office(or concierge) manager actively engaging and helping out guests. For example: I walked back into the hotel after a meeting on a hot summer day and was met by the front office lady calling my name to give me two bottles of complimentary water. Now, thats recognition, and service. I bought some things that I needed to package for shipping and within minutes I had scissors, boxes and tape in my room. Impressive. 

The city view from the lounge outdoor seating area are simply spectacular(photo). The African American gentleman who man’s the lounge in the evenings is a super professional - be prepared to be entertained because this guy’s a real character. If I owned an upscale restaurant in NYC I would’ve stolen him at any cost.

I would say that the staff are this hotels biggest assets. Sure the location is good, the rooms are acceptable, but what makes Sheraton Tribeca stand out are a few genuinely engaged and nice human beings and because of this, I'll be back.

title: Modern hotel in convienent location
text: The Sheraton Tribeca is a comfortable hotel offering above average service.  We stayed on the club floor and took advantage of the club room for happy hour.  Our room had some housekeeping issues that were fully resolved promptly after notification of staff.

title: sketchy neighbourhood but OK overall
text: I thought the location was very convenient, very close to subway stations, tribeca, chinatown and little italy. The rooms are tiny and kind of dark but the bed was comfy! Also, the hotel was in a very sketchy neighbourhood.

title: 첫 뉴욕 출장
text: 다녀 온지 오래되었지만 첫 뉴욕 출장이라 기대를 하고 갔지만 그냥 평범한 비지니스 호텔 수준이다. 호텔 방은 상당히 좁았고 방에 슬리퍼도 제공이 안되었다. 다행히 지친 몸을 이끌고 업무가 끝나고 숙면을 취하기 좋았다. 여행이 아닌 출장자에게 더 좋은 호텔인듯 하다. 소호가 도보로 가까워서 좋았다.

title: Dreary
text: We stayed at this hotel because it was in a convenient for us location and because we will get SPG points for staying there. The room was claustrophobically small, the mattress too soft, the walls thin. It may be Ok for one person, but very uncomfortable for two. Very little counter space in the bathroom and the bathroom not very clean, there was a black line and black splotches around the shower pan where it touches the wall tile.  We had a room in the "quiet area" but it still was noisy at night.

title: Great Location
text: Hotel is located in a great spot, easy access to the subway, all kinds of restaurants and shops in the area, the benefits of being right on Canal and near Soho and Nolita.  Beautiful room, realllly comfortable beds, great water pressure (I loved the shower).  My only comment would be how loud the plumbing is, which isn't a big deal especially when it provides such fantastic water pressure.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Functional with no frills.
text:
Stayed at the Tribeca Sheraton in early February 2017, the location is advantageous to the Metro system, and nearby Little Italy & Tribeca its self. 
The hotel was ok, clean, very busy, comfortable a nice bed, but nothing spectacular. 
One small bottle of water per double room (unchilled) was provided on a daily basis, I thought 2 would have been more apt. 
The view was a definite plus point, and I was happy with the room description which was an accurate reflection . On the whole, it was a value for money in respect of the location, and I'd consider using it again, but it wasn't a showstopper.

title: Just right
text: This hotel was just right for us. The room was a good size, the bed super comfortable. It was close to a subway stop so you could get just about anywhere else. Price was less than many NY hotel that are not as nice.The gentleman at check in was super helpful. I regret I did not get his name but he made sure our room had a great view.

title: Excellent location, views, bed & value for money - Recommended
text:
Positives:

- Excellent hospitality & service: Katie, in particular went above
  and beyond for the special arrangements that she made for our stay and
  Dion in the Club Lounge for his kindness, made us feel at home. Cheri
  (housekeeping), for her great service and little notes.
- Facilities:
Very good king bed room (floor 14): Spacious room, extremely comfy bed, maybe even too comfy... it was difficult to wake up! Good sized shower. Average shower amenities. Decent wardrobe size. Exceptional view from room, directly facing the Empire State Building. The Club Lounge has a view that is just incredible, free computer access, friendly evening service (Dion) that make up for the pretty lack lustre breakfast food.
- Excellent location: 
Close to Broadway, Little Italy and Chinatown with many shops and the restaurants and also good for bargain souvenirs from the street sellers. Also perfect for metro access both uptown and downtown.
- Excellent value for money (IF you book in advance)

Negatives:

- For a Sheraton hotel/4-star hotel, it could maybe do with some
  renovation work
- Breakfast was average in the Club Lounge. The evening service is above average, Dion was very welcoming and the wine selection is good (nice Malbec!)
- The Antica bar is a tad pricey but they have a good selection of beers, in particular the ales.

title: Great base for exploring Lower Manhattan
text: This was our first time staying in Lower Manhattan - we usually stay in the Upper East Side / Times Square area and found the Sheraton to be a great base for exploring this part of the city especially if you want to spend a lot of time in Soho and Tribeca. The rooms were on the small side and they could have done a better job with the housekeeping. Otherwise, a good hotel if you're on a budget.

title: Good value, excellent location
text: We stayed there on two separate visits in February. Nice clean rooms, and good beds. Level rooms on the top floors have a nice view, and less noice from the traffic in Canal Street. Walking distance from the shopping area in SOHO and no problem finfint Nice restaurants next to the hotel.

title: Regular Visitor: Great location, Wonderful staff
text: Is this the fanciest hotel you'll ever stay at in your life?  No.  But what it lacks in imagination it makes up for in location, location, location.  I am a former NYer who returns to the city twice a month and this is my go-to hotel.  It's close to my office (a huge plus), but it's also very close to major access points in the city. It's right off the ACE and 123 lines, which can take you pretty much anywhere on the west side or downtown.  It's also a short walk to the 456 to go uptown and the east side. The staff is amazing - they take care of me very well!  It's reasonably priced, clean, safe with great access to much of the city.

title: Clean shoe box
text: If you want a room with a crap view that's the size of an elevator in the ugliest part of manhattan you've come to the right spot. DO NOT trust the photos on Hotels.com they're insanely misleading. The doors are paper thin, and there's nothing around in the neighborhood except for sketchy people. Make sure you lock your door. Pillow top mattress? This thing is like sleeping on a carpeted floor.

title: Club Level Room Trick
text:
Wir haben für 5 Tage ein Club Level Room gebucht. Laut Information auf der Webseite, liegen die Club Level Räume auf der 21+22 Etage. Zusätzlich bekommt man Frühstück incl in der Club-Level Lounge.

Beim einchecken, bekammen wir aber nur ein Zimmer in der 17 Etage angeboten. Wir haben der Dame am Empfang direkt gesagt, dass wir aber ein Club-Level Raum gebucht haben. Diese Zimmer wären aber nur auf der 21+22 Etage. Wir haben extra diese Zimmer gebucht, damit wir einen besseren Ausblick haben, Frühstück dabei ist, und diese Zimmer kosten auch mehr Geld

Leider könnten wir ein Zimmer auf diesen Etagen heute nicht bekommen, weil die ALLE ausgebucht sind.

Tja, was soll ich sagen?!? Die Club-Level Zimmer kosten mehr, sind auch nur auf 2 Etagen angeboten und wir bekommen ein Zimmer auf ein paar Etagen tiefer.

Die Dame am Empfang meinte noch, es wären eh alle Zimmer gleich - aha, und wieso kosten dann die Club-Level Zimmer mehr?? Wir könnten aber in 2 Tagen umziehen.

Naja, 1x den Koffer ausgepackt, wer zieht da noch freiwillig nach 2 Tagen um??

Mit den Zimmerkarten hat man dann automatisch Zugang zu der Lounge. Leider ging unsere Karte nicht, die Tür blieb verschlossen. Warum? Weil wir eine Zimmer-Karte für einen Standard-Zimmer hatten und eben nicht Club-Level Zimmer. Also, wieder runter zum Empfang, Problem angesprochen. Wir wurden dann manuell dafür freigeschaltet, sodass unsere Karten für die Lounge funktionierten.

Zimmer: Zimmer war sauber, aber sehr laut. Obwohl es in der 17 Etage war, konnte man jedes Auto hören, da es mit Fenster an der Canal Str. lag. Man hatte das Gefühl, man hätte das Fenster geöffnet.

Frühstück: In der Lounge flogen überall dreckige Teller rum, es wurde nur sporadisch abgeräumt. Deswegen sah es teilweise echt ungemühtlich aus.

Ich bewerte hier oft und habe durchaus auch viele positive Bewertungen, aber hier gibt es einfach zu viel zum meckern.

Fakt ist: Das Hotel mit Standardzimmer, ohne Frühstück ist mit Sicherheit ok. Aber wenn man schon Club-Level Zimmer anbieten und dafür bezahlt, möchte man auch so ein Zimmer haben. Wir haben kein Geld zurück bekomen, und wurden einfach so am Empfang vertröstet. Und wenn man mitten in New York steht, was soll man dann schon machen?

title: Home Away from Home
text:
This is truly my home away from home.  I have been here about every other month, and out of the hundreds of hotels I could choose, I keep on coming back here.  

I continue to be amazed by the level of customer service that I receive every time I return to the Sheraton Tribeca.  I first met Colin Hughey last summer - he took such great care of me (with giving me the best room possible, and just being so genuinely pleasant).  Then I met Katie Cardone (guest relations manager), who has been my go-to person - takes care of my reservation and everything you can think of when you're away from home.  During this last stay, I was impressed by the amazing customer service again.  I landed really late, delays with flight, luggage, etc, so that by the time I got to the hotel it was past midnight.  I just wanted a glass of wine to relax; called downstairs but everything was closed.  Five minutes later, Luis (front desk) saved the day and brought me wine, even though the lounge and restaurant (and room service) was closed.  Then day after day, I'd leave at 6am, before the breakfast was open/available, and the night manager, Nelson happily got me hot water for my tea and croissants.  

The best part about these people is that they look like they genuinely love their job.  I love this place!

title: CORRECTO Y BUENA UBICACIÓN
text: Hotel correcto con buena ubicación, cerca del metro y con fácil acceso a pie a Chinatawn y Soho. Servicio amable y rápido. En general limpio. Lo que me desencanto fue la habitación excepto la cama que es muy cómoda, me parecen muy sencillas para ser un cuatro estrellas, sobretodo el armario ridículo que tienen. En mi caso que estuve dos semanas y no pude sacar la mitad de la ropa de la maleta por que no cabía en el ropero... por todo lo demás bien.

title: Great Stay at the Sheraton Tribeca
text: I loved my stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. It is easy to get to as it is right on Canal Street. There are many stores and things to do within walking distance. Check in was easy. Valet parking was available at a reasonable cost. The rooms are not big, but that is clear from the room size upon booking. We were on the 19th floor and we could hear nothing from the street.  The food selection in the lounge was adequate, but beer and wine are free, which is a great bonus. I would definitely shay here again.

title: SoHo El Barrio perfecto
text: Esta vez elegí el soho en cambio del uptown para mí visita a NYC. No puedo estar más satisfecho con la elección. Tiendas y restaurantes, mercados, plazas y gente con onda. El hotel está en Canal St. que es definitivamente una calle fea. Pero en solo una cuadra mejora mucho. Cuartos de tamaño chico inclusive en el piso concierge pero las vistas son excelentes. Pedir vista al Empire State. El plan concierge es muy recomendable porque incluye bebidas y comidas todo el día. Volvería.

title: The BEST Sheraton in Manhattan!  Amazing Service!
text:
I have stayed at the Sheraton Times Square and now the Sheraton Tribeca and I can clearly tell everyone, stay at the Sheraton Tribeca without a doubt!  As a Gold Preferred Member, some locations treat Gold guests as second-class guests (Times Square), but the Sheraton Tribeca treated me perfectly!

Let me begin by saying thank you to Lisenia for helping me get the kind of room that I wanted!  I was very happy with the room, the floor, and felt truly taken care of.

Then a big thank you to Sal at the front desk.  He was the most warm and friendly employee I have seen in years of staying at SPG hotels.  You can't teach good customer service.  Some people are born with it and Sal has it!

My room was wonderful.  It was big and comfortable.  The club lounge was one of the best with a great selection of food for breakfast, evening, and mid-day snacks.

This hotel is really close to the subway and truly convenient if you are looking to travel around Manhattan.

I truly feel that I had an amazing experience.  The hotel was wonderful as the service was World Class.  Your hotel has absolutely EARNED my repeat business!

title: Lower Manhattan
text: Perhaps not the best location in the city. But it is easily accessible by subways (a,c), by uber or cab. Narrow hallway, 4 express elevators, nice clean room and friendly staff with a very hospitable bar near the entrance. What else can a traveler ask for. Maybe it is off season, I thought the rate is very reasonable. I don't mind the downtown location, because I am meeting associates in Chelsea area.

title: Weekend of the 29th stay
text: The room was a decent size, particularly for the usual NYC tight quarters in accommodations. Very clean with a really helpful, efficient and friendly staff. We asked for a small fridge and it was provided as soon as possible. The lounge area was very nice with wonderful cocktails, which was a surprise. The club level was a great touch. I will stay here again.

title: great location and staff
text: Stayed for 4 days through MLK day. Smooth check in, Decent rooms. Location is perfect. Subways are within 4 blocks. Chinatown and Little Italy are half a mile away. Walking distance to some grand shopping on broadway street and Greene st. Great hotel.

title: Great location, helpful staff, comforable stay
text: Staff was especially helpful, friendly, and efficient upon arrival (thanks, Sal & Megan!).  Room was ready for my requested early check-in, and I had terrific view over Soho and midtown.  Hotel is ideally located for immediate access to Soho & Tribeca, and a short walk to all lower Manhattan locations.  And it is so nice to stay in NYC outside of the Mid-town and Times Square crush.  Easy access to hotel from NYC subway system (A-C-E lines around the corner on the same block).  Comfortable room - fresh soft goods.   Excellent sweet sleeper bed and pillows.  A little bit of road noise (Canal Street is a busy thoroughfare) and hallway noise, but nothing that a pair of earplugs couldn't block out.  Will add this to our future NYC hotel options.

title: Great location! Good hotel!
text: We usually stay around times square but decided to stay further downtown this time and were really happy about it! Youre right in SOHO so nice to walk the area and shop. Amaaazing breakfast bagel place open 24hrs next to the hotel too! Also walking distance to the Red Blue and Yellow subway lines so easy to get around. Hotel rooms were fairly big, clean and hotel staff were reaaally nice all the time. They dont clean rooms until late in the afternoon, but thats pretty standard around here. Overall super happy with the Sheraton!!

title: Nice for the area
text: We just stayed one night and it was more than adequate for the price we paid.   The room was clean, although small, and the bathroom was quite nice and had several mini toiletries.   The hotel employees at the front desk were pleasant and accommodating and the "Grab and Go" breakfast consisted of coffee, tea, or a juice and fruit, small yogurt and muffin which was enough for us.   For heartier fare, there is a restaurant on premises which is open for breakfast.   This hotel is convenient to Chinatown, Little Italy and the World Trade Center.

title: Un'ottima posizione per girare NY
text:
Ho soggiornato a NY nel periodo delle vacanze natalizie pernottando 11 gioni allo Sheraton Tribeca Hotel. Prenotando molto in anticipo (agosto 2016) abbiamo potuto usufruire di un ottimo prezzo in questa struttura a quattro stelle.
La stanza era comoda e confortevole, sempre pulita e rifornita di asciugamani e prodotti per il corpo. 
La posizione è ottimale per spostarsi tra Manhattan e Brooklyn, per arrivare sulla 5th e raggiungere Central Park, così come il distretto finanziario a pochi passi. A pochi passi dall'hotel buoni ristoranti e posti dove fare colazione. In albergo è presente un punto Starbucks di cui abbiamo usufruito solamente un giorno.
L'unica nota negativa è stata l'inconveniente del pagamento tramite Booking. La struttura non ha infatti specificato che avrebbero prelevato dalla mia carta prepagata (ricaricata per l'occasione) un ammontare (di molto) superiore a quanto dovevo pagare con il risultato che arrivando in hotel la mia prenotazione risultava cancellata. Per fortuna, tutto si è risolto per il meglio.

title: Stay somewhere else unless you're desperate or until  it's been refurbished
text:
I booked a 5 night stay here as I wanted a downtown location. I'm SPG Platinum and this hotel offered great deal on redeeming points. Check in went smoothly, Sal at front desk  couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. Unfortunately I then went to my room, first impressions were it needed a refurb but I could suck it up as the view from the outdoor deck of the business lounge wad so fantastic and would compensate. Then I noticed the bed cover and a large dirty mark so I called housekeeping to have it changed. An hour later called again. 2 hours later I went to the front desk...someone came to my room and sorted things. I knew Canal St would be noisy but even on a high floor it was just crazy. My bed was old, had a dip in it so after a terribly uncomfortable night I went to the front desk at 6am to let them know I was checking out.
The front desk manager was very understanding and credited back all my points. I relocated to the W Union Square - heaven! 
So great staff, great view from club lounge but noisy & uncomfortable...much better options at similar pricepoint.

title: Club level but received non-club level room
text:
This review is for the club level room.

Pluses: good location by soho and chinatown/little italy.

Negatives: 
Very small room 
A bit old

Now, I booked club level room, but I realized they gave me 2nd floor room, which is not a club level and with a blocked view to the deck of the building where the flags are.
I did not realize this is non club room after the last day. So, for you readers who want to book club level, please be careful when checking in! Club levels are 19 and above! Ask for it.
Very tricky front desk!
I am not very happy with this.

The club lounge breakfast is very minimal. Just like motel's style muffin and coffee.
The view from the lounge is good, however.

title: Friendly staff and convenient location
text: The front desk staff could not have been more helpful! They were friendly and attentive to every detail. They made our stay in New York very comfortable. Our room was clean and had everything that we needed. The location was very convenient. We definitely would stay here agin.

title: It's ok
text: For New York it's ok.  I stayed in Nov 2014 and it was awesome!!  Stayed in 2015 and it's been broken in for sure, wasn't as clean or nice.  But that's New York. The rooms get used every day and they get broken in and 'old' very fast.  It's a Sheraton, so the beds and bedding are good quality.  I'm in my 40's now so I'm getting picky on quality,  not sure I would stay again.  Next visit I'll have to just pay more for cleaner higher quality room.  Or may to pay more for better room at the hotel. My room was a smaller room in the back of the hotel.  Our friends stayed in suite upstairs that was actually nicer -

title: Once again, excellent
text: My husband and I have stayed here now three times while visiting NYC. It is about a block from the W and the R train which is very convenient. This hotel is a great deal especially for NYC prices. And right around the corner from peoplinos which is arguably the best Italian food I've ever had. I absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone whisking to stay in manhattan. Service is great, people are friendly, concierge is very helpful. The rooms are very clean and while on the smaller side(as all rooms are in manhattan) there is a very good use of space.

title: Bra hotell med bra läge
text: Vi bodde här på vår bröllopsresa. Standardrum som är helt okej. Läget på Canal street är kanske inte så charmigt med ett bra läge för att utforska staden. Nära till soho och alla restauranger där. Nära till metron. Vi hade ett rum med tillgång till club level där vi kunde äta frukost och snacks. Helt ok utbud och smidigt att inte behöva ge sig iväg för att äta frukost.

title: Terriblement décevant
text: L'hôtel en lui même est sympa. Bien placé. Mais le personnel est absolument antipathique ! La propreté laisse à désirer. J'ai retrouvé dans ma chambre en cours de séjour 1 soutien gorge qui ne m'appartenait pas. Le ménage de la chambre est très approximatif.  Des draps froissés à l'arrivée que nous avons malencontreusement taché de café  et qui n'ont jamais étés changés sur 8 jours. Serviettes de toilette trouées ( original pour un 4 étoiles ). Il fallait toujours réclamer à la réception quelque chose ( sucre. Café. Eau ). En clair bien déçue du service. Et le staff du petit dej inutile - sur leurs portables et affalés sur le comptoir.

title: Location location
text: Our stay at the Tribecca was wonderful. Very nice updated atmosphere in the lobby, restaurant and bar. The rooms were very nice and size was average as expected in NYC. it was an easy walk to Ground Zero and an easy cab to the train or Time Square. Subways were close but we didn't use them.

title: Ottimo!!
text: Mi sono trovata benissimo in questo hotel, posizione eccellente perché difronte a soho e con tre linee della metro vicine. Il personale è gentilissimo e disponibile. Camera pulite e letti comodi. Unica pecca l aerazione della camera da migliorare. Ha anche starbucks all interno e un buon ristorante

title: Better than Expected- Convenient,
text:
We went to NYC and stayed in Sheraton Tribeca (by accident) and another hotel in 55th street.  I eventually enjoyed Sheraton more. Waking up in the morning with Empire state building view. Room is spacious (Open suit case easily). Great location - Taking subway is very convenient, close to Chinatown for the best fish soup!, 24 hr Bagle place next doors has good food for jet lag people like us, convenient for shopping and dining in Soho, downtown or meatpacking district easily.  I may come back here again next time.
The only thing that bothering me is rather old carpet, bring your own slipper is recommended.

title: Stayed in a Sheraton Club room/ very disapointed
text: Location was very good and very handy for the underground which unfortunately we only realised on our last day, so easy time square in 11 mins with no delays and no rude over priced taxis. The room however was very disappointing, we brought this to the attention of reception staff who advised they could not offer another room rusted fittings in bathroom, carpets worn, 2 double beds in the room although we had booked a king club room, small inadequate wardrobe space for a stay of 4 nights feel sorry for anyone staying longer. Facilities in the club lounge were good, staff helpful and courteous in the club lounge, door staff extremely helpful. As a softener for not being able to accommodate us in another room we were provided with breakfast and drinks vouchers. We used a breakfast voucher on the first morning of our stay the breakfast buffet was the worst I have ever experienced neither my husband or I could eat it really poor quality we did not risk that again during our stay, the club lounge provided a far superior breakfast, it was also substantially cleaner. I have stayed at many Sheraton resorts I am sorry to say this was the worst I have ever experienced particularly as you pay a premium for a club room so you expect a bit better than average the room was below average and very tight on space. We also had torn towels, on check out the reception staff were quite rude.

title: Très moyen
text: Ma chambre n as jamais été nettoyer en 10jours malgré que j ai demander à la réception et à la femme de ménage ! La jeune brune demoiselle a l accueil  est très méchante ! Prévoir de prendre le métro ou taxi pour tout faire , je ne recommande pas cet hôtel

title: Got worse each stay and will not return again
text: As a seasoned traveler and SPG platinum member I go out of my way to stay at SPG properties and the first to speak highly of them. So it pains me to leave such a negative review here but it's well earned. I've stayed at this Sheraton for the past few years when visiting NYC mostly for location. And given the price point I don't have unreasonable expectations. Yes the hotel is outdated and can get crowded at times but that comes with the territory. But during my stay the room was absolutely filthy and some of the towels were torn and stained. I don't expect a large or fancy room (this is not the W) but don't expect it to be dirty. In addition the wifi did not work and never rectified. Ended up having to use international roaming to send work emails that could not wait. Housekeeping did not provide turndown service one day after I called to make sure it would be done in the morning. When I called the manager with these issues he said he would email me with a detailed reply and offer points as compensation. Neither happened. I also had an important package being delivered to me which the hotel said they never received. then later said the person did not give them my last name so they couldn't locate me. Given the rudeness and incompetence I experienced from them I think they are just covering their behinds. The last person I spoke to there was a manager named Katie who promptly hung up on me when she suspected I was calling to complain. Unbelievable.

title: Don't overlook this property
text: Great location....Canal Street, Soho Shopping, Little Italy, Chinatown, Broadway, Subway stations, all within mere blocks of this great location.  The hotel generally offers discounts or promotions, so take advantage of them as well.  Beautifully appointed rooms, attentive staff, and they also offer airport transportation if you prefer not using a taxicab.

title: Excellent hotel with an amazing view of the city
text:
This hotel really surprised me, I didn't really know what i was in for. The staff was amazing and new us by name. We stayed at a club level which was fantastic and our room had a wonderful view. On the floor above us was the Club room with a fantastic balcony with such a great view and in the morning there was served breakfast there (free) and in the afternoon the amazing happy hour was served (not too miss prior to ELO concert ;-) ) The location was excellent .. just few steps away from the cozy Soho. The Subway is just located nearby and so easy to travel on Manattan from this Hotel.  
We will be back you guys and thank you for making this New York trip unforgettable and so wonderful.
PS the gym was great as well ;-)

title: C'era una volta lo Sheraton...
text:
Abbiamo scelto quest'albergo per il prezzo davvero conveniente proposto nel periodo natalizio,  per cui,  considerando che da sempre lo Sheraton è sinonimo di garanzia e qualità,  non c'abbiamo pensato due volte a prenotare. 
Per cominciare,  appena arrivati,  abbiamo avuto problemi con la carta di credito e la signorina alla reception anziché proporre soluzioni o aiutarci a risolverli,  per lei dovevamo andarcene perché non poteva aiutarci.  Fortunatamente,  dopo 3 quarti d'ora,  è intervenuto un collega che ha risolto il problema. Da ciò si evince la poca disponibilità e voglia di aiutare il cliente! 
Sinceramente alla vigilia di Natale avremmo avuto serie difficoltà a trovare una sistemazione. 
Proseguendo,  appena arrivati in camera,  troviamo in terra dei calzini e nella doccia una tovaglia sporca tutta bagnata. 
Insomma,  abbiamo cominciato a reclamare direttamente alle signore delle pulizie che incontravamo al piano,  ma puntualmente non c'era verso che togliessero  i calzini non nostri o dopo 10 giorni che cambiassero le lenzuola. Fin quando siamo stati costretti a prendere i calzini e gettarli nel carrello delle signore delle pulizie nel corridoio.  
Insomma,  per farla breve la pulizia in quest'albergo lascia proprio a desiderare. 
Per non parlare delle informazioni inesatte fornite alla reception.  Nella specie abbiamo chiesto se le cialde per il caffè in camera fossero incluse nel prezzo della stanza o si pagassero a parte ed hanno risposto che erano incluse,  ma poi c'hanno addebitato quasi 100 $ di caffè. 
Dal prezzo del caffè potrebbe sembrare che ci nutrivamo solo di questo ,  ma vi garantisco che non è così...solo un caffè la mattina per 8 notti ad un prezzo carissimo. 
Concludendo... Qui fanno pagare a caro prezzo anche l'aria che si respira. 
Quest'albergo poi non è all'altezza della catena.  Il mobilio ricorda gli anni '70, la pulizia carente ed il ristorante "Antica" all' interno d'italiano ha solo il nome. Disastro...

title: Hardly clean
text: Disappointed with the hotel which looks already worn out. Rooms were not vacuumed every day and bed sheets did not look clean. Staff was ok but I would not recommend hotel. The view from the rooms are great but the area were the hotel is is not very animated.

title: Great stay
text:
I stayed at this hotel for three and a half weeks over the summer and it was beyond amazing, from the service to the amenities.

I moved here in a panic after leaving the hotel I initially booked because of poor service and false advertising, and the Sheraton made me feel my decision was right. 

I immediately felt welcome when I arrived and after seeing the length of my stay the lady at the check in kindly upgraded my room to an executive king which was beautiful and situated on one of the higher floors. 

Room service and housekeeping were great, always timely and efficient and the location of the hotel was perfect considering I needed to commute to Greenwich Village everyday, it was only a mile walk. 

I would recommend all types of travelers here, whether for business or leisure, the hotel delivers on all its promises.

title: Parfait
text:
Localisation idéale pour visiter New York
On peut aller à pied à  One World (15mn)
Métro au coin de la rue qui vous mène vers le sud ouest le nord rapidement.
Chambres simples et correctes.
Super club lounge en supplément mais qui vaut vraiment le coup avec une superbe vue (voir la photo)
Staff très sympa

title: Amazing Service - Great Management
text: I called in advance to let them know it was a special stay and they didn't disappoint.  My family were doing the tourist thing in the city and we were celebrating my wife's birthday.  Colin the PM Manager went out of his way to make us feel welcome.  He sent a nice little amenity for my kids and a bottle of wine for us and we were so gracious.  I could tell when I was checking in that other guests were really enjoying their stay as well.  I would definitely recommend booking a club room for the nominal extra fee its well worth it.  Great selection and exclusivity.  Great job guys!  - Jonathan

title: Pensavo meglio
text: L'entrata dell'hotel è piccola, considerato anche che c'è sempre tanta gente con le valigie che aspetta di partire o essere registrata. In un angolo c'è il bar Starbucks con giusto il necessario, ma pochi posti a sedere. Nella camera non ho trovato il frigorifero come invece c'era scritto nella descrizione quando ho prenotato, in più ho trovato un calzino per terra di chi era venuto prima di noi. Siamo stati fortunatamente solo una notte, quindi non so come avvengano i cambi della biancheria. La posizione è buona, e Tribeca è un luogo bello da visitare.

title: New Discovered Nice Hotel in NYC
text:
I used to have negative impressions with hotels in NYC because the price and the room size. However, this Sheraton changed my mind by its location and services. 

It's walking distance to Soho for shopping even though it's in the city. 

The staff were very kind and welcoming when we check in. We were offered to go to the happy hour at the rooftop lounge and nice hotel room. 

Considering it's in NYC, the price usually is quite reasonable too. It's a wise choice to stay here when go to NYC again.

title: Ubicación y atención
text: Ubicado en el lower manhathan, cerca del Soho, el hotel tiene una rápida salida a través del metro con las lineas azules y amarillas. Se puede ir caminando a Chinatown y Little Italy, como también a la zona cero y los barcos que salen para la estatua de la Libertad. La atención del personal es excelente y cuando el huesped le solicita algo, siempre tratan de solucionarlo o complacerlo.

title: Nice hotel in the Village
text: Clean, good size room, safe neighborhood and close to subway stations.  Maria at the front desk was very helpful, wonderful attitude and very friendly.  The curbside valet service was a little pricey (it is the city) but very convenient especially since traffic in the area was hard to deal with.

title: Até agora só decepção.
text: Chegamos hoje, as 8:00 am. A recepcionista disse que não era possível fazer o early check in. Até aí ok. Sabíamos que o check in era a partir das 15h. Deixamos nossas malas, mãe como estamos em 5 ( sendo uma criança de 5 anos ) tivemos que pedir para pegar a mala uma três vezes. Uma para pegar o casaco da criança, outra pra minha mãe é uma vez para pegar um remédio controlado que meu pai toma. Estamos cansado, 10h de viagem, 5 horas esperando um quarto e o rapaz das que guardou as malas foi bem mal educado disse: "Quer que eu tire todas as malas e deixe aí?" (Num tom bem arrogante). E, quando os quartos ficaram prontos,  descobrimos que por erro deles só em 1 foi feito check in, ou seja, estamos aqui (15:45) esperando o segundo quarto. Quando desci para perguntar do quarto foi dito que ainda não estava pronto, mas outros hóspedes que estão chegando agora estão recebendo suas chaves. Como explicar isso? Estamos decepcionados com o descaso.

title: BREATHING VIEWS
text:
The most spectacular views the city. This hotel greets it's Platinum level guest with a happy hour that serves wines & other spirits as will as a snack pantry which I believe is available 24 hours a day.
Its served on a patio that has the most amazing views of the city. What a wonderful way to unwind from the day. I loved the location which is in the Chinatown area & just a few shorts blocks from Soho & Tribeca.

title: Love love love this hotel
text:
This hotel is in a great location with really good access to several subways. There's loads of choice for shops and eateries within a 5-10 minutes walk too.  

The staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful and friendly from the moment we arrived to the moment we left, especially Sal, Megan, Jamie and James. 

We upgraded our room to an executive and got access to the club lounge which was well worth the extra money if not for the views alone. Doin who was there most nights was extremely helpful and kept everything in order.  There was a good choice for breakfast, snacks, crisps, fruit, muffins etc throughout the day and cheese and biscuits etc in the evening.
