Thank you again to all the staff for making this such a good stay.

I will definitely stay here if/when I return to New York x

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text: Decided to go away from the Midtown Sheraton to give this location a try.  Nicely located, able to discover smaller more cozy restaurants nearby.  It has been indicated that the rooms are small, sure but they're cozy and the quality of the rooms are fine, up to Sheraton standards, no complaints there.  Actually found the rooms nicer than Midtown...;)

Mielestäni hintatasoja ja hotellin taso eivät kohdanneet. Kun saavuimme huoneeseen wc:ssä oli likaisia pyyhkeitä edellisiltä vierailijoilta. Sijainti ok. Ajoittain koen, että saimme kohtuullista palvelua. En suosittele.

title: Nice localization
text:
Nice hotel, close to Soho and nice restaurants and bars! The staff was very polide. The room was very confortable and the bed also. Everything was perfect!!!
They has also nice rooftop and nice lobby bar. Wifi was working good.

title: Non all'altezza della catena Sheraton
text: Ho soggiornato in questo hotel per lavoro solo 2 notti. La camera King da 27 mq era piccolissima. Ho fatto reclsmo e mi è stato risposto che le camere sono tutte cosi e sono 27 metri. L'avevo scelta per la grandezza !! Non è stato possibile aprire due valigie grandi. La camera dava su Canal Street dove il traffico è intenso a tutte le ore della notte non ho chiuso occhio perché non insonorizzata. Riscaldamento rumorosissimo con ventola che sparava sul letto. Impossibile tenere acceso. Bagno angusto e vecchio. Nessun set di cortesia nessun accappatoio o ciabatte. Macchina per caffè ok. La prima mattina siamo scesi per colazione inclusa alle 9....non c'era più niente ed il buffet era sudicio con pezzi di cibo ovunque ed un cameriere molto scortese quando chiedevamo qualcosa. Seconda mattina un po meglio ma la scelta di riduce a yogurt in barattolo cereali, poca frutta su richiesta, uova strapazzate e bacon e qualche dolcetto in una misera bacheca ...una vera tristezza. Reception poco cordiale e concierge poco efficiente. Devo dare un giudizio molto scarso. Sono stata in Sheraton in tutto il mondo ed ho avuto esperienze ben di più alto livello. Considerato che ho pagato quasi 400 euro a notte ....una follia....è bocciato.

title: Oh so dated...
text: The rooms at the Sheraton are like stepping back in time...tired and sad. Worn furnishings, crappy pillows...something about the room aircon made me feel ill the entire time I was there. The only upside is the club lounge - usually a good spread and a great happy hour or three for free wine. The staff were way too over the top American-style for my liking. I moved to The Surrey after and it was like a whole different world. Regret spending the majority of my trip at the Sheraton, never again.

title: Good hotel located near the financial district
text:
Located on Canal Street on the Lower Westside of NYC, the Sheraton TriBeCa is conveniently located near the financial district, the One World Trade building, Chinatown and Little Italy. 

The hotel is pleasant and the staff is customer service oriented. The rooms, like most in NYC, are small. There is is a Club hospitality room that offers a breakfast as well as wine/beer and snacks in the evening.

On-site restaurant and coffee bar (neither of which I used) are available. There is also a nice fitness facility in the hotel.

There are a number of restaurants located close by, along with sundry, gift and wine/spirits all within close walking distance.

This is a decent hotel and I would certainly stay there again.

title: Solid Business Hotel in a Convenient Location
text:
Stayed here for a week on a business trip and couldn't be more satisfied.  Rooms were clean and were fairly large (in terms of NYC standards).  The location was extremely convenient to my office in Tribeca, but is also close to SoHo where you can check out all the chic boutiques.  There's also a Duane Reade nearby in case you forgot any toiletries or if you simply need a couple of bottled waters.  My only complaint was the food in the Club Room.  The scrambled eggs were atrocious.  They need to fix that.  But the few from the Club Room (top floor) was gorgeous, especially on a bright summer day. 

They also have a Planet Fitness gym adjacent to the hotel that is open 24 hours during the weekdays.  I believe the fee is $10 for a monthly membership and is a perfect option in case you need to burn off those calories from all the delicious food you'll be eating.

Great place to stay if you are flying to/from Newark Airport.  It's about 3-5 minutes away from the Holland Tunnel and prevents you from having to cut through the city to get there.  This is a huge relief after a long flight!

title: Conveniently situated, disappointing service.
text:
The hotel itself is ideally located in Canal street, Tribeca, handy for local bars and cafes which are within easy walking distance from the hotel.

The staff are polite and helpful for general questions about local places which are reasonably priced for meals and local attractions walking or by cab.

It's advisable to read other customers comments regarding the traffic noise level on the lower floors if you are a light sleeper. I stayed on the eleventh floor and had no difficulty sleeping.

I had breakfast in the hotel once purely for convenience, it's adequate, unremarkable and I thought a little expensive. 

I recommend visiting local bubbys, which is also a little expensive but well worth the visit. 

Finally, be wary and pay close attention to your hotel billing on your departure. I was mistakenly charged a bar bill. This was acknowledged and corrected on my departure, or so I thought.

On return to the U.K. I noticed my credit card was still debited for the bar bill. The hotel promised an immediate refund.

Over three weeks and numerous polite phone calls later, I'm still waiting. 

So you be the judge.

title: Great location - not a great Starwood property
text: My husband & I used points to stay 2 nights at this hotel for a wedding we were attending in downtown NYC.  We did not use their valet parking - it would have cost us $150 to valet our SUV for 48 hours.  We parked it on our own close by & it was $125 for 48 hours.  When we arrived 90 minutes before check in time we were told our room was clean but it hadn't been released by housekeeping.  No problem - we checked our bags and went out & explored.  The room was small as most NYC hotel rooms are.  It was clean.  The previous occupant left a suit hanging in the wardrobe.  We gave the suit to the maid in the hallway and she didn't seem to know what to do with it.  The first problem encountered was the shower stall.  In order to reach the shower knobs, you have to get into the shower & the first cold blast of water lands right on you. Then you have to back up & stand against the back wall while it warms up so only your feet are exposed to the cold water until warm water comes out.  The next problem were the bed pillows - they were all super soft and feathery & didn't support your head or neck at all. My husband went without a pillow - I took the throw pillow off the chair and wrapped in it a towel & used that.   Throughout the night we discovered these rooms have zero sound proofing.  We were by the elevator & heard every person (most of them loud since it was after midnight) who was coming back for the night.  Some decided they needed to use the ice maker after midnight which was also across from our room & very loud.   The next day we went out from 8:30-10:00am &  11:00am-2:30pm.  Housekeeping did not clean our room during this time.  I took two clean towels off the cart in the hallway so we could shower for the wedding.   We took a nap to make up for the bad night's sleep the night before & then got ready.  As we were leaving at 5:30pm we went to the front desk and told them that our room was not cleaned by housekeeping today and we would like it to be serviced now.  The man at the front desk did not seem to care so it wasn't a surprise when we got back at midnight & it was still dirty.  My husband called down for clean towels for the morning & they did bring them up right away.  At 5am I was awoken by 3 people who decided to sit on the floor near the ice maker and have a conversation at full volume.  Finally after 20 minutes - I opened the door and asked them to please take their conversation elsewhere.   I was more than happy to leave this hotel on Sunday morning.  I've been to other Starwood properties in Manhattan that were great so we will not be going back to this one.   On Monday morning I got an updated folio for our stay.  They added a $4 water charge to the bill.  The Evian water was $4 and we did not touch it.  The Dasani was complimentary & we did drink that.  I called them & they did remove the $4 charge from our bill.

title: Nice location for discovery travel
text:
We stayed here for 2 nights during the summer to attend a wedding.  Our little family of 4 had no problems with the hotel.  The room is on the small side, which is normal for NY.  The upstairs club room has a balcony with an incredible view.  The staff was nice and attentive to our needs, and even held on to my daughters little doll that she accidentally left on the elevator.  Next door is a little deli/shop where you can buy light snacks and drinks if you didn't have access to the club room.

One of the best features, IMO, is the location.  We walked just a few blocks with the kids and discovered we were right next to Chinatown and Little Italy.  There are so many little shops and restaurants to discover, it would take us weeks to check out all of them.  

If you decide to try and grab a cab at the main entrance, forget about it, the traffic is terrible on that street and it is one way.  Walk 2 blocks to 6th and grab one there.  Otherwise, use Uber or Lyft(or something like those).

title: Great Location; great hotel!
text: First time staying here; wonderful, friendly staff (especially Salvatore and the young lady who checked us in Sunday afternoon (Dec. 4)). Nice room with very comfortable bed. Free wifi! Nice location (walking distance to Blue Note jazz club).

title: Never again
text:
The only redeeming feature of this hotel is its location. Soho is at your very doorstep.
As for the hotel itself, here are the less redeeming aspects of my stay - rude and disinterested staff, tired and dusty decor, horrendous platinum lounge with cold coffee, warm juice and stale bagels not to mention the filthy tables and chairs, and room service completely unavailable at 1045pm even though it is supposed to run until 11pm. Apparently the chef wasn't very busy so he just decided to go home!
Avoid this hotel at all costs.

title: Ottimo hotel!
text:
La catena di hotel Sheraton non si smentisce mai! l'hotel è davvero ben curato, moderno e confortevole. Il personale è davvero meraviglioso, sono sempre sorridenti e solari, super disponibili capaci di strapparti un sorriso ogni volta che passi dalla reception! 
Il ristorante italiano dell'hotel è anche molto buono, detto da italiana.
Uniche pecche che non mi permettono di dare all'hotel il massimo del punteggio sono:
-wifi a pagamento (ma che per concessione natalizia ci è stato offerto gratuitamente)
-zona un po' isolata di sera

title: Still my favorite in NYC
text:
It's been about 4 years since my last review for this hotel and I thought I would post again as it's been consistently good over dozens of stays since my initial review (including this month).  The hotel is in very good condition and is very well maintained.  Despite being a high traffic property it is still not showing wear and tear in my experience.  

I use this hotel for both business and personal stays in NY.  There are multiple subways that are very close so it's easy to get anywhere.  The location is awesome if you like a more neighborhood feel, lots of shopping and dining nearby.  I much prefer being down here to midtown which feels very generic and touristy compared to SoHo/Tribeca.

My experience with the staff has always been terrific, particularly the front desk.  In particular Sal is awesome and remembers me by name.  You have to care quite a bit to pull that off, especially when it might be a couple months since I've been in and this is a busy hotel.  Also, Katie on the Guest Relations team has been very proactive and helpful in reaching out to get feedback and help with any questions and requests.  Again, she obviously cares quite a bit.  I feel bad I don't remember all the names of the other great folks, it's not because they don't offer great service as well.

SPG recognition is the best I've experienced in NYC as well.  I've been to just about every property in midtown (all brands) and this hotel is consistently the best with upgrades and amenities.

Finally, I usually find this hotel to be very reasonably priced compared to the other SPG properties in town.  

Some tips:

1.  The club lounge is awesome.  Good service, food selection, extra snacks during the day and one of the best views in the whole city and an amazing roof deck.  If there weather is nice you don't even need to go out, hang out and have drinks on the roof deck.

2.  Peppolino for Italian right around the corner is terrific.  

3.  Nancy Whiskey is a great dive bar with good burgers right around the corner

4.  The gym is decent but there is also a Planet Fitness connected

5.  Canal St is very busy, sometimes it's easier to have your Uber/Lyft/Car meet you across the street or around the corner

6.  Like many NYC hotels, the rooms can be small.  If you are with others, spring for the larger rooms, the difference is worth it

This will continue to be my go to spot in NYC when the price is right!

title: THE WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE IN  THE PAST 20 YEARS!
text:
My wife and I are seasoned world travelers, so we are used to minor glitches when we travel and generally do not complain about small problems when they arise. At the Sheraton Tribeca, the problems were not small, forcing us to scramble the day after we arrived to secure alternate accommodations. What was wrong? Her is a BRIEF list of a few selected issues that made our continued stay impossible:

Except for the bed, the comfort of the accommodations, as a whole, was unacceptable -- 1. The deadbolt did not work on the door to our room when we arrived, and to the room to which we were moved on Day 2; 2. The gym was immediately below our $300+/day room, and the treadmill noise -- thumpa, thumpa, thumpa, thumpa -- woke me at 7:00 am and continued non-stop for an hour before I finally gave up after only 3 1/2 hours of sleep); 3. NO SHELF/DRAWER SPACE IN THE ENTIRE ROOM, SO WE WERE FORCED TO LIVE OUT OF OUR SUITCASES FOR 2 DAYS BEFORE WE MOVED OUT; 4. terrible night staff attitude and service (day staff much better and accommodating); 5. view of pipes and brick wall outside both of the rooms to which we were assigned, AND THESE WERE SUPPOSEDLY THE BEST ROOMS IN THE ENTIRE HOTEL!!!; 6. I could go on, but why bother? The bottom line: THIS IS THE WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE THAT WE HAVE HAD IN THE PAST 25 YEARS, and my wife & I are seasoned world travelers (each of us has visited more than 80 different countries)!!!

title: Great Hotel near Soho!
text:
I stayed over the night of November 6th and 7th 2016, room 1805.
The hotel is located in South Manhattan, walking distance from many great shops.
The room was quite spacious with a very nice view of the City. For being Platinum I had access to the Club Lounge, which is located on the last floor and has a beautiful view with a great outdoor sitting area over the Empire State building.

title: Terrible Experience, Charged incorrectly
text:
We stayed there for three nights in Sept 2016. We have booked this as package deal from lastminute.com. We put up the sign not to be disturbed on the first day due to our belief in being green. We did asked for second day to make up our room. There were no sign of make up. We had to ask for fresh towel by ourselves.

When we tried to check out, we were asked whether we consumed Evian water. We have never found this bottle. After 3 months later, the hotel is now charging separately, although we have already paid this through LastMinute.com. Be extremely careful about this hotel. I would be cautious if I were you.

title: Small, clean, nicely located with good staff
text: We stayed 5 days over the Thanksgiving holiday.  Service is friendly and professional, as is housekeeping.  Standard king room on the 7th floor was small with a comfortable bed, desk and chair, nightstands, flat screen, safe, tiny closet with iron and board, and a nice, but also small bathroom.  Decor is minimal, modern.  There's a floor to ceiling window wall to view the front street.  Traffic noise could be bothersome during peak hours.  Never heard another guest.  Coffee maker was good with Starbucks coffee from their tiny store in the lobby.  Restaurant was nicely decorated and the food and service good, but there was never more than 1 table with a few guests there at any given time.  Expensive and they charge a 20% "service fee" that they do not consider to be a tip??  Location is good for subway, restaurants, shopping and walking to downtown.  Overall, we liked it because of location, cleanliness and professional staff.

title: INCRÍVEL
text:
O hotel é bem localizado. Fica na Canal Street – que divide o Soho do Tribeca. Só isso já fundamentaria a escolha do hotel, já que passear por esses dois bairros é algo, digamos, memorável.
Desde o primeiro momento fomos muito bem recebidos pelos funcionários, que foram bastante atenciosos em nossas solicitações durante toda nossa estadia.
Havia uma estação de metrô a poucos metros do hotel, que facilitou a locomoção para qualquer outro ponto da cidade.
As acomodações são bastante confortáveis. As roupas de cama e a cama eram impecáveis. O quarto não era grande, mas dispunha de tudo de que precisávamos (com exceção do frigobar – que nem sentimos tanta falta assim). As instalações são novas, o que já torna a estadia mais agradável.

title: A comfortable, spacious room at a great price
text: Very friendly staff and efficient check in/check out experience.   A clean, comfortable, and good sized room.  Room has a large safe, modern and spacious bathroom & shower.  No mini bar in room, but bottled water available.  Hotel has fast & efficient elevators with minimal waiting.  There is also a nice little bar & cafe area and a fitness room with good machines.  There's also a restaurant on site, but I did not eat there due to the many incredible restaurants in the area.  (like Khe-yo & Tamarind).  Hotel is in a very good location with easy access to the World Trade Center, Chinatown, Little Italy, Soho, & Midtown.  Highly recommended.

title: Excellent
text:
The property is located close to subways in the south Manhattan.
Staff is very friendly.
We booked a club floor room and we had a very nice view on the Empire State Building.
The club floor is a great place to start and finish the day around something to drink and eat.
The only bad point is the rate but we are in New York and it was not overrated with competitors.
Very nice stay.

title: Not bad hotel, not the best location
text:
The hotel is located in lower manhattan so if you wish to visit the center you must jump on the subway.
Bed was comfortable and they offered us free breakfast (nothing remarkable but hey... it was for free)

title: Tribeca and more with this great location
text: Great location. Good deals if you look around. Close to many locations either on foot by cab or subway. Small rooms but that's NYC. Street noise happens with all hotels here. Wear earplugs if it's an issue for you. Many amenities. Restaurant but why eat in with so many in the area. mini Starbucks on site. Took the subway from Grand Central. Walked the Brooklyn Bridge, dinner and drinks around the corner on N Moore St. Walked to Chinatown etc. subway line is great Green and Yellow are right here.

title: Dated, tired rooms but well located
text: The hotel was not really the standard that I'd expect from a Sheraton hotel, mostly because our room was very tired and could definitely use an upgrade.  We were on a lower floor facing Canal Street and it was very noisy (which I expected but was told very unsympathetically at reception that the hotel was fully booked so no higher rooms available).  The bathroom was two star standard, very disappointing.  Very impersonal check in experience.  The price however, was very cheap for the area - although I would describe the location as just on the outskirts of Tribeca, but it was only a 5-10 minutes walk to the Tribeca bars/restaurants.  We only stayed for one night, and I would not recommend staying more than 1-2 nights if you are looking for a comfortable/luxury stay.

title: Mixed feelings
text:
I have mixed feelings about this property. The Sheraton TriBeCa is on Canal, nestled in between takeaway shops and closed shops. The subway connections are good and it's a short walk to Soho and Downtown but on an evening there are questionable characters lurking outside and the atmosphere can be uncomfortable. 

I didn't have a great arrival or start to my stay here, problems with the room rate I booked, a dirty room and argumentative manager. Eventually all was resolved, I was given a different room, given the correct room rate and promised points for my troubles; the female manager didn't get why I was frustrated and didn't come back to me to follow up. 

The problem with this property is that it's dated, never particularly feels fully clean and the club lounge and lobby bar are always incredibly crowded; it makes relaxing anywhere but your room difficult. There is a Starbucks concession in the lobby which is an added bonus. 

The rooms here do need updating and the furnishings do need replacing. The rate here is not cheap compared to other hotels in the area and hence the value for money is questionable. The TV's are terrible but the wifi is good. 

The service, in general, was good. Reception team were friendly and the bell boy and concierge was also welcoming and helpful. The night manager was good; he tried to resolve the issues I'd faced on arrival. 

Room service was always good and quick.

I think more attention needs to be paid to housekeeping here and with ensuring SPG benefits are delivered consistently. This could be a great hotel instead of a good hotel if standards were improved. 

I am still waiting a response from the hotel as to why my rate changed before my arrival and why I was downgraded. They did eventually sort this out but still annoying and shouldn't happen.

title: OK bra utsikt från club level terrassen
text: vi bodde på club level i en svit. Access till terrasen som har mycket bra utsikt och möjlighet till frukost och förfriskningar (kvällstid) gör att hotellet får ett högre betyg. lite småstöking incheckning (fick först inte det rum som var bokat) annars OK. nära till tunnelbana, bra restauranger och shysta barer.

title: Che vista!
text: Hotel situato in un quartiere vivace e piacevole, comodo alla metropolitana, stanza abbastanza spaziosa(per NY) con letto king size! Colazione non inclusa, ma c'è una postazione Starbucks nella hall, oltre a tanti bar nelle vicinanze! Vista mozzafiato dal rooftop! Acqua e cioccolatini di benvenuto in omaggio fanno sempre piacere!

title: Nice and functional
text: Well located hotel near two sub stations offers good transport options to locations around and in the city. The hotel location itself is nothing to write home about. The rooms are in good shape and it start to look that they need an additional eye to spot the spots. Anything from thick layer of dust above the bathroom mirror to broken curtains. The staff are ok, very cold so didn't make me feel too welcomed. Reserved through Booking.com and the hotel/spg didn't respect my gold status which was disappointing considering other chains do respect status even when booking via 3rd party.  Overall good enough for the rate paid.

title: Bom hotel
text:
O Sheraton Tribeca é uma ótima escolha se você quer fugir das áreas normalmente frequentadas por turistas e deseja ficar perto de bons restaurantes.
O quarto não é muito amplo, mas de bom tamanho. O principal: cafeteira no quarto abastecida diariamente com café starbucks e no hall do hotel tem uma filial desse café.
Pessoal super gentil. A Canal Street não é uma rua muito bonita,mas tem comércio de baixo custo.
Me hospedaria novamente.

title: Good location
text: Location is good, close to subway stations of various lines. Room was moderately clean. However there was a long black hair in my bed and there were hairs in the shower drain. Under one of the beds was a plastic bag with a brand new garment in it, obviously left by a previous guest. Staff at the desk was helpful. Roof terrace was only available by becoming a member of some sort of club, which cost 30 dollars.

title: Too dirty
text: Location is nice , but hotel is  very worn out.Walls need renovation.Wallpaper are dirty, doors have scratches , bed sheet were little bit over used.Reception was kind but big mess. Tube is around the corner.

title: Amazing friendly staff
text: The hotel is immaculate and the staff are super friendly it's location is great for hopping on the subway for up and downtown locations I've loved my stay and would stay again although I wouldn't recommend the bar the drinks are a little expensive although not more so than many hotels but if using as a base for a holiday rather than business maybe find a bar elsewhere

title: Great location and friendly service
text: My wife and I have stayed here several times.  We like this place because of its Tribeca location and super friendly staff. We like the concierge level club. Every day they put out a nice selection of snacks and some complimentary beverages. My wife finds the club and the roof top such a lovely place to visit and hang.  The rooms are a bit small, but adequate.  The bed was luxuriously comfortable, the bathroom has modern fixtures with hot showers.  However, one area of improvement:  The breakfast service was a bit slow, maybe understaffed or disinterested staff.  The result is that the food can use refreshing,  more attentiveness while the staff is taking their break in the back room.  To end on a high note- the lady who takes care of us at happy hour is a joy, as well as the front desk and bell service.

title: Bike New York
text: Every year on May 1st NYC invites 32,000 cyclists to tour the 5 Burroughs of NYC. I was lucky enough to stay at the Sheraton TriBeCa NY Hotel. This Hotel is to hospitality what Amazon is to  retail. Enough said.

title: Hotel muito bom
text: Optamos por ficar no ou próximo ao Soho e chegamos ao Sheraton Tribeca. Excelente opção e com bom preço para a região. Boas instalações, fitness center, atendimento simpático na recepção, quartos e banheiro de bom tamanho. A região do hotel parece estar melhorando, mas hoje ainda tem uns imóveis feios. Nada que atrapalhe, pois tudo é muito seguro.

title: molto buono, nel cuore di chinatown
text: hotel molto buono per gli standard mid price di new york. nel cuore di chinatown (o di quello che ne rimane) e a due passi dalla metropolitana e dalla Broadway. stanze sufficientemente grandi, bagno ok, ottima reception in termini di accoglienza ospiti e cortesia. buon soggiorno

title: Tiny rooms, clean and reasonably priced...   great location near the subway.
text:
This hotel is super cute.   The staff is great and the SPG MEMBER recognition is impeccable.   I'm Gold and I didn't have to wait in line at all!  

The subway is right out the front door.   There are tons of great little bistros in this part of town.   It's very clean for you neat freaks out there like me!  

We stayed here on our annaversary and it was a 15 minute ride to see a play on 42nd street.   Awesome!!!

title: Good for Quick Business Stay
text:
My image I had about Tribeca didn't match the exact location of this hotel.  However the interior was definitely up to Sheraton's standards.  Note the room size is on the smaller side since it is New York.  I didn't mind the size since it was just me. 

I was impressed with the person checking me in.  I noticed he knew the regulars and had a fun, polite conversation with them.

According to my colleague, the hotel restaurant was quite good.

My only complaint is some noise - when someone was entering their hotel room next to mine, it was loud, sounded like the door slamming every time it closed.

title: Average Hotel in Tribeca
text: The Hotel and rooms are ok/average. The location is great - walking distance to wtc/ground zero and subway in front of the door. We booked a clubroom - breakfast was included. Anyhow we decided to get breakfast outside as the lounge was very crowded and the choice was very limited.i would return, as the location combined with the medium price was ok.

title: Excellent stay at Sheraton Tribeca
text: We stayed 4 nights and had only positive experiences.  All of the hotel staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful. We needed assistance from housekeeping several times and the response was prompt.  Room service from the Antica restaurant downstairs was a highlight.  The food was delicious.  We were on the 15th floor so it was very quiet. Beds are very comfortable.  The room was older but clean.  No bathtub but a large shower. We upgraded so we could use the club lounge on the 21st floor and I would recommend that.  The view is amazing.  The breakfast was good and the happy hour with appetizers was great. We had a 3 yr old with stroller and we walked all over Soho, Tribeca, Chinatown, Little Italy.  It's a great location.  The Hudson Riverfront Park was beautiful.  There is a Japanese restaurant called Tataki right around the corner that was very good.  In all of our time at the Sheraton we only had good service from all the employees.  We will definitely be back.

title: It's fine
text: The Sheraton Tribeca is just ok. We had some fantastic service from the night shift guys, Colin and Nelson.  Most of the staff have been very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping has done a poor job at turning down our third bed, all three nights of our stay. I think it's been a busy Halloween weekend for them. The room itself is average. Overall not much stands out here but the location has been convenient for us.

title: Sheraton Tribeca NYC Experience
text:
Sheraton Tribeca NYC
370 Canal St
Lower Manhattan

Three nights (10-12 June, 2016). Reasonably priced. Location: ideal for tourists; safe / friendly neighborhood; convenient walking distance to subway station,Tribeca and Soho taverns, restaurants, and “convenience stores”; and to 9/11 Memorial; quick access from and to Holland tunnel . Room: overlooking Canal St. (traffic on this 700 block of Canal St. should impress NASCAR fans). Staff: exceptionally friendly and helpful, particularly in giving directions; valley parking and bellmen service was quick and efficient. A thoughtful bellman walked us across the street to the parking garage, saving us a great deal of time in getting into the proper lane to exit the city via the Holland tunnel. Staff helped make this visit a worthwhile experience for first time "Big Apple" visitors.

title: Sehr gute Lage, die allerdings Ihren Preis hat.
text:
Die Lage des Hotels zu mehreren U-Bahn-Linien ist perfekt. WTC und Chinatown zu Fuß erreichbar. Personal sehr freundlich. Alles recht sauber. Wifi sehr gut. Zimmer im 15. Stock nach außen ruhig, zum Nachbarzimmer allerdings weniger.

Mehrer Angaben auf meiner booking.com-Auswahl trafen nicht zu. Kühlschrank war nicht vorhanden. Statt der City-View nur Ausblick aufs gegenüberligende AT&T-Hochhaus. Angegebene Fläche war 27m², war aber deutlich kleiner.

title: Wird der Marke nicht gerecht
text:
Wir hatten uns das Sheraton Tribeca wegen der guten Lage und des vermeintlich höheren Standards ausgesucht.

Die direkte Nachbarschaft (Drogen- und Straßenverkäufer - gefälschte Rolex etc.) des Tribecas in der Canalstreet ist weniger schön, aber nicht bedrohlich.

Die Lobby mit einem Starbucks und Bar ist recht hell und nett gestaltet. Das ein oder andere zerschlissene Möbelstück sollte aber mal ausgetauscht werden.
Das Personal war stets freundlich und (fast immer) hilfsbereit. Einen WLAN-Zugang gibt es kostenlos. Den Dachterrassenzugang muss man mit 30$ aber leider bezahlen.
Morgens ist aber wohl ein Frühstück und abends eine Getränkeauswahl (bis zu einer bestimmten Uhrzeit) im Preis inbegriffen. Da ich aber nur Fotos machen
wollte fand ich das eher ärgerlich.

Das Zimmer (312) war groß geschnitten. Daher waren wir auch zunächst sehr erfreut, waren wir von unserem letzten New York-Besuch anderes gewohnt.
Die anfängliche Freude wich aber von Tag zu Tag immer größer werdender Ernüchterung: Zunächst hatten wir Makeup-Flecken auf dem Bettlacken. Da wir so spät angekommen sind, konnte uns der Herr an der Rezeption nur für den nächsten Tag einen Austausch versprechen. Die auf Augenhöhe liegende Abschlusskante des
Fliesenspiegels im Bad hatte augenscheinlich noch nie einen Putzlappen gesehen, unter dem Waschtisch tummelten sich die Staubmäuse samt alten Deodosen
(das fiel auf, weil mir selbst etwas runtergefallen war), der Teppichboden war schon zu unserer Ankunft nicht gesaugt und die Sitzfläche des Schreibtischstuhls versifft.
Als ich dann noch am Abreisetag die Schrankfächer und den Safe auf Hinterlassenschaften unsererseits kontrolliert habe, fiel auf, dass auch der Schrank
nicht staubgewischt war und in einem Fach sogar ein ekliger Sport-BH eines Vormieters übersehen wurde.

Die Kofferaufbewahrung und der Taxiservice haben aber tadellos funktioniert.

Das Hotel kann ich, auch gerade wegen seines hohen Preises, nicht weiterempfehlen.

title: Angenehmer Aufenthalt
text: Das Wichtigste für mich zuerst, die Zimmer waren sauber - ich musste keine Antihistamine einnehmen. Das Bett war wirklich sehr gut. Wir schliefen hervorragend. Es stimmt, dass es aufgrund des hohen Verkehrsaufkommens im Umkreis doch etwas lauter ist, wenn man den ganzen Tag unterwegs ist, schläft man trotzdem. Zimmer und Bad ist zwar etwas klein, aber sehr funktionell. Die Dusche war angenehm groß. Leider hatte der Starbucks im Erdgeschoss etwas wenig zu bieten. Wenn am Morgen etwas essen wollen, suchen sie sich etwas in der Umgebung.

title: All OK
text:
We were here for a weekend get-away - nothing to complain about and nothing truly outstanding. All just OK, which isn't a bad thing in NYC.

Room was clean, comfortable. WiFi fast. Front desk staff friendly and helpful.

Good location if you want to stay downtown - Canal & 6th Ave. A few blocks to Hudson River and then a 10-15 min walk to World Center site and ferry to Statue of Liberty.

title: Sheraton Tribeca Cancelled Our Reservation On Evening of Stay
text:
We were going to stay at the Sheraton Tribeca in late October 2016.  A couple days before our reservation date, we received a confirmation email letting us know that everything was in order.

Check-in time was 3:00PM.  We got stuck in traffic and were unable to reach the hotel until 7:00PM.  Upon trying to check in, we were told that our reservation was cancelled at 6:00PM because they ran our credit card and it was declined.

Instead of taking two minutes to call us and tell us about the card being declined and asking for a different one (or, as was the case, getting an updated number), they cancelled the reservation and gave our room to someone else.  The hotel was full, so we could not stay there. The staff were rude about the whole situation. This was incredibly frustrating, and we were left to find a new place to stay at the last minute.

Additionally, it's worth noting that we had colleagues staying there the same evening who had booked a suite.  They were told the check in time was 3:00PM and arrived at approximately that time.  Upon arrival, the suite was not ready.  They would not allow them to check any baggage in, so someone had to stay with their baggage in the lobby, and the suite was not ready until 7:00PM. They were not given any sort of a discount.

Terrible policy, and the staff were awful with they handled this.  Very disappointed.

title: Horrible service!!!!
text: The hotel itself is in a good location, easy access to the train etc. The room was clean, bed was super comfy, great view! That being said, the service at the bar, restaurant, and room service is awful!!!  And the concierge was so rude not just once but EVERY time I spoke with her. The final straw was me sitting there waiting to secure a ride to the airport while she argued on the phone with someone acting put out that I was interrupting her. I've stayed here before but it was never this bad! Won't be back.

title: Terrible - dirty, old, no service
text: The gym is super filthy, the room not taken care off, old and worn out. Not even an umbrella can be provided. The location is great, but still would no one recommend to stay. Way to expensive for what you get. Very disappointed about the brand Sheraton.

title: Clean, comfortable room - near Chinatown and Tribeca
text: Rooms are nice, clean and comfortable. The noise from the street can be loud. Location is good to easily walk to Chinatown, Little Italy and Tribeca. And an easy 1 train ride to Midtown. Would recommend.

title: OK, but overnight front desk went AWOL
text:
I really liked the feather pillows for a good night's sleep, the 24-hour gym - for those of us staying on UK time - and the location; it's a gentle stroll from the cute soho streets, the delis, the bars, dean and delucca on Broadway and not too far from Washington Square. 

Sadly, the front desk messed up taking a business call, which is deeply unimpressive. when I checked on Monday, I told them I was due to take a call at 6am from a client in Spain and the girls on the front desk assured me they have 24-hour coverage on the front desk. Being on the 18th floor, I couldn't just nip down close to the scheduled time, so I phoned the front desk... and it rang and rang and rang for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, my client is phoning from Spain and similarly, no-one is picking up. The client, my publisher and I are all swapping emails and still no-one is picking up. Eventually a man does pick up and I say, 'where have you been?'. 'Right here', he replies. So I tell him about the calls, and he claims no-one rang through. BUT I RANG THROUGH! So frustrating. 

So overall, a well-located hotel (bring ear-plugs - Canal street is noisy even if your room, like mine, is not on Canal Street itself - but a business hotel this is not!

title: Ottimo soggiorno in posizione strategica
text:
Un soggiorno favoloso in un hotel con personale veramente squisito pronto a risolvere ogni problema è a soddisfare ogni esigenza ho trascorso 4 giorni bellissimi.
Inoltre l hotel è  vicino alla metro di Canal street dove passano numerose linee; a piedi è  possibile comunque raggiungere molti posti chiave di NY.
Cosa che poi ho adorato è  la zona, lontano dall'invasione dei turisti belle vie locali alla moda negozi e gallerie d'arte. 
Un indirizzo da tenere in considerazione in un soggiorno a NY

title: Concierge mal-educada e inútil
text: Concierge é péssima, mal-educada, mal-humorada, totalmente desqualificada. Queríamos alterar a data de uns ingressos e ela disse que no hotel tinha wi-fi e computadores no hall para eu utilizar, pois ela não faria nada para nos ajudar! Um absurdo, realmente revoltante!

title: Decent value with good access
text:
Booking a hotel in New York is never that easy. You usually have to choose between location and cost, and getting both is pretty rare. NYC has a good number of hip boutique hotels that spawl across Tribeca and Soho, but these usually come upwards of £300 per night. If you are like me, it's great to stay in cool and hip hotel, but a great location and price that isn't going cripple me is more important.

The Sheraton Tribeca is located on Canal Street, a busy road linking the Holland Tunnel and Manhattan bridge and splits the Tribeca and Lower Manhattan neighbourhoods. At first glance you feel like the hotel is sandwiched between two busy lanes of traffic, which it is, however you are also positioned within 15 minutes walk from some of the nicest places to eat and drink in Manhattan. A Metro stop is around the corner so you can reach the heights of Central Park and Times Square easily, however if you want to sightsee around either of these locations then I wouldn't stay here and instead opt for somewhere further north.

Walking out of the door of the hotel to the north is the delights of Soho and Greenwich, with the Meat Packing district about 30 minutes walk. Bleekers Street, famous for eateries and live music is 15 minutes away. 15 minutes to the east is Little Italy and Chinatown, and 15 minutes to the south is the WTC.

Inside the hotel the rooms are of average size, a little dated, but clean and comfy enough. The sound proofing isn't great as the doors don't really keep the noise out, however the beds are very comfortable which makes sleeping after a long day of walking the streets nice and easy.  

All in all if you are looking for a good location then The Sheraton Tribeca ticks the boxes especially if you are a foodie and live music junky. Don't expect boutique decor and long velvet curtains or you will be disappointed.

Transfers to JFK are 1.15hr and Newark approx 1hr.

title: 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼
text: very convenient location in the heart of Manhattan! elegant terrace with panoramic views on the club floor! nice linens in the rooms and comfortable mattresses for a healthy sleep! Hotel suitable for both short term and for the long journey!

title: Bra placerat hotel
text:
Bra placerat hotel med nära till tunnelbana, restauranger och promenadavstånd till Greenwich  Village och Ground Zero. 

Trevlig och bra service, men rumsstädningen var inte alltid så snabb.

Flera bra frukostställen nära, hotellets frukost kan man skippa. 

Fräscha rum med bra badrum. Lugnt. 

Bra WIfi.

title: Good location for Tribeca- sort of grungy
text: The front desk folks are all really nice.  The hotel is a good location if you want to be down here.  The gym is OK as long as there are only 2 or 3 people in it.  The free breakfast is probably OK if you get there the minute they open, otherwise it is really picked over and sort of gross by 10:00 am.  The housekeeping is what really made me drop it to 3 stars.  I stayed 5 nights and I had to finally ask for them to vacuum my room and clean my desk and my sink.  Plus the housekeepers bang the doors of whatever room they are cleaning 10 or 15 times.  I do not understand why they can't stick a towel in the door but instead they let it slam shut each time they go out to their cart.  It woke us up early every morning and then in the late afternoon when I would try to rest before going out to dinner, bang bang bang all over again.  So, housekeeping is not good,not very clean,  but the rest of the people at the hotel are really nice.  If I had to work down here again, I would maybe have to stay here just for the location.

title: NEM UM FRIGOBAR.....
text: Rede Sheraton o que você espera? nada disso.....se quiser algum conforto não fique neste hotel. Quarto pequeno e desajeitado, banheiro menor ainda. Funcionários atenciosos, o japonês da porta merece referência. É excelente. Aliás, até parar o carro para descarregar as bagagens é problema...bom minha nota é essa e pronto! desaconselho.

title: greatdeal and attentive staff
text: two thumbs up for price and value the staff was attentive the room was clean and neat we used points for one night and paid 271 for the second it was a great deal for Tribeca in new York city...canal street and the Holland tunnel are at your doorstep snacks at the rooftop club were convienient.

title: Very clean and adequate
text: The hotel is conveniently located at the corner of W. Broadway and Canal, at the confluence of TriBeCa, Soho and Chinatown.  There is no place in the hotel to purchase snacks or forgotten items like razors or anti acids, which was inconvenient. Also, the little place I think they called the Link, or the Line, where supposedly you could get a coffee or tea or breakfast pastry, was in the lobby and unstaffed both mornings I was there. Also, the "lounge" is also in the lobby and is not by any stretch of the imagination a place where you would want to hang out and have a drink with friends.  Basically, this is a good, basic place to sleep, but not to spend any time in. I have to say, the young men at the door who were available to help you get a cab (which is not easy) were great. Friendly and down to earth and very helpful.

title: Friendly and helpful staff
text:
I chose the hotel for its location, downtown Manhattan. The staff were helpful and the room standard was good. Did not eat in the restaurant. Bar expensive, but then that was much as I discovered  across NYC. The hotel was handy for the subway, getting back to jfk airport and walking down to Brooklyn bridge, staten island ferry, Greenwich village/hi line and the 9/11 memorial museum. I would recommend this hotel for part of a stay in New York as it is a little less hectic than around Times Square/Empire State building etc.
 Other reviews have suggested a room on the upper floors. We were on the 7th, not much of view, canal street.

title: Dirty
text:
This both the smallest and dirtiest room I have ever stayed at in New York. There are clearly some deferred maintenance issues throughout the hotel. The toilet in my room constantly leaks and one of the two buttons is broken. The exhaust fan in the ceiling is filthy. The carpet in the room and hallway is showing signs of age and stained. The exterior window looks as through it has never been cleaned. 

From a housekeeping perspective... eww. There was thick black hair on not 1 but 2 towels in the bathroom. The room was not throughly vacuumed, it looked like shredded straw rappers were strewn about. But worst of all, when going to bed I noticed that one of the 4 pillows had a disgusting stain on it (see included picture), so I pulled back the sheets and saw the bottom sheet had rips all along the fitted sheet portion and found several hairs between the sheets. GROSS!

I would have expected more of a Starwood property, I will no the returning.

title: Horrible Customer Service
text:
Staff continuously lie to you when something goes wrong. We payed for a club room and were put in a traditional room that we were told didn't even have enough room for us (family of 4). We went to reception and told them that we payed for a club room and it were transferred to 4 different staff members - each of them telling their own stories of why we didn't get the room we payed for. Finally we were told by the manager that she would give us the room we payed for and refund us the difference. However she lied about the amount and said it was only a $30 a night difference when we were told by another staff member that it was $90 a night (which it was) and blamed the difference in numbers to the fact that the staff member was new and only had been there for a week. After looking into it we proved that it was actually $90 a night.
Definitely not the service expected from a Sheriton hotel.

title: Great location, but hotel is a little tired
text: If you're planning to spend time in Chelsea, this is a very convenient location within walking distance to Chelsea Market, a bunch of great restaurants, and shops. Customer service was excellent -- Sal at the front desk was a real professional. He managed to get us checked in a little early, too. Overall, the hotel was just fine -- the rooms, while standard issue in terms of decor, are fairly spacious by NYC standards. The bedding was so-so -- mattress a bit soft for my taste and pillow too thick (but, I should point out, I did not try asking for a different pillow, which I probably could have). The linens were nice and the bathroom was clean. I think the one change this hotel could make is the LOBBY. It's tiny -- probably can't do much about that -- and really quite tired. The furniture and floors are dirty, and there aren't those little perks you find in other hotels like cucumber or lemon water. But, good service trumps all that, so I would definitely come back. Dinner at Mario Battali's La Sirena -- just across the street from Chelsea Market -- was spectacular.

title: Friendly front desk staff, great club lounge patio view.
text: Rooms were smaller the Sheraton Times Square, as was club lounge.  Front desk staff very friendly and professional, but management has some glitches. Housekeeping was extremely slow responding with basic needs, sometimes requiring a wait of an hour and a half and/or multiple requests.

title: standardisé, impersonnel
text: Les chambres sont assez impersonnelles, mais correctes. J'avais réservé sur Booking une chambre avec vue sur la ville et j'ai eu une chambre avec vue frontale sur un immeuble de bureaux. Je n'ai pas pu changer avant le lendemain. Et le petit déjeuner servie dans la chambre était très médiocre (viennoiseries spongieuses, jus d'orange industriel...)

title: Decent for a quick business trip
text: Room was comfortable & clean. Room service breakfast was quick and attentive with average food. Front desk staff were very friendly and especially helpful at finding a good Italian restaurant for dinner nearby.

title: Fab hotel with excellent service to match!
text: Just returned from a great stay at this hotel and will return for sure. The location, amenities and service gives this hotel five stars. All the staff are excellent from concierge to front desk, club lounge to housekeeping, nothing is too much trouble. Would recommend a club lounge room, as the rooftop lounge with amazing views of the city and Empire State Building are fantastic. It was my sons 21st birthday during our stay, special thanks to Colin, Rhonda and Megan for making it so special.

title: I really like the hotel
text: I'm a Starwood platinum member and This was my sixth stay at this hotel. I love the location especially if you're flying into or out of Newark. It's between soho and TriBeCa and Chinatown so there's something for everyone. The club lounge is awesome. There's always something to snack on they are very generous and it has a beautiful rooftop area. The rooms are ok. You can tell it's an older hotel but that's ok because the staff are wonderful. On one of my precious visits they found out it was my wedding anniversary and sent us a bottle of wine. It's close to the subway. Can't go wrong here.

title: An SPG gem in a bustling city
text: I have stayed in MANY SPG properties in the city and in Brooklyn (W, Westin Times Square, Sheraton Times Square, Element, Four Points Soho, Aloft Brooklyn, Sheraton Brooklyn) and this is my favorite place to stay in the city. Close to subways, great restaurants, wonderful VIP lounge and terrace with a superb view of the city. There's something very cozy about this hotel.

title: Quick business trip
text: I was here for a very short overnight trip for work. The hotel is conveniently located and clean. Staff was very nice even very late at night. The rooms are decent size for New York City. There is a restaurant and Starbucks right in the lobby.

title: Room with A View
text: My son and I just returned from an amazing visit to New York. The Sheraton Tribeca was a great choice for us. When we arrived we were greeted by Rhonda who was extremely gracious and personable and was that way with every single encounter we had with her. She was always positive and upbeat! Our room was on an upper level with a great view. The location of the hotel was perfect; a short walk to the Brooklyn Bridge, Soho shopping and restaurants in Alphabet City. All of the staff were friendly and ready to give us a helping hand should we need it, We will stay there again!

title: Nick
text: Big compliments to Rhonda for making the stay most enjoyable. She was super friendly and customer service focused!  We need more Rhonda's working at every hotel. The rooms were normal size for NYC, but we're newer and clean. Would definitely recommend!

title: Amazing stay at a gem of a hotel
text:
My husband and I came to town for an extended long weekend away and can honestly we were blown away by the service at this hotel.
We checked in early and right away they stored our bags and gave us a bottle of water.  We received a call when our room was ready which allowed us to enjoy a full day exploring the city. 

Our front desk rep Sal was wonderful from the get go. This would be the pattern throughout our stay; asking how are day went, offering water, advice, and always with a smile. Consistently great service from all the reps; it was their mission to ensure our stay was the best possible, they even gave us a free drink at the bar when they knew we were celebrating a special occasion.

Room size was great for NYC, very clean and the rooftop patio is a must.

Fantastic hotel, cannot say enough great things

title: Great short weekend stay
text:
My wife and I visited the Sheraton TriBeCa this past weekend for a short getaway. Overall, it was a great experience and I would stay again in a heartbeat. My thoughts:

Pros:
- Club lounge offers awesome views of Midtown skyline. 
- Customer service is exceptional. 
- I'm not sure if it was a one-off thing, but they offered us a flat-rate ride from hotel to Laguardia. $55 considering it took 1.5 hours because of traffic. Meter would have been much more. 

Cons:
- Smallish rooms, but you're in New York. No room is large in NYC and you're not spending time in your room, so it was ok with us. 
- Location if you're looking for the Midtown sites (Times Square, Central Park, etc.). We've visited New York many times and we wanted a different location, which is why we chose the Sheraton TriBeCa. If you're looking for a hotel for your first time visit to take in the Midtown sites, you would be better off looking elsewhere. Otherwise, great location for World Trade Center, Brooklyn Bridge, etc.

title: Nice business hotel
text: Stayed here recently.  The hotel is clean and the staff is very accomodating and nice.  The rooms were normal size and the beds are fine.  I would stay here again.  Very close to China Town and Little Italy.

title: Medel hotell med bra läge i downtown
text:
Hotellet har väldigt bra läge då vi föredrar downtown med alla sina restauranger bra shopping mm

Rummen är rätt slitna med brun beige inredning. Väldigt skön stor säng och i övrigt helt ok standard. 

Personalen på hotellet var väldigt trevlig och hjälpsam. 

Ingen lyx men är du i NYC och vill ha ett medel hotell är detta helt ok.

title: Close to Broadway and within walking distance of the 9/11 Memorial.
text: Very friendly staff especially the barmaid.  Had a drink in the when we returned after a tiring day sightseeing.  Room was clean and quiet right opposite the lift. Hotel is well located although outside you get accosted by the Canal Street traders selling handbags and fake Rolex watches. Canal Street is well placed for the Big Bus tour and about 20 minutes on foot to the 9/11 memorial.
